original: thar pa'i grong khyer du phyin par byed pa'i don gyis na lam yin la de med pas lam ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i grong khyer du phyin par byed pa'i don gyis na lam yin la de med pas lam ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is a path because it causes one to arrive at the city of liberation. It is not a path because it does not exist.

original: de dag dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ngan song chad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ngan song chad pa'o //
translated: It is a severance of evil destinies because it is free from those.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pas na rigs pa yin la de med pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pas na rigs pa yin la de med pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is a principle because it is the antidote to all afflictions. It is not a principle because it does not exist.

original: de dag dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a mixture of those.

original: 'bras bu ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid yin la de mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid yin la de mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
translated: The result is enlightenment itself. Its realization is the realization of that.

original: de'i don gyi thabs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i don gyi thabs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the means to that?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid de /
translated: It is non-conceptuality.

original: thams cad du mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: It is non-attachment to everything.

original: sems phyin ci ma log pa ston pa'i don gyis na bsgrub pa yin la de med pa ni sgrub pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems phyin ci ma log pa ston pa'i don gyis na bsgrub pa yin la de med pa ni sgrub pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is a practice because it teaches the non-erroneous mind. It is not a practice because it does not exist.

original: de dag las rnam par grol ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mtshan ma sngon po la sogs pas tha snyad du bya ba'i rgyu dang ma 'brel cing ma 'dres pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de dag las rnam par grol ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mtshan ma sngon po la sogs pas tha snyad du bya ba'i rgyu dang ma 'brel cing ma 'dres pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Since they are liberated from those, all phenomena such as form are not related to or mixed with the cause of being conventionally designated by a sign such as blue.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rtag pa'i gnas su 'gro bas na nges par 'byin pa yin la de med pa ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rtag pa'i gnas su 'gro bas na nges par 'byin pa yin la de med pa ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Since it goes to the state of the reality that is not related to or mixed with that, it is the definite emergence that is not the definite emergence that is not that.

original: de dag med pa nyid kyis na stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid shes bya dang sgra gnyis la shes pa skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par na brjod par bya ba dang
analyzed: de dag med pa nyid kyis na stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid shes bya dang sgra gnyis la shes pa skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par na brjod par bya ba dang
translated: Since it is empty because of the nonexistence of those, it is the nonarising of consciousness with regard to the object of cognition and sound, which have the nature of the expressed and the expresser.

original: rjod par byed pa dag med pas de dag gi shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid de chos kyi dbyings nyid kyi gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dag med pas de dag gi shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid de chos kyi dbyings nyid kyi gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Since the expressed and the expresser do not exist in reality, they are not the objects of consciousness. It is the state of the dharmadhƒÅtu itself.

original: 'dis ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams kyi rnam pa bcu drug sngar bshad pa de rnams kyi nang nas bden pa re re zhing rnam pa gnyis gnyis kyi chos gang yin pa dang / rjes su shes pa gang yin pa kun rdzob kyi bden par @190a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams kyi rnam pa bcu drug sngar bshad pa de rnams kyi nang nas bden pa re re zhing rnam pa gnyis gnyis kyi chos gang yin pa dang / rjes su shes pa gang yin pa kun rdzob kyi bden par @190a * //
translated: This passage explains that from among the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths previously explained, any phenomenon that is two aspects of each truth and any subsequent knowledge is called conventional truth.

original: brjod pa yin la de ni shes pa gnyis gnyis su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa yin la de ni shes pa gnyis gnyis su blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those should be viewed as two knowledges.üîΩAny phenomenon that is not observed as permanent or impermanent or as suffering or not suffering is any knowledge of that phenomenon.

original: de la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dag mi dmigs pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag la shes pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang sdug bsngal la chos shes
analyzed: de la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dag mi dmigs pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag la shes pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang sdug bsngal la chos shes
translated: That is perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: pa'o // de bzhin du bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang mi stong pa mi dmigs pa dag gi rjes su shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su chos shes pa yin no /
analyzed: pa'o // de bzhin du bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang mi stong pa mi dmigs pa dag gi rjes su shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su chos shes pa yin no /
translated: Similarly, the knowledge that follows the non-apprehension of self and not-self, of emptiness and non-emptiness, is subsequent knowledge of the truth of the Dharma and subsequent knowledge of the truth of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa re re zhing yang shes pa bzhi bzhi dang sbyar bas shes pa bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa re re zhing yang shes pa bzhi bzhi dang sbyar bas shes pa bcu drug yin no //
translated: Similarly, there are sixteen knowledges, since each of the four truths is associated with four knowledges.

original: gzhan dag na re shes pa 'di rnams kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa bden pa bzhi'i yul la skye ba'i shugs kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes
analyzed: gzhan dag na re shes pa 'di rnams kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa bden pa bzhi'i yul la skye ba'i shugs kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes
translated: Others believe that these knowledges are of the aspect of permanence and impermanence, etc., since they are generated with the four truths as their object, by the force of the non-apprehension of permanence and impermanence, etc.

original: 'dod do // nyan thos la sogs pa'i phyogs ltar na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dag gi chos gang yin pa dang / de dag gi shes pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod do // nyan thos la sogs pa'i phyogs ltar na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dag gi chos gang yin pa dang / de dag gi shes pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yin la /
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to cessation and the subsequent cognition with regard to cessation are the cognition of cessation and the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to the path and the subsequent cognition with regard to the path are the cognition of the path and the cognition of nonarising.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness and the subsequent cognition with regard to unsatisfactoriness are the cognition of unsatisfactoriness and the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to the origin and the subsequent cognition with regard to the origin are the cognition of the origin and the cognition of nonarising.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to cessation and the subsequent cognition with regard to cessation are the cognition of cessation and the cognition of nonarising.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to the path and the subsequent cognition with regard to the path are the cognition of the path and the cognition of nonarising.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rjes gang dag yin pa de dag gi shes pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su chos shes pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa re re la yang shes pa bzhir sbyar bas shes pa bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rjes gang dag yin pa de dag gi shes pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su chos shes pa yin no // de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa re re la yang shes pa bzhir sbyar bas shes pa bcu drug yin no //
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness and the subsequent cognition with regard to unsatisfactoriness are the cognition of unsatisfactoriness and the cognition of nonarising.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to the origin and the subsequent cognition with regard to the origin are the cognition of the origin and the cognition of nonarising.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bden pa bzhi'i yul la skye ba'i don gyi shugs kyis shes pa rnams kyang bden pa bzhi'i rnam par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bden pa bzhi'i yul la skye ba'i don gyi shugs kyis shes pa rnams kyang bden pa bzhi'i rnam par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to cessation and the subsequent cognition with regard to cessation are the cognition of cessation and the cognition of nonarising.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to the path and the subsequent cognition with regard to the path are the cognition of the path and the cognition of nonarising.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness and the subsequent cognition with regard to unsatisfactoriness are the cognition of unsatisfactoriness and the cognition of nonarising.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to the origin and the subsequent cognition with regard to the origin are the cognition of the origin and the cognition of nonarising.üîΩThe cognition of the factors with regard to cessation and the subsequent cognition with

original: de ni de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: That is what is meant by ‚Äúhaving that aspect‚Äù and so on.

original: 'phags pa byams pa dang seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas bdag gi yul gsum car la shes pa dang rnam pa ma bstan na yang bdag gis ma bstan pa ni de'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa yang don yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa dang seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas bdag gi yul gsum car la shes pa dang rnam pa ma bstan na yang bdag gis ma bstan pa ni de'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa yang don yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: ƒÄrya Maitreya and Haribhadra say that even if consciousness is not taught to have an object and an aspect, the meaning of ‚Äúhaving that aspect‚Äù is understood by implication.

original: shes pa yang yul gyi rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyi'i yul yod pa dang shes par smra ba rnams kyi tshad ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shes pa yang yul gyi rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyi'i yul yod pa dang shes par smra ba rnams kyi tshad ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: And consciousness is said to have the aspect of the object because it is the valid cognition of those who assert the existence of external objects.

original: lam shes pa nyid la ji lta ba de bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid la nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dag gi bsgom pa'i lam so sor med ce na /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid la ji lta ba de bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid la nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dag gi bsgom pa'i lam so sor med ce na /
translated: Just as it is for the knowledge of the path, is there no separate path of meditation for ≈õrƒÅvakas and bodhisattvas in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: kun shes pa @190b nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: kun shes pa @190b nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The text says ‚Äúin the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù and so on.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes pas mthong nas 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas mngon sum du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bsgom pa'i lam bstan la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes pas mthong nas 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas mngon sum du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bsgom pa'i lam bstan la /
translated: Since it is not directly realized, the path of meditation is taught to bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don nyid yang dang yang du mngon du bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pas rtogs sla ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don nyid yang dang yang du mngon du bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pas rtogs sla ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: The path of meditation for sravakas and so on is the repeated direct realization of the meaning that is seen, but it is not taught to bodhisattvas because it is easy to realize.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyang sngar bshad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyang sngar bshad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the factors conducive to penetrative insight of bodhisattvas are as previously explained.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa na zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi dro ba la sogs pa ni gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ma bstan par khong du chud par bya'o
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa na zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi dro ba la sogs pa ni gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ma bstan par khong du chud par bya'o
translated: The listeners and so forth, when they focus on the four noble truths with the aspects of impermanence and so on, do not teach the heat and so on of the nature of meditation that is contaminated, because they are clear.

original: // de ltar rgyas par bstan nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid kyi don gang yin pa de mtha' dag sdud par byed pa yin pas gtso bo yin pa nyid kyis na //
analyzed: // de ltar rgyas par bstan nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid kyi don gang yin pa de mtha' dag sdud par byed pa yin pas gtso bo yin pa nyid kyis na //
translated: Having thus taught in detail, he summarizes all the topics of the characteristics of the eight realizations, and because they are primary,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum mjug bsdu bar gsungs pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyal ba'i yum las bshad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum mjug bsdu bar gsungs pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyal ba'i yum las bshad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he states the summary of the three omnisciences.

original: lam shes pa nyid du nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam brjod pas thams cad shes pa nyid bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid du nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam brjod pas thams cad shes pa nyid bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the path knowledge explained by expressing the paths of the listeners and so forth?

original: ci'i phyir yang thams cad shes pa nyid logs shig tu bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang thams cad shes pa nyid logs shig tu bstan ce na /
translated: Why is the knowledge of all bases taught separately?

original: brjod par bya ste de ni /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste de ni /
translated: This is to be stated.

original: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
translated: In the method of knowing the path,üîΩthe ≈õrƒÅvaka should know this path

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //üîΩnyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni // nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //
translated: through the non-apprehension of the aspects of the four noble truths.

original: zhes bya bas mi dmigs par bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam byang chub sems dpas bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mi dmigs par bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam byang chub sems dpas bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no /
translated: Thus it is said that the bodhisattva should cultivate the paths of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on through the stages of non-apprehending meditation and so forth.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzlog pa'i sgo nas 'phangs pa'i gzhi ma lus pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du thams cad shes pa nyid logs shig tu smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzlog pa'i sgo nas 'phangs pa'i gzhi ma lus pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du thams cad shes pa nyid logs shig tu smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to completely understand the entire basis of the imputations through the negation of the aspects of impermanence and so on, the knowledge of all aspects is mentioned separately.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi gzhung rtogs dka' ba'i snang ba'i dka' 'grel dharma k'irtis byas pa las skabs gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi gzhung rtogs dka' ba'i snang ba'i dka' 'grel dharma k'irtis byas pa las skabs gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the third chapter of the commentary on the treatise of the Ornament of Clear Realization, the instructions on the perfection of wisdom, composed by Haribhadra, the commentary on the difficult points called the Illumination.üîΩThe three knowledges, etc.

original: // / @191a * //  thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'grel pa brjod nas rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de skad gsum du gsungs pa'i gnyen po ma lus pa ni
analyzed: // / @191a * //  thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'grel pa brjod nas rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de skad gsum du gsungs pa'i gnyen po ma lus pa ni
translated: Having stated the commentary, with regard to the complete and perfect realization of all aspects, he said, ‚ÄúThe basis, etc.‚Äù The antidote to the three statements is

original: gzhi ste / de rnams kyi ye shes kyi rnam pa ni de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gzhi ste / de rnams kyi ye shes kyi rnam pa ni de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyi khyad par ro //
translated: the basis. The aspect of their wisdom is the special mind that focuses on that.

original: de rnams kyi rnam pa gang yin pa ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam pa gang yin pa ni snang ba'o //
translated: The aspect of those is appearance.

original: kun mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi skye ba med par mkhyen pas ye shes ni rnam gsum phyir /
analyzed: kun mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi skye ba med par mkhyen pas ye shes ni rnam gsum phyir /
translated: Omniscience is threefold because of the three knowledges: of all things, of the path, and of the nonproduction of things.

original: zhes bya ba dbye na rnam pa gsum yod pas de ni rnam pa gsum po nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dbye na rnam pa gsum yod pas de ni rnam pa gsum po nyid yin la /
translated: When divided, it is threefold.

original: de ltar ci rigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par 'dod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ci rigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par 'dod par shes par bya'o //
translated: The nature of omniscience should be understood as the general characteristic of the realization of all aspects.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verses begins with the line ‚Äúeternality, etc.‚Äù

original: rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa ni rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ma yin pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa ni rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ma yin pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of things as eternal, etc., is the adherence to things as eternal, painful, etc.

original: de nyid ni spang bar bya ba yin pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni spang bar bya ba yin pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Since that is what is to be abandoned, it is the counteragent.

original: de'i gnyen po ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is impermanence, etc.

original: de'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni shes par snang ba ste de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni shes par snang ba ste de rnams kyi'o //
translated: The nature of the reality of those is the appearance of knowledge.

original: de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa rnams zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa rnams zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: That is to say, they are the aspects of the intuition that has as its object impermanence, etc.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par la rnam pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes nges par byas pa'o /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par la rnam pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes nges par byas pa'o /
translated: The special intuition that has as its object impermanence, etc. is determined to be the aspect itself, because it is established as the aspect.

original: mtshan nyid ni spyir na rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pas dmigs pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni spyir na rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pas dmigs pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: In general, a characteristic is the sign of the object that is fully realized by the complete realization of all aspects.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi gzhi'i yul can yin pa nyid kyis na sngar smras pa'i rnam pa rnams gzhi med pa'i rnam pa yin par nges pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi gzhi'i yul can yin pa nyid kyis na sngar smras pa'i rnam pa rnams gzhi med pa'i rnam pa yin par nges pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: By this statement beginning with ‚Äúthose,‚Äù it is clarified that the previously mentioned aspects are indeed aspects without a basis, because they are the objects of the basis of the three knowledges.

original: spyir zhes bya bas rnam pa rnams la dbye ba ma brjod par rnam pa gsum bstan nas da ni khyad par te /
analyzed: spyir zhes bya bas rnam pa rnams la dbye ba ma brjod par rnam pa gsum bstan nas da ni khyad par te /
translated: By the word ‚Äúin general,‚Äù without mentioning a division of the aspects, the three aspects are taught. Now, the special aspects are taught.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten pa'i dbye bas med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten pa'i dbye bas med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The aspects of nonexistence, etc. are stated in terms of the classification based on the four noble truths.

original: med pa'i rnam pa nas gzung ste zhes bya ba ni med pa dang mi skye ba'i rnam pa nas gzung ste /
analyzed: med pa'i rnam pa nas gzung ste zhes bya ba ni med pa dang mi skye ba'i rnam pa nas gzung ste /
translated: The phrase beginning with the aspects of nonexistence means beginning with the aspects of nonexistence and nonarising,

original: mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyis so //üîΩ@191b brtsi ba ni bden pa so so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyis so // @191b brtsi ba ni bden pa so so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: up to the aspects of nonproduction and nonmanifestation.

original: bden pa so so la bzhi dang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa gsum la bzhi bzhi ste bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bden pa so so la bzhi dang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa gsum la bzhi bzhi ste bcu gnyis so //
translated: The phrase the four for each truth, etc. means that there are four aspects for each of the three truths of suffering, etc.

original: lam gyi bden pa la ni bco lngar zhes bya ba de dag ni rnam pa zhes bya ba yin par bshad do //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la ni bco lngar zhes bya ba de dag ni rnam pa zhes bya ba yin par bshad do //
translated: The phrase fifteen for the truth of the path explains the aspects.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don smos pa yin te /
translated: The phrase in regard to these refers to the meaning of the verses.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyis dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi nang nas 'dir so sor bsgom par 'dod pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyis dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi nang nas 'dir so sor bsgom par 'dod pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, having taken hold of the state of knowing everything means that, from among the three states of omniscience, this is the state of knowing everything, because it is desired to cultivate each of the three states of omniscience.

original: med pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rtag pa'i tshul gyis med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rtag pa'i tshul gyis med pa'o //
translated: Non-existence means non-existence in the manner of permanence, which is equal to space.

original: mi skye ba ni yang dag par skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni yang dag par skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Non-arising means not arising in reality.

original: dben pa ni yon tan skyed par byed pa nyid kyis na bdag stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dben pa ni yon tan skyed par byed pa nyid kyis na bdag stong pa nyid do //
translated: Isolation means empty of self in the sense of generating good qualities.

original: mi brdzi ba ni bdag med pa nyid kyis mu stegs pa rnams kyis 'khrugs par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: mi brdzi ba ni bdag med pa nyid kyis mu stegs pa rnams kyis 'khrugs par mi nus pa ste /
translated: Invincibility means without self in the sense of not being able to be disturbed by tƒ´rthikas.

original: sdug bsngal mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: yang dag par na ming dang gzugs kyi phung po skyed par byed pa med pa'i don gyis na gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na ming dang gzugs kyi phung po skyed par byed pa med pa'i don gyis na gnas med pa'o //
translated: In reality, non-abiding means the meaning of non-production of the aggregate of name-and-form.

original: nam mkha' ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Space is non-existent.

original: yang dag par na tshig tu brjod du med pa na brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na tshig tu brjod du med pa na brjod du med pa'o //
translated: Since it cannot be expressed in words in reality, it is inexpressible.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po med pa ni ming med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po med pa ni ming med pa ste /
translated: The absence of the formless aggregates is namelessness.

original: kun 'byung gi rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the origin is the cause of origination, origination, full arising, and condition.

original: 'gro ba med pa ni yang dag pa nyid du na 'gro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa ni yang dag pa nyid du na 'gro ba med pa'o //
translated: Non-going is non-going in reality.

original: mi 'phrogs pa ni gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid kyis na yul med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa ni gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid kyis na yul med pa'o //
translated: Non-seizure is non-object due to primordial peace.

original: mi zad pa ni zad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa ni zad pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-exhaustion is non-exhaustion.

original: skye ba med pa ni ma skyes pa ste 'gog pa'i 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni ma skyes pa ste 'gog pa'i 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Non-production is unproduced, having the characteristic of cessation, peace, excellence, and definite emergence.

original: de ltar na med pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa gsum gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na med pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa gsum gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these twelve aspects such as non-existence should be explained as the characteristics of impermanence, etc. of the three truths of suffering, etc. in order.

original: da ni lam gyi bden pa rnam pa gsum nyon mongs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni lam gyi bden pa rnam pa gsum nyon mongs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Now, the three aspects of the truth of the path are stated beginning with ‚Äúthe obscurations of the afflictions,‚Äù etc.

original: nyon mongs pa nyid ni rtsig pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar sgrib pa yin te /üîΩyang dag pa'i ye shes kyi @192a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid ni rtsig pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar sgrib pa yin te / yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi @192a * //
translated: The afflictions themselves are obscurations, like walls, etc.

original: gegs byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gegs byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the obstructions toüîΩcorrect wisdom.üîΩThe antidote to those is the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: de'i gnyen po nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la dang po nyan thos rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i lam la yang dag pa nyid du na byed pa po dmigs su med pas na byed pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la dang po nyan thos rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i lam la yang dag pa nyid du na byed pa po dmigs su med pas na byed pa po med pa'o //
translated: The first is the uncontaminated path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas. Since the agent is not observed in reality, there is no agent.

original: bdag nyid med pas na shes pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid med pas na shes pa po med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no self, there is no knower.

original: yang dag par na 'pho ba med pas na 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na 'pho ba med pas na 'pho ba med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no transference in reality, there is no transference.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba med pas na 'dul ba med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba med pas na 'dul ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not a discipline because it does not subdue the afflictions.

original: de ltar na rnam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lam la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lam la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äúin terms of its aspects, etc.‚Äù refers to the path, etc., as follows:

original: lam dang rig pa dang sgrub pa dang nges par 'byin pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: lam dang rig pa dang sgrub pa dang nges par 'byin pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The path, knowledge, practice, and deliverance are its nature.

original: gnyis pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The second is the path of the pratyekabuddhas, which is accompanied by the outflows.

original: rab tu gnyid kyis log pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa ni rmi lam mo //
analyzed: rab tu gnyid kyis log pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa ni rmi lam mo //
translated: A dream is a cognition that occurs in a state of deep sleep.

original: brag cha ni sgra brnyan no //
analyzed: brag cha ni sgra brnyan no //
translated: An echo is a sound that is reflected back.üîΩA mirage is a hallucination of water in the desert.

original: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i snang ba ni mig yor ro //üîΩsmig rgyu ni mya ngan gyi smig rgyu'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i snang ba ni mig yor ro // smig rgyu ni mya ngan gyi smig rgyu'o //
translated: An optical illusion is a double image of the moon.

original: mig 'phrul ni sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: mig 'phrul ni sgyu ma'o //
translated: A magical creation is an illusion.

original: de ltar na rnam pa de lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag pa nyid du na skye bar mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa de lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag pa nyid du na skye bar mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äúin terms of these five aspects, etc.‚Äù refers to the fact that it is not reasonable for them to arise in reality.

original: zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: spyir shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: spyir shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: In general, they are the antidotes to the obscurations to that which needs to be known.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the destruction of all the obscurations of the knowable.üîΩThe third is the absence of defilement and purification.

original: gsum pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams ni lam la 'dod chags la sogs pa med pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams ni lam la 'dod chags la sogs pa med pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of defilement is the absence of attachment, etc. to the path on the part of the Solitary Buddhas.

original: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Purification is nirvana.

original: de med pa ni rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of purification is the absence of nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma gos pa na gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma gos pa na gos pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of stain is the absence of all the defilements and secondary defilements.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa med pa ni spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa med pa ni spros pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of conceptual differentiation is the absence of conceptual differentiation in regard to form, etc.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa ni rlom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa ni rlom pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of conceit is the absence of the conceit of the apprehending subject.

original: chos kyi dbyings ltar brtan pas na mi g-yo ba ste //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ltar brtan pas na mi g-yo ba ste //
translated: The absence of movement is the absence of movement like the element of earth.

original: 'di dag rnam pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag rnam pa rnams yin no //
translated: These are the aspects.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Defilement is attachment, etc.

original: rnam par byang ba ma yin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma yin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-purification is non-nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyun nam med pa'i rnam pa nye bar mthong bar nus pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyun nam med pa'i rnam pa nye bar mthong bar nus pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags rnams so //
translated: The latent impressions of afflictions are the latent impressions of afflictions that can be seen to be the cause or aspect of the continuum of attachment and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i bar du dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i bar du dbye ba'o //
translated: The proliferation of form and so on is the division up to form, feeling, and so on.

original: @192b rang gi rtog pa ni 'dzin pa'i shes pa la nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: @192b rang gi rtog pa ni 'dzin pa'i shes pa la nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: One's own conceptualization is the observation of the apprehending consciousness.

original: yongs su nyams pa ni nyon mongs pa 'joms pa sta /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa ni nyon mongs pa 'joms pa sta /
translated: Degeneration is the destruction of afflictions.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa 'di rnams kyi so sor nges pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa 'di rnams kyi so sor nges pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dag yin no zhes smos te /
translated: These conceptualizations that have the nature of counteragents are the individual antidotes to those.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa shes bya'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi drug po dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa shes bya'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi drug po dag nyid yin no //
translated: Those are the six that are the obscurations to omniscience such as the afflictions and so on.

original: rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa bshad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa bshad par 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to explain the verse that begins with cause,

original: gnas skabs pa la bden bya ba la sogs par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs pa la bden bya ba la sogs par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: One should understand that the conventional is so-called because it is the object of conventional knowledge, and because it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang cig shos kyi phyogs la brten nas zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i yul gyi dbye bas so //üîΩgrangs bzhin du rnam pa brgyad dang zhes bya ba la sogs par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung dang lam dag la rnam pa brgyad dang bdun rnams so //üîΩsdug bsngal dang 'gog pa la rnam pa lnga dang bcu drug tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang cig shos kyi phyogs la brten nas zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i yul gyi dbye bas so // grangs bzhin du rnam pa brgyad dang zhes bya ba la sogs par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung dang lam dag la rnam pa brgyad dang bdun rnams so // sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa la rnam pa lnga dang bcu drug tu shes par bya'o //
translated: The conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.

original: de la kun 'byung gi bden par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de la kun 'byung gi bden par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.üîΩThe conventional is the object of conventional knowledge, and it is the object of conventional expression.

original: yul la rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yul la rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The conventional is the object of conventional

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa ni mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa ni mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Non-abiding is non-attachment.

original: nyes pa nye bar zhi ba ni zhi ba'o //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa nye bar zhi ba ni zhi ba'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags med pa'o //
translated: Peace is the pacification of faults.üîΩNon-desire is freedom from desire.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang dang bral ba'o //
translated: Non-aversion is freedom from aversion.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes ni gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes ni gti mug med pa'o //
translated: Non-ignorance is right wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-affliction is freedom from afflictions.

original: sems can med pa ni sems can med pa ste /
analyzed: sems can med pa ni sems can med pa ste /
translated: Non-sentience is the absence of sentient beings.

original: rnam pa 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du 'di rnams gang dag gi gnyen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du 'di rnams gang dag gi gnyen po yin zhe na /
translated: What are the antidotes to these?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang rab tu skye ba dang rkyen te rnam pa bzhi smos pa yin la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang rab tu skye ba dang rkyen te rnam pa bzhi smos pa yin la /
translated: The adverse factors are the four causes of the truth of origin: origination, full arising, conditions, and

original: de la rgyu gang yin pa de ni sngon dang phyi ma'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang srid pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: de la rgyu gang yin pa de ni sngon dang phyi ma'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang srid pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin la /
translated: Among them, the cause is threefold by way of cause and effect in terms of past and future.

original: de ni 'dun pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dun pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúDesire, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dun pa ni yul thams cad mngon par 'dod pa'o //üîΩde mngon du 'gro ba'i mngon par @193a * //üîΩzhen pa ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni yul thams cad mngon par 'dod pa'o // de mngon du 'gro ba'i mngon par @193a * // zhen pa ni 'dod chags te /
translated: Desire is the wish for any object.üîΩAttachment is the strong desire to approach an object.

original: 'dod chags la ni dga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la ni dga' ba ste /
translated: Delight is the pleasure in attachment.

original: lhar 'gyur ba'am mir 'gyur ba'o zhes srid pa la mngon par dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhar 'gyur ba'am mir 'gyur ba'o zhes srid pa la mngon par dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Longing is the wish for a divine or human rebirth.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di rnams kyi gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi gnas pa dang zhi ba'i rnam pa ste gsum yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di rnams kyi gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi gnas pa dang zhi ba'i rnam pa ste gsum yin no //
translated: The three aspects of the antidote to these resistant tendencies are nonattachment, non-abiding, and peace.

original: kun 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang gsum ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang gsum ste /
translated: The origin of suffering is also threefold:

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
translated: attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di rnams kyi gnyen po ni 'dod chags med pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di rnams kyi gnyen po ni 'dod chags med pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'o //
translated: The antidotes to these resistant tendencies are nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion.

original: rab tu skye ba gang yin pa de ni kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba gang yin pa de ni kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The full development of suffering is conceptualization.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the aspect of all that is not conducive to that.

original: de'i gnyen po ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: The antidote to that is non-affliction,

original: nyon mongs pa ldog pa las rnam par rtog pa thams cad ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ldog pa las rnam par rtog pa thams cad ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because from the cessation of affliction, the cessation of all conceptual thoughts occurs.

original: rkyen gang yin pa de ni sems can du mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen gang yin pa de ni sems can du mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: That which is a condition is the adherence to sentient beings,

original: de'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the aspect of that.

original: de'i gnyen po ni sems can med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni sems can med pa ste /
translated: The antidote to that is the absence of sentient beings,

original: sems can med par shes pa las de'i mngon par zhen pa ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can med par shes pa las de'i mngon par zhen pa ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because from the knowledge of the absence of sentient beings, the adherence to that is reversed.

original: de ltar na de rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, they are antidotes to those.

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa mi mthun par gyur pa'i ngo bo gsum dang gsum zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa dang gcig dang gcig ste zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa med pa dang sems can med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa mi mthun par gyur pa'i ngo bo gsum dang gsum zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa dang gcig dang gcig ste zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa med pa dang sems can med pa ste /
translated: The three kinds of natures that are incompatible with aspiration, desire, and so on, are the three kinds of freedom from desire, and so on, and the three kinds of absence of desire, and so on.

original: brgyad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyu rnam pa brgyad yin no zhes bya bar bsgrags so //
analyzed: brgyad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyu rnam pa brgyad yin no zhes bya bar bsgrags so //
translated: The eight kinds of causes, and so on, are proclaimed to be the eight kinds of causes.

original: lam gyi rnam pa bdun ni tshad med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa bdun ni tshad med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The seven kinds of paths are the immeasurable, and so on.

original: rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis na tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis na tshad med pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable because they are not the domain of conceptual thought.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis spangs pas na mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel ba ste ma dmigs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis spangs pas na mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel ba ste ma dmigs so //
translated: They are not connected with the two extremes because they abandon both cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang 'dra ba dbyer med pa nyid yin pas na tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang 'dra ba dbyer med pa nyid yin pas na tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: They are not different because they are inseparable from the dharmadhatu.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pas mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pas mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without supreme apprehension, since it is not mixed with the discriminations of the Sravakas, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni stong pa nyid yin par mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog @193b pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni stong pa nyid yin par mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog @193b pa'o //
translated: It is non-discriminative, since all discriminations are the same in being emptiness.

original: shes par bya ba med pas na dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba med pas na dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable, since it is not an object of knowledge.

original: chos thams cad la zhen pa med pa'i phyir chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la zhen pa med pa'i phyir chags pa med pa ste /
translated: It is without attachment, since it is not attached to any dharma.üîΩThese cognitions, etc.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa ni sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa'i lam ni thar pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa ni sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa'i lam ni thar pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The path which opens up the opportunity for all sentient beings is the path which opens up the opportunity for all sentient beings to attain the city of liberation.

original: ji ltar sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa ji ltar smos pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa ji ltar smos pa la sogs pas so //
translated: How does it open up the opportunity for all sentient beings? As it is said, etc.

original: rig pa gang yin pa dang ji ltar rig par yin pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed pa dang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa gang yin pa dang ji ltar rig par yin pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed pa dang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is awareness and how it is awareness is due to the direct realization of correct intuitive wisdom and the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: sgrub pa gang yin pa dang ji ltar bsgrub pa yin pa ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa nyid dang / sems phyin ci ma log par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa gang yin pa dang ji ltar bsgrub pa yin pa ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa nyid dang / sems phyin ci ma log par sgrub pa'o //
translated: What is practice and how it is practice is due to the perfection of the cultivation of the antidotes such as the generation of the mind of enlightenment, and the practice of the mind without error.

original: nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: What is the escape is nirvana.

original: de dag ni de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: These are the nature of those, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The aspects of the truth of suffering are impermanence, etc.

original: med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir med pas na mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir med pas na mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Because it is said that the meaning of non-existence is the meaning of impermanence, impermanence is due to non-existence.

original: 'du byed nyid yin pas na sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed nyid yin pas na sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Because it is a formation, it is suffering.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pas stong pas na stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pas stong pas na stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty because it is empty of a self, etc., imagined by others.

original: gang zag la sogs pa med pas na bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa med pas na bdag med pa'o //
translated: It is selflessness because there is no person, etc.üîΩThe aspects of signlessness are fivefold.üîΩWhat are they? The nature of non-production is the non-production of all things by their own intrinsic reality.üîΩThe nature of non-cessation is the non-cessation of all things by their own intrinsic reality.üîΩThe nature of quiescence is the quiescence of all things by their own intrinsic reality.üîΩThe nature of primordial quiescence is the primordial quiescence of all things by their own intrinsic reality.üîΩThe nature of non-separation is the non-separation of all things by their own intrinsic reality.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i rnam pa ni lnga yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i rnam pa ni lnga yin te /
translated: The aspects of wishlessness are fivefold.üîΩWhat are they? The nature of non-production is the non-production of all things by their own intrinsic reality.

original: de yang gang zhe na ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ma skyes pa ste /
translated: The nature of non-cessation is the non-cessation of all things by their own intrinsic reality.üîΩThe nature of quiescence is the quiescence of all things by their own intrinsic reality.üîΩThe nature of primordial quiescence is the primordial quiescence of all things by their own intrinsic reality.

original: thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nature of non-separation is the non-separation of all things by their own intrinsic reality.üîΩThe aspects of emptiness are fivefold.üîΩWhat are they? The emptiness of internal phenomena refers to the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.üîΩThe emptiness of external phenomena refers to forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental objects.üîΩThe emptiness of both internal and external phenomena refers to the internal and external sense bases.üîΩThe emptiness of emptiness refers to the emptiness of all phenomena.üîΩThe emptiness of the great refers to the great elements of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: btags pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa chos brgyad po de dag la mngon par zhen pa bkag pas yang dag pa nyid du med pa nyid kyis na go rims bzhin du stong pa zhes bya ba stong pa nyid dang / chen po zhes bya ba chen po stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: btags pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa chos brgyad po de dag la mngon par zhen pa bkag pas yang dag pa nyid du med pa nyid kyis na go rims bzhin du stong pa zhes bya ba stong pa nyid dang / chen po zhes bya ba chen po stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate refers to nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas zhes bya ba 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa zhes bya ba mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas zhes bya ba 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa zhes bya ba mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The aspect of the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate, the aspect of the conditioned is the emptiness of the conditioned, the aspect of the unconditioned is the emptiness of the unconditioned, the aspect of transcendence is the emptiness of transcendence,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa zhes bya ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa zhes bya ba dor ba med pa stong pa @194a * //üîΩzhes bya ba ste rnam pa de dag yin no //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa zhes bya ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa zhes bya ba dor ba med pa stong pa @194a * // zhes bya ba ste rnam pa de dag yin no //
translated: the aspect of the beginningless and endless is the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the aspect of the inexhaustible is the emptiness of the inexhaustible.

original: gya nom pa'i rnam pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gya nom pa'i rnam pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the aspect of the sublime?

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i byed pa po gang yin pa de bkag pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i byed pa po gang yin pa de bkag pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of the emptiness of nature is the negation of any creator imputed by others, such as the Vaibhasikas and so on.

original: yang dag par na bya ba med pas na lha sbyin la sogs pas las byed pa po nang na mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / ma mthong bar brtags pa ni ha cang thal ches pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par na bya ba med pas na lha sbyin la sogs pas las byed pa po nang na mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / ma mthong bar brtags pa ni ha cang thal ches pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no activity in reality, the agent of action such as Devadatta is not perceived internally, and it is too much to imagine that it is not seen externally.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bshad do zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bshad do zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: yul du 'khrul pa yang dag pa nyid du shes pa'i rnam pa yin na yang phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: yul du 'khrul pa yang dag pa nyid du shes pa'i rnam pa yin na yang phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The aspect of the knowledge of the correct nature of error regarding the object is the error regarding external form, etc.

original: de'i bdag nyid rnams ni btags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid rnams ni btags pa ste /
translated: Those that have that nature are imputed,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: the conventions of form, etc.

original: mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their characteristics are suitability for material form, etc.

original: dus ni dpyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus ni dpyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The times are spring, etc.

original: 'di rnams su 'khrul pa rnams ni gang de kho na nyid du ni yang dag pa ma yin na yang yang dag par rnam par 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams su 'khrul pa rnams ni gang de kho na nyid du ni yang dag pa ma yin na yang yang dag par rnam par 'khrul pa'o //
translated: The errors in these are not correct in reality, but are correct errors.

original: de rnams kyi 'gag par chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dus ni kun rdzob tu yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / yang dag par na shes pa'i snang ba las gzhan pa'i dus kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'gag par chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dus ni kun rdzob tu yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / yang dag par na shes pa'i snang ba las gzhan pa'i dus kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of nonobservation, since the time imputed by others is not observed even conventionally and since, in reality, time is not tenable as anything other than the appearance of consciousness.

original: rnam pa gsum po de dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de dag go //
translated: Those are the three aspects.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa kho na zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam pa nyid yin la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa kho na zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam pa nyid yin la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: The aspect of definite emergence is the aspect of nirvana itself, since it is the emptiness of the nature of nonentities due to the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: The aspect of thusness and so on is proclaimed to be the single aspect of the emptiness of the nature of nonentities.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni bcu drug tu bsgrags so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni bcu drug tu bsgrags so //
translated: Thus, the aspects are proclaimed to be sixteen.

original: kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse ‚Äúomniscience‚Äù and so on is stated in the verse ‚Äúomniscience‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy omniscience‚Äù is as previously explained.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it includes all ƒÅrya persons‚Äù means because it includes ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and perfect buddhas.

original: @194b grangs bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: @194b grangs bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order‚Äù should be applied to the following.

original: dran pa nyer bzhag nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang por byas nas so //
analyzed: dran pa nyer bzhag nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang por byas nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBeginning with the applications of mindfulness‚Äù means beginning with the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam par zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa rnam pa sum cu rtsa dgu'i bar ni rnam pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam par zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa rnam pa sum cu rtsa dgu'i bar ni rnam pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The final one is called ‚Äúthe knowledge of all aspects,‚Äù which should be understood as the thirty-nine aspects, such as the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that all noble beings are included in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúBecause of the three knowledges, etc.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum du grags pa des bsdus pa'i lam gang la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i lam gyi bden pa rnam pa gsum po de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba de'i thabs kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum du grags pa des bsdus pa'i lam gang la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i lam gyi bden pa rnam pa gsum po de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba de'i thabs kyis so //
translated: The path that is included in the three knowledges, which are renowned as the three knowledges, is the three aspects of the truth of the path, such as the knowledge of all aspects, and so on.

original: 'dis ni kun mkhyen nyid gsum bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun mkhyen nyid gsum bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the verse that says, ‚ÄúBecause of the three knowledges, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum yang dag par na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yin par bshad la /
analyzed: 'dir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum yang dag par na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yin par bshad la /
translated: Here, the three knowledges, which are included in the knowledge of all aspects, are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc.üîΩIt is intended that these are the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.

original: de yang nyan thos la sogs pa lam gsum gyi bye brag gis gsum nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩde ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang nyan thos la sogs pa lam gsum gyi bye brag gis gsum nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so // de ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsdus pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi nang nas so //üîΩthams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa rnam par dbyad pa'i thabs la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsdus pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi nang nas so // thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa rnam par dbyad pa'i thabs la'o //
translated: The three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.

original: bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i lam la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i lam la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: The three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.üîΩThe three knowledges are explained as the three knowledges of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., due to the differences in the three paths.

original: rnam par dpyad pa ni lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa ni lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The analysis is the body, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gi don gyi bya ba nus pa dang mi nus pa dag gis yongs su brtag cing skye ba med pa nyid du shes par byed pa gang yin pa de rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gi don gyi bya ba nus pa dang mi nus pa dag gis yongs su brtag cing skye ba med pa nyid du shes par byed pa gang yin pa de rnam pa yin no //
translated: The analysis is that which is fully investigated by the power and impotence of the specific and general characteristics of the body, etc., and which is understood to be unproduced.

original: brtson 'grus bskyed pa'i phyir rtsol ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus bskyed pa'i phyir rtsol ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path of effort is for the sake of generating effort.

original: yang dag par spong ba'i thabs la mi dge ba nges par skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dag yang dag par spong bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mi bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / @195a * //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba'i thabs la mi dge ba nges par skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dag yang dag par spong bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mi bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / @195a * //
translated: The method of the correct abandonment is for the sake of abandoning the non-virtue that has definitely arisen and that which has not arisen, and for the sake of not generating it.

original: dge ba yang dag par skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la 'phel bar bya ba dang bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: dge ba yang dag par skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la 'phel bar bya ba dang bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The cause of increasing and generating the virtue that has arisen and that which has not arisen is effort.

original: sems las su rung ba nyid du byed pa ni sems rtse gcig par gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba nyid du byed pa ni sems rtse gcig par gyur pa yin pas /
translated: The mind becomes serviceable through one-pointedness of mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path of thorough preparation for meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan 'du byed pa'i thabs rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i rnam pa la'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan 'du byed pa'i thabs rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i rnam pa la'o //
translated: The aspects of the bases of psychic power are the means of accomplishing meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis spong ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis spong ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rtsol ba'o //
translated: The abandonment by means of meditative concentration is the exertion of attachment and so on.

original: de'i don du 'du byed pa ni 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don du 'du byed pa ni 'bad pa'o //
translated: The thorough preparation for that is effort.

original: de dang ldan zhing bcas pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan zhing bcas pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
translated: The bases of psychic power are endowed with and possess that.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rten yin pa ni 'di dag gi stobs kyis rdzu 'phrul byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rten yin pa ni 'di dag gi stobs kyis rdzu 'phrul byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are the basis of psychic power because psychic power is performed by their power,

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas las su rung bar 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas las su rung bar 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are flexibility that arises from aspiration and so on.

original: sems yongs su sbyang ba byas shing ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: sems yongs su sbyang ba byas shing ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path of preparation for clear realization endowed with meditative concentration is the thorough preparation of the mind.

original: sbyor ba'i nus pa las byung ba'i dad pa la sogs pa'i thabs la'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i nus pa las byung ba'i dad pa la sogs pa'i thabs la'o //
translated: The aspects of the path of preparation are the means of clear realization endowed with meditative concentration.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang pos 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dro ba dang rtse mo'i sbyor ba rtogs par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdro ba la sogs pa thob cing dro ba dang rtse mo rtogs pa ni bzod pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel cing gcig tu gyur pa'i lam dad pa'i stobs la sogs pa gang yin pa de la 'dod pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyi rjes
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang pos 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dro ba dang rtse mo'i sbyor ba rtogs par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro // dro ba la sogs pa thob cing dro ba dang rtse mo rtogs pa ni bzod pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel cing gcig tu gyur pa'i lam dad pa'i stobs la sogs pa gang yin pa de la 'dod pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyi rjes
translated: and the faculties of faith, etc., are the path of the arya because they are the means of realizing the heat and peak applications in order to correctly accomplish the path of the arya.üîΩThe faculties of faith, etc., which are the path connected with and unified with the realization of the clear realization of acceptance, etc., are the applications of heat, peak, and so on.
