original: thogs la bden pa'i rtogs pa'i don du dad pa med pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog gi sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs la bden pa'i rtogs pa'i don du dad pa med pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog gi sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Immediately after the faculties of faith, etc., in order to realize the meaning of the truths, they are the applications of acceptance and supreme mundane qualities that overpower the discordant classes of faithlessness, etc.

original: dro ba la sogs pa bzhi rtogs pa la ni /
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa bzhi rtogs pa la ni /
translated: The realization of the four, heat, etc.,

original: bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: is the path of seeing the four truths.

original: bden pa bzhi shes pa'i thabs la ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lam shes bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi shes pa'i thabs la ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lam shes bya ste /
translated: The method of knowing the four truths should be known as the path of clear realization.

original: dran pa la sogs pa'i thabs des thog ma kho nar de kho na nyid du mngon par rtogs par rig pa yongs su shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa'i thabs des thog ma kho nar de kho na nyid du mngon par rtogs par rig pa yongs su shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that method of mindfulness, etc., one first understands the knowledge of the realization of reality.

original: bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam yin te /
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúseeing the truths,‚Äù etc., right view, etc., are the path of right deliverance,

original: mthong ba'i lam yan chad 'dis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam yan chad 'dis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by this path, beginning with the path of seeing, one is delivered to the purification of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: der 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di rnams go rims bzhin du 'byung bas @195b go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: der 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di rnams go rims bzhin du 'byung bas @195b go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these factors of enlightenment should be understood in order, because they occur in this order.

original: de ltar na dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la sogs pa lam rnam pa bdun gyi dbang du byas nas slob ma rnams la kun shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la sogs pa lam rnam pa bdun gyi dbang du byas nas slob ma rnams la kun shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can te /
translated: Thus, with reference to the sevenfold path, beginning with the path of understanding things as they are, the disciples are established in the path of understanding all things,

original: de la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa yin no //
translated: and they abide in it.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi ni lam shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi ni lam shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Now, the thirty-four aspects of the bodhisattvas' knowledge of the path are indicated by the words knowledge of the path, etc.

original: lta ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi shes pa'o //
translated: View is the knowledge of the adverse side of the apprehended object, etc.

original: de rnams kyi gnyen po'i lam ni rnam par sel ba'i thabs rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen po'i lam ni rnam par sel ba'i thabs rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The path that is the antidote to those is the three kinds of means of elimination.

original: de ni lta bas byas pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ni lta bas byas pa zhes smos te /
translated: That is called view-making,

original: lta ba las gyur pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: lta ba las gyur pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: the antidote to the adverse side that comes from view.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ni lta ba'i rgyu'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ni lta ba'i rgyu'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The reason for that is conceptualizing the cause of view,

original: rtog pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: rtog pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: and that is the antidote to those conceptualizations.

original: khams gsum pa la smon pa ni sems can du lta ba la zhugs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa la smon pa ni sems can du lta ba la zhugs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Aspiring to the three realms is the engagement in the view of sentient beings.

original: de ni gnyen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the knowledge of the path, etc.

original: zhi ba'i rnam pas mtshan ma med ces bya ba 'di dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pas mtshan ma med ces bya ba 'di dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: The words signless through the aspect of peace contradict this.

original: 'di ni dngos po'i rgyu'i rgyu mtshan dang rjes su 'brel pa'i nyan thos kyi lam gyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩde skad brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i rgyu'i rgyu mtshan dang rjes su 'brel pa'i nyan thos kyi lam gyi dbang du byas nas / de skad brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is said with reference to the causal path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, which is the cause of the object.

original: sprul pa'i lam ni sprul pa'i thabs kyi bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i lam ni sprul pa'i thabs kyi bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The path of emanation is the three kinds of activities of the means of emanation.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma bshig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la zhes bya ba kha dog bzang ba dang kha dog ngan pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma bshig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la zhes bya ba kha dog bzang ba dang kha dog ngan pa'o //
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúbecause the ideation of internal form has not been destroyed,‚Äù etc., external forms are good or bad colors.

original: blta'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten te zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: blta'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten te zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne sees‚Äù means that one sees by relying on the meditative concentration or the formless meditative attainment.

original: sprul pa'i sgrib pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sgrib pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The obscuration to emanation is the counteragent to that.

original: de'i gnyen po rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The counteragent to that is twofold.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The third liberation is stated with the words ‚Äúone who has the ideation of internal form,‚Äù etc.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i rgyu las gyur pas gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i rgyu las gyur pas gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa ste /
translated: The emanations of the Buddhas are beautiful and ugly forms, due to the causes of the merit and demerit of the disciples.

original: 'phags pa dang cig shos kyi rnam pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dang cig shos kyi rnam pa dag ste /
translated: The beautiful forms are the aspects of the noble ones, and the ugly forms are the aspects of others.

original: de dag gi sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sprul pa'o //
translated: The emanations of the Buddhas are those two.

original: dga' ba ni 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni 'bad pa'o //
translated: Delight is effort.

original: mi dga' ba ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: Aversion is turning away.

original: gnyis po de dag ni kun tu chags pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /üîΩmi mthun pa yin la de dag gi gnyen po ni rgyur gdul bya rnams kyi sdug @196a * //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag ni kun tu chags pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ste / mi mthun pa yin la de dag gi gnyen po ni rgyur gdul bya rnams kyi sdug @196a * //
translated: Those two are thoroughly afflicted because they are the causes of attachment.

original: pa ste / bsod nams kyi rgyu'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: pa ste / bsod nams kyi rgyu'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste /
translated: The antidote to those two is the cause of the disciples' merit, the door of liberation of the beautiful.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi thabs so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi thabs so //
translated: It is the method of perfect enlightenment.

original: lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ji ltar gdul bar lus kyi 'phags pa'i rnam par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ji ltar gdul bar lus kyi 'phags pa'i rnam par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having manifested it with the body, means having manifested the body of an ƒÅrya in whatever way is necessary to tame disciples.

original: rdzogs par byas te zhes bya ba ni bstan par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par byas te zhes bya ba ni bstan par dmigs pa'o //
translated: Having completed it, means having completed the observation of the teaching.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba ni bya ba thams cad kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba ni bya ba thams cad kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbides‚Äù means that he engages in all actions.

original: 'dir yang bdag nyid gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba'i 'du shes la brten te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bdag nyid gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba'i 'du shes la brten te /
translated: Here, too, one should understand that he, on the basis of the notion of mutual dependence of the attractive and unattractive, and on the basis of the notion of mutual penetration,

original: phan tshun gyi 'du shes ro gcig pa thob pas gzugs ji ltar 'dod pa'i rnam par thar pa la dbang thob pa yin no zhes blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi 'du shes ro gcig pa thob pas gzugs ji ltar 'dod pa'i rnam par thar pa la dbang thob pa yin no zhes blta bar bya ste /
translated: attains the state of a single taste of the notion of mutual penetration, and thus attains mastery over the liberation of form as he wishes.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bdag nyid thar pa khyad par can gyi rgyur gyur pas na rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bdag nyid thar pa khyad par can gyi rgyur gyur pas na rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: It is a liberation because it is the cause of a special liberation that has the nature of perfect enlightenment.

original: mthong ba'i chos ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du mdzad pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du mdzad pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The present life is the knowledge that the Lord has actualized.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi bde bar gnas pa gang yin pa ni ji ltar bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi bde bar gnas pa gang yin pa ni ji ltar bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The ease that has that as its nature is the ease of whatever is at ease.

original: de'i lam ni thabs rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de'i lam ni thabs rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Its path is the five kinds of means.

original: thabs kyi rang bzhin yang rnam pa gnyis bshad pa ni de mthong bas gzhan rnams kyi yang de bstan pas thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i rgyur gyur pas thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin la gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam
analyzed: thabs kyi rang bzhin yang rnam pa gnyis bshad pa ni de mthong bas gzhan rnams kyi yang de bstan pas thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i rgyur gyur pas thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin la gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam
translated: The nature of method is also explained in two aspects.üîΩüîΩThe nature of the path that abides in accordance with liberation is the formless meditative attainments.üîΩ

original: pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: pa bzhi ste /
translated: The nature of the method is also explained in two aspects. By seeing that, the others are also taught. It becomes the cause for abiding in accordance with liberation. Therefore, the nature of the path of abiding in accordance with liberation is the four formless absorptions.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four formless absorptions are the base of infinite space and so on.

original: zhi bar gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the path of abiding in peace is the absence of faults such as attachment.

original: 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste ;
analyzed: 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste ;
translated: By the words perception and so on, the absorption of cessation is taught.

original: gcig yin no //
analyzed: gcig yin no //
translated: It is one.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thabs rnam pa dgu la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thabs rnam pa dgu la'o //
translated: It is on the nine aspects of the supramundane path, the method.

original: spong ba'i lam ste nyon mongs pa sel ba'i thabs la'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i lam ste nyon mongs pa sel ba'i thabs la'o //
translated: It is the path of abandonment, the method for eliminating afflictions.

original: bar chad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lam gcig yin na yang bden pa bzhi'i bye brag gis nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhi yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lam gcig yin na yang bden pa bzhi'i bye brag gis nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhi yin no //
translated: The path without obstacles, etc. Even though it is one path, it is a basis characterized by the absence of afflictions due to the distinctions of the four noble truths.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The path to buddhahood is generosity, etc.

original: de ni sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by generosity, etc.

original: de ltar na lam rnam pa drug gi dbang du mdzad nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lam rnam pa drug gi dbang du mdzad nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, with reference to the six aspects of the path, he states the bodhisattva, etc.

original: da ni yang dag @196b par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa dgu ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni yang dag @196b par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa dgu ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Now, the thirty-nine aspects of the knowledge of all aspects of the perfect buddhas are stated by the knowledge of all aspects, etc.

original: shin tu phul du byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi mchog yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu phul du byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi mchog yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is extremely sublime means because it is the most excellent of all.

original: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lam gcig pu kho na yin na yang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis phye ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lam gcig pu kho na yin na yang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis phye ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The uncommon and so on means that although it is the sole path, it is distinguished by the specifics of the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: da ni de la ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni de la ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Now, he says, the abode and non-abode and so on.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa dgu'o zhes bya ba ni stobs la sogs pa rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug dang 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / gang zhig de chos thams cad la mnga' bsgyur ba'i rang byung dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa dgu'o zhes bya ba ni stobs la sogs pa rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug dang 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / gang zhig de chos thams cad la mnga' bsgyur ba'i rang byung dang /
translated: The aspects of the buddhas are thirty-nine, meaning the thirty-six aspects such as the powers, the essence of these, suchness, and that which is the self-arisen one who has mastery over all phenomena,

original: gang gi don du rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba gsum mo //
analyzed: gang gi don du rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba gsum mo //
translated: and the buddhahood for the sake of which all aspects are fully awakened, called the three.

original: rnam pa thams cad bsdus te rang bzhin dang grangs ni de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad bsdus te rang bzhin dang grangs ni de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The nature and number of all aspects are included in the statement, ‚ÄúThe aspects of the knowledge of all aspects,‚Äù and so on.

original: dri ma med pa'i rnam pa bcu drug las gzhan med do zhes gang gsungs pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po las dgongs pa yin pas de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i rnam pa bcu drug las gzhan med do zhes gang gsungs pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po las dgongs pa yin pas de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There are no other aspects than the sixteen stainless aspects. This is stated from the point of view of the antidote to the afflictive obstructions, so there is no contradiction with the present topic.

original: sbyor ba khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi yum sgom par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi yum sgom par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe special application,‚Äù and so on, explains the implied meaning of the bodhisattva who cultivates the Mother of the nature of the application with its aspects.

original: de dag kyang sbyor ba po med par brjod par mi nus pas zhes bya ba ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir smra bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang sbyor ba po med par brjod par mi nus pas zhes bya ba ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir smra bar mi rigs so //
translated: And since it is not possible to speak of them without an agent, it is not reasonable to speak of them because they are purposeless.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas pa ni sangs rgyas la dmigs te gtsug lag khang la sogs pa byed pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams la bsod snyoms la sogs phul bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas pa ni sangs rgyas la dmigs te gtsug lag khang la sogs pa byed pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams la bsod snyoms la sogs phul bas so //
translated: The worship of the Buddhas is the construction of temples, etc.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa ni sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa ni sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The planting of the roots of virtue is the service of the Buddhas, etc.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mgon dang bcas shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi mgon dang ldan pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi yum 'di mnyan pa'i snon yin zhing 'dzin pa dang 'chang ba la sogs pa ni snod nyid yin par dam
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mgon dang bcas shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi mgon dang ldan pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi yum 'di mnyan pa'i snon yin zhing 'dzin pa dang 'chang ba la sogs pa ni snod nyid yin par dam
translated: The protection of the spiritual friend is the protection of the spiritual friend, and the protection by the spiritual friend is the hearing, etc. of this Mother who is the essence of the practice with its aspects.

original: pa rnams @197a * //
analyzed: pa rnams @197a * //
translated: The Buddhas have declared that the vessel is the one who hears, etc.

original: bzhed pa ste /
analyzed: bzhed pa ste /
translated: this Mother, and the one who hears, etc.üîΩthis Mother is the one who is praised in it.

original: der bsngags pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: der bsngags pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the permission of the Buddhas.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'das pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'das pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verses begins with the words: the past, etc.

original: gzhan dang mnyam pa la sogs pa 'thob par mi 'gyur bas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun cing sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang mnyam pa la sogs pa 'thob par mi 'gyur bas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun cing sbyangs pa ste /
translated: Since they do not obtain equality with others and so on, they plant and cultivate roots of virtue in the buddhas of the past and present.üîΩThey focus on all buddhas and make offerings of alms and so on to those who make temples and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la dmigs te gtsug lag khang la sogs pa byed pa de rnams la bsod snyoms la sogs pa phul bas dang po thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sa bon thob pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la dmigs te gtsug lag khang la sogs pa byed pa de rnams la bsod snyoms la sogs pa phul bas dang po thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sa bon thob pa'o //
translated: They obtain the seed of the first stage conducive to liberation.üîΩIn general, since others do not have it, they make offerings to the tathagatas in general, the buddhas themselves.

original: spyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams la med pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la spyir sangs rgyas de dag nyid la bkur sti byas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun cing sbyangs pa'i sbyor ba po thams cad kyi lha'i rigs /
analyzed: spyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams la med pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la spyir sangs rgyas de dag nyid la bkur sti byas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun cing sbyangs pa'i sbyor ba po thams cad kyi lha'i rigs /
translated: They are the lineage of the gods of all those who plant and cultivate roots of virtue and make offerings.

original: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba lus dang ngag dang sems kyis bskor ba bya ba dang / don ci lta ba bzhin bstod pa dang thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pas bsnyen bkur byas shing bsten par byas pa dang / ras ris la sogs par gtogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mnyes par byas shing mchod pa ni lus la sogs pa'i bsnyen bkur gyis mnyes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba lus dang ngag dang sems kyis bskor ba bya ba dang / don ci lta ba bzhin bstod pa dang thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pas bsnyen bkur byas shing bsten par byas pa dang / ras ris la sogs par gtogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mnyes par byas shing mchod pa ni lus la sogs pa'i bsnyen bkur gyis mnyes par bya ba'o //
translated: Worship with body, etc. means to worship with body, speech, and mind, to serve and attend by praising according to the meaning, by listening, reflecting, etc., and to please and worship the Tathagatas belonging to the painting, etc.

original: the tshom gyi don yongs su 'dri ba ni yid gnyis su gyur pa'i don dge ba'i bshes gnyen la zhu ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi don yongs su 'dri ba ni yid gnyis su gyur pa'i don dge ba'i bshes gnyen la zhu ba'o //
translated: Asking about the meaning of doubts means to ask the spiritual friend about the meaning of what is doubtful.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sgrub pa ni nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sgrub pa ni nyams su len pa'o //
translated: Practice means accomplishing the ten perfections such as generosity.

original: de dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa 'di nyid ni rnam pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yum zhes bya ba rnam pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di go rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa 'di nyid ni rnam pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yum zhes bya ba rnam pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di go rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes
translated: This very one who is endowed with that, who is blessed by the spiritual friends, is the mother who has the characteristic of the aspect, called the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the application of the aspect, in just the right order.

original: bya ba bkur sti byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun cing sbyangs pa dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / the tshom gyi don yongs su dri ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa dang ldan pa ste / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ldan pa bzhi po ni mnyan pa la sogs pa bzhi'i snod nyid du gyur pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bya ba bkur sti byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun cing sbyangs pa dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / the tshom gyi don yongs su dri ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa dang ldan pa ste / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ldan pa bzhi po ni mnyan pa la sogs pa bzhi'i snod nyid du gyur pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One who has served, planted wholesome roots, purified, attended to the Buddha, asked about the meaning of doubt, and is endowed with the practice of generosity, etc., these four who are endowed with the spiritual friend are vessels for the four beginning with listening.

original: tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni len pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni len pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: By the words beginning with ‚Äúwords‚Äù he explains ‚Äúaccepting,‚Äù etc.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni lam bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni lam bsgom pa'o //
translated: Proper mental attention is the cultivation of the path.

original: gang gis sngon @197b sangs rgyas mngon sum du mthong zhing de rnams la des bkur sti byas pa'i bsod nams nye bar bsags na des de rnams nyid las ci'i phyir yum mnyan pa la sogs pa ma bsgrubs zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis sngon @197b sangs rgyas mngon sum du mthong zhing de rnams la des bkur sti byas pa'i bsod nams nye bar bsags na des de rnams nyid las ci'i phyir yum mnyan pa la sogs pa ma bsgrubs zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not say that he did not accomplish his mother, Nanda, and so on, because he previously accumulated the merit of honoring those Buddhas whom he directly saw.

original: de rnams ni de'i tshe des mngon sum du 'dul bar 'gyur ba ma yin la da ltar ni tshul de'am rgyud de las dge ba'i bshes gnyen des 'dul ba nyid kyis na yum mnyan pa la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni de'i tshe des mngon sum du 'dul bar 'gyur ba ma yin la da ltar ni tshul de'am rgyud de las dge ba'i bshes gnyen des 'dul ba nyid kyis na yum mnyan pa la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: At that time, they were not to be disciplined by him directly, but now, because the spiritual friend is to be disciplined by that method or continuum, his mother, Nanda, and so on, will appear.

original: za ma tog bkod pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkas sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas b'a r'a na gnas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang 'dra ba yin pas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: za ma tog bkod pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkas sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas b'a r'a na gnas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang 'dra ba yin pas na nyes pa med do //
translated: Since it is like the case of Sarvanlvaral)a, who, by the word of the Tathagata, served the spiritual friend living in Varanasi, there is no fault.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni sbyor ba'i rab tu byed pa'i don bshad pa yin te / yang dag par na gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis mi gnas pa ni mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni sbyor ba'i rab tu byed pa'i don bshad pa yin te / yang dag par na gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis mi gnas pa ni mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: The phrase form and so on explains the meaning of the preparatory application, for the non-abiding in form and so on due to their intrinsic realitylessness is non-attachment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag la mi sbyor ba nyid sbyor ba yin pa ni bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa gsum po nye bar ma dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag la mi sbyor ba nyid sbyor ba yin pa ni bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa gsum po nye bar ma dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-application to form and so on is application, which is the non-apprehension of the three, namely, the object of meditation and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag nyid de bzhin nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pas zab pa dang gting dpag dka' ba dang tshad med pa nyid mi gnas pa dang mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin dang rnyog pa med pa dang / mtha' med pa nye bar ma dmigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag nyid de bzhin nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pas zab pa dang gting dpag dka' ba dang tshad med pa nyid mi gnas pa dang mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin dang rnyog pa med pa dang / mtha' med pa nye bar ma dmigs pa nyid de /
translated: The non-abiding, non-apprehension, intrinsic reality, non-turbidity, and non-apprehension of the limitless of form and so on are due to their profundity, difficulty of fathoming, and immeasurability, which are due to their emptiness with respect to suchness.

original: de ltar rtogs shing shes pa dang ldan pa rnams la grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs shing shes pa dang ldan pa rnams la grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: The five applications beginning with ‚Äúin that way, those who have realization and knowledge‚Äù explain the meaning of ‚Äúbecause they do not dwell in form, etc.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la tshegs chen po dang yun ring po dag gis sdug bsngal ba dang / bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa de la skrag pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la tshegs chen po dang yun ring po dag gis sdug bsngal ba dang / bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa de la skrag pa'o //
translated: The fear of the perfection of wisdom is the suffering of great difficulty and long duration, and the full enlightenment in three incalculable aeons.

original: sangs rgyas rnams las 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyis dus dang ming dang nges pa la sogs pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni lung bstan pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams las 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyis dus dang ming dang nges pa la sogs pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni lung bstan pa thob pa ste /
translated: The attainment of prophecy is the attainment of time, name, certainty, etc. from the Buddhas themselves through enlightenment.

original: de la mi skrag pas ni tshegs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir lung bstan ces bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mi skrag pas ni tshegs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir lung bstan ces bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúattainment of prophecy‚Äù is because of the realization of great difficulty and long duration.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid du yang dag par 'dzin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i don phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis bzung ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid du yang dag par 'dzin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i don phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis bzung ba'o //
translated: The correct retention of irreversibility is the retention of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom and so forth through non-erroneousness.

original: @198a * // nges par 'byung ba ni bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pa la bar chad kyi chos 'og nas smos pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de rnams spong ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: @198a * // nges par 'byung ba ni bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pa la bar chad kyi chos 'og nas smos pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de rnams spong ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'dor ba'o //
translated: The renunciation is the abandonment of any faults that are obstacles to attaining unsurpassed wisdom, which are mentioned below.

original: bar chad med cing rgyun mi chad pa'i rtag tu chos bsgom pa'i yid nyid kyis gus pa dang bcas pa la sogs pas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med cing rgyun mi chad pa'i rtag tu chos bsgom pa'i yid nyid kyis gus pa dang bcas pa la sogs pas bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation is the cultivation with respect, and so forth, by the mind that always meditates on the Dharma without interruption or obstacle.

original: rang gi tshul las ltos nas yang dag par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub dang nye ba yin zhing zag pa med pa'i chos gser gyi rten nyid yin pa ni sangs rgyas pa kho nar gyur na nye bar dmigs pa'i gnas skabs su rtogs pa'i chos mthong ba
analyzed: rang gi tshul las ltos nas yang dag par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub dang nye ba yin zhing zag pa med pa'i chos gser gyi rten nyid yin pa ni sangs rgyas pa kho nar gyur na nye bar dmigs pa'i gnas skabs su rtogs pa'i chos mthong ba
translated: The proximity to perfect manifest enlightenment is in dependence on one's own system, and the basis of observation of the realization of the Dharma is the basis of the uncontaminated Dharma, which is only attained upon becoming a Buddha.

original: dang bral ba'i phyir nyid sngon du ma byung ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ye shes kyi rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa'i rten nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: dang bral ba'i phyir nyid sngon du ma byung ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ye shes kyi rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa'i rten nyid yin pa'o //
translated: Because it is free from the two obscurations, it is the basis of the ten powers, etc. which are not of the nature of afflicted wisdom, since they did not exist previously.

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub cing 'bras bu chos kyi sku mngon par grub pa ni pha rol gyi stobs bcu la sogs pa'i rten gyi chos kyi sku rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub cing 'bras bu chos kyi sku mngon par grub pa ni pha rol gyi stobs bcu la sogs pa'i rten gyi chos kyi sku rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: The swift attainment of complete enlightenment and the actualization of the result, the Dharma Body, is the completion of the Dharma Body which is the basis of the ten powers, etc. of others.

original: de ltar smon pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar smon pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is so because of the vow.

original: byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // zhes bya ba byang chub rnam pa gnyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // zhes bya ba byang chub rnam pa gnyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: The two kinds of enlightenment are explained in the verse: ‚Äúnear and swift.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don du chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba ni kun nas chos ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba ni kun nas chos ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The turning of the wheel of the Dharma for the sake of others is the performance of teaching the Dharma.

original: 'phel ba med pa dang 'grib pa med cing gzugs la sogs pa'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mi mthong ba ni ma dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba med pa dang 'grib pa med cing gzugs la sogs pa'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mi mthong ba ni ma dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of form, etc. is the non-perception of the increase and decrease of form, etc.

original: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is form, etc.

original: chos min ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos min ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The non-existent is space, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gang zag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gang zag la sogs pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the person, etc.üîΩThe non-perception of those is the non-apprehension of the existent and the non-existent, etc.

original: de rnams yang dag par mi mthong ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa nye bar mi dmigs pa ste / de la 'dod pa'i khams su mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams yang dag par mi mthong ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa nye bar mi dmigs pa ste / de la 'dod pa'i khams su mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of those in the desire realm is the non-apprehension of the existent.üîΩThe non-apprehension of form, etc. by the emptiness of the inconceivable aspect is the non-apprehension of the non-existent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa'i stong pa nyid kyis 'gog cing mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de la gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par rlom pa med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i stobs pa nyid la mngon parüîΩzhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa'i stong pa nyid kyis 'gog cing mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de la gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par rlom pa med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i stobs pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-conceit of form, etc. in the inconceivable aspect is the non-attachment to the emptiness of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la mi rtog pa ni gzugs dang de'i mtshan ma dang / de'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par mi rtog pa ste / gzugs kyi phung po dang sngon po la sogs pa 'byung @198b ba chen po la sogs par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la mi rtog pa ni gzugs dang de'i mtshan ma dang / de'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par mi rtog pa ste / gzugs kyi phung po dang sngon po la sogs pa 'byung @198b ba chen po la sogs par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-discrimination of the entity of form, etc. is the non-discrimination of form, its sign, and its nature, the non-discrimination of the aggregate of form, and the elements such as earth, etc.

original: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa la 'bras bu dang po mthong ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras
analyzed: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa la 'bras bu dang po mthong ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras
translated: The precious result is given means that the precious result of the result of stream enterer and so on up to the precious result of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is given.

original: bu shes pa'o //üîΩdag pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi dri ma med pa ni gzugs rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: bu shes pa'o // dag pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi dri ma med pa ni gzugs rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The first result is seen means that the result of stream enterer and so on is known.üîΩPurity is stainless suchness.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa dri ma med pa'o //
translated: Form is pure means that the aggregate of form and so on is stainless.

original: mtshan ni dri ba'i dus la sogs pa'i nges pas lo skor du mngon par brtson pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa rnams go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor ba rnam pa bco lnga'o //
analyzed: mtshan ni dri ba'i dus la sogs pa'i nges pas lo skor du mngon par brtson pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa rnams go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor ba rnam pa bco lnga'o //
translated: The marks are the fifteen types of application, such as the one called not forsaking effort for a year and so on, through the certainty of the time of asking questions and so on.

original: sbyor ba rnam pa nyi shu yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba lnga dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam pa nyi shu yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba lnga dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The twenty types of application are the five previously explained applications and the fifteen applications.

original: gzhan don 'phel med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan don 'phel med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the other two lines is self-evident.

original: sbyor ba nyi shu po de dag gi go rims 'di ni rigs pa kho na yin te / de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pas gnas pa dang / de la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba la mngon par brtson pa de dag gis gzugs la sogs pa la zag pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyi shu po de dag gi go rims 'di ni rigs pa kho na yin te / de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pas gnas pa dang / de la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba la mngon par brtson pa de dag gis gzugs la sogs pa la zag pa nyid dang /
translated: The order of these twenty applications is quite reasonable, for those who are intent on the application of non-application to the non-apprehension of all dharmas such as form, etc., will understand the dharmas such as form, etc., as being defiled,

original: gting dpag dka' ba nyid dang / tshad med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //üîΩde nas 'di yang dag pa'i sbyor ba mi byed pa nyid kyis ni las dang po pa nyid kyi ni tshegs chen pos 'thob po //
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba nyid dang / tshad med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //üîΩde nas 'di yang dag pa'i sbyor ba mi byed pa nyid kyis ni las dang po pa nyid kyi ni tshegs chen pos 'thob po //
translated: as being difficult to fathom, and as being immeasurable.üîΩThen, by not applying to them, they will understand the dharmas such as form, etc., as being pure, as being easy to fathom, and as being measurable.

original: de las gzhan pa ni lung bstan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bde blag tu thob nas nges par 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhing bar chad med par 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la nye bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni lung bstan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bde blag tu thob nas nges par 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhing bar chad med par 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la nye bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Those who are different from them will easily attain the stage of the prophecy and irreversibility, and they will not be separated from the definite emergence and the absence of obstacles, and they will approach manifest complete enlightenment.

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will quickly attain manifest complete enlightenment.

original: de las gzhan gyi don byed cing 'phel ba med pa dang 'grib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi don byed cing 'phel ba med pa dang 'grib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will perform the benefit of others and they will not increase or decrease.

original: des na chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa la ming dang gzugs dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa la khyad par gyi 'du shes thams cad dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pas mchog tu rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa la ming dang gzugs dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa la khyad par gyi 'du shes thams cad dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pas mchog tu rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, because they are free from all conceptions of difference with regard to phenomena, non-phenomena, and so on, and with regard to the inconceivable, they are non-conceptual, and through the gift of the precious result, they will attain the ultimate perfection of purity.

original: snga ma bzhin du lo gcig gi bar du mngon par brtson pas sems kyi rgyud yongs su sbyangs pa yin @199a * //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du lo gcig gi bar du mngon par brtson pas sems kyi rgyud yongs su sbyangs pa yin @199a * //
translated: As before, he is thoroughly purified in mind for one year through his great effort.

original: pas 'di ni mngon par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: pas 'di ni mngon par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: This is distinguished by his clear realization.

original: bdud kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni bdud kyi mthu bcom pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / bdud kyi mthu bcom pa ni dbang po la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi nus pa bsal ba'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni bdud kyi mthu bcom pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / bdud kyi mthu bcom pa ni dbang po la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi nus pa bsal ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with ‚ÄúMara‚Äù is as follows: The destruction of Mara‚Äôs power is the removal of the power of obstacles such as the faculties.

original: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa nyid ni sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su sangs rgyas kyi spyan ras kyis btsas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa nyid ni sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs su sangs rgyas kyi spyan ras kyis btsas pa'o //
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs attention and knowledge is the Buddha‚Äôs vision at the time of the preparation, actual basis, and conclusion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mngon sum du mdzad pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yul du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mngon sum du mdzad pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yul du mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs manifestation is the Buddha‚Äôs object.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa ni byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa ni byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The approach to perfect complete enlightenment is the approach to enlightenment.

original: don yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na don chen po ste / rang gi don gtso bo ma yin na yang gzhan gyi don gtso bo che ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na don chen po ste / rang gi don gtso bo ma yin na yang gzhan gyi don gtso bo che ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a great object, since it is an object and it is great. It is great because it is the cause of the greatness of the primary object of others, even though it is not the primary object for oneself.

original: de'i dngos po ni don chen po nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni don chen po nyid do //
translated: The state of that is the greatness of the object.

original: gzhung gi bdag nyid kyi yum 'chang ba dang klog pa nyid kyis rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / bde 'gro dag dang yang dag par 'tshang rgya ba nyid dang mi 'bral ba nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni de phan chad kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung gi bdag nyid kyi yum 'chang ba dang klog pa nyid kyis rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / bde 'gro dag dang yang dag par 'tshang rgya ba nyid dang mi 'bral ba nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni de phan chad kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: One who holds and recites the Mother in the form of the text is never separated from perfect enlightenment and happy rebirth, etc. The word etc. indicates that, like a wish-fulfilling gem, she is uninterruptedly the cause of others benefit in every way.

original: yul dpyad pa ni yum bshad pa'i phyir 'chad pa po'i byang phyogs la sogs pa'i yul rnam par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yul dpyad pa ni yum bshad pa'i phyir 'chad pa po'i byang phyogs la sogs pa'i yul rnam par bstan pa'o //
translated: The analysis of the object is the demonstration of the object of the expounder, etc., in order to explain the Mother.

original: zag pa med pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bskyed pa'o //
translated: The production of the qualities of a Buddha is the perfection of all the uncontaminated qualities.

original: smra ba'i skyes bu nyid ni chos thams cad skye ba med par ston pa po mi phyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: smra ba'i skyes bu nyid ni chos thams cad skye ba med par ston pa po mi phyed pa nyid do //
translated: The status of a teacher is the one who teaches that all phenomena are unborn.

original: mi phyed pa nyid ni byang chub las mi bskyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi phyed pa nyid ni byang chub las mi bskyod pa nyid do //
translated: Unwavering is the one who is unshaken from enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong ma yin pa skye ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong ma yin pa skye ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa'o //
translated: The arising of uncommon roots of virtue is the generation of merit through generosity and so on that is completely pure of the three spheres.

original: dam bcas pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa ni sngon gyi smon lam rnam pa thams cad du rdzogs so //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa ni sngon gyi smon lam rnam pa thams cad du rdzogs so //
translated: The accomplishment of the meaning of the promise is the complete fulfillment of former aspirations in every way.

original: 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The possession of a vast result is the possession of enlightenment.

original: sems can gyi don sgrub pa ni chos ston pa la sogs pa la gzhan gyi don len pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don sgrub pa ni chos ston pa la sogs pa la gzhan gyi don len pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the purpose of sentient beings is the attainment of the purpose of others through teaching the Dharma and so on.üîΩThe definite attainment is the attainment of the perfection of wisdom without deficiency.

original: nges par 'thob pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma tshang ba med par thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i yon tan rnams ni 'bras bur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'thob pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma tshang ba med par thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i yon tan rnams ni 'bras bur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These qualities are the results.

original: don gyis 'phangs pa'i @199b rgyur gyur pa'i yon tan ni grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyis 'phangs pa'i @199b rgyur gyur pa'i yon tan ni grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The qualities that are the indirect causes are mentioned in the verse beginning ‚Äúaccording to the number.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni nus pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni nus pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù Empowerment is the generation of the capacity.

original: dgongs pa ni gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni gzigs pa'o //
translated: Intention is the vision.

original: ye shes kyi gzigs pa ni lha dang shes rab dang chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi gzigs pa ni lha dang shes rab dang chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni ye shes so //
translated: The vision of gnosis is the gnosis of the divine eye, the eye of wisdom, and the eye of Dharma.

original: nye bar gyur pa ni nye ba nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar gyur pa ni nye ba nyid do //
translated: Proximity is the state of being near.

original: phan yon chen po ni bstod dang bkur dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan yon chen po ni bstod dang bkur dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Great benefit is praise, honor, and so on.

original: bya ba byed pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Performance of function is the ripening of sentient beings and so on.

original: gnyen po'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa ni lam shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa ni lam shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the qualities that are the antidotes is the perfection of the knowledge of the path.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gtam brjod pa ni yum ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gtam brjod pa ni yum ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the discourse on omniscience is the teaching of the Mother.

original: grogs mdzad pa ni mgon dang bcas pa'i bya bas mnyam pa nyid du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: grogs mdzad pa ni mgon dang bcas pa'i bya bas mnyam pa nyid du bskyed pa'o //
translated: The performance of assistance is the generation of equality through the performance of protection.

original: dga' ba rgya chen po bskyed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi dga' ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba rgya chen po bskyed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi dga' ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: The generation of vast joy is the generation of the joy of the supramundane Dharma.

original: de'i dam bcas pa'i tshig la rjes su ri rang ba ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i smon pa'i tshig le'u la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dam bcas pa'i tshig la rjes su ri rang ba ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i smon pa'i tshig le'u la dga' ba'o //
translated: The delight in his words of commitment is the delight in the chapter of the words of aspiration endowed with application.

original: chos zab mo mngon par 'dod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyen par 'dod pa la sogs pa mngon par mos pa'o //
analyzed: chos zab mo mngon par 'dod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyen par 'dod pa la sogs pa mngon par mos pa'o //
translated: The aspiration for the profound Dharma is the aspiration for the perfection of wisdom and so on.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The benefit of sentient beings is as before.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshang bar rnyed pa ni yam yang dag par rdzogs par rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshang bar rnyed pa ni yam yang dag par rdzogs par rnyed pa'o //
translated: The complete attainment of the perfection of wisdom is the complete attainment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa'i yon tan bcu bzhi po de dag phyin ci ma log pa'i sbyor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sngon bshad pa'i sgom pa po la 'bras bur gyur pa'i yon tan 'byung bar 'gyur
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa'i yon tan bcu bzhi po de dag phyin ci ma log pa'i sbyor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sngon bshad pa'i sgom pa po la 'bras bur gyur pa'i yon tan 'byung bar 'gyur
translated: Thus, for the meditator explained earlier who delights in the unmistaken application of those fourteen qualities that serve as causes such as the Buddha's blessings, the qualities that serve as results arise.

original: zhing mngon sum du 'gyur la rjes su mthun par bslab par bya ba nyid yin pas yon tan bcu bzhi yin no //
analyzed: zhing mngon sum du 'gyur la rjes su mthun par bslab par bya ba nyid yin pas yon tan bcu bzhi yin no //
translated: There are fourteen qualities because the field is directly perceived and one should train in accordance with it.

original: de'i 'og tu yang gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don yin la sbyor ba po'i bar chad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni nyes pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don yin la sbyor ba po'i bar chad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni nyes pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verses beginning with ‚Äúthen‚Äù and so on is the meaning of the verses. The explanation of the faults beginning with ‚Äúthe obstacle of the composer‚Äù and so on is the explanation of the faults.

original: tshigs chen pos 'thob pa ni yum shes par ring zhig na thob pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs chen pos 'thob pa ni yum shes par ring zhig na thob pa'o //
translated: Obtaining the great scriptures is obtaining the mother after a long time.

original: spobs pa ha cang myur ba ni sngon dang phyi ma ma dpyad par yum shin tu myur bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa ha cang myur ba ni sngon dang phyi ma ma dpyad par yum shin tu myur bar shes pa'o //
translated: Excessive eloquence is knowing the mother too quickly without examining before and after.

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len dang sems kyi gnas ngan len ni lus dang sems dag gi rnam par g-yeng ba'o / rig pa dang ma yin pa @200a * //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len dang sems kyi gnas ngan len ni lus dang sems dag gi rnam par g-yeng ba'o / rig pa dang ma yin pa @200a * //
translated: The degeneration of the body and the degeneration of the mind are the distractions of the body and mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gcig la gcig rgod pa la sogs pas dri ba la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gcig la gcig rgod pa la sogs pas dri ba la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The questions and so on due to mutual agitation and so on are the questions and so on.

original: phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yum mnyan pa la sogs pa la dad pa med pas so //üîΩrgyu la mngon par zhen pa nyams pa la sogs pa ni theg pa chen po spangs nas theg pa gzhan byang chub kyi rgyu nyid yin pa dang / gya nom pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad du theg pa'i mchog nyid dang / rtag tu ched du bya ba nyid dang /
analyzed: phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yum mnyan pa la sogs pa la dad pa med pas so // rgyu la mngon par zhen pa nyams pa la sogs pa ni theg pa chen po spangs nas theg pa gzhan byang chub kyi rgyu nyid yin pa dang / gya nom pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad du theg pa'i mchog nyid dang / rtag tu ched du bya ba nyid dang /
translated: The reason for turning away is lack of faith in the mother, the scriptures, etc.üîΩThe six, such as the degeneration of adherence to cause, etc., are called degenerations because they are the causes of degeneration from the Mahayana.üîΩThe degeneration of adherence to cause, etc., is due to adherence to the cause, etc., of the Mahayana as being the cause of enlightenment, as being sublime, as being the supreme vehicle in every way, as being the constant goal,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel ba nyid dang / gong na med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pas rgyu la mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa drug po la nyams pa zhes smos pa ni theg pa chen po las nyams pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel ba nyid dang / gong na med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pas rgyu la mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa drug po la nyams pa zhes smos pa ni theg pa chen po las nyams pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: as being the connection between cause and effect, and as being unsurpassed.

original: yul rnam pa mang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bud med la sogs yul rnam pa mang po'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rnam pa mang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bud med la sogs yul rnam pa mang po'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The degeneration of the many kinds of objects is due to the arising of the consciousness that conceives of many kinds of objects, such as women, etc.

original: yi ger 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa yang theg pa chen po las g-yengs pa'i rgyu rnams yin no /'dir bcu tshan snga ma ni nyan pa po yin la bcu tshan phyi ma ni 'chad pa po yin te /
analyzed: yi ger 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa yang theg pa chen po las g-yengs pa'i rgyu rnams yin no /'dir bcu tshan snga ma ni nyan pa po yin la bcu tshan phyi ma ni 'chad pa po yin te /
translated: Here, the first group of ten is for the listener, and the second group of ten is for the expounder.

original: de ni grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: As the case may be means as the case may be.

original: grangs bzhin du nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag ces bya ba nyan pa dang 'chad par byed pa de dag gang yang rung ba ni gcig cig go //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag ces bya ba nyan pa dang 'chad par byed pa de dag gang yang rung ba ni gcig cig go //
translated: As the case may be, the listener and the expounder are either one or the other of the two, that is, they are either listeners or expounders.

original: de ni snga ma dang phyi ma dang mngon par 'brel bas zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni snga ma dang phyi ma dang mngon par 'brel bas zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: As the case may be means as the case may be in the former and latter cases.

original: bcu tshan snga ma'i sbyor ba ni snga ma nyan pa po yin la bcu tshan phyi ma'i sbyor ba la ni phyis smos pa 'chad pa po yin par sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcu tshan snga ma'i sbyor ba ni snga ma nyan pa po yin la bcu tshan phyi ma'i sbyor ba la ni phyis smos pa 'chad pa po yin par sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The application of the first group of ten is to the former, that is, to the listener, and the application of the second group of ten is to the latter, that is, to the expounder.

original: 'dun pa dang snyom las ni mngon par 'dod na yang le lo byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang snyom las ni mngon par 'dod na yang le lo byed pa'o //
translated: Aspiration and laziness are the causes of distraction from the Mahayana, because even when one aspires, one is lazy.

original: 'dun pa'i yul tha dad pa ni nyan pa po'i 'dun pa'i yul las 'chad pa po'i 'dun pa tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i yul tha dad pa ni nyan pa po'i 'dun pa'i yul las 'chad pa po'i 'dun pa tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: The object of aspiration is different, because the object of aspiration of the listener is different from the object of aspiration of the expounder.

original: 'dod rtsen chung ba dang 'dod rtsen chung ba ma yin pa nyid ni nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag yum bsgom pa med pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas 'di dag la nyams pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'dod rtsen chung ba dang 'dod rtsen chung ba ma yin pa nyid ni nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag yum bsgom pa med pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas 'di dag la nyams pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The lesser and non-lesser enjoyer refers to the listener and expounder who are not the cause of the meditation on the mother. Therefore, they are called degenerations.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dag ni nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag 'dod rtsen chung ba dang / 'dod rtsen chung ba ma yin pa dag gis zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dag ni nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag 'dod rtsen chung ba dang / 'dod rtsen chung ba ma yin pa dag gis zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Those who possess and do not possess the virtues of training should be explained as the lesser and non-lesser enjoyers of the listener and expounder.

original: dge ba dang dge ba ma yin pa'i chos @200b nyid dang gtong ba dang ser sna byed pa ni dad pa'i chos nyid kyis na nyan pa po'i nor gtong ba dad pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid kyis na 'chad pa po la ser sna byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang dge ba ma yin pa'i chos @200b nyid dang gtong ba dang ser sna byed pa ni dad pa'i chos nyid kyis na nyan pa po'i nor gtong ba dad pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid kyis na 'chad pa po la ser sna byed pa'o //
translated: The nature of virtue and non-virtue and the giving and miserliness refer to the listener who gives wealth through the nature of faith in the Dharma and the expounder who is miserly through the nature of non-faith in the Dharma.

original: sbyin pa dang mi len pa ni nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag ster pa dang mi len pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang mi len pa ni nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag ster pa dang mi len pa'o //
translated: The giver and the nonreceiver are the expounder and the listener, respectively.

original: mgo smos pas go ba dang rnam par spros pa nyid ni nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag go //
analyzed: mgo smos pas go ba dang rnam par spros pa nyid ni nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag go //
translated: The one who understands through a mere indication and the one who is very detailed are the listener and the expounder, respectively.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par mi shes pa nyid ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dag go //
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par mi shes pa nyid ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dag go //
translated: The one who has direct knowledge of the Dharma of the sutras, etc., and the one who does not have direct knowledge of it are the expounder and the listener, respectively.

original: de nyid kyis na 'di dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'di dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, they are endowed with the six perfections and not endowed with them, as the case may be.

original: grangs bzhin du gcig pu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig snga ma snga ma dag ni 'chad pa po yin la / phyi ma phyi ma dag ni nyan pa po yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du gcig pu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig snga ma snga ma dag ni 'chad pa po yin la / phyi ma phyi ma dag ni nyan pa po yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The former terms, such as ‚Äúalone‚Äù are to be applied to the expounder, and the latter terms, such as ‚Äúin a group‚Äù are to be applied to the listener.

original: de ni 'chad pa po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'chad pa po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The expounder is endowed with the six perfections, etc.,

original: 'khor la mngon par dga' ba nyid ni bdag nyid ni 'khor dang bcas par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor la mngon par dga' ba nyid ni bdag nyid ni 'khor dang bcas par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is not truly fond of his retinue means that he does not wish to be surrounded by a retinue.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly generous means that he does not wish to be known as a generous person.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of avarice means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of deceit means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of hypocrisy means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of malice means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of spite means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of envy means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of stinginess means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of guile means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of arrogance means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of anger means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.

original: go skabs mi 'byed pa nyid dang 'dod pa nyid kyi rjes su ma 'brel pa nyid ni bdag nyid kho na sbyin pa po nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: go skabs mi 'byed pa nyid dang 'dod pa nyid kyi rjes su ma 'brel pa nyid ni bdag nyid kho na sbyin pa po nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is not truly free of hostility means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of deceit means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of hypocrisy means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of malice means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of spite means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of envy means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.üîΩThe phrase he is not truly free of stinginess means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.

original: zang zing cung zad tsam 'dod pa dang de sbyin par mi 'dod pa nyid ni nor rnams la sbyin par mi 'dod pa'o //üîΩsrog gi bar chad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bcu tshan bzhi pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: zang zing cung zad tsam 'dod pa dang de sbyin par mi 'dod pa nyid ni nor rnams la sbyin par mi 'dod pa'o // srog gi bar chad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bcu tshan bzhi pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhi'o //
translated: The phrase he is not truly free of guile means that he does not wish to give away his wealth.

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i nyes pa drug po de ni de bzhin du mu ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /üîΩde ltar na nyes pa bzhi bcu rtsa drug gis ni yum shes pa la sogs par rung ba'i sems sun 'byin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i nyes pa drug po de ni de bzhin du mu ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /üîΩde ltar na nyes pa bzhi bcu rtsa drug gis ni yum shes pa la sogs par rung ba'i sems sun 'byin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir skyon yin no //
translated: The phrase he

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi po re re zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi khyad par yod pa rnams kyi nang nas so //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi po re re zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi khyad par yod pa rnams kyi nang nas so //
translated: As for the four characteristics, each one is distinguished by the three knowledges.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don bshad pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verses beginning with ‚Äúthe appearance of the Tathagata‚Äù is explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni yum gyi dbang gis sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni yum gyi dbang gis sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'o //
translated: The appearance of the Tathagata is the accomplishment of Buddhahood by the power of the Mother.

original: 'jig rten 'jigs pa med pa ni skad cig ma nyid dang rgyun mi 'dra ba'i rgud pa'i 'jigs pas yang dag par na mi 'jigs pa'o //üîΩsems can gyi sems kyi @201a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jigs pa med pa ni skad cig ma nyid dang rgyun mi 'dra ba'i rgud pa'i 'jigs pas yang dag par na mi 'jigs pa'o // sems can gyi sems kyi @201a * //
translated: The world is fearless, because it is not really afraid of the fear of decline, which is momentary and not continuous.

original: spyod pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'am grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'am grangs med pa'o //
translated: The conduct of the mind of sentient beings is the eighty-four thousand thoughts of sentient beings, or innumerable.

original: sems bsdus pa ni yang dag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sems bsdus pa ni yang dag pa'i sems so //
translated: The collected mind is the right mind.

original: sems rnam par g-yengs pa ni de las go bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yengs pa ni de las go bzlog pa'o //
translated: The distracted mind is the opposite of that.

original: sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa ni gzhal bya mi zad pa nyid kyis na snying rje chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa ni gzhal bya mi zad pa nyid kyis na snying rje chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems so //
translated: The aspect of the inexhaustibility of mind is the mind that is empowered by great compassion, because the objects of knowledge are inexhaustible.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind with passion, etc., is the mind with defilement; the mind without passion, etc., is the mind without defilement.

original: sems rgya chen po la sogs pa ni rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir dang khyab pa'i phyir dang grangs dang tshad dag gis gzhal par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir dang dbang po la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rgya chen po la sogs pa ni rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir dang khyab pa'i phyir dang grangs dang tshad dag gis gzhal par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir dang dbang po la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind of vast extent, etc., is vast because it is all-pervading, and it is immeasurable because it cannot be measured by number or degree, and it is incomparable because it is beyond all similes, and it is beyond the senses because it is not the object of sense-experience.

original: sems g-yo ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba ni rang gi yul la sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sems g-yo ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba ni rang gi yul la sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The mind that moves, etc., moves and does not move in that it engages in its own object by way of affirmation and negation.

original: de las skyes pa'i sems ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i sems ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: The mind that is born from that is moving.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sems mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sems mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase, etc., refers to the mind that does not move.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa can ni sngar bshad pa'i g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dag stong pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa can ni sngar bshad pa'i g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dag stong pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The aspect of the reality of movement, etc. is the emptiness of the movement and non-movement explained above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid rtogs pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid rtogs pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: The realization of the reality of the Tathagata is the knowledge of emptiness by the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: de gzhan la bstan cing btags pa ni gdul bya rnams la de kho na nyid ston pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis de rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de gzhan la bstan cing btags pa ni gdul bya rnams la de kho na nyid ston pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis de rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: The teaching and designation of that to others is the teaching of reality to those to be trained, and the destruction of that by the universality of all dharmas.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su mi dmigs pa'i shes pa'i bar gyi rnam pas de la mi dmigs pa'i shes pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su mi dmigs pa'i shes pa'i bar gyi rnam pas de la mi dmigs pa'i shes pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Thus, the difference of the knowledge of non-apprehension in regard to that is the aspect of the knowledge of non-apprehension up to the knowledge of the appearance of the Tathagata, etc., as it is.

original: rnam pa bcu drug gi tshul bzhin du zhes bya ba tha dad pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug gi tshul bzhin du zhes bya ba tha dad pa nyid du'o //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the sixteen aspects is a separate one.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams ni sngar bshad pa rnams mtshon cing shes pas na shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mtshan nyid ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams ni sngar bshad pa rnams mtshon cing shes pas na shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi mtshan nyid ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The applications of the knowledge of all aspects are the characteristics of the knowledge of all aspects, etc. because they illustrate and know the previously explained aspects.

original: ngo bo nyid dang rten med pa dang nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de gsum ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes @201b rnams yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rten med pa dang nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de gsum ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes @201b rnams yin no //
