translated: The three characteristics of the knowledge of all aspects are the characteristic of nirvana, the characteristic of the expanse of reality and the characteristic of thusness.

original: chos nyid rnam par 'khrugs pa med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la bdag la sogs par sgro mi 'dogs pas stong pa nyid las ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid rnam par 'khrugs pa med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la bdag la sogs par sgro mi 'dogs pas stong pa nyid las ma nyams pa'o //
translated: The reality that is not disturbed is the nondeficiency of emptiness because it does not superimpose a self, etc. on form, etc. that is empty of the intrinsic reality of form, etc.

original: 'du mi byed pa ni yang dag par na phung po la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'du mi byed pa ni yang dag par na phung po la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Nonfabrication is the nonexistence of the aggregates, etc. in reality.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Nonconceptuality is the absence of conceptualization.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni sna tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni sna tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: Distinction is diversity.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chags pa med pa'o //
translated: The words without characteristics and so on are about non-attachment.

original: de ni nyid kyi chos bstan nas zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni nyid kyi chos bstan nas zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: After teaching his own Dharma, and so on, the meaning of the chapter on the wisdom of omniscience is stated with the Tathagata, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩnyid kyi chos la brten nas gnas pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la gnas pa'i spyod lam bzhi'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o // nyid kyi chos la brten nas gnas pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la gnas pa'i spyod lam bzhi'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The words that very Tathagata should be applied to all.

original: gus par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchod pa zhes bya bar don gcig go //
analyzed: gus par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchod pa zhes bya bar don gcig go //
translated: Relying on his own Dharma, abiding in the four modes of conduct of abiding in non-dual wisdom, with respect and so on have the same meaning as worship.

original: byed pa med pa nyid ni byed pa po med pas 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa med pa nyid ni byed pa po med pas 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of activity is the absence of result due to the absence of agent.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba ni gdul bya'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba ni gdul bya'i dbang gis so //
translated: Universal pervasion is due to the power of those to be tamed.

original: ma mthong ba'i don ston pa ni de kho na nyid du gzugs la sogs pa ma mthong ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don ston pa ni de kho na nyid du gzugs la sogs pa ma mthong ba ston pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot seeing‚Äù is shown by ‚Äúnot seeing form, etc. in reality.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten stong pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du brjod pa'i phyir dang / shes par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / ston par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten stong pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du brjod pa'i phyir dang / shes par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / ston par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world is empty, etc. means that the world is empty, and so on, because it is expressed as such, because it is made known, and because it is taught.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / zhi ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / zhi ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivable, etc. means that it is inconceivable, peaceful, cessation, and non-perception.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byas pa dang 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byas pa dang 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The verses and commentary on the characteristics of distinction are easy to understand.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi lam gyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi lam gyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The commentary on the verse of the special path beginning with ‚Äúinconceivable‚Äù is ‚Äúthe perfect Buddha,‚Äù etc.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pas legs par yongs su bzung ba'i shes rab kyi stobs @202a * //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pas legs par yongs su bzung ba'i shes rab kyi stobs @202a * //
translated: The power of wisdom well-grasped by the perfect Buddha, etc.,

original: kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang mi mnyam pa dang gzhal du med pa dang / bgrang du med pa nyid yin pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang mi mnyam pa dang gzhal du med pa dang / bgrang du med pa nyid yin pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: is inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, and incalculable, and so ‚Äúinconceivable,‚Äù etc., is stated.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pas yum ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / de 'phags pa rnams dang rjes su 'brel ba nyid yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pas yum ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / de 'phags pa rnams dang rjes su 'brel ba nyid yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par bshad do //
translated: The Mother is the perfection of wisdom, because of the nature of the knowledge of all modes, and because of the connection with the noble ones, as is explained by ‚Äúthe noble person,‚Äù etc.

original: skyes bu mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshad ma la mkhas pas rtogs par bya ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshad ma la mkhas pas rtogs par bya ba yin pa'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe wise are called‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on means that the wise are those who understand through valid cognition,

original: rnal 'byor ba'i rang rig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i rang rig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or they are the yogins who have reflexive awareness.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yul dang dus kyis chod pa'i dngos po phra mo shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yul dang dus kyis chod pa'i dngos po phra mo shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on means that they are those who know subtle things that are distant in terms of space and time.

original: rang gi lugs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bskal pa grangs med pa gsum mam /
analyzed: rang gi lugs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bskal pa grangs med pa gsum mam /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin our system‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on means that the wisdom of a perfect buddha is attained quickly, in three incalculable aeons,

original: de'i phyed dam de dag kyang nyung bas myur bar yang dag par ye shes thob par gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyed dam de dag kyang nyung bas myur bar yang dag par ye shes thob par gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or half of that, or even less than that.

original: kun rdzob dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa'i bri ba med pa nyid dang gang ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa'i bri ba med pa nyid dang gang ba med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconventional‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on means that form and so on are not diminished and not increased conventionally.

original: kun rdzob kyi dbang gis bsags pa nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi dbang gis bsags pa nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the accumulation is perceived in terms of the relative.

original: don dam par bri ba med pa dang gang ba med pa ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis tha snyad du byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par bri ba med pa dang gang ba med pa ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis tha snyad du byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is neither diminished nor increased because form, etc. which are conventionally designated as entities are not seen.

original: 'khor gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par na sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyin par bya ba la sogs par mi dmigs pa dag tu bsgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par na sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyin par bya ba la sogs par mi dmigs pa dag tu bsgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three spheres, etc. are established as the non-apprehension of the object, etc. in generosity, etc. in the ultimate.

original: yang dag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas bsod nams dang ye shes bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsags pa thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas bsod nams dang ye shes bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsags pa thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The correct, etc. is the attainment of the accumulation of merit and direct intuition in three incalculable aeons, because of the purification of the three spheres.

original: chos thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams la dag pa nyid du dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams la dag pa nyid du dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All dharmas, etc. is the apprehension of purity in regard to internal and external things.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan pa dag ni yum shes pa la @202b gnas pa yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan pa dag ni yum shes pa la @202b gnas pa yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe realm of phenomena‚Äù and so on is because it is not tenable that anyone other than a bodhisattva abides in the knowledge of the mother.

original: smon lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa dang 'tsham pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa dang 'tsham pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúaspirations‚Äù and so on and the phrase ‚Äúspiritual friend‚Äù and so on are because the mere completeness of the causes and the connection and suitability are inferred.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i ro myang ba med pa ni chags pa med pa la yang ma zhen pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i ro myang ba med pa ni chags pa med pa la yang ma zhen pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout the taste of clinging‚Äù is because there is no attachment even to nonattachment.

original: 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi gnas skabs su ni de yang spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi gnas skabs su ni de yang spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even that is something to be abandoned in the state of buddhahood.

original: bcu drug gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid bcu drug go //
analyzed: bcu drug gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid bcu drug go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith the nature of sixteen‚Äù is because there are sixteen special natures.

original: 'dis ci zhig ni mtshon 'di'i khyad par ni ji lta bu zhig yin pa dang ji ltar na khyad par gyi lam du bstan pa la brten pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig ni mtshon 'di'i khyad par ni ji lta bu zhig yin pa dang ji ltar na khyad par gyi lam du bstan pa la brten pa yin zhe na /
translated: What does this indicate? What is its distinction? How is it based on the path of distinction?

original: de'i phyir go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /üîΩde ltar bcu drug po'i go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa skad cig ma rnams kyi re re zhing sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa la mtshan nyid bzhi bzhi yin la lam shes pa la sogs pa gnyis ni zhes bya ba lam
analyzed: de'i phyir go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / de ltar bcu drug po'i go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa skad cig ma rnams kyi re re zhing sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa la mtshan nyid bzhi bzhi yin la lam shes pa la sogs pa gnyis ni zhes bya ba lam
translated: Thus, in order, it is said thatüîΩin that way, in order, the moments of the truths of suffering and so on, each of the sixteen aspects of the four truths such as impermanence and so on, the two knowledges of the path and so on, and the two knowledges of all aspects and so on are the aspects of the bodhisattva and so on.

original: shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa ste /
translated: The two knowledges of the path and so on are the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas dag nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam sngar gsungs pa rnams las khyad par ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi dbye ba bstan pa gang yin pas khyad par zhugs shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi thabs nyid
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas dag nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam sngar gsungs pa rnams las khyad par ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi dbye ba bstan pa gang yin pas khyad par zhugs shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi thabs nyid
translated: The bodhisattvas and buddhas have a special path that is different from the paths of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on, which were previously explained.

original: yin pa'i phyir khyad par gyi lam yin te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir khyad par gyi lam yin te /
translated: The special path is the method for perfect enlightenment,

original: sngar bshad pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: because it teaches the special divisions of the inconceivable and so on.

original: 'dir nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin nam gzhan du na khyad par du khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin nam gzhan du na khyad par du khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Here, is it not also appropriate to describe the paths of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on? Otherwise, they will not understand the special path.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text says,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lam sngar bshad pa las nyan thos la sogs pa de dag gi ni ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lam sngar bshad pa las nyan thos la sogs pa de dag gi ni ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par dang bral ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the path of the bodhisattva is explained as being free from the distinctions of those sravakas and so on, as previously explained, which are empty of the inconceivable and so on.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pas stong pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i lam yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pas stong pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i lam yin no //
translated: It is the path of the four noble truths.

original: de ltar na yang ci'i phyir ma bshad @203a * //
analyzed: de ltar na yang ci'i phyir ma bshad @203a * //
translated: Why is it not explained in that way?

original: ce na / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba mnyam par gzhag pa las mig la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa'i phyogs gcig pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhing sogs pa'i sgras 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la sogs paüîΩskyed pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: ce na / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba mnyam par gzhag pa las mig la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa'i phyogs gcig pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhing sogs pa'i sgras 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa skyed pa nyid kyis na /
translated: It is said that it is due to the characteristics of the arising of higher perceptions and so on, which are the characteristics of the knowledge of the single aspect of the higher perception of the eye and so on that arises from equipoise. The term and so on refers to the characteristics of the arising of freedom from attachment to the desire realm and so on.

original: go sla ba'i phyir dang lung dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul las grags pa'i phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: go sla ba'i phyir dang lung dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul las grags pa'i phyir ma bshad do //
translated: It is not explained because it is easy to understand and because it is renowned in the scriptures and in the Bodhisattva way.

original: de ltar khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyis de sngar ma bshad pas so //
analyzed: de ltar khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyis de sngar ma bshad pas so //
translated: Thus, since the distinctive characteristics have not been explained previously, they are explained here.

original: mtshams bcad pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam rnams las tha dad par byas pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam rnams las tha dad par byas pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The boundary is the four noble truths, which are distinguished from the paths of the sravakas, etc.

original: byed pa zhes bya ba gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa zhes bya ba gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the agent?

original: byed pa po'i mtshan nyid ni phan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po'i mtshan nyid ni phan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the agent is stated in the verse: ‚Äúbenefiting, etc.‚Äù

original: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i phan pa dang tshe 'di'i bde ba ni 'jig rten pha rol po'i dang / 'jig rten 'di pa'i lus dang sems kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i phan pa dang tshe 'di'i bde ba ni 'jig rten pha rol po'i dang / 'jig rten 'di pa'i lus dang sems kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the verse: ‚Äúbenefiting future lives and the happiness of this life‚Äù is the mental and physical happiness and satisfaction of those in the next world and this world, respectively.

original: sdug bsngal med pa'i rnam par smin pa ni btang snyoms te lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa'i rnam par smin pa ni btang snyoms te lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yin la /
translated: The neutral ripening is the neutral mind, which is not suffering.

original: de nyid ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: That itself is non-ripening,

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i 'bras bu 'byin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i 'bras bu 'byin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not produce the results of good and bad destinies.

original: 'di rnams kyi chos nyid ni rjes su mthun pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi chos nyid ni rjes su mthun pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The reality of these is the nature of the concordant, etc.

original: de'i nye bar bsgrub pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom pa po la ster ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar bsgrub pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom pa po la ster ba'o //
translated: Its attainment is the bestowal upon the one who cultivates the four noble truths with the special qualities of the inconceivable, etc.

original: rgyu des na phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //üîΩgtan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal lam /
analyzed: rgyu des na phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no // gtan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal lam /
translated: For that reason, it is beneficial, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las zlog par byed pa ma 'ongs pa na phan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las zlog par byed pa ma 'ongs pa na phan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The eternal, etc. is the bliss of nirvana, which is beneficial in the future, since it turns one away from the suffering or the cause of suffering.

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor ba dang zhi ba mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor ba dang zhi ba mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: Samsara, etc. is the knowledge of the equality of samsara and nirvana.

original: rang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: rang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: One's own, etc. is the cause of both one's own and another's definite goodness and manifest excellence.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The phrase the welfare of others and so on refers to the accomplishment of the aims of sentient beings in all circumstances.

original: sems can gyi don zhes bya ba @203b la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don la shin tu bslabs pas pha rol gyi don la 'bad pa med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don zhes bya ba @203b la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don la shin tu bslabs pas pha rol gyi don la 'bad pa med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase the welfare of sentient beings and so on refers to the effortless engagement in the aims of others that is due to having trained thoroughly in the aims of others.

original: theg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the vehicle and so on refers to the fact that the afflictions of bodhisattvas are conceptual in nature.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the three and so on refers to the fact that they do not actualize the result that is the three kinds of knowledge.

original: de ltar bdun po 'di rnams dus ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pas khyad par zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i rim gyis thogs pa med par gzhan gyi don ji
analyzed: de ltar bdun po 'di rnams dus ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pas khyad par zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i rim gyis thogs pa med par gzhan gyi don ji
translated: In this way, these seven are the means by which the bodhisattva practices the four noble truths in an extraordinary manner, through the aspects of the inconceivable and so on, in a manner that is not surpassed by any other means.

original: lta ba bzhin du yang dag par nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba bzhin du yang dag par nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the correct accomplishment of the view.üîΩIn the phrase in all aspects, etc., the knowledge of all aspects is the Dharma of generating the Thought, etc.üîΩ The basis is the basis of the trainees.üîΩ The function is the function of the basis.üîΩ The basis is the basis of the trainees.

original: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gang gi chos thams cad ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gang gi chos thams cad ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The function is the function of the basis.üîΩ The basis is the basis of the trainees.

original: de ston pa nye bar sgrub pa'i don gyis na rten gyi mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de ston pa nye bar sgrub pa'i don gyis na rten gyi mdzad pa ste /
translated: The function is the function of the basis.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi rten nyid ni gcig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi rten nyid ni gcig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The basis is the basis of the trainees.üîΩ The function is the function of the basis.üîΩ The basis is the basis of the trainees.üîΩ The function is the function of the basis.üîΩ The basis is the basis of the trainees.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The function is the function of the basis.üîΩ The basis is the basis of the trainees.üîΩ The function is the function of the basis.üîΩ The basis is the basis of the trainees.üîΩ The function is the function of the basis.üîΩ The basis is the basis of the trainees.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The cause of desire, etc. is improper mental attention.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngag 'khyal ba la sogs pa ste de'i rnam par rtog pa'i'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngag 'khyal ba la sogs pa ste de'i rnam par rtog pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to idle speculation about frivolous speech, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po ste /
translated: Desire and the absence of desire, etc. are the counteragents to the adverse elements.üîΩSince they are empty, they are the reality of isolation because they do not exist.üîΩThe adverse elements, the counteragents, and the reality of isolation are the reality of cessation.üîΩThe reality of cessation is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the cessation of suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa dang lam dag gis bsdus pa dag ni stong pa nyid kyis na 'di rnams med pa yin pa'i phyir dben pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lam dag gis bsdus pa dag ni stong pa nyid kyis na 'di rnams med pa yin pa'i phyir dben pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The reality of the path is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.üîΩThe reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rtags dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag ni dben pa'i bdag nyid yin no //üîΩdon dam par med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par med pa la @204a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rtags dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag ni dben pa'i bdag nyid yin no // don dam par med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par med pa la @204a * //
translated: The reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of error in regard to the absence of error.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reality of the absence of error is the reality of the absence of error because it is the absence of

original: theg pa gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa brgyad par gtogs pa'i theg pa chen po la gnas pa ni nges par nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam du mi ltung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa brgyad par gtogs pa'i theg pa chen po la gnas pa ni nges par nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam du mi ltung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn other vehicles‚Äù and so on means that one who is established in the Mahayana that belongs to the eighth stage does not fall into the paths of the Sravakas and so on.

original: yun ring po nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum las nges par 'byung ba'i 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi mchog dang rab dang thu bo dang / rab mchog la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung gi sgo nas ngoms pa med pa nyid slob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring po nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum las nges par 'byung ba'i 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi mchog dang rab dang thu bo dang / rab mchog la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung gi sgo nas ngoms pa med pa nyid slob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor a long time‚Äù and so on means that one who is definitely emerging from the three incalculable aeons is a learner because of his insatiable attitude toward the supreme, excellent, and most excellent enlightenment, which is the goal of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsgom par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par na bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa yod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par na bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa yod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúMeditation‚Äù and so on means that it is not tenable that meditation and so on exist in reality.

original: dngos por zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn things‚Äù means that one is not attached to form and so on.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid dang lam shes pa nyid ni sngar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid dang lam shes pa nyid ni sngar bshad pa ste /
translated: The knowledges of all aspects and of the path were explained above.

original: des yang dag par bsdus pa'i dngos po'i khyad par phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi lam gyi bdag nyid de la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: des yang dag par bsdus pa'i dngos po'i khyad par phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi lam gyi bdag nyid de la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It focuses on the reality of the path, which is subsumed by those knowledges, and which has the nature of internal and external entities.

original: 'jig rten ni phyi rol gyi bstan bcos la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni phyi rol gyi bstan bcos la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The world is those who delight in external treatises.üîΩThe practice of those who assert eternal sound and so on is to hold their own treatises and so on.

original: de rnams kyi sgrub pa gang yin pa'i sgra mi tshangs pa rtag pa la sogs par brjod pa'i rang gi bstan bcos 'dzin pa la sogs pa de rnams las 'dzin pa la sogs pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgrub pa gang yin pa'i sgra mi tshangs pa rtag pa la sogs par brjod pa'i rang gi bstan bcos 'dzin pa la sogs pa de rnams las 'dzin pa la sogs pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: This is the opposite of holding and so on.

original: de'i bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa ston pa'i yum nyan pa dang / gzhung 'dzin pa dang mi brjed pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ston pa yin la de nyid ni mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa ston pa'i yum nyan pa dang / gzhung 'dzin pa dang mi brjed pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ston pa yin la de nyid ni mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: It is the listening to the Mother that teaches the selflessness of phenomena and persons, which is contrary to their treatises, and it is the retention, nonforgetting and proper mental activity that it teaches.

original: 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i shes pa gzugs la sogs pa bdag med pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma dang 'gal bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa thogs pa med par shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i kun rdzob kyi shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i shes pa gzugs la sogs pa bdag med pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma dang 'gal bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // gzugs la sogs pa thogs pa med par shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i kun rdzob kyi shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cognition of form, etc., as devoid of self, which is contrary to the world, is held to be contrary to valid cognition.üîΩThe cognition of form, etc., as unobstructed is the conventional cognition of form, etc., which is not contrary to valid cognition.

original: shes bya dang shes pa mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pas gzhi med pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya dang shes pa mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pas gzhi med pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the non-apprehension of the cognized and cognition‚Äù means that, because there is no apprehended object and no apprehending subject, there is no basis for the latter.

original: rten med pa'o /
analyzed: rten med pa'o /
translated: It is without support.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis 'gro ba med pa ni de bzhin nyid kyis 'gro ba @204b mi rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis 'gro ba med pa ni de bzhin nyid kyis 'gro ba @204b mi rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the non-existence of going by means of reality‚Äù means that it is not reasonable that there be going by means of reality.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yin pas gzugs la sogs pa skye ba mi 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yin pas gzugs la sogs pa skye ba mi 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the non-existence of the arising of form, etc.‚Äù means that the arising of form, etc., is not tenable because of emptiness.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du gcig pa nyid kyis na tshul gsum gyi ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du gcig pa nyid kyis na tshul gsum gyi ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEntity, non-entity, etc.‚Äù means that it is not tenable that the three modes are the nature of suchness because of being the same.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba las tha dad par bshad pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa med pas sbyor ba ni mtshan nyid kho nar mi 'thad pas sbyor ba dag mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bzhin du zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba las tha dad par bshad pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa med pas sbyor ba ni mtshan nyid kho nar mi 'thad pas sbyor ba dag mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bzhin du zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù means that since the characteristic is not understood as explained separately from the syllogism, the syllogism is not tenable as just the characteristic. Therefore, ‚Äúlike the syllogism, the characteristic is endowed with the three modes.‚Äù

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni mtshan ma med ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni mtshan ma med ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The verse on the factors conducive to liberation is ‚Äúsignless, etc.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: Signless means selfless.

original: des sbyin pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de la yang dag par sgrub pa ni nyams su len pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: des sbyin pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de la yang dag par sgrub pa ni nyams su len pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is generosity, etc. with that is the attainment of practice.

original: de la mkhas pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Skill in that is faith, etc.

original: mtshan ma med par zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
translated: The verse-text is commented upon by the words ‚Äúsignless,‚Äù etc.

original: mtshan ma med par dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i sems so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i sems so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe aspect of the cognition that perceives the signless‚Äù refers to the mind that perceives emptiness.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mthar thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mthar thug pa rnams so //
translated: The perfections of generosity, etc., up to the knowledge of all aspects are the culmination of the three knowledges.

original: rang gi rgyud la bskyed pa ni nyams su len pa nyid kyis rnal 'byor ba'i sems la nges par bskyed pa ste de la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la bskyed pa ni nyams su len pa nyid kyis rnal 'byor ba'i sems la nges par bskyed pa ste de la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarisen in one‚Äôs own mental continuum‚Äù means that they are definitely generated in the mind of the practitioner, and one becomes skilled in that.

original: dad pa la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa 'di la ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa 'di la ste /
translated: Faith, etc., are the realization of all aspects.

original: de'i sbyor ba shes pa'i skabs su thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba shes pa'i skabs su thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the context of the knowledge of their application‚Äù refers to the factors conducive to liberation.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i khyad par dang rjes su mthun pa yin par rgyal ba rnams 'dod cing bshad de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i khyad par dang rjes su mthun pa yin par rgyal ba rnams 'dod cing bshad de /
translated: The victors assert and explain that the roots of virtue are similar to and in accord with the special separation from affliction.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid yin pa'i phyir blang bar bya ba nyid du mngon par bzhed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid yin pa'i phyir blang bar bya ba nyid du mngon par bzhed do //
translated: Since they are roots of virtue, they are asserted to be that which is to be taken up.

original: gzhan du na 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa rang bzhin gyi dad pa la sogs pa tsam ni gdul bya'i rgyu la lam bskyed par nges pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa rang bzhin gyi dad pa la sogs pa tsam ni gdul bya'i rgyu la lam bskyed par nges pa med pa yin la /
translated: Otherwise, the mere natural roots of virtue such as faith that are mundane meditations are not definitely generated as the path in the continuum of disciples.

original: 'dir nges pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin par bshad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩsangs rgyas @205a * //üîΩsogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mkhas pa'i tshig le 'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin par bshad do zhes bya bar dgongs so // sangs rgyas @205a * // sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mkhas pa'i tshig le 'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is explained that the definite generation of the path is the factor conducive to liberation.üîΩThe commentary on the verse that begins with ‚Äúfaith in the Buddha and so on‚Äù is ‚Äúfaith and so on.‚Äù

original: dad pa la sogs pa ni dkon mchog gsum la mngon par yid ches pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa ni dkon mchog gsum la mngon par yid ches pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Faith and so on are the aspects of clear faith and so on in the three jewels.

original: khyad par can dbang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ni dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir gzhan pa dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can dbang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ni dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir gzhan pa dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The special ones are not of the nature of the faculties, because they are not the objects of the faculties, such as faith and so on.

original: grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: According to the number, the Buddha is the perfect Buddha.

original: sbyin pa ni gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni gtong ba'o //
translated: Giving is the act of giving.

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni dge ba 'dod pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni dge ba 'dod pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of aspiration is the desire for virtue and so on.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni las dang byed pa po dang bya ba ma dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni las dang byed pa po dang bya ba ma dmigs pa la'o //
translated: Non-conceptuality is in the non-observation of action, agent, and object.

original: chos thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are form and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni rang dang spyi'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni rang dang spyi'i tshul gyis so //
translated: All aspects are by way of the individual and general modes.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni rang dang spyi'i tshul gyis yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni rang dang spyi'i tshul gyis yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of all aspects by way of the individual and general modes.

original: de la sogs pa'i yul ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i spyod yul gyi thabs rnam pa lnga la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i yul ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i spyod yul gyi thabs rnam pa lnga la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The object of that and so on is the five types of skill in the means of the field of activity of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, such as giving and morality.

original: ci thabs mkhas pa yod pa kho nas byang chub 'thob pa'am 'on te ma yin zhe na de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci thabs mkhas pa yod pa kho nas byang chub 'thob pa'am 'on te ma yin zhe na de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Is enlightenment attained only through skill in means or not?üîΩIt is said that it is so, but not merely through the existence of faith and so on.

original: yod pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba dad pa la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa ma yin zhing kun rdzob tu bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba dad pa la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa ma yin zhing kun rdzob tu bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Faith and so on are not merely existent, but are generated conventionally.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of things.

original: byang chub kyi lam 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas dad pa la sogs pa rno zhing gsal ba chen pos ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du gong nas gong du bslabs pa mchog tu gyur bas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas dad pa la sogs pa rno zhing gsal ba chen pos ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du gong nas gong du bslabs pa mchog tu gyur bas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs
translated: Since this path to enlightenment is inconceivable, it is realized through the supreme training in the great clarity and sharpness of faith and so on over three measureless kalpas.

original: par sla bar shes par bya ba la de dag nyid du rtul pos ni zhes bya ba de mngon sum du byed par mi nus pa'i dad pa la sogs pa chung dus ni rtogs par dka' zhing shes par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: par sla bar shes par bya ba la de dag nyid du rtul pos ni zhes bya ba de mngon sum du byed par mi nus pa'i dad pa la sogs pa chung dus ni rtogs par dka' zhing shes par dka' ba yin no //
translated: It should be understood that it is easy to attain the first two results.

original: 'dir dad pa la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba dang de dag nyid las smos pas yang dag par na byang chub kyi thabs rnam pa gnyis yod pas de ni shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin @205b te ;
analyzed: 'dir dad pa la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba dang de dag nyid las smos pas yang dag par na byang chub kyi thabs rnam pa gnyis yod pas de ni shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin @205b te ;
translated: Here, by saying ‚Äúmerely by the existence of faith, etc.,‚Äù and by mentioning them, he shows that in reality there are two methods of enlightenment.

original: 'dir ye shes chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i bye brag gis byang chub gsum gyi dbye ba ston pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ye shes chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i bye brag gis byang chub gsum gyi dbye ba ston pa yin la /
translated: Here, the three kinds of enlightenment are shown by the distinctions of great, middling, and small wisdom.

original: de bas na chen po'i chen pos ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon sum du bya bar ston pas /
analyzed: de bas na chen po'i chen pos ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon sum du bya bar ston pas /
translated: Therefore, the great of the great, by demonstrating the realization of perfect enlightenment,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dad pa la sogs pa ma smos su zin kyang de'i shes pa'i dbang gis 'bring dang chung ngu nyid thob pa rnams kyi rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyi byang chub kyi bya ba ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas theg pa chen
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dad pa la sogs pa ma smos su zin kyang de'i shes pa'i dbang gis 'bring dang chung ngu nyid thob pa rnams kyi rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyi byang chub kyi bya ba ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas theg pa chen
translated: Although faith and so on other than that are not mentioned, the activities of the enlightenment of the Solitary Realizers and Hearers are not able to be done elsewhere by those who have obtained the middling and lesser stages through the power of that knowledge.

original: po thams cad du byang chub gnyis po ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub las go bzlog par bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: po thams cad du byang chub gnyis po ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub las go bzlog par bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that in all the Great Vehicle, the two enlightenments are taught as the opposite of perfect enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: This is the indirect implication.

original: dro ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel ba yin te /
analyzed: dro ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel ba yin te /
translated: The verse on the factors conducive to penetrative insight beginning with ‚Äúthe warmths‚Äù is explained by ‚Äúall aspects‚Äù and so on.

original: tshul ngan pa med pa dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i don bsam pa nyid dag dang / nga rgyal bcom pa nyid dang mngon par 'tshe ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sems lnga yin no //
analyzed: tshul ngan pa med pa dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i don bsam pa nyid dag dang / nga rgyal bcom pa nyid dang mngon par 'tshe ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sems lnga yin no //
translated: The five thoughts are: (1) equality, because there is no bad conduct; (2) sympathy, because one thinks of the present and future welfare of others; (3) destruction of pride, because one is not arrogant; (4) non-violence, because one does not harm others; and (5) non-distinction, because one does not discriminate between those who are dear, neutral, and hostile.

original: de rnams kyi pha dang ma'i sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //üîΩrtse mor rtogs pa ni mdor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi pha dang ma'i sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no // rtse mor rtogs pa ni mdor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The thought of the father and mother, etc. is mentioned.üîΩThe thought of the summit is mentioned in the verse: ‚ÄúIn brief, the thought of the summit is the thought of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the virtues of non-greed, etc. and who is engaged in the relinquishment of the two obscurations.‚Äù

original: mdor zhes bya ba ni dbye ba la ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mdor zhes bya ba ni dbye ba la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: In brief means without differentiation.

original: mi dge ba ni chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Non-virtue is greed, etc.üîΩVirtue is the opposite of that.

original: dge ba ni de las go bzlog pa la nyams pa dang // len pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni spang ba dang blang ba'i dbang gis gzhan rnams sdig pa las ldog pa dang / dge ba la gnas pa dag la sbyor ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni de las go bzlog pa la nyams pa dang // len pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni spang ba dang blang ba'i dbang gis gzhan rnams sdig pa las ldog pa dang / dge ba la gnas pa dag la sbyor ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Relinquishment and acceptance means that others are engaged in turning away from evil and abiding in virtue through the power of relinquishing and accepting.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag ni gnyis yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag ni gnyis yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue are the two kinds, hence the two aspects.

original: de bzhin du zhugs pa rnams la rang dang gzhan sdig pa las ldog pa dang dge ba la sbyor ba ni gzhan dag la bsngags pa brjod pa dang mthun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhugs pa rnams la rang dang gzhan sdig pa las ldog pa dang dge ba la sbyor ba ni gzhan dag la bsngags pa brjod pa dang mthun par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, for those who have entered the stages, the two aspects are the praise of others and the conformity with others, since they cause others to turn away from evil and to engage in virtue.

original: bsngags pa smra ba dang mthun par byed pa gnyis yin pas rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: bsngags pa smra ba dang mthun par byed pa gnyis yin pas rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: The two aspects are the praise of others and the conformity with others.

original: sbyar bar bya ba dang sbyor ba po dang / de'i yul mtha' yas pa'i phyir rnam pa rnams ni yang dag par na mtha' yas pa yin pas de'i @206a * //
analyzed: sbyar bar bya ba dang sbyor ba po dang / de'i yul mtha' yas pa'i phyir rnam pa rnams ni yang dag par na mtha' yas pa yin pas de'i @206a * //
translated: The aspects are infinite in reality, since the objects of engagement, the engager, and the object of that engagement are infinite.

original: chos kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The aspects of the perfection of wisdom are explained in the perfection of wisdom scriptures.

original: de ltar de rnams kyi sems can la dmigs shing yul du byas pa ni rtse mor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de rnams kyi sems can la dmigs shing yul du byas pa ni rtse mor gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the focus on sentient beings and the object of those who have reached the peak are the peak.

original: bdag nyid kyi bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The self, action, and so on have been explained.

original: rtse mor gyur pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúfor oneself and others‚Äù and so on is by ‚Äúthe peak, etc.‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos mchog de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos mchog de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthe supreme mundane state is similar‚Äù and so on is by ‚Äúas before‚Äù and so on.

original: yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di rnams ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas re re zhing rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di rnams ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas re re zhing rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, these factors conducive to penetrative insight are each threefold, by way of the distinctions of small, medium, and great.

original: de la dro bar rtogs pa chung ngu'i ni mnyam pa dang byams pa'i sems dag yin te /
analyzed: de la dro bar rtogs pa chung ngu'i ni mnyam pa dang byams pa'i sems dag yin te /
translated: The small of the realizations of heat are the minds of equanimity and loving kindness,

original: de nyid kyi tshe gzhan la 'tshe ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe gzhan la 'tshe ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time there is no harm to others.

original: 'bring gis ni phan pa la sogs pa'i sems gsum gyis ma 'ongs pa'i gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bring gis ni phan pa la sogs pa'i sems gsum gyis ma 'ongs pa'i gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The medium is the three minds of benefit and so on, because there is the intention to benefit others in the future.

original: chen po'i ni pha la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pas de'i tshe 'di dang phyi ma dag tu gzhan rnams kyi 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i ni pha la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pas de'i tshe 'di dang phyi ma dag tu gzhan rnams kyi 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great of the small is taught because at that time, one wishes to accomplish the desires of others in this life and the next through generating the mind of enlightenment in one's father and so on.

original: rtse mor gtogs pa chung ngu'i ni bdag dang gzhan sdig pa las ldog pa la sbyor ba dang / gzhan rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyud las ldog par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtse mor gtogs pa chung ngu'i ni bdag dang gzhan sdig pa las ldog pa la sbyor ba dang / gzhan rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyud las ldog par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The small of the medium is taught because one wishes to engage oneself and others in turning away from evil and to turn others away from the continuum of suffering.

original: 'bring gis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la rang dang gzhan gnas pas gzhan rnams kyi dge ba'i rgyu la sbyor bar mngon par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bring gis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la rang dang gzhan gnas pas gzhan rnams kyi dge ba'i rgyu la sbyor bar mngon par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The medium is taught because one wishes to engage oneself and others in generosity and so on and to connect others to the causes of virtue.

original: chen po'i ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam gnyis bsgoms pa las bdag dang gzhan zhugs pas gzhan rnams kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la phyin ci log pa spang ba'i bsam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po'i ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam gnyis bsgoms pa las bdag dang gzhan zhugs pas gzhan rnams kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la phyin ci log pa spang ba'i bsam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great is taught because one wishes to abandon the error of self and other in relation to the happiness and suffering of others through meditating on the two kinds of dependent origination.

original: bzod pa ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen por bshad de /
analyzed: bzod pa ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen por bshad de /
translated: Patience is explained as lesser, medium and great.

original: go rims bzhin du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa'i bar gyis de ltar gzhan rnams 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa dang / 'tshang rgya ba nyid la sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa'i bar gyis de ltar gzhan rnams 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa dang / 'tshang rgya ba nyid la sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bshad mod kyi /
translated: It is explained that the bodhisattva who is on the level of patience is desirous of connecting others to the first result of the ƒÅrya path and so on and to buddhahood itself, respectively.

original: 'on kyang bzod pa chen po ni skad cig ma du mar gzung bar @206b bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bzod pa chen po ni skad cig ma du mar gzung bar @206b bya'o //
translated: However, great patience should be held to be many moments.

original: chos kyi mchog chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ni go rims bzhin du gzhan rnams khyad par med par theg pa chen po la smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i lam la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ni go rims bzhin du gzhan rnams khyad par med par theg pa chen po la smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i lam la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Lesser, medium and great supreme mundane dharmas are explained as being desirous of ripening others in the MahƒÅyƒÅna without distinction, of connecting them to the bodhisattva path in particular and of connecting them to the ƒÅrya path.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rab kyi mthar thug par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bo dam bcas pa'i tshig gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rab kyi mthar thug par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bo dam bcas pa'i tshig gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because he desires the ultimate perfection of all perfections, he has spoken the words of the vow, the nature of which is the absence of obscuration in the complete maturation of sentient beings.

original: chos mngon pa las ji ltar bzod pa chen po skad cig ma gcig yin pa ltar chos kyi mchog kyang de bzhin no zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rang gi don gyi dbang du mdzad pa yin la //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las ji ltar bzod pa chen po skad cig ma gcig yin pa ltar chos kyi mchog kyang de bzhin no zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rang gi don gyi dbang du mdzad pa yin la //
translated: In the Abhidharma, it is said that just as the supreme mundane state is a single moment, so too is the highest mundane state. This is stated from the perspective of one's own aim.

original: 'dir ni rang gzhan gyi don la brten pa rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rang gzhan gyi don la brten pa rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis bshad pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is explained from the perspective of those who rely on their own and others' aims, with distinctions of lesser, middling, and greater.

original: gzhan gyi don la brtson pa'i rab dang mchog gi gnas skabs dag srid pas 'di dang de la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la brtson pa'i rab dang mchog gi gnas skabs dag srid pas 'di dang de la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since it is possible that the supreme and highest states of striving for others' aims exist, there is no contradiction between this and that.

original: mngon par rtogs pa drug tu nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir bstan ce na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa drug tu nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir bstan ce na /
translated: Why are the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on definitely taught as six realizations?

original: rnam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The aspects, etc.

original: rnam pa dang lam dang gzhi thams cad ni sngar bshad pa'o //üîΩde rnams rnam par bsgom pa ni bye brag gis bsam gtan gyi khyad par gyi mngon par rtogs pa drug po rnams su nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la bshad pa yin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩde ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa bshad pa na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid de /üîΩgsum la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang lam dang gzhi thams cad ni sngar bshad pa'o // de rnams rnam par bsgom pa ni bye brag gis bsam gtan gyi khyad par gyi mngon par rtogs pa drug po rnams su nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la bshad pa yin par blta bar bya'o // de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa bshad pa na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid de / gsum la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: All the aspects, paths, and bases have been explained previously.

original: sngar bshad pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa bstan pa gsungs pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa bstan pa gsungs pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of those is the six realizations of the distinctions of the distinctions of the distinctions of the distinctions of the distinctions of the distinctions of the distinctions original: 'dir brjod pa'i rgyu ni 'jig rten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa'i rgyu ni 'jig rten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The cause mentioned here is ‚Äúthe mundane,‚Äù etc.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong gi dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong gi dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mundane factors conducive to penetrative insight are the mundane heat, etc., which are common to sravakas, etc.

original: de rtogs pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: Their realization is knowledge.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba ni de'i rgyu can no //üîΩgang gi phyir 'jig rten las @207a * //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba ni de'i rgyu can no // gang gi phyir 'jig rten las @207a * //
translated: That which precedes it is the cause of that.

original: 'das pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam gang yin pa de dag rtogs pa ni shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam gang yin pa de dag rtogs pa ni shes pa yin no //
translated: Because the supramundane is the path of insight and the path of cultivation that are not realized by sravakas, etc., their realization is knowledge.

original: de bas na zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the supramundane path is the cause of the knowledge of the factors with regard to the path.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa gsum la ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rtse mo thob pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i sbyor ba la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa gsum la ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rtse mo thob pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i sbyor ba la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The three realizations are the realization of all aspects, the realization of the summit, and the realization of the serial.

original: 'dir brjod pa'i rgyu ni bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa'i rgyu ni bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The cause of expression here is cultivation, etc.

original: bsgom pa ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni goms pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is practice.

original: de gong nas gong gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni go rims las gyur pa'i rab kyi mtha' ste /üîΩrgyu des na rnam pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de gong nas gong gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni go rims las gyur pa'i rab kyi mtha' ste / rgyu des na rnam pa thams cad de /
translated: By the distinction of higher and higher states means by the end of the order.

original: rnam pa kun du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du'o //
translated: By that cause, all aspects means all aspects.

original: khyad par gyi lam ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam ni sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The path of distinction is as previously explained.

original: des bsdus pa'i ye shes zab pa med pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: des bsdus pa'i ye shes zab pa med pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pas stong pa'o //
translated: The wisdom included in that is profound, being empty of attachment, etc.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rim gyis skye zhing 'byung ba yin pas de ltar na cig car skye ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir te /üîΩshes pa gcig la skye ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum por mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam shes par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas na rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa yang khyad par gyi lam shes
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rim gyis skye zhing 'byung ba yin pas de ltar na cig car skye ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir te / shes pa gcig la skye ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum por mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam shes par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas na rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa yang khyad par gyi lam shes
translated: Because they arise and occur in stages, small, medium and great, the three knowledges are the cause of knowing the path of seeing and so on in order to simultaneously stop their arising.

original: pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa brjod pa yin la /
translated: Since they are the cause of knowing the special path of complete realization of all aspects and so on, they are described as the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on.

original: mngon par rtogs pa gnyis la ni de med pas ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa gnyis la ni de med pas ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: But since they do not exist in the two realizations, they are not.

original: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / nges 'byed yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i lam la gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bzod pa dang shes pas bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa dang /

original: rgyun dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun bshad pa yin no //
translated: The verse summary called ‚Äúirreversible‚Äù and so on explains the irreversible Sa·πÖgha of bodhisattvas who are abiding on the path of preparation that is conducive to penetrative insight, and similarly, who are abiding on the path of seeing that is subsumed by the stages of patient acceptance and knowledge, and who are abiding on the uninterrupted path of meditation.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la de la nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la @207b gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la de la nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la @207b gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The verse summary called ‚Äútheir characteristics‚Äù and so on explains the characteristics of the form and so on of those who are abiding in the branches of penetrative insight and so on. The commentary on the verse summary is easy to understand.

original: yang ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid rnam pa nyi shu'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid rnam pa nyi shu'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse of the metrical text beginning with Again, the reversal, etc. is stated by Because of the absence of own-being, etc.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa yi ni nges par 'byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa yi ni nges par 'byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse of the metrical text beginning with The one who is established on the path of vision, etc. is stated by The one who is established on the path of vision, etc.

original: mthong ba'i lam la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //üîΩskad cig ma'i rnam pa ni mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no // skad cig ma'i rnam pa ni mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse of the metrical text beginning with On the path of vision, etc. is stated by Suffering, etc.üîΩ The aspect of momentariness is stated by The characteristic, etc.

original: rnam pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse of the metrical text beginning with Aspect is stated by Own-characteristic, etc.

original: yang dag par na don gyi bya ba nus pa'i ngo bo med pas yul med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par na don gyi bya ba nus pa'i ngo bo med pas yul med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa ldog pa yin no //
translated: In reality, since there is no entity that is capable of the activity of an object, there is no object, and therefore there is the cessation of the perception of form, etc.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dge ba zad cing thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba 'phel bas sangs rgyas la sogs pas byang chub pa'i bar du byang chub kyi sems bstan par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dge ba zad cing thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba 'phel bas sangs rgyas la sogs pas byang chub pa'i bar du byang chub kyi sems bstan par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word Buddha and so on refers to the teaching of the thought of enlightenment, because of the exhaustion of the non-virtuous and the increase of the virtuous which is conducive to liberation, up to the enlightenment of the Buddha, etc.

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa gzung ba nyams su len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa gzung ba nyams su len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word Mahayana and so on refers to the practice of the acceptance of the generation of the thought of enlightenment, etc.

original: chos rab tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mthus gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams skye ba med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rab tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mthus gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams skye ba med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the words the supreme dharma and so on, it is because of the knowledge of the non-production of dharmas such as form, etc., by the power of the supreme investigation of the dharmas.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The word etc. refers to the attainment of the meditative concentration of cessation.

original: 'di dag nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir de bskyed pa'i yan lag yang dag pa ste yang dag pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir de bskyed pa'i yan lag yang dag pa ste yang dag pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: These are the limbs of generating that, i.e., of generating the enlightenment, because they are the very causes of perfect enlightenment.

original: de rnams yongs su zad pa 'di ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams yongs su zad pa 'di ma chags pa'o //
translated: The complete exhaustion of those is nonattachment.

original: mi dge ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dge ba dang ldan pa kho na'i lus la sogs pa las su mi rung ba ni lci ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dge ba dang ldan pa kho na'i lus la sogs pa las su mi rung ba ni lci ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfreedom from the nonvirtuous‚Äù and so on refers to the unserviceability of the body and so on that is associated with the nonvirtuous, because it is heaviness.

original: sems can 'dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba gzhan gyi don gyi smon lam med pas 'dul bar mi nus pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa la mngon par @208a * //üîΩchags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba gzhan gyi don gyi smon lam med pas 'dul bar mi nus pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa la mngon par @208a * // chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúinability to train sentient beings‚Äù and so on refers to the inability to train sentient beings due to the absence of a vow to benefit others in accordance with their intentions, because it is the manifest attachment to the enjoyment of form and so on.

original: yul gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun tu sbyor ba la mngon par zhen pa nyid yul gyi nyes dmigs ma mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun tu sbyor ba la mngon par zhen pa nyid yul gyi nyes dmigs ma mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe faults of the object‚Äù and so on refers to the failure to see the faults of the object due to manifest clinging to the fetters.

original: skyes bu dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sme sha can la sogs pa skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa rnams ni sdig pa'i rgyu nya la sogs pa gsod cing 'chi ba'i rgyur byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩstong pa nyid la gnas pa nyid kyis na bdag med pa'i bsam pa yod pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched lngar bshad pa de rnams la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba dag la mngon par zhen pa dang shin tu mngon par zhen pa dag tu
