analyzed: skyes bu dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sme sha can la sogs pa skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa rnams ni sdig pa'i rgyu nya la sogs pa gsod cing 'chi ba'i rgyur byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // stong pa nyid la gnas pa nyid kyis na bdag med pa'i bsam pa yod pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched lngar bshad pa de rnams la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba dag la mngon par zhen pa dang shin tu mngon par zhen pa dag tu
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are not holy beings‚Äù and so on means that those who are not holy beings, such as outcastes, are the very cause of death for those who kill fish and so on, which is a sinful cause.

original: mi bya bar te /
analyzed: mi bya bar te /
translated: Because they abide in emptiness, they have the thought of no-self. Therefore, they should not be attached to or strongly attached to the five aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been explained, and to their combination and association.

original: de ltar sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba dag gi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba dag gi gnas pa ste /
translated: In this way, they abide in the combination and association.

original: spyod pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de so sor bkag pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de so sor bkag pa'o //
translated: This is the specific practice that is being refuted.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pa ni rten med pa nyid kyis thams cad du mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsal ba nyid kyis na gzung ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa nyid kyisüîΩgang zhig rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pa ni rten med pa nyid kyis thams cad du mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsal ba nyid kyis na gzung ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa nyid kyis gang zhig rtogs pa ste /
translated: The meditative absorption of the nonarising of all phenomena is endowed with the absence of a basis, because it is free from clinging to anything.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum shes pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum shes pa yin la /
translated: The realization of the three knowledges is the realization of the three knowledges.

original: de rnams kyi bar chad byed pa'i chos ni sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bar chad byed pa'i chos ni sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa rnams te /
translated: The phenomena that create obstacles to those are the faults explained above.

original: de la snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba stong pa nyid la gnas pa nyid kyi sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba la gnas par mi bya'o zhes 'di'i phyi ma rnams la yang sgra'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba stong pa nyid la gnas pa nyid kyi sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba la gnas par mi bya'o zhes 'di'i phyi ma rnams la yang sgra'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As before means that one should not abide in the application and subsequent application of abiding in emptiness. The meaning of the words in the latter [lines] is the same as before.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdud la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni de las 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na rnam par rtog pa nyid nyes pa yin no zhes yongs su shes pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi rgyu'i tshogs
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdud la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni de las 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na rnam par rtog pa nyid nyes pa yin no zhes yongs su shes pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi rgyu'i tshogs
translated: Because there is no attachment to generosity, etc.,üîΩThe cause of attachment to duality isüîΩThe faults of Mara, etc., arise from that, so conceptualization itself is a fault in reality.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no attachment to generosity, etc.,üîΩThe cause of attachment to duality isüîΩThe faults of Mara, etc., arise from that, so conceptualization itself is a fault in reality.üîΩBecause there is no attachment to generosity, etc.,üîΩThe cause of attachment to duality isüîΩThe faults of Mara, etc., arise from that, so conceptualization itself is a fault in reality.üîΩBecause there is no attachment to generosity, etc.,

original: gzung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis su mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na /
analyzed: gzung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis su mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na /
translated: The cause of attachment to duality isüîΩThe faults of Mara, etc., arise from that, so conceptualization itself is a fault in reality.üîΩBecause there is no attachment to generosity, etc.,üîΩThe cause of attachment to duality isüîΩThe faults of Mara, etc., arise from that, so conceptualization itself is a fault in reality.üîΩBecause there is no attachment to generosity, etc.,üîΩThe cause of attachment to duality isüîΩThe faults of Mara, etc., arise from that, so conceptualization itself is a fault in reality.

original: bdud dang bdud kyi 'khor rnams kyi ral gri dang mda' la sogs pa rnams lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i bya ba yin pas rnal 'byor ba rnams la g-yul 'gyed pa med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdud dang bdud kyi 'khor rnams kyi ral gri dang mda' la sogs pa rnams lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i bya ba yin pas rnal 'byor ba rnams la g-yul 'gyed pa med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no attachment to generosity, etc.,üîΩThe cause of attachment to duality isüîΩThe faults of Mara, etc., arise from that, so conceptualization itself is a fault in reality.üîΩBecause there is no attachment to generosity, etc.,

original: byams pas sam chos thams cad nye bar ma dmigs pas bgegs nye bar zhi ba @208b yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: byams pas sam chos thams cad nye bar ma dmigs pas bgegs nye bar zhi ba @208b yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The cause of attachment to duality isüîΩThe faults of Mara, etc., arise from that, so conceptualization itself is a fault in reality

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi rgyud la sbyin pa la sogs pas byas pa'i ser sna la sogs pa las ldog pa'i khyad par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi rgyud la sbyin pa la sogs pas byas pa'i ser sna la sogs pa las ldog pa'i khyad par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the knowledge of the distinctive qualities of generosity, etc., refers to the knowledge of the distinctive qualities of generosity, etc., that are produced in one's mind due to the reversal of stinginess, etc.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la phra rab la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu dang gya nom pa dang gya nom pa ma yin pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la phra rab la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu dang gya nom pa dang gya nom pa ma yin pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the knowledge of all entities refers to the knowledge of the entities of form, etc., that are devoid of the nature of atoms, etc., and of a cause such as a divine creator, etc., and of the good and bad.

original: rtogs pa'i chos ni 'dir byang chub yin no //üîΩmngon par yid ches pa la sogs pa ni mngon par shes pa drug gi stobs kyis mngon par yid ches pa thob pas yang dag pa'i ye shes nges par thob pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos ni 'dir byang chub yin no // mngon par yid ches pa la sogs pa ni mngon par shes pa drug gi stobs kyis mngon par yid ches pa thob pas yang dag pa'i ye shes nges par thob pa ni /
translated: The Dharma of realization is enlightenment. üîΩThe phrase the knowledge of the attainment of full confidence, etc., refers to the attainment of full confidence that is gained through the power of the six clairvoyances. The attainment of full knowledge of reality is the knowledge of one's own three stages that is gained through the three knowledges of an omniscient being.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rang gi sa gsum la rang gi sa yin pa nyid kyis na nges pa nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rang gi sa gsum la rang gi sa yin pa nyid kyis na nges pa nyid kyi ste /
translated: The phrase the knowledge of one's own stage refers to the knowledge of one's own three stages.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa ni the tshom med par dmigs su med pa'i ye shes su nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa ni the tshom med par dmigs su med pa'i ye shes su nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the eighth ground and so forth, they are definitely without doubt in the non-conceptual gnosis.

original: gcig tu gzhol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcig tu gzhol ba nyid kyi phul du byung ba dang bcas pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i chos mngon du gyur pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi don du srog gtongüîΩba yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu gzhol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcig tu gzhol ba nyid kyi phul du byung ba dang bcas pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i chos mngon du gyur pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi don du srog gtong ba yin te /
translated: In the line ‚Äúthey are dedicated to the one thing,‚Äù and so forth, it is said that they give up their lives for the sake of the Dharma, such as the knowledge of all things, because they have actualized the Dharma, such as the generation of the mind of awakening, which is dedicated to the one thing, and so forth.

original: rtag tu ngu ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba'i yul gzhan du 'gro ba'am lus btsong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ngu ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba'i yul gzhan du 'gro ba'am lus btsong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Like Sadaprarudita and so forth, they go to other lands where their lives are threatened, or they sell their bodies, and so forth.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa'i thabs kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon sum du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa'i thabs kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon sum du byas pa yin la /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have the method that is the defining characteristic of knowledge, as explained above, actualize it.

original: de nyid kyis na gzhan gyi mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gzhan gyi mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that others do not understand it?

original: ji ltar na gzhan rnams kyi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhes rtogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan rnams kyi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhes rtogs pa la /
translated: How are they characteristics of the realization of others?

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni 'du shes las ldog pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni 'du shes las ldog pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The characteristics of knowledge are causes of results that are the reversal of discernment and so on.

original: rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras skye bar //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras skye bar //
translated: The result arises from the assembly of causes.

original: rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa //üîΩdon gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa // don gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
translated: That which is inferred

original: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //üîΩces bya ba'i rigs pas 'tsham pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pas mtshan nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs @209a * //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod // ces bya ba'i rigs pas 'tsham pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pas mtshan nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs @209a * //
translated: is said to be intrinsic natureüîΩbecause it does not rely on another object.

original: pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThus‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on teaches that it is characteristics alone because it is suitable to be inferred through reasoning.

original: de ltar na bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma rnam pa bcu drug gis bsdus pa 'di rnams ni 'bras bu nyid yin pas bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma rnam pa bcu drug gis bsdus pa 'di rnams ni 'bras bu nyid yin pas bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug yin te /
translated: Thus these sixteen moments of perseverance and knowledge subsumed by the four truths are results.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug yang dag par thob pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis goms par byas par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa med pas dag pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug yang dag par thob pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis goms par byas par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa med pas dag pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu
translated: The cause of the mundane is the subsequent cognition that is included in the subsequent mind that possesses conceptuality because it arises after the moments of nonconceptual patience and knowledge that possess the aspect of nonapprehending apprehender and apprehended.

original: yin pa'i phyir /üîΩ'jig rten pa yin pa gang gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa can nyid kyi bzod pa dang / shes pa'i skad cig ma rnam par mi rtog pa rnams las phyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rjes kyi sems rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa des bsdus pa gang yin pa'i rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir / 'jig rten pa yin pa gang gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa can nyid kyi bzod pa dang / shes pa'i skad cig ma rnam par mi rtog pa rnams las phyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rjes kyi sems rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa des bsdus pa gang yin pa'i rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The mundane is the cause of the mundane because it is the cause of the result that is its homogeneous result.üîΩThe result of the mundane is the result of the mundane because it is the cause of the result that is its homogeneous result.üîΩThe result of the mundane is the result of the supramundane because it is the cause of the result that is its homogeneous result.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las ldog pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa de rnams kyi rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las ldog pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa de rnams kyi rgyu yin pas so //
translated: The result of the supramundane is the result of the supramundane because it is the cause of the result that is its homogeneous result.

original: skyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes pa'i skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang de bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: skyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes pa'i skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang de bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúbecause it produces,‚Äù etc., the characteristic of the moment of consciousness is not its own nature, but it is the cause of its production.

original: nye bar btags pa'i dgongs pa ni rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i dgongs pa ni rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The intended meaning of the designation is stated in the phrase ‚Äúthe yogis,‚Äù etc.

original: thams cad du nyan thos la sogs pa'i lta ba la yang rtogs pa dang mthun pa kho na yin pa ni thos pa'i shes pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad du nyan thos la sogs pa'i lta ba la yang rtogs pa dang mthun pa kho na yin pa ni thos pa'i shes pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid do //
translated: The conformity with realization is the conformity with the knowledge of hearing in all views of the sravakas, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams ni lam de'i bsam gtan rab kyi mthar phyin pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams ni lam de'i bsam gtan rab kyi mthar phyin pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The yogis are endowed with the perfection of the concentration of that path.

original: tha snyad ni rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i 'jig rten dang mthun par spyod pa ni nges pa yin la bcos ma ni nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ni rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i 'jig rten dang mthun par spyod pa ni nges pa yin la bcos ma ni nges pa med pa'o //
translated: The conventional is the definite conduct in accordance with the world through the natural superknowledges of the yogis, etc., and the indefinite is the artificial.

original: de ni sems can 'dul ba'i dgos pa'i dbang ma rtogs par zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni sems can 'dul ba'i dgos pa'i dbang ma rtogs par zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: That is said to be due to not realizing the power of the need to tame sentient beings.

original: gdul bya'i don du yang rtogs pa'i don dang mthun pa ma yin na yang tha snyad du rnam par mi rtog pa mi mnga' ba'i bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra ba yin pas nye bar btags nas shes pa'i skad @209b cig ma'i mtshan nyid kyis bshad cing bstan to
analyzed: gdul bya'i don du yang rtogs pa'i don dang mthun pa ma yin na yang tha snyad du rnam par mi rtog pa mi mnga' ba'i bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra ba yin pas nye bar btags nas shes pa'i skad @209b cig ma'i mtshan nyid kyis bshad cing bstan to
translated: Even for the sake of those to be tamed, if it is not in accord with the meaning of realization, it is conventionally explained and taught by the characteristics of the moments of consciousness that are imputed to be similar to the BhagavƒÅn, who is not nonconceptual.

original: // de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be imputed.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud las so so rang gi rig pa ni sgom pa po'i rang rig pa'i skad cig ma rnams te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud las so so rang gi rig pa ni sgom pa po'i rang rig pa'i skad cig ma rnams te /
translated: In the Yoga Tantra, one‚Äôs own awareness is the moments of one‚Äôs own awareness of the meditator.

original: shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams ji ltar gzhan yid ches par byed pa zhes bya ba sgom pa po las gzhan pa dag gis shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams ji ltar gzhan yid ches par byed pa zhes bya ba sgom pa po las gzhan pa dag gis shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin par mi 'thad de /
translated: How can the moments of consciousness be the characteristics of the consciousness of others, those other than the meditator?

original: rang gi rig pa ni gzhan gyi rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa ni gzhan gyi rig pa ma yin te /
translated: One‚Äôs own awareness is not the awareness of others.

original: rang gi rig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: consciousness.üîΩAlthough there is much to be said about the path of cultivation, the

original: bsgom pa'i lam la brjod par bya ba mang du yod na yang dang po khyad par brjod pa'i rgyu ni de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la brjod par bya ba mang du yod na yang dang po khyad par brjod pa'i rgyu ni de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: cause for the first distinction is stated in the following:

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zab mo yin no /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zab mo yin no /
translated: The path of cultivation is profound because it is endowed with profundity.

original: zab mo de gang yin zhe na stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo de gang yin zhe na stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is that profundity? It is emptiness and so on.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i zab pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i zab pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the profundity of emptiness and so on?

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do //
translated: It is the freedom from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The commentary on the verses states ‚Äúemptiness and so on are empty,‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid dang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: because emptiness, suchness, and so on are empty.

original: gzugs med pa la zhes bya ba ni gzugs su sgro 'dogs pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la zhes bya ba ni gzugs su sgro 'dogs pa bkag pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Formless‚Äù refutes the superimposition of form.

original: stong pa dang stong pa ma yin pa dag la stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa gcig par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa dang stong pa ma yin pa dag la stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa gcig par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for emptiness and non-emptiness, etc. and form, etc. to be identical.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa la tshor ba la sogs pa med do zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa la tshor ba la sogs pa med do zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be viewed that feeling, etc. do not exist in emptiness, etc.

original: gzugs stong pa nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid kyis na gzugs dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa skur pa btab pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid kyis na gzugs dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa skur pa btab pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Since form, etc. and emptiness, etc. are different, the negation of form, etc. and emptiness, etc. is contradictory.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa med pas rang gi ngo bo dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur bas stong pa nyid la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya bas ni skur pa 'debs pa dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa med pas rang gi ngo bo dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur bas stong pa nyid la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya bas ni skur pa 'debs pa dgag pa yin no //
translated: Since the emptiness, etc. of form, etc. do not exist, it would follow that they have an essence. Therefore, since emptiness, etc. are not different from form, etc., this passage refutes the negation of emptiness, etc.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par blta bar bya'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par blta bar bya'o /
translated: Similarly, it should be viewed that emptiness, etc. are not different from feeling, etc.

original: de bzhin du go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa sgro 'dogs @210a * //üîΩpa dang skur pa'i mtha' can yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa sgro 'dogs @210a * // pa dang skur pa'i mtha' can yin te /
translated: are respectively the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni 'jig pa'i mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni 'jig pa'i mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the extremes of annihilation because they are the ultimate of destruction.üîΩThat which is free and liberated from them is emptiness, etc.

original: de dag las grol zhing bral ba'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni zab mo ste stong pa nyid la sogs pa yin pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa med pa dang gzugs la sogs pa la yang stong pa
analyzed: de dag las grol zhing bral ba'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni zab mo ste stong pa nyid la sogs pa yin pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa med pa dang gzugs la sogs pa la yang stong pa
translated: That emptiness, etc. is profound, because the non-existence of form, etc. in emptiness, etc. and the non-existence of emptiness, etc. in form, etc.

original: nyid la sogs pa med pa gang yin pa de dag ni rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid yin pas /
analyzed: nyid la sogs pa med pa gang yin pa de dag ni rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid yin pas /
translated: are to be realized by the direct perception of the yogi.

original: zab mo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'og nas bshad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni zab cing gting dpag dka' ba yin no //üîΩthos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin /
analyzed: zab mo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'og nas bshad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni zab cing gting dpag dka' ba yin no //üîΩthos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin /
translated: Therefore, the path of meditative realization, which will be explained below, is profound and difficult to fathom, because it possesses profundity.üîΩThe path of meditative realization is profoundüîΩbecause it is difficult to fathom.üîΩThe path of meditative realization is profound because it is difficult to fathom.

original: nges 'byed ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
analyzed: nges 'byed ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúpeak‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming dang / tshig dang ngag dang yi ge dang dbyangs kyi yi ge'i bdag nyid can bsgom pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming dang / tshig dang ngag dang yi ge dang dbyangs kyi yi ge'i bdag nyid can bsgom pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one meditates on the perfection of wisdom, which is the name, the words, the phrases, the letters, and the syllables of the melody of the letters, then one realizes all aspects completely.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa gsum la nges par mthong ba'i don zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa skabs gsum du gsungs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i don la dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i rab
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa gsum la nges par mthong ba'i don zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa skabs gsum du gsungs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i don la dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i rab
translated: At that time, one should explain the three phrases ‚Äúthe meaning of seeing certainty in the three topics,‚Äù ‚Äúthe meaning of the heat, etc., of the path of seeing and the path of meditation,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe divisions of the aspects that focus on the object,‚Äù respectively.

original: tu dbye ba rnams go rims bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag yang dang yang du sems pa dang 'jal ba dang nges par rtogs pa zhes tshig gsum bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tu dbye ba rnams go rims bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag yang dang yang du sems pa dang 'jal ba dang nges par rtogs pa zhes tshig gsum bshad par bya'o //
translated: One should explain the three phrases ‚Äúrepeated reflection,‚Äù ‚Äúrepeated evaluation,‚Äù and ‚Äúrepeated ascertainment‚Äù in terms of the wisdoms that arise from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: gang gi tshe lam gyi bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba lam bsgom pa la sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug rnams su sngar bshad pa de'i bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis gzung
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam gyi bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba lam bsgom pa la sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug rnams su sngar bshad pa de'i bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis gzung
translated: the basis of meditative stabilization, the actual basis of meditative stabilization, and the conclusion of meditative stabilization.üîΩThe three terms are:üîΩthe wisdom that meditates on the absence of apprehendeds and so on,üîΩthe mental factor of definite discernment that is the object of observation of the path of seeing and the path of meditation,

original: ba la sogs pa med pa la dmigs pa rab tu gyur pa'i sems kyi nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa'i rnam pa la yang dang yang du sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang nges par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum yin te /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa med pa la dmigs pa rab tu gyur pa'i sems kyi nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa'i rnam pa la yang dang yang du sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang nges par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum yin te /
translated: and the repeated mental contemplation, evaluation, and ascertainment of the aspects of the object of observation.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa yin no //
translated: This is the continuous path of meditation.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa dmigs @210b pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi dbye ba la dmigs pas na yang dang yang du de rnams nyid la dmigs pas dmigs par byed pa'i sems ni grangs med pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la de'i rang bzhin yin pas
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa dmigs @210b pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi dbye ba la dmigs pas na yang dang yang du de rnams nyid la dmigs pas dmigs par byed pa'i sems ni grangs med pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la de'i rang bzhin yin pas
translated: Since it is the nature of that path, it is infinite since it is limitless.

original: mtha' yas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni de rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de'i rgyun chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: mtha' yas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni de rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de'i rgyun chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The certainty that it is infinite is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIt is the aspect of that‚Äù and ‚ÄúIts continuity‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas don dam par zhes bya ba de kho na nyid mthong bas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgom pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i sems kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas don dam par zhes bya ba de kho na nyid mthong bas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgom pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i sems kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: In accordance with the just explained process, the meditation of the aspect of the nature of emptiness, which is the view of ultimate reality, is the special mind that focuses on the absence of things.

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu'i gnyen po'i dbye ba las zhes bya ba ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu'i gnyen po nyid yin pas rnam pa dgu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu'i gnyen po'i dbye ba las zhes bya ba ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu'i gnyen po nyid yin pas rnam pa dgu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nine aspects are due to the classification of the antidotes to the nine conceptualizations, i.e., the conceptualizations of the apprehended, etc., which are differentiated by the categories of small, medium, etc.

original: grangs bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas dgu dag tu zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas dgu dag tu zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
translated: The nine are the nine spheres of the desire realm, etc.

original: dgu la bsgom pa'i lam dgu ni rgyun chags yin no //
analyzed: dgu la bsgom pa'i lam dgu ni rgyun chags yin no //
translated: The nine paths of meditative development are continuous.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why? Because they occur continuously.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i don mang po la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ram bar chad med pa'i lam du rgyun du zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i don mang po la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ram bar chad med pa'i lam du rgyun du zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, because they arise from the meditative development of the many meanings of the factors that contribute to enlightenment, etc., or because the stream is uninterrupted on the path of no-more-learning.

original: bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu nyid yin par de kho na nyid du mi 'thad do zhes dogs pa la kun rdzob yin pa'i lan btab pa ni rgyal ba'i yum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu nyid yin par de kho na nyid du mi 'thad do zhes dogs pa la kun rdzob yin pa'i lan btab pa ni rgyal ba'i yum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The reply to the qualm that the nine aspects of the path of meditation are not tenable in reality is that they are tenable conventionally.

original: rgyal ba'i yum de dang de las zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum de dang de las zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa las so //
translated: The Mother of the Victor, in that and that, refers to the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas and so on.

original: rnam pa re re'i dbang du mdzad de zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis dro ba la sogs pa re re nas nye bar gzung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa re re'i dbang du mdzad de zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis dro ba la sogs pa re re nas nye bar gzung ste /
translated: From the perspective of each aspect, refers to each of the aspects of heat and so on of the path of meditation that have just been explained.

original: grangs dang tshad dang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas kyang rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs dang tshad dang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas kyang rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they cannot be realized by means of number, measure, direct perception and so on.

original: ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams grangs med pa dpag tu med pa tshad med pa gang yin pa de rnams skye bar gsungs pa'i phyir zhes bya @211a * //
analyzed: ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams grangs med pa dpag tu med pa tshad med pa gang yin pa de rnams skye bar gsungs pa'i phyir zhes bya @211a * //
translated: It is because it is said that the countless, immeasurable, limitless merit of the roots of virtue of nonattachment and so on arise.

original: ba skye bar brjod pas bye brag mang ba ste /
analyzed: ba skye bar brjod pas bye brag mang ba ste /
translated: Since the path of meditation is described as generating many distinctions, it is the result of the merit of countless incalculable numbers of heat and so on.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis dro ba la sogs pa'i grangs med pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pas na grangs med pa la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur na ji ltar rnam pa dgu nyid yin te mi 'thad do zhen grangs med pa la sogs
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis dro ba la sogs pa'i grangs med pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pas na grangs med pa la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur na ji ltar rnam pa dgu nyid yin te mi 'thad do zhen grangs med pa la sogs
translated: Therefore, since it is countless incalculable, how could it be ninefold?üîΩIt is untenable.

original: pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel te /
translated: The first half of the verse is explained by countless and so on.

original: grangs med pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: grangs med pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Countless and so on have already been explained.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni brjod du med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni brjod du med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term and so on refers to inexpressible and so on.

original: de rnams bstan pa rnams te de dang der smos pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams bstan pa rnams te de dang der smos pa rnams so //
translated: They are taught and mentioned there and there.

original: de yang yang dag pa'i don ma yin pa de ni dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa'i don ma yin pa de ni dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: That is not the correct meaning.

original: tshig tu brjod pa'i ngo bo rnams ni don dam par mi 'thad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba yang dag par na ji ltar grags pa'i don du mi rung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa'i ngo bo rnams ni don dam par mi 'thad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba yang dag par na ji ltar grags pa'i don du mi rung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The nature of verbal expressions is not tenable ultimately, because they are not suitable as objects of renown in reality.

original: snyan dang gas sbyar ba dang 'dra bar sgra dgod pa tsam du sbyar ba'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid can gyi brjod par bya ba'i sgra ni brdzun yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snyan dang gas sbyar ba dang 'dra bar sgra dgod pa tsam du sbyar ba'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid can gyi brjod par bya ba'i sgra ni brdzun yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The verbal expressions that are the nature of distinctions applied by merely positing sounds are false, like the application of the vowels and consonants.

original: de bas na bsgom pa'i lam bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' las ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: de bas na bsgom pa'i lam bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' las ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: Therefore the path of meditation has the characteristics explained in the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs scriptures.

original: zab mo la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bsgom pa'i lam ni bye brag tu dbye ba byed par bzod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zab mo la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bsgom pa'i lam ni bye brag tu dbye ba byed par bzod pa ma yin te /
translated: The path of meditation, which has the nature of the profound, and so on, is not suitable to be analyzed.

original: grangs med pa la sogs pa nyid du bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: grangs med pa la sogs pa nyid du bya bar mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be made into a number, and so on.

original: ji ltar zhe na don gcig tu ste don gyi dbye ba gzhan la ltos pa med pas nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i yul gcig pa ni don gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na don gcig tu ste don gyi dbye ba gzhan la ltos pa med pas nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i yul gcig pa ni don gcig pa yin la /
translated: How? With one object, because it is not dependent on another division of objects.

original: de la rab tu sbyar zhing nges par ldan pa'i ldog pa'i dbye ba gang yin pa de la ltos pas rgyu de las nye bar skyed pa'i tha dad pa nyid kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de la rab tu sbyar zhing nges par ldan pa'i ldog pa'i dbye ba gang yin pa de la ltos pas rgyu de las nye bar skyed pa'i tha dad pa nyid kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: That which is definitely connected with the application to that is the nature of difference that is generated from that cause, which is dependent on that.

original: grangs med pa la sogs pa gang yin pa des nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i yul gcig pa nyid la sogs pa yin par gcig tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs med pa la sogs pa gang yin pa des nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i yul gcig pa nyid la sogs pa yin par gcig tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: That which is called innumerable, etc., definitely engages in the sameness of the object of the branches of penetration, etc.

original: de bas na bye brag tu snang ba nyid yin na yang dbye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na bye brag tu snang ba nyid yin na yang dbye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, even though it appears as different, it is not different.

original: dbye ba gzhan la ltos nas yang nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa don sna tshogs pa dang rab tu sbyar pa'i ldog pa la @211b ltos pa'i las nye bar skyed pa'i tha dad pa nyid kyi ngo bo bye brag tu dbye ba nyid yin no
analyzed: dbye ba gzhan la ltos nas yang nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa don sna tshogs pa dang rab tu sbyar pa'i ldog pa la @211b ltos pa'i las nye bar skyed pa'i tha dad pa nyid kyi ngo bo bye brag tu dbye ba nyid yin no
translated: In terms of other divisions, it is also the specific differentiation of the nature of the generation of different functions in terms of the distinctions of application to various meanings, such as the limbs of definite discrimination and so on.

original: // kun rdzob ces bya ba la sogs pa phyed 'og ma bshad pa kun rdzob tu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: // kun rdzob ces bya ba la sogs pa phyed 'og ma bshad pa kun rdzob tu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The second half of the verse beginning with ‚Äúconventionally‚Äù explains:

original: kun rdzob tu ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba rnam par mi rtog pas khyab pa'i thugs rje de'i rang bzhin gyi chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba rnam par mi rtog pas khyab pa'i thugs rje de'i rang bzhin gyi chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: Conventionally, the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu is the great compassion of the buddhas and so on, which is called ‚Äúnonreferential,‚Äù that is, the compassion that pervades nonconceptuality.

original: stobs bcu la sogs pa'i rgyu gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: stobs bcu la sogs pa'i rgyu gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the nondual pristine wisdom that is the cause of the ten powers and so on.

original: de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa yin pa ni cha 'dra ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa yin pa ni cha 'dra ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Its natural outflow is the similar essence.

original: de ni bshad pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de ni bshad pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: That is the nature of the Dharma that is to be explained.

original: yang dag pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ston pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ston pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The nature of the Dharma that teaches the nondual, perfect pristine wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches just that nondual pristine wisdom in all aspects.

original: ji skad bshad cing bstan pa ni grangs med pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad cing bstan pa ni grangs med pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams so //
translated: The words ‚Äúincalculable‚Äù and so on refer to what has been explained and taught.

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams ni ma rig pas khyab pa rnams gzhug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams ni ma rig pas khyab pa rnams gzhug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is for the purpose of introducing those childish beings who are pervaded by ignorance.

original: 'bras bu chen po bskyed par rab tu ston pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu skyed par brjod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po bskyed par rab tu ston pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu skyed par brjod pa yin pas so //
translated: Because it is taught to produce the great result, it is said to produce the result of omniscience.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bzhed pas zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par sems can bzhugs pa'i tshul mkhyen pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dgongs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bzhed pas zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par sems can bzhugs pa'i tshul mkhyen pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dgongs so //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas intend it, because the TathƒÅgatas know the way beings abide without error.

original: rgyu de bas na mang po nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i lam grangs med pa la sogs par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de bas na mang po nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i lam grangs med pa la sogs par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that many results would follow from one cause.

original: chos kyi dbyings grangs med pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsod nams grangs med pa la sogs pa nyid yin pa ni kun rdzob tu yin gyi yang dag par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings grangs med pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsod nams grangs med pa la sogs pa nyid yin pa ni kun rdzob tu yin gyi yang dag par ni ma yin te /
translated: The immeasurable merit of yogins and so on is immeasurable in the relative, but not in reality,

original: bsod nams kyi rgyu nyid nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa grangs med la sogs pa nyid yod na ji ltar na de'i 'bras bu grangs med pa la sogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyu nyid nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa grangs med la sogs pa nyid yod na ji ltar na de'i 'bras bu grangs med pa la sogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: because if the causes of merit, such as the factors conducive to penetrative insight, generosity and so on, are immeasurable, how could their results be immeasurable?

original: de'i 'bras bu ma yin par thal bar 'gyur na de ltar na yang bcom ldan 'das ni brdzun du gsungs pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ma yin par thal bar 'gyur na de ltar na yang bcom ldan 'das ni brdzun du gsungs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It would follow that they are not the results of those causes, but the Transcendent Conqueror does not speak falsely.

original: sems @212a * //
analyzed: sems @212a * //
translated: The mind of the Transcendent Conqueror is not mistaken.

original: can rnams gzhug pa'i tshul phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa nyid kyis na gang zag la sogs pa dang 'dra bar na de ltar ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: can rnams gzhug pa'i tshul phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa nyid kyis na gang zag la sogs pa dang 'dra bar na de ltar ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The Transcendent Lord, by virtue of his correct knowledge of the way to lead sentient beings, teaches in that way, as if he were a person and so on.üîΩThis is also explained:

original: de yang / nye bar gnod phyir yang dag par //
analyzed: de yang / nye bar gnod phyir yang dag par //
translated: Because it is harmful, it is not real.

original: gang zhig smras gyur de nyid brdzun //
analyzed: gang zhig smras gyur de nyid brdzun //
translated: That which is said to be real is false.

original: bden dang bden min don ci yin //
analyzed: bden dang bden min don ci yin //
translated: What is the meaning of real and unreal?

original: gzhan don byed gang de bden yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩgal te nyon mongs pa rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid yin na de med pa yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan don byed gang de bden yin // zhes bshad pa yin no // gal te nyon mongs pa rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid yin na de med pa yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas ci zhig bya /
translated: That which benefits others is real.üîΩIf the afflictions are by nature emptiness itself, then since they do not exist, what is the point of meditating on them?

original: 'on te yang dag par rang bzhin yod na de lta na yang bsgom pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te yang dag par rang bzhin yod na de lta na yang bsgom pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: But if they really exist by nature, then again, what is the point of meditating on them?

original: rang bzhin la ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir gnyi ga ltar na yang nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni stong pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas don med par rtog pa la stong pa nyid kyi mtshan
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir gnyi ga ltar na yang nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni stong pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas don med par rtog pa la stong pa nyid kyi mtshan
translated: Because it is impossible to transform the nature of something, the path of meditation that is the branches of definite discrimination and so on is pointless, as stated in the lines ‚ÄúThe path of meditation is emptiness‚Äù and so on.

original: nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni bzung ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i lam dang / de bsgom pa'i sems ni dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni bzung ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i lam dang / de bsgom pa'i sems ni dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúdue to the defining characteristics of emptiness‚Äù is as follows: The object of apprehension and so on are discordant factors, and the path of the branches of definite discrimination and so on is the mind that meditates on emptiness because it is a nonentity.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba la sogs pa'i tshad ma ni kun tu 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba la sogs pa'i tshad ma ni kun tu 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: The argument that things are devoid of singularity and plurality and so on is a universal because it is the intention of the challenger.

original: goms pa phul du phyin pa byar med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: goms pa phul du phyin pa byar med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the culmination of familiarization is not to be achieved‚Äù means that

original: gus pa dang bcas pa dang rgyun mi 'chad pa dang dus ring mor bslabs su zin na yang rab tu sbyor bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pa dang rgyun mi 'chad pa dang dus ring mor bslabs su zin na yang rab tu sbyor bar mi rigs te /
translated: Even if one trains with respect, without interruption, and for a long time, it is still unreasonable to apply oneself to the path of meditation.

original: med pa la med par goms pa ni mi'i rva ni ri bong gi rva nyid du phul du byung ba byar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: med pa la med par goms pa ni mi'i rva ni ri bong gi rva nyid du phul du byung ba byar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that a non-existent can be cultivated as non-existent, just as it is not tenable that the horn of a human can be cultivated as the horn of a rabbit.

original: de'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i lam ni ci yang byed mi nus te /üîΩgang du khyad par du byar med pa dang rnam pa gang gis kyang med pa ni byed pa po nyid du mi rigs so zhes skye bo blo dman pa dag gi ngor nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i lam kun rdzob tu yod pa yin zhing
analyzed: de'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i lam ni ci yang byed mi nus te / gang du khyad par du byar med pa dang rnam pa gang gis kyang med pa ni byed pa po nyid du mi rigs so zhes skye bo blo dman pa dag gi ngor nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i lam kun rdzob tu yod pa yin zhing
translated: Therefore, it is said that it does not perform any function at all.üîΩThe path of meditation is not able to perform any function at all, because it is unreasonable that that which is not differentiated and does not exist in any way is an agent.üîΩIn order to dispel the doubts of those of lesser intelligence, the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on exist conventionally.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'thad pa'i rab kyi mtha' mi shes pa'i skye bo rnams kyi ngor dogs pa bsu ba ni dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'thad pa'i rab kyi mtha' mi shes pa'i skye bo rnams kyi ngor dogs pa bsu ba ni dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: In order to dispel the doubts of those who do not understand the ultimate, the existence of the path is tenable in terms of the relation between cause and effect.

original: tshig le'ur @212b byas pa'i don rnam par 'grel pa ni chos nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur @212b byas pa'i don rnam par 'grel pa ni chos nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The commentary on the meaning of the verses is ‚Äúreality itself,‚Äù etc.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yang dag par na de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa nyid kyis bye brag dang / bye brag med pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin par brjod du med pa la thos pa la sogs pa mi nus pa ni ci /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yang dag par na de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa nyid kyis bye brag dang / bye brag med pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin par brjod du med pa la thos pa la sogs pa mi nus pa ni ci /
translated: Since it is devoid of intrinsic reality, it is inexpressible as identical with or different from, both, or neither, and as specific or non-specific, both, or neither, in reality. Is it impossible to hear, etc.,

original: kun rdzob tu yin nam 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yin nam 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: in the conventional or not?

original: chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe reality of its own essence,‚Äù

original: yang dag par na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: yang dag par na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: since it is the nature of non-dual intuition in reality.

original: rgyu'i khyad par de dag gis na gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa de'i phyir brjod du med pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par de dag gis na gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa de'i phyir brjod du med pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: Since it is the nature of non-dual intuition due to those special causes, therefore, the inexpressible is the nature of the path that is desired.

original: sngar bshad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni brjod du med pa nyid kyis na gang zag la sogs pa dang 'dra bar dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni brjod du med pa nyid kyis na gang zag la sogs pa dang 'dra bar dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The path of cultivation explained above does not exist as a thing, like a person, etc., because it is inexpressible.

original: de bas na bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gyis te /
analyzed: de bas na bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gyis te /
translated: Therefore, the path called ‚Äúcultivation‚ÄùüîΩis not tenable as separation from the class of adverse factors and the arising of the class of antidotes, in the order in which they were explained above.

original: rgyus mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag sngar bshad pa dag las go rims bzhin du 'bral ba dang skye bar mi rung ngo zhes bya bar bsgom pa phul du phyin pa byar med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang dag par na bsgom pa'i lam med pa
analyzed: rgyus mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag sngar bshad pa dag las go rims bzhin du 'bral ba dang skye bar mi rung ngo zhes bya bar bsgom pa phul du phyin pa byar med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang dag par na bsgom pa'i lam med pa
translated: Because there is no cultivation of the path of cultivation,üîΩthere is no cultivation of the path of cultivation that is superior.

original: nyid kyis na bsgom pa phul du gyur par byar med pa'i phyir de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyis na bsgom pa phul du gyur par byar med pa'i phyir de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Because of this, it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, there is no cultivation of the path of cultivation.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu bsgom pa'i lam du bshad pa la ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bsgom pa'i lam du bshad pa la ni /
translated: However, in the explanation of the path of cultivation as conventional,

original: thos pa la sogs par nus pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs par nus pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: it is said that it is possible to hear, etc.,

original: don dam par ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: but not ultimately.

original: bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa med pa la yang yang dag par na bsgom pa dang / de'i don gyi bya bas kyang /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa med pa la yang yang dag par na bsgom pa dang / de'i don gyi bya bas kyang /
translated: And in the absence of meditation, etc., there is meditation in reality, and by the activity of that,

original: nyon mongs pa bstsal ba dang / byang chub skyed pa'i mtshan nyid med pa nyid yin pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bstsal ba dang / byang chub skyed pa'i mtshan nyid med pa nyid yin pa bden mod kyi /
translated: the afflictions are eliminated and enlightenment is generated.

original: de lta na yang rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu dngos po la sogs pa yod pas bsgom pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu dngos po la sogs pa yod pas bsgom pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Although that is so, since things, etc. exist conventionally for the yogi, meditation exists.

original: de lta bas na byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam phul du phyin pa las nyon mongs pa rnams glo bur pa yin pas na sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam phul du phyin pa las nyon mongs pa rnams glo bur pa yin pas na sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the afflictions are adventitious, there is no fault in the previously explained path of meditation that is perfected in accordance with enlightenment.

original: @213a * // de gsal bas gnyen po zhes bya ba skye ba la yang 'gag pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: @213a * // de gsal bas gnyen po zhes bya ba skye ba la yang 'gag pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is the intention that since the antidote is generated, there is no cessation of arising.

original: rnam 'grel mdzad pas kyang /üîΩde bas yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: rnam 'grel mdzad pas kyang / de bas yang dag yang dag min //
translated: The author of the Pramii(laviirttikam) also says:üîΩTherefore, the real and the unreal

original: shin tu bsgom zhing gang gang yin //
analyzed: shin tu bsgom zhing gang gang yin //
translated: are well meditated upon.

original: bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa na //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa na //
translated: When the power of meditation is complete,

original: de gsal mi rtog blo'i 'bras bu //
analyzed: de gsal mi rtog blo'i 'bras bu //
translated: That is the result of the mind of clear non-discursiveness.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos pa dang bsgom pa dag ni don dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos pa dang bsgom pa dag ni don dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, listening to and meditating on the perfection of wisdom are meaningful.

original: mdo sde'i rgyan las /
analyzed: mdo sde'i rgyan las /
translated: The Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras says:

original: gal te thos pa tsam gyis don mthong 'gyur na bsgom pa don med 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te thos pa tsam gyis don mthong 'gyur na bsgom pa don med 'gyur //
translated: If the meaning were seen merely through listening, meditation would be meaningless.

original: gal te ma thos par yang sgom 'jug 'gyur na bsten pa don med 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te ma thos par yang sgom 'jug 'gyur na bsten pa don med 'gyur //
translated: If one were to engage in meditation without listening, reliance would be meaningless.

original: zhes bshad pas rtog pa dang ldan pas thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas rtog pa dang ldan pas thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who are intelligent should strive in listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: ma grub pas ci yang sgrub par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bsgom pa ma grub na byang chub mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma grub pas ci yang sgrub par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bsgom pa ma grub na byang chub mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If meditation is not accomplished, is it not the case that awakening is not accomplished, since it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is not established does not establish anything else‚Äù?

original: ji ltar na des don gyi bya ba de sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas yang snga ma'i phyed kyi byang chub med par dogs pa bsu ba ni de lta yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar dpyad par bya ste re zhig byang chub ni sngon dang phyi mar gyur pa'i sems las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar na des don gyi bya ba de sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas yang snga ma'i phyed kyi byang chub med par dogs pa bsu ba ni de lta yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste re zhig byang chub ni sngon dang phyi mar gyur pa'i sems las byung ba yin la /
translated: How does it accomplish the action of its object?  With this thought, he anticipates the qualm that the first half of the verse does not refer to enlightenment, and he says, ‚ÄúEven though that is so‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩ  Thus, he analyzes: Enlightenment is a mental factor that occurs before and after.

original: de la snga phyir gyur pa'i sems re re'am /
analyzed: de la snga phyir gyur pa'i sems re re'am /
translated: Is the cause of enlightenment a single moment of mind that occurs before or after,

original: mang po cig car 'dus pa'am /
analyzed: mang po cig car 'dus pa'am /
translated: or is it a collection of many minds occurring simultaneously,üîΩor is it a series of minds occurring in sequence?

original: rim gyis 'byung ba'i sems byang chub kyi rgyu yin zhes brtag pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba'i sems byang chub kyi rgyu yin zhes brtag pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: There are three ways to analyze this.

original: phyogs dang po ni re res byang chub pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ni re res byang chub pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The first position is that it is illogical for enlightenment to be produced by a single moment of mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na snga phyir gyur pa'i sems re re la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de sgrub par byed pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i don mtha' dag ces bya ba sngar bshad pa gang yin paüîΩde mi snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na snga phyir gyur pa'i sems re re la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de sgrub par byed pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i don mtha' dag ces bya ba sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de mi snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because the meaning of the omniscience of the nonconceptual gnosis of the buddhas‚Äô enlightenment, which is accomplished in each individual mind of the past and future, is not seen.

original: sems gcig la yul du ma nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sems gcig la yul du ma nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning of the above is that the omniscience of the buddhas‚Äô enlightenment is not seen in each individual mind of the past and future because many objects do not exist in a single mind.

original: phyogs gnyis pa gsal ba ni mang po nyid kyis kyang byang chub par ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa gsal ba ni mang po nyid kyis kyang byang chub par ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The second position is clarified: ‚ÄúIt is not logical to be enlightened by many minds.‚Äù

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed par snang ba'i sems cig car 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed par snang ba'i sems cig car 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe simultaneous arising of minds that appear to accomplish the desired aim.‚Äù

original: 'dod @213b pa'i don ni byang chub po //
analyzed: 'dod @213b pa'i don ni byang chub po //
translated: The desired aim is enlightenment.

original: gang du de sgrub par byed par snang ba sems cig car 'byung ba mang po de rnams kyis byang chub par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang du de sgrub par byed par snang ba sems cig car 'byung ba mang po de rnams kyis byang chub par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not reasonable that many minds that appear to establish that would be enlightened.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te dus gcig gi tshe rtog pa du ma mi skye bas so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te dus gcig gi tshe rtog pa du ma mi skye bas so //
translated: Why? Because it is impossible, since many thoughts do not arise at one time.

original: nyams su myong ba grub pa yin na yang 'di ni rtog pa nye bar bsgrubs pa yin no zhes 'ga' zhig phyin ci ma log pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba grub pa yin na yang 'di ni rtog pa nye bar bsgrubs pa yin no zhes 'ga' zhig phyin ci ma log pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Even if experience is established, this is the establishment of thought.

original: lung ni sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu re re ba'o zhes 'byung bas smos pa yin te /
analyzed: lung ni sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu re re ba'o zhes 'byung bas smos pa yin te /
translated: To eliminate the misconception of some, it is said that scripture states that the cause of consciousness of sentient beings is individual.

original: rnam par rtog pa mang po cig car 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mang po cig car 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that it is impossible for many thoughts to occur simultaneously.

original: des na sems can rnams kyi snying ni rnam par rtog pa gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na sems can rnams kyi snying ni rnam par rtog pa gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the heart of sentient beings is a single thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas kyang rnam par rtog pa gnyis po dus gcig min //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas kyang rnam par rtog pa gnyis po dus gcig min // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The two conceptual thoughts do not occur simultaneously.

original: brtag pa gsum la gsal ba ni rim gyis 'byung ba yang ma yin te zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: brtag pa gsum la gsal ba ni rim gyis 'byung ba yang ma yin te zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúclearly‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúclearly manifest in three ways‚Äù is also used because they do not occur sequentially.

original: sngar bshad pa'i snga phyir gyur pa'i sems gang yin pa de mang po nyid yin na yang byang chub par ni rigs pa ma yin zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i snga phyir gyur pa'i sems gang yin pa de mang po nyid yin na yang byang chub par ni rigs pa ma yin zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The mind that occurs sequentially, as explained earlier, is not suitable to be enlightened, even if it is many.

original: ji lta bu zhe na bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sgrub par byed pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar rtogs shing shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo sgyu ma lta bur shes pa'i tshul gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sgrub par byed pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar rtogs shing shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo sgyu ma lta bur shes pa'i tshul gang yin pa des so //
translated: How is it that the nature of the realization and knowledge of the path that establishes unsurpassed buddhahood‚Äîfrom the foundations of mindfulness up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha‚Äîis illusory?

original: ci'i phyir byang chub par rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub par rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not suitable to be enlightened?

original: de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù and so forth is said.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sems de rang gi ngang gis byung ma thag gi rjes thogs la 'jig cing nyams pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sems de rang gi ngang gis byung ma thag gi rjes thogs la 'jig cing nyams pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: The mind that is explained as being destroyed and lost immediately after it arises by itself is without a subsequent continuum,

original: rgyu med pa yin la de'i dngos po de nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yin la de'i dngos po de nyid kyis te /
translated: that is, it is without a cause.

original: des na phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gcig la gcig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyu de bas na khyad par can te /
analyzed: des na phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gcig la gcig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro // rgyu de bas na khyad par can te /
translated: By that very fact, it is not related to the mind that is its antecedent, because they are not mutually related.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa der snang ba'i sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa der snang ba'i sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas /
translated: For that reason, it is not reasonable that the mind that is generated in the aspect of the defining characteristics of the applications of mindfulness, etc.,

original: ji ltar don gyi bya ba byang chub sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /üîΩmi rigs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi @214a * //
analyzed: ji ltar don gyi bya ba byang chub sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te / mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi @214a * //
translated: is the cause of the attainment of enlightenment, which has the defining characteristic of the activity that is beneficial to the world.

original: don yin te /
analyzed: don yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not reasonable‚Äù is that it is not reasonable for the mind that is generated in the aspect of the defining characteristics of the applications of mindfulness, etc.,üîΩto be the cause of the attainment of enlightenment, which has the defining characteristic of the activity that is beneficial to the world.

original: de ltar na snga phyir gyur pa'i sems 'dus pa dag gis byang chub sgrub par byed pa yin na 'dus pa yang med de /
analyzed: de ltar na snga phyir gyur pa'i sems 'dus pa dag gis byang chub sgrub par byed pa yin na 'dus pa yang med de /
translated: If enlightenment is attained by the combination of earlier and later minds, then the combination does not exist.

original: 'di ni byung ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'di ni byung ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems so //
translated: because it is destroyed immediately upon arising.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni brtag pa gsum po gang yin pa de dag ni legs pa ma yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' smra bas smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni brtag pa gsum po gang yin pa de dag ni legs pa ma yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' smra bas smras pa yin no //
translated: The Proponent of the Conclusion says, ‚ÄúThat is not correct,‚Äù meaning that the three analyses are not good.

original: mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The commentary on the verse that begins ‚Äúlike a flame‚Äù is the statement ‚ÄúHow could it be that . . .‚Äù

original: 'dir yang me lce dang snying po ci re re nas skad cig ma snga phyis sam 'on te phrad nas snying po tshig pa yin zhes brtag pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang me lce dang snying po ci re re nas skad cig ma snga phyis sam 'on te phrad nas snying po tshig pa yin zhes brtag pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Here, too, there are two analyses: Is the flame and the wick burned sequentially, moment by moment, or is the wick burned all at once when the flame touches it?

original: de la dang po bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la dang po bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To refute the first, it says, ‚ÄúHow could it be that . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: me lce ni mar me'i me lce'o //
analyzed: me lce ni mar me'i me lce'o //
translated: The flame is the flame of the butter lamp.

original: snying po ni grags par zad do //
analyzed: snying po ni grags par zad do //
translated: The wick is well known.

original: 'di dag phrad pa'i skad cig ni 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid de dang po sreg par nus pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa med par zhes bya ba ni sreg par nus pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa med par me lce ni sreg par byed pa yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'di dag phrad pa'i skad cig ni 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid de dang po sreg par nus pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa med par zhes bya ba ni sreg par nus pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa med par me lce ni sreg par byed pa yin pa'i phyir
translated: The first moment is capable of burning, because the flame is the agent that burns, since the second moment of the flame that is capable of burning does not exist.üîΩThe fuel is the effect, because it is what is to be burned.

original: rgyu yin la snying po ni bsreg par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu yin par ci rigs pa 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yin la snying po ni bsreg par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu yin par ci rigs pa 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: This is the nature of the characteristics.

original: gang sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba me lce dang snying po dag ni sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba nyid yin par ji lta ba bzhin du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba me lce dang snying po dag ni sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba nyid yin par ji lta ba bzhin du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is this: it is not tenable that the flame and the fuel are, respectively, the agent and object of burning, just as they are.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: me lce dang snying po dag gi rang gi rgyus zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid dang phan tshun lhan cig byed pa'i skad cig mas de dag phan tshun gyi sgo nas rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i dbang gis dus mnyam du ste /üîΩdus mtshungs par gyur pa'i phrad pa'i bskyed pas zhes bya ba me lce dang snying po phrad pa bskyed pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni khyad par can du ma byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: me lce dang snying po dag gi rang gi rgyus zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid dang phan tshun lhan cig byed pa'i skad cig mas de dag phan tshun gyi sgo nas rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i dbang gis dus mnyam du ste / dus mtshungs par gyur pa'i phrad pa'i bskyed pas zhes bya ba me lce dang snying po phrad pa bskyed pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni khyad par can du ma byas pa'i phyir te /
