and they are mutually simultaneous secondary causes.

original: thun mong yin pa nyid kyis rang rang gi nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur byas pa dus mnyam par gyur pa nyid kyis na dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i ba lang gi rva dang 'dra bas ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid me lce
analyzed: thun mong yin pa nyid kyis rang rang gi nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur byas pa dus mnyam par gyur pa nyid kyis na dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i ba lang gi rva dang 'dra bas ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid me lce
translated: The flame and the wick are simultaneous since they are mutually simultaneous primary causes and they are mutually simultaneous secondary causes.üîΩThe flame and the wick

original: dang snying po sreg par byed @214b pa dang bsreg par bya ba'i gnas skabs su gnas zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩde bzhin du nus pa yin phyir te gang me lce dang snying po de dag skye ba skad cig ma gnyis pa'am yang zhes bya ba skad cig ma dang po ma yin par snga ma bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid me lce dang snying po sreg
analyzed: dang snying po sreg par byed @214b pa dang bsreg par bya ba'i gnas skabs su gnas zhes bya bar dgongs so // de bzhin du nus pa yin phyir te gang me lce dang snying po de dag skye ba skad cig ma gnyis pa'am yang zhes bya ba skad cig ma dang po ma yin par snga ma bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid me lce dang snying po sreg
translated: and the firebrand and the core exist in the state of being burned and burner.

original: par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba'i ngo bor mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba'i ngo bor mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: So too, because of capability, the firebrand and the core that arise in the second moment or the first moment, as before, are not suitable to be the characteristics of cause and effect, the firebrand and the core, in the nature of the burner and the burned.üîΩThe rest is as before.

original: rtag tu yod par la sogs par thal bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa skad cig ma dang po med par 'byung bar khas len pa na rgyu med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag tu yod par la sogs par thal bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa skad cig ma dang po med par 'byung bar khas len pa na rgyu med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would follow that it would always exist and so on, because if it is accepted that the second moment arises without the first moment, it would be causeless.

original: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
translated: Because it is causeless and does not rely on another,

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
translated: it would always exist or not exist.

original: dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig /'byung ba ltos pa las yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig /'byung ba ltos pa las yin no //
translated: Things sometimes arise in dependence on conditions.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas rtag tu yod pa'am med par thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar na kun rdzob tu yang 'byung ba med de gang gi phyir skad cig ma dang po med par skad cig ma gnyis pa 'byung bar khas len na thams cad 'bras bu yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu yang skye ba med pa yin
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas rtag tu yod pa'am med par thal bar 'gyur ro // de ltar na kun rdzob tu yang 'byung ba med de gang gi phyir skad cig ma dang po med par skad cig ma gnyis pa 'byung bar khas len na thams cad 'bras bu yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu yang skye ba med pa yin
translated: By this reasoning, it follows that things would either be permanent or nonexistent.üîΩThus, even conventionally, arising does not exist, because if one accepts that a second moment arises without a first moment, then all things would be effects without cause, and there would be no difference between them.üîΩThus, even conventionally, arising does not exist.

original: la de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: la de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, if a second moment arises without depending on a first moment, then it would always exist, because the cause, the first moment, would not have disintegrated.üîΩAnd if it does not exist, then it would be powerless, and therefore it would not exist even conventionally, like the essence of a burnt seed.

original: yang na skad cig ma dang po la ma ltos par skad cig ma gnyis pa skye na rtag tu yod pas na rgyu'i skad cig ma ma zhig pas so //
analyzed: yang na skad cig ma dang po la ma ltos par skad cig ma gnyis pa skye na rtag tu yod pas na rgyu'i skad cig ma ma zhig pas so //
translated: Or, if a second moment arises without depending on a first moment, then it would always exist, because the cause, the first moment, would not have disintegrated.

original: med pa yang nus pa med pa yin pa'i phyir snying po tshig pa kun rdzob tu yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa yang nus pa med pa yin pa'i phyir snying po tshig pa kun rdzob tu yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it does not exist, then it would be powerless, and therefore it would not exist even conventionally, like the essence of a burnt seed.

original: de bas na me lce dang snying po ni rgyu la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na me lce dang snying po ni rgyu la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the flame and the core are not the cause, etc.

original: skad cig ma dang po dang skad cig ma gnyis pa phrad pa kho nas kun rdzob tu snying po tshig pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po dang skad cig ma gnyis pa phrad pa kho nas kun rdzob tu snying po tshig pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The mere contact of the first moment with the second moment is the conventional burning of the core, because, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma re res yin par mi rung ba de'i phyir rgyu 'di dang rkyen 'di las skye bas 'di'i rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam yin pa de'i bdag nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma re res yin par mi rung ba de'i phyir rgyu 'di dang rkyen 'di las skye bas 'di'i rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam yin pa de'i bdag nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid
translated: Since it is not tenable that the former and latter moments are the burner and the burned, therefore, since it arises from this cause and this condition, it is merely the conditionality of this, the reality of dependent origination,üîΩwhich is the nature that is born in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: kyi zhes bya ba rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa las skyes pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa des me lce dang snying po ni sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba'i gnas skabs su gzhag go zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: kyi zhes bya ba rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa las skyes pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa des me lce dang snying po ni sreg par byed pa dang bsreg par bya ba'i gnas skabs su gzhag go zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is this: by that nature, the flame and the core are posited as the burner and the burned.

original: @215a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang gi tshe gnyi ga phrad cing 'dus pa'i gnyis pa la sogs pa phrad pa'i skad cig ma skyed par rung ba me lce dang snying po gnyis ka phrad du rung ba'i skad cig ma de la ltos shing rgyur byas nas ma brtags na gcig tu nyams dga'
analyzed: @215a * // ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi tshe gnyi ga phrad cing 'dus pa'i gnyis pa la sogs pa phrad pa'i skad cig ma skyed par rung ba me lce dang snying po gnyis ka phrad du rung ba'i skad cig ma de la ltos shing rgyur byas nas ma brtags na gcig tu nyams dga'
translated: Why?üîΩWhen both the flame and the wick are suitable to contact, the second moment of contact and so on are suitable to generate the second moment of contact and so forth.

original: ba zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa gang yin pa de'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa gang yin pa de'i stobs kyis te /
translated: In dependence on that moment of contact, when not analyzed, the power of the cause and effect of the relative truth, which is called ‚Äúthe delightful single state,‚Äù

original: de'i rgyus skad cig ma dang po des drangs shing sgro btags pa'i mthu khyad par can sreg tu rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid yin gyi ris mi mthun pa gzhan dag yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyus skad cig ma dang po des drangs shing sgro btags pa'i mthu khyad par can sreg tu rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid yin gyi ris mi mthun pa gzhan dag yang ma yin te /
translated: is the special power of the first moment of contact, which is the characteristic of the suitability of burning. That is all it is, and it is not another dissimilar type.

original: khyad par du snying po bsreg pa bskyed par rung ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du snying po bsreg pa bskyed par rung ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The second moment of contact and so on are suitable to generate the special burning of the wick.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa yod na de'i tshe rgyu med pa zhig kyang zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i skad cig ma rang gi ngang gis 'jig na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba me lce dang snying po'i mtshan nyid dag go
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa yod na de'i tshe rgyu med pa zhig kyang zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i skad cig ma rang gi ngang gis 'jig na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba me lce dang snying po'i mtshan nyid dag go
translated: If the moment of the cause itself ceases, then cause and effect would be simultaneous, like the characteristics of a flame and its essence.

original: rims bzhin du gang dus mnyam du srang mda'i mtho dman dang 'dra ba skye ba dang 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: rims bzhin du gang dus mnyam du srang mda'i mtho dman dang 'dra ba skye ba dang 'jig pa ste /
translated: In the same way, arising and ceasing would occur simultaneously, like the rising and falling of the two arms of a scale.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa gang yin pa de dag nye bar dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa gang yin pa de dag nye bar dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the arising and ceasing of the cause and effect are observed.

original: me yi 'bras bu du ba ste //
analyzed: me yi 'bras bu du ba ste //
translated: The effect of fire is smoke.

original: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes 'jug phyir //üîΩde med par yang de yod na //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes 'jug phyir // de med par yang de yod na //
translated: Because the effect is concomitant with the cause.üîΩIf it existed without the cause,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //
translated: it would be causeless.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa lnga dag gis me lce dang snying po dag 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa lnga dag gis me lce dang snying po dag 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By this reasoning, because the flame and the wick are observed to be cause and effect, which have the nature of engaging and disengaging, through the five types of perception and non-perception.

original: yang gang gi phyogs la yang dag par na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ba de la yid brtan du rung ba med de de'i phyogs la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de rjes su sbyar bar 'dod par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so
analyzed: yang gang gi phyogs la yang dag par na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ba de la yid brtan du rung ba med de de'i phyogs la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de rjes su sbyar bar 'dod par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so
translated: Moreover, in any position where the nature of cause and effect is not suitable in reality, there is no reliability, and in that position, one should wish to apply the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: // gzhan du na de'i phyogs la sna tshogs rgyu med pa'am rgyu ma nges par 'gyur te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // gzhan du na de'i phyogs la sna tshogs rgyu med pa'am rgyu ma nges par 'gyur te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, in that position, the variety would be without a cause or the cause would be indefinite, because there would be no certainty.

original: rnam 'grel mdzad pas /
analyzed: rnam 'grel mdzad pas /
translated: The author of the Pramanavarttika says:

original: thams cad nus pa med ce na //üîΩsa bon sogs ni myug sogs la //
analyzed: thams cad nus pa med ce na // sa bon sogs ni myug sogs la //
translated: If you say everything is powerless,üîΩThe power of seeds, etc. is seen in sprouts, etc.

original: nus mthong gal te de kun rdzob //
analyzed: nus mthong gal te de kun rdzob //
translated: If that is a convention,

original: 'dod na ji lta de ltar zad //
analyzed: 'dod na ji lta de ltar zad //
translated: Then how is it exhausted?

original: ces gang bshad pa dang / dbu ma'i rgyan las /
analyzed: ces gang bshad pa dang / dbu ma'i rgyan las /
translated: The Ornament of the Middle Way says:

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of all things

original: rig pa'i lam @215b gyi rjes 'brang bar //
analyzed: rig pa'i lam @215b gyi rjes 'brang bar //
translated: Is to be known through the path of reasoning.

original: gzhan dag 'dod pa sel bar byed //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'dod pa sel bar byed //
translated: It dispels the assertions of others.

original: de'i phyir rgol ngan gnas med do //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgol ngan gnas med do // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no basis for bad arguments.

original: pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpes bstan pa'i byang chub dang mar me'i dpe'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpes bstan pa'i byang chub dang mar me'i dpe'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the example of the lamp in the example of enlightenment.

original: skad cig ma snga phyir gyur pa gnyis kyis gang yul gcig la zhes bya ba mar mer gtogs pa sreg pa la'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga phyir gyur pa gnyis kyis gang yul gcig la zhes bya ba mar mer gtogs pa sreg pa la'o //
translated: Two successive moments of a lamp are said to be in the same place, that is, in the place of the lamp,üîΩbecause they are applied to the same object, that is, the object of the lamp.

original: de la nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i rgyu nyid du shes par byed pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i rgyu nyid du shes par byed pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: The application is the cause of the knowledge of that.

original: de lhur len pa ni de gtso bor gyur pas mar me'i dpe'i tshul du rig pas so //
analyzed: de lhur len pa ni de gtso bor gyur pas mar me'i dpe'i tshul du rig pas so //
translated: The teaching is the primary factor in the example of the lamp.

original: byang chub sgrub par byed pa dngos po tshad yod pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid dam dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sgrub par byed pa dngos po tshad yod pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid dam dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The actual thing that accomplishes enlightenment is the eight realizations, or the characteristics of the applications of mindfulness and so on.

original: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i sems rgyur byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i sems rgyur byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness that appears as that is the mind of conceptualization that is the cause of the eight realizations and so on.

original: snga ma la brten nas zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rkyen tsam nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kun rdzob tu rgyur byas nas so //
analyzed: snga ma la brten nas zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rkyen tsam nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kun rdzob tu rgyur byas nas so //
translated: In dependence on the former, means that the nature of dependent origination, which is merely a condition, is taken as the cause conventionally.

original: snang ba'i don ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul gzung ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du nges pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: snang ba'i don ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul gzung ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du nges pa'i yul lo //
translated: The meaning of appearance is the object that is ascertained as the characteristic of the discordant class, such as the object apprehended by the eye consciousness and so on.

original: des na dben pa ni lhag par khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: des na dben pa ni lhag par khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: Therefore, seclusion is superior and exalted.

original: khams gsum pa khyad par du byas pa'i snang ba nyid kyis na lhag pa'i sems kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa khyad par du byas pa'i snang ba nyid kyis na lhag pa'i sems kyi khyad par te /
translated: Since the appearances of the three realms are qualified, they are the special mental states.

original: de'i gnyen po'i mtshan nyid de'i gnyen por snang ba'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma zhes bya ba phyis 'byung ba'i byang chub la rtogs pa'i sems skye bar gyur pa na byang chub thob par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i mtshan nyid de'i gnyen por snang ba'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma zhes bya ba phyis 'byung ba'i byang chub la rtogs pa'i sems skye bar gyur pa na byang chub thob par gyur pa ste /
translated: The later consciousness that appears as the antidote to that is called the antidote to that. When the mind that arises as the realization of enlightenment occurs later, enlightenment is attained.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs par rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs par rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable that the afflictions are abandoned along with their imprints.

original: dbu ma'i rgyan las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rgyan las /
translated: As it is said in the Ornament of the Middle Way:

original: chos la bdag med mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: chos la bdag med mkhas pa ni //
translated: The wise ones who know the selflessness of phenomena

original: rang bzhin med pa goms byas pas //üîΩphyin ci log las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa goms byas pas // phyin ci log las byung ba yi //
translated: are accustomed to the absence of nature.üîΩThey abandon the afflictive obstructions

original: nyon mongs sgrib pa med par spong //
analyzed: nyon mongs sgrib pa med par spong //
translated: that arise from error.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa dang / yang de nyid las /
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa dang / yang de nyid las /
translated: And also in that same text:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //
translated: The entities of cause and effect

original: kun rdzob tu na ma bzlog pas //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na ma bzlog pas //
translated: are not refuted conventionally.

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang sogs //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang sogs //
translated: Thus the presentation of thorough affliction and complete purification

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'khrug pa med //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'khrug pa med //
translated: is not disturbed.

original: @216a * // ces gang bshad pa dang / dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: @216a * // ces gang bshad pa dang / dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
translated: And in the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga:üîΩThe obscurations are taught to be

original: nyon mongs pa yi sgrib pa dang // shes bya'i sgrib pa nyid du bstan //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yi sgrib pa dang // shes bya'i sgrib pa nyid du bstan //
translated: afflictive and to knowledge.

original: der ni sgrib pa thams cad de //üîΩde zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
analyzed: der ni sgrib pa thams cad de // de zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
translated: All obscurations are included in those two.

original: ces smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ces smos pa yin no //
translated: Liberation is asserted to be the exhaustion of those.

original: de ltar mar me'i dpes yang dag par na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du mi rung bas byang chub kun rdzob tu nye bar bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar mar me'i dpes yang dag par na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du mi rung bas byang chub kun rdzob tu nye bar bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, since it is not tenable that cause and effect are real in reality by the example of the lamp, enlightenment is taught to be conventional.

original: gzhan dag tu yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i don rnam pa brgyad gsungs pa dam pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i don rnam pa brgyad gsungs pa dam pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: And in other s≈´tras, the Bhagavat taught the eight difficult topics that are difficult to understand, which are to be accomplished by the holy ones.

original: zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach that, the Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúThe thus-gone ones, the worthy ones, the perfect buddhas are said to be‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: skye ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The verse ‚Äúbirth, etc.‚Äù and so on is a commentary on the verse that defines the nonreturner who abides on the path of meditation. The verse ‚Äúmoment‚Äù and so on is a commentary on the verse ‚Äúbirth, etc.‚Äù

original: bsgoms pas rtogs par bya ba ni thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pas rtogs par bya ba ni thob par bya ba'o //
translated: The verse on the characteristic of the non-returner who is established in the path of meditative development begins with ‚Äúbirth‚Äù and so on. The commentary on this verse begins with ‚Äúthe realization through meditative development is what is to be attained.‚Äù

original: don khyad par du 'phags pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don khyad par du 'phags pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub gang yin pa'o //
translated: The special meaning is the enlightenment that is not shared with the sravakas and so on.

original: de skyed pa ni goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de skyed pa ni goms par byed pa'o //
translated: The generation of this is the cultivation.

original: skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma dag gis kyang snga ma bzhin du mi 'thad la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis kyang snga ma bzhin du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma dag gis kyang snga ma bzhin du mi 'thad la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis kyang snga ma bzhin du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second reason is that it is not tenable that the former and latter moments are the same, nor is it tenable that they are essentially different.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sngar nye bar bstan pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub pa po'i shes pa zab pa nyid ni 'og nas bshad pa'i don bdun car la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sngar nye bar bstan pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub pa po'i shes pa zab pa nyid ni 'og nas bshad pa'i don bdun car la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the profound knowledge of the practitioner, which was previously taught in the context of dependent origination and in the passage beginning ‚Äúinconceivable,‚Äù should be applied to all seven topics that will be explained below.

original: rang bzhin gyis dngos po med par byung ba nyid kyis na yang dag par na 'gag par mi 'thad pas 'gag pa de ni dngos po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dngos po med par byung ba nyid kyis na yang dag par na 'gag par mi 'thad pas 'gag pa de ni dngos po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Since it is essentially non-arisen, it is not tenable that it ceases in reality. Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThat cessation of all things‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don dag la goms pas mngon sum du bya ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mngon sum du mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don dag la goms pas mngon sum du bya ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mngon sum du mi byed pa yin te /
translated: Since one becomes familiar with the meaning of reality and unreality, one possesses direct perception, and thus one does not directly perceive suchness.

original: de ni gnas skabs thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn all situations‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa rang bzhin med pas sbyin par bya ba la sogs par rtog pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa mi 'thad @216b pa'i phyir zhes bya ste sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa'i gzung ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa rang bzhin med pas sbyin par bya ba la sogs par rtog pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pa mi 'thad @216b pa'i phyir zhes bya ste sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa'i gzung ba'o //
translated: Because the object of giving and so on are essenceless, it is not tenable to establish the practice of giving and so on that conceives of the object of giving and so on.

original: de ni de bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is the apprehended object of the object of giving and so on.üîΩThe apprehending consciousness is the consciousness of the eye and so on, which is the consciousness of the object of giving and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med pas de'i shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med pas de'i shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Since the phenomena of the object of giving and so on, such as form, do not exist due to their lack of intrinsic reality, the consciousness of that is the consciousness of the eye and so on.

original: de ni de bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by suchness and so on.

original: stong pa nyid yin pas na sems bskyed pa la sogs pa dang gzhan dag nyams su len pa med pa'i phyir spyod pa ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin pas na sems bskyed pa la sogs pa dang gzhan dag nyams su len pa med pa'i phyir spyod pa ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa yin te /
translated: Practice is the practice of generating the mind and so on, because there is no practice of others such as generating the mind and so on due to emptiness.

original: de ni chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by the nature of phenomena and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshul rnam pa gnyis su snang bas gnyis su med par shes pa min par mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzung ba la sogs pa med pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshul rnam pa gnyis su snang bas gnyis su med par shes pa min par mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzung ba la sogs pa med pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: It is untenable that the nondual consciousness does not perceive the two modes of appearance of form and so on as dual.üîΩ

original: de ni gnyis su med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the non-apprehension of duality is not the knowledge of non-duality through the appearance of the mode of form, etc. as twofold, he says, ‚Äúthe non-existence of the apprehended object, etc. is non-duality.‚Äù

original: snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyis na sangs rgyas la sogs pa nyid /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyis na sangs rgyas la sogs pa nyid /
translated: The attainment of Buddhahood, etc. is due to the perfection of the stores of merit and knowledge.

original: 'thob pa mi 'jigs pas thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa mi 'jigs pas thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Skill in means is due to fearlessness.

original: sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-dejection of mind, etc.

original: de ni tshogs thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshogs thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe perfection of all the stores,‚Äù etc.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i don ni yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam rtogs par dka' ba'i shes pa nyid yin pas shes pa zab pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i don ni yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam rtogs par dka' ba'i shes pa nyid yin pas shes pa zab pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba
translated: The knowledge of the difficulty of realizing the Bodhisattva path is the knowledge of the mutual contradiction of the meaning of dependent origination, etc. Hence, profound knowledge is the inconceivable wisdom.

original: la sogs pa smos pa yin te /üîΩ'di ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa kho na'i yul yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pas tshu rol mthong bas ni 'dir dad pa kho na legs so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: la sogs pa smos pa yin te / 'di ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa kho na'i yul yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pas tshu rol mthong bas ni 'dir dad pa kho na legs so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: and so on refers to the other three.üîΩThe Bhagav√•n intended that the object of the first is the world of sentient beings, the object of the second is the world of inanimate things, the object of the third is the world of sentient beings and inanimate things, and the object of the fourth is the world of sentient beings and inanimate things in their ultimate mode of being.

original: gang gis 'dren pa'i nges 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: gang gis 'dren pa'i nges 'byung ba'i //
translated: The Bhagav√•n intended that the object of the first is the world of sentient beings, the object of the second is the world of inanimate things, the object of the third is the world of sentient beings and inanimate things, and the object of the fourth is the world of sentient beings and inanimate things in their ultimate mode of being.üîΩThe faith of those who are led

original: dad pa gzhon pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: dad pa gzhon pa mchog yin no //
translated: To renunciation is the best.üîΩTherefore, the wise should rely

original: de bas dad pa'i rjes 'brang nyid //üîΩblo ldan mi yis brten par gyis //
analyzed: de bas dad pa'i rjes 'brang nyid // blo ldan mi yis brten par gyis //
translated: On the follower of faith.

original: dad pa med pa'i mi rnams la //
analyzed: dad pa med pa'i mi rnams la //
translated: In those who have no faith

original: dkar po'i chos rnams mi skye ste //üîΩsa bon me yis tshig pa la //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos rnams mi skye ste // sa bon me yis tshig pa la //
translated: Virtuous qualities do not grow,üîΩJust as sprouts do not grow from seeds

original: myu gu sngon po ji bzhin no //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩchos rnams zhes @217a * //
analyzed: myu gu sngon po ji bzhin no // zhes gang gsungs pa yin no // chos rnams zhes @217a * //
translated: Burnt by fire.üîΩThe meaning of the path is stated in the line:

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i lam gyi don gyi 'khor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i lam gyi don gyi 'khor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe path is the means for attaining nirvana.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba dang rnam par byang ba ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa'i mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ni gzung ba la sogs pa dang lam gyi 'bras bur brjod pa gang yin pa de rnams ni snang brnyan tsam gyi ngo bo nyid de
analyzed: 'khor ba dang rnam par byang ba ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa'i mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ni gzung ba la sogs pa dang lam gyi 'bras bur brjod pa gang yin pa de rnams ni snang brnyan tsam gyi ngo bo nyid de
translated: They are the nature of mere reflections.üîΩSince it is only mind, it is realized and comprehended to be like a dream.üîΩTherefore, since samsara and nirvana are not imagined to be different,

original: sems tsam nyid gang yin pas rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid du rtogs shing khong du chud pa de'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la tha dad pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pas na mnyam pa nyid du lhag par mos pa ni
analyzed: sems tsam nyid gang yin pas rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid du rtogs shing khong du chud pa de'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la tha dad pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pas na mnyam pa nyid du lhag par mos pa ni
translated: one is devoted to their sameness.

original: mnyam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is sameness.

original: slob dpon n'a ga rdzu na'i zhal snga nas kyis /üîΩmya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
analyzed: slob dpon n'a ga rdzu na'i zhal snga nas kyis / mya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
translated: As stated by Master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna:üîΩThe limit of nirvana

original: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te //üîΩde gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te // de gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
translated: Is the limit of samsara.üîΩBetween the two

original: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Not even the slightest difference exists.

original: rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni klan ka yin la //
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni klan ka yin la //
translated: The objection is stated in the words, ‚ÄúIf it is just like a dream, etc.‚Äù

original: lan ni ji skad bshad par zad //
analyzed: lan ni ji skad bshad par zad //
translated: The answer is just as has been explained.

original: ces bya ba'i bshad pa ni ji ltar phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bshad pa ni ji ltar phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the words, ‚ÄúJust as in the case of external objects,‚Äù etc., is stated.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i lugs la zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde'i gzhung lugs la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i lugs la zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde'i gzhung lugs la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of external objects‚Äù refers to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika and SautrƒÅntika systems.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis rgyu med par 'jig pa yin la zhes bya ba ni ral gris bsnun pa la sogs pa mthong du zin na yang de la ma ltos par srog chags la sogs pa rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis rgyu med par 'jig pa yin la zhes bya ba ni ral gris bsnun pa la sogs pa mthong du zin na yang de la ma ltos par srog chags la sogs pa rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of momentariness, they perish without a cause‚Äù means that even though one sees, for example, a cut with a sword, the living being, etc., perishes by its own nature without depending on that.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las kyang /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las kyang /
translated: And in the tenets it is said:

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las skyes //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las skyes //
translated: The various worlds are born from karma.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rang gi las kyi stobs kyis srog gcod pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i lung yin pas don dam par de'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis srog chags la sogs pa ni skad cig ma nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rang gi las kyi stobs kyis srog gcod pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i lung yin pas don dam par de'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis srog chags la sogs pa ni skad cig ma nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThrough the power of their karma, they kill and so on,‚Äù this is their scripture.üîΩIn the ultimate truth, it is impossible for living beings and so on to be killed and so forth, because they are momentary and disintegrate, and because the killer and so on are emanations of their own karma.

original: de gsod pa po la sogs pa yang rang gi las kyis sprul ba yin pa'i phyir srog bcad pa la sogs pa mi srid pas na sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de gsod pa po la sogs pa yang rang gi las kyis sprul ba yin pa'i phyir srog bcad pa la sogs pa mi srid pas na sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it says ‚Äúno one‚Äù and so on.

original: ma blangs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba yul med pas de dgag pa yang rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma blangs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba yul med pas de dgag pa yang rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNor is it not taken‚Äù is illogical, because it is impossible to negate something that does not exist.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni su'i yang bud med gang gis kyang blangs pa med @217b do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i phyogs kyi rgyun la 'jug pa na srog chags la sogs pa la dga' ba'i dngos po lus la sogs pa g-yo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni su'i yang bud med gang gis kyang blangs pa med @217b do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i phyogs kyi rgyun la 'jug pa na srog chags la sogs pa la dga' ba'i dngos po lus la sogs pa g-yo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that the continuum of the class of faults is engaged when one thinks, ‚ÄúNo one has taken this woman as his wife,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yin pa de ral gri la sogs pas skyed pa la gsod pa la sogs par rtogs pa ni bdag gis bsad do //
analyzed: gang yin pa de ral gri la sogs pas skyed pa la gsod pa la sogs par rtogs pa ni bdag gis bsad do //
translated: When one thinks, ‚ÄúI have killed such and such a living being,‚Äù one is referring to the body, which is the object of one‚Äôs affection, and which is characterized by immobility.üîΩWhen one thinks, ‚ÄúI have killed,‚Äù ‚ÄúI have taken his wealth,‚Äù ‚ÄúI have taken his wife,‚Äù and so on, one is referring to the body, which is the object of one‚Äôs affection, and which is characterized by immobility.

original: 'di'i rdzas sam bud med bdag gis blangs so zhes bya ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa de rtogs pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: 'di'i rdzas sam bud med bdag gis blangs so zhes bya ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa de rtogs pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: One thinks, ‚ÄúI have killed,‚Äù ‚ÄúI have taken his wealth,‚Äù ‚ÄúI have taken his wife,‚Äù and so on, on the basis of the conceptualization of the body, which is the object of one‚Äôs affection.

original: de'i dbang gis srog gcod pa la sogs par rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis srog gcod pa la sogs par rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: On the basis of that conceptualization, one establishes that one has killed, and so on.

original: ji lta bur zhe na tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la mi dge ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tshangs par spyod pa nyid du dam bcas pa dang ldan pa'i dge
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la mi dge ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tshangs par spyod pa nyid du dam bcas pa dang ldan pa'i dge
translated: What is it? It is like nonvirtue and so on that arise in those who possess improper attention and so on.

original: slong la la zhig la lan 'ga' zhig tu bud med 'ga' zhig mthong bas nu ma sra zhing mkhrang la rgyas pa mnye ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa sngon du 'gro bas phrad pa na 'khyud pa la sogs pas nyams pas rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i mtshan nyid can
analyzed: slong la la zhig la lan 'ga' zhig tu bud med 'ga' zhig mthong bas nu ma sra zhing mkhrang la rgyas pa mnye ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa sngon du 'gro bas phrad pa na 'khyud pa la sogs pas nyams pas rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i mtshan nyid can
translated: A fully ordained monk who possesses a promise to maintain celibate conduct for as long as he lives may sometimes see a woman and due to the prior conception of her firm, full and attractive breasts, he may embrace her and so on when he meets her.

original: gyi mi dge bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gyi mi dge bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: That nonvirtue has the characteristics of a root downfall.üîΩThe term and so on refers to the virtuous state of obtaining full ordination through confessing that fault to the Sa·πÖgha without concealment.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni de'i mod la dge 'dun la 'chab pa med pas de la mthol ba sngon du 'gro bas dge slong nyid 'thob pa'i phyir dge ba yin la de nyid gnyid kyis log pa ni lung du ma bstan pa rnam par gzhag pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni de'i mod la dge 'dun la 'chab pa med pas de la mthol ba sngon du 'gro bas dge slong nyid 'thob pa'i phyir dge ba yin la de nyid gnyid kyis log pa ni lung du ma bstan pa rnam par gzhag pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: That is like the neutral state of one who is asleep.

original: ci'i phyir don dam par yod par smra ba'i gzhung gi phyogs ltar na ji ltar skad cig ma nyid kyis na mi dge ba la sogs pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa'i phyir dang / las las skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de byed pa mi dge ba la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir don dam par yod par smra ba'i gzhung gi phyogs ltar na ji ltar skad cig ma nyid kyis na mi dge ba la sogs pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa'i phyir dang / las las skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de byed pa mi dge ba la sogs pa med do //
translated: Why? Because, according to the scriptural standpoint of the proponents of ultimate existence, since the momentariness of nonvirtue, etc. is destroyed, and because it is born from karma, that which performs it, nonvirtue, etc. does not exist.

original: yang na dge ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba mi dge ba la sogs pa rtog pa dge slong de'i gnas skabs su 'jog pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na dge ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba mi dge ba la sogs pa rtog pa dge slong de'i gnas skabs su 'jog pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, nonvirtue, etc., which is the opposite of virtue, etc., is posited as the state of that monk who conceives of it. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: de bzhin du dngos po rmi lam dang 'dra ba la yang zhes bya ba chos thams cad dngos po med pa la de dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po rmi lam dang 'dra ba la yang zhes bya ba chos thams cad dngos po med pa la de dang mthun pa ste /
translated: Similarly, in the case of things that are like dreams, all phenomena are unreal. That which is similar to that is

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i don gyi srog chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la gang dngos por mngon par zhen cing dngos po la mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i don gyi srog chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la gang dngos por mngon par zhen cing dngos po la mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: the characteristic of living beings, etc., which is the meaning of emptiness of intrinsic nature. That is what is conceived as real and what is attached to as real.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag gis ral gri la sogs pas bsad do zhes bya ba la sogs @218a * //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag gis ral gri la sogs pas bsad do zhes bya ba la sogs @218a * //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that the entire bondage of error is not destroyed for those who are attached to the idea that ‚ÄúI kill with a sword,‚Äù and so on.

original: pa mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de'i dbang gis phyin ci log gi 'ching ba mtha' dag ma nyams pa rnams la bdag med pa la lhag par ma mos pa rnams la srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i
analyzed: pa mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de'i dbang gis phyin ci log gi 'ching ba mtha' dag ma nyams pa rnams la bdag med pa la lhag par ma mos pa rnams la srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i
translated: The answer is that killing and so on are established for those who have not yet attained a deep conviction of selflessness.

original: lan yin la de dang de phyogs gzhan las gsungs pa ni mdo sde las gsungs so zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lan yin la de dang de phyogs gzhan las gsungs pa ni mdo sde las gsungs so zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The answer is that the s≈´tras teach that the other position is correct.

original: 'dir dngos po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas thams cad du srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas thams cad du srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Here, killing and so on are established in all cases by attachment to things and so on.

original: so sor rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi ji srid de yod pa de srid byang chub pa'i bar du mi dge ba spangs la nges par dge bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi ji srid de yod pa de srid byang chub pa'i bar du mi dge ba spangs la nges par dge bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that those who have discernment should abandon nonvirtue and definitely do what is virtuous for as long as that exists, until enlightenment.

original: stong nyid don ni mi shes par //
analyzed: stong nyid don ni mi shes par //
translated: The meaning of emptiness is not understood,

original: thos pa rnams la 'jug byed cing //
analyzed: thos pa rnams la 'jug byed cing //
translated: and they engage in the study of the scriptures.

original: gang dag bsod nams mi byed pa //
analyzed: gang dag bsod nams mi byed pa //
translated: Those who do not perform meritüîΩare ruined, those contemptible people.

original: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gang dag bshad pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gang dag bshad pa ni lan yin no //
translated: The response to that is stated in the verse beginning with ‚ÄúThose who do not perform merit are ruined, those contemptible people.‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i lan ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i lan ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The response indicated by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is stated in the verse beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni lan gzhan bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni lan gzhan bsdus pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù indicates another response.

original: rmi lam sems ni gnyid kyis nyams //
analyzed: rmi lam sems ni gnyid kyis nyams //
translated: The mind in a dream is impaired by sleep.

original: zhes bya ba gang gi phyir gnyid ces bya ba'i le lo'i khyad par gyis sgrib par bshad pas nyams shing mi gsal bar gyur pa'i sems ni rgyu des rmi lam ste gnyid kyis log pa'i gnas skabs su srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'bras bu
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang gi phyir gnyid ces bya ba'i le lo'i khyad par gyis sgrib par bshad pas nyams shing mi gsal bar gyur pa'i sems ni rgyu des rmi lam ste gnyid kyis log pa'i gnas skabs su srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'bras bu
translated: Because it is explained that the mind is obscured by the particular lethargy called ‚Äúsleep,‚Äù the mind that is impaired and unclear, by that cause, in a dream, in the state of sleep, has a consciousness of killing, etc.,

original: 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: and the result is not similar.

original: gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs dang mtshungs pa mi dge ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs dang mtshungs pa mi dge ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is that the result of nonvirtue, etc., is not established as it is in the state of not being asleep.

original: gal te rmi lam na yang sems gsal bar gyur na de'i tshe gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra bar srog gcod pa la sogs pa khu ba byung ba dang 'dra bar de yang rnam par gzhag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam na yang sems gsal bar gyur na de'i tshe gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra bar srog gcod pa la sogs pa khu ba byung ba dang 'dra bar de yang rnam par gzhag pa nyid yin te /
translated: If the mind becomes clear even in a dream, then, like the state of not being asleep, the result of killing, etc., would be established as it is in the state of emission of semen.

original: dngos po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen par mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen par mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is the same in terms of attachment to things, etc.

original: de ltar na dpe ma grub po zhes bya ba rmi lam gyi dpe ni gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba la sogs pa med par sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dpe ma grub po zhes bya ba rmi lam gyi dpe ni gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba la sogs pa med par sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the example is not established. The example of a dream is not the proof that nonvirtue, etc., does not exist in the state of not being asleep.

original: lan gyi rnam pa gzhan ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba la @218b sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: lan gyi rnam pa gzhan ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba la @218b sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Another type of response is stated with ‚Äújust as,‚Äù etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs de dang 'dra bar rmi lam na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i spyad pa ni zhes bya ba rmi lam du dge ba la sogs pa byas pa sad pa'i gnas skabs na ldang ba'i gnas skabs
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs de dang 'dra bar rmi lam na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i spyad pa ni zhes bya ba rmi lam du dge ba la sogs pa byas pa sad pa'i gnas skabs na ldang ba'i gnas skabs
translated: Likewise, means just as in the waking state, in a dream, one engages in virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: so // thol le byas so legs pa byas so zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang bas dge ba la sogs pa la dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so // thol le byas so legs pa byas so zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang bas dge ba la sogs pa la dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the waking state, one thinks, I did this and that well, I did this and that badly, because one rejoices in virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.üîΩThe mind in the subsequent state is the mind that occurs after the dream.

original: rjes kyi gnas skabs kyi sems ni de'i phyi mar gyur pa'i sems kyis mngon par zhen pa'i gsos ni 'phel ba gang yin pa ste //
analyzed: rjes kyi gnas skabs kyi sems ni de'i phyi mar gyur pa'i sems kyis mngon par zhen pa'i gsos ni 'phel ba gang yin pa ste //
translated: The nourishment of manifest clinging is the increase of that.

original: de yongs su gsos pa ni dge ba la sogs pa 'phel bar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gsos pa ni dge ba la sogs pa 'phel bar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The nourishment of that is the increase of virtue and so on.üîΩTherefore, the example is not established.

original: de'i phyir yang dpe ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dpe gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba la sogs pa med pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dpe ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dpe gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba la sogs pa med pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The example of a dream is not established in the waking state, where nonvirtue and so on do not exist.

original: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa'i 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa'i 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The commentary on the purification of the Buddha-field beginning with the words ‚Äúsentient beings‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: de'i yul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni bar chad kyi chos las zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i yul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni bar chad kyi chos las zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
translated: The verse beginning with the words ‚Äúthe object of which‚Äù is commented upon by the words ‚Äúthe dharmas of obstruction,‚Äù etc.

original: bar chad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzung ba'i chos rnams yod par lta ba las ni bdud la sogs pa 'byung la de med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzung ba'i chos rnams yod par lta ba las ni bdud la sogs pa 'byung la de med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúobstruction,‚Äù etc. refer to the fact that Mara, etc. arise from the view of the existence of the dharmas of form, etc. which are grasped, and that they do not exist.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pas bdag med par bsgom pa goms par byas pa ni thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin pas gang du yang mngon par zhen pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pas bdag med par bsgom pa goms par byas pa ni thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin pas gang du yang mngon par zhen pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúall dharmas,‚Äù etc. refer to the fact that there is no clinging to anything whatsoever because of the cultivation of the realization of selflessness through dependent origination, etc. which is the sameness of everything.

original: smon lam las grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don la go cha bgos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam las grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don la go cha bgos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase due to the accomplishment of prayers and so on refers to the fact that he is completely armored for the benefit of others.

original: dka' ba spyad pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtong ba dang gtong ba chen po dang shin tu gtong ba la goms pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' ba spyad pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtong ba dang gtong ba chen po dang shin tu gtong ba la goms pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase due to the practice of all the austerities and so on refers to the fact that he is habituated to giving, great giving, and excellent giving.

original: chos dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag med pas thams cad du bsam pa rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par thar pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs par ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med @219a * //
analyzed: chos dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag med pas thams cad du bsam pa rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // rnam par thar pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs par ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med @219a * //
translated: The phrase due to the purity of all his virtues and so on refers to the fact that he is completely pure in his intentions due to his selflessness.

original: pa dang smon pa med pa'i thabs la goms pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa dang smon pa med pa'i thabs la goms pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase due to the liberation of all his virtues and so on refers to the fact that he is habituated to the methods of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: 'dri ba sngon du btang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dris pa'i rjes thogs la chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dri ba sngon du btang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dris pa'i rjes thogs la chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase due to the questions that were asked and so on refers to the fact that he teaches the Dharma immediately after a question is asked.

original: yul thams cad shes pa nyid dang byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa la mkhas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul thams cad shes pa nyid dang byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa la mkhas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of skill in all objects, in consciousness itself, and in the immeasurables such as love.

original: sgra rnams las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained by the verse beginning with ‚Äúfrom the words‚Äù.

original: de'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The object of that, etc. is to be explained.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ni rnam pa bcu ste rnam grangs bcu yin pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ni rnam pa bcu ste rnam grangs bcu yin pa /
translated: It has ten aspects, ten categories, and is of the nature of non-conceptuality.

original: de'i yul ni spyod yul mngon sum du bya ba ni gang bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i yul ni spyod yul mngon sum du bya ba ni gang bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du bya ba ste /
translated: Its object is the domain that is to be actualized, which is to be actualized by oneself.

original: de'i dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa ni rigs pa dang mi rigs pa'i dus shes pa'i sbyor ba ni bsam pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa ni rigs pa dang mi rigs pa'i dus shes pa'i sbyor ba ni bsam pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The knowledge of its timely and untimely moments is the application of knowing the time for what is reasonable and unreasonable. The distinction in intention is the distinction in the object of intention.

original: thabs la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar lam rnam pa bcu la byang ba'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar lam rnam pa bcu la byang ba'o //
translated: Skill in means is being skilled in the ten aspects of the path.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i don gyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i don gyis shes par bya'o //
translated: This is to be known by the meaning of abiding in the path of cultivation.

original: yang thams cad mkhyen pa gsum dang / rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i khyad par ci zhig yin zhe na /üîΩkha cig na re thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas rnam pa'i yul so sor nges pa yin la rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa 'di rnam pa ma lus pa'i yul yin no zhes 'dod do gzhan dag
analyzed: yang thams cad mkhyen pa gsum dang / rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i khyad par ci zhig yin zhe na / kha cig na re thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas rnam pa'i yul so sor nges pa yin la rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa 'di rnam pa ma lus pa'i yul yin no zhes 'dod do gzhan dag
translated: What is the difference between the three knowledges and the knowledge of all aspects?üîΩSome say: The three knowledges are objects with specific aspects, as they have been explained. This knowledge of all aspects is the object of all aspects without exception.

original: ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni mtshan nyid can du rnam par bzhag la rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba can yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni mtshan nyid can du rnam par bzhag la rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba can yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The three knowledges are posited as the characteristics and the knowledge of all aspects is the application.

original: la la ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pas rab tu phye ba yin la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltaüîΩbu ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: la la ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pas rab tu phye ba yin la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de lta bu ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some say: Complete realization of all aspects is distinguished by the antidote to discordant classes, but the three omnisciences are not like that, since they are just the aspect of natural peace.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi gzhung rtogs par dka' ba'i snang ba mdor bshad pa chos kyi grags pas byas pa las skabs bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'i @219b bshad
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi gzhung rtogs par dka' ba'i snang ba mdor bshad pa chos kyi grags pas byas pa las skabs bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'i @219b bshad
translated: This is explained in Haribhadra's brief explanation of the difficult points of AbhisamayƒÅla·πÖkƒÅra commentary on the treatise of advice on the perfection of wisdom, composed by Dharmottara, the commentary on the fourth chapter.

original: pa'o / // / gang du 'bad pa med par dran pa med pa der ni 'bad pas bsam par bya'i gzhan dag tu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'o / // / gang du 'bad pa med par dran pa med pa der ni 'bad pas bsam par bya'i gzhan dag tu ni ma yin te /
translated: Where there is no mindfulness without effort, there one should reflect with effort, but not elsewhere,

original: de ni lhun gyis grub par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni lhun gyis grub par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because that is spontaneously present.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i rim gyis gang du rtsol ba med pa der ni rtsol ba dor bar bya la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i rim gyis gang du rtsol ba med pa der ni rtsol ba dor bar bya la /
translated: In the perfection vehicle, one should give up effort where there is no effort in the stages of meditation such as the generation of the enlightenment mind that is passed down from one to another.

original: gang du de med pa der ni rtsol ba bya'o //
analyzed: gang du de med pa der ni rtsol ba bya'o //
translated: And where there is no such effort, there one should make effort.

original: de ltar skabs rnam pa bzhi'i don bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi'i skye ba med par shes pa dang ldan par bshad pa'i rim gyis bsgom par bya ba'i don du yang de las rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i lam rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan par
analyzed: de ltar skabs rnam pa bzhi'i don bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi'i skye ba med par shes pa dang ldan par bshad pa'i rim gyis bsgom par bya ba'i don du yang de las rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i lam rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan par
translated: Thus, through meditating on the meaning of the four topics, one should meditate in stages as explained, possessing the knowledge of the non-arising of all aspects, paths, and bases.

original: bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the purpose of teaching that,

original: rnam pa kun du mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa kun du mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, ‚Äúfrom the complete and manifest realization of all aspects,‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi skye ba med par shes pa dang ldan pa las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi skye ba med par shes pa dang ldan pa las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and if one possesses the knowledge of the non-arising of all aspects, paths, and bases, what will occur?

original: rab kyi mthar phyin par rtogs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rab kyi mthar phyin par rtogs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The realization of the culmination of the supreme will arise.

original: 'di la rab kyi mthar phyin par rtogs pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la rab kyi mthar phyin par rtogs pa yod pa ste /
translated: Here, there is realization of the culmination of the supreme.

original: rtsol ba dang mi rtsol ba dag gi rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa bsgoms pas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsol ba dang mi rtsol ba dag gi rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa bsgoms pas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the cultivation of the realization of the summit of the supreme, which is both with and without exertion, spontaneous transcendent wisdom arises.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //üîΩrtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa las dang por rtags la sogs pa bshad pa'i rgyu go sla ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o // rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa las dang por rtags la sogs pa bshad pa'i rgyu go sla ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: This is the remainder.üîΩIn the explanation of the signs, etc. of the realization of the summit, it is said that the reason is easy to understand.

original: rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa shin tu goms pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gus pa dang bcas pa la sogs pas bdag med pa'i lam bsgoms pa na nyung zad tsam gyi
analyzed: rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa shin tu goms pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gus pa dang bcas pa la sogs pas bdag med pa'i lam bsgoms pa na nyung zad tsam gyi
translated: The commentary on the verse on the signs, etc. beginning with ‚Äúeven in dreams‚Äù is ‚Äúbecause of thorough familiarity,‚Äù etc. When those who are respectful, etc. cultivate the path of selflessness, they have a little

original: rab kyi mthus gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mthong ba nyid kyis na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs par mthong bar ma zad kyi gzhan du na gnyid kyis nyams pa'i gnas skabs su yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab kyi mthus gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mthong ba nyid kyis na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs par mthong bar ma zad kyi gzhan du na gnyid kyis nyams pa'i gnas skabs su yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the highest power, not only does one see phenomena such as form as dreamlike and illusionlike in the state of being awake, but also in the state of being asleep.

original: de'i rjes la nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du blo rab mchog yod pas lam gzhan snying po med pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba @220a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du blo rab mchog yod pas lam gzhan snying po med pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro // de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba @220a * //
translated: After that, the one who is called a ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., sees the other paths as being without essence because of having the highest, supreme awareness.

original: la sogs pa ni de bzhin du rang gi sems las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa tha mi dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //

original: par du 'phags pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde'i don la slob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par du 'phags pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde'i don la slob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The study is to be taken as before.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du gzung ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du gzung ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All and so on means that there is no longer any thought of grasping and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du bsam pa dri ma med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du bsam pa dri ma med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Buddha and so on means that there is no longer any thought of defilement and so on.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyi'o //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyi'o //
translated: The special state of attaining the peak realization means the spontaneous wisdom of the peak realization.

original: rtags @220b yin no zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas mtshan ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtags @220b yin no zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas mtshan ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: The signs are as follows: The yogin of the peak realization has signs such as grasping and so on.

original: 'dir zhum pa'i sems ni gzung bar bya //
analyzed: 'dir zhum pa'i sems ni gzung bar bya //
translated: Here, a depressed mind is to be grasped.

original: rgod pa yang ni zhi bar bya //
analyzed: rgod pa yang ni zhi bar bya //
translated: And excitement is to be pacified.

original: zhes smos pas bsgom pa thams cad la zhum pa'i sems ni snang ba yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: zhes smos pas bsgom pa thams cad la zhum pa'i sems ni snang ba yid la byed pas so //
translated: Thus, in all meditations, a depressed mind is to be grasped by the attention of illumination.

original: 'dod chags dang rnam par rtog pa dag gis rgod pa la ni go rims bzhin du mi sdug pa dang / dbugs bgrang ba dran pa'i bsam gtan dag gis bzlog par bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang rnam par rtog pa dag gis rgod pa la ni go rims bzhin du mi sdug pa dang / dbugs bgrang ba dran pa'i bsam gtan dag gis bzlog par bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that agitation due to attachment and discursive thought is to be averted, respectively, by the contemplations of the ugly and the mindfulness of breathing.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs par skyes pa'i skye bo rnams ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs par skyes pa'i skye bo rnams ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo ste /
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with ‚Äúthe people of Jambudvipa‚Äù is as follows: The people of Jambudvipa, etc., are those born in Jambudvipa, etc.

original: de rnams ji snyed yod pa grangs de snyed kyi sangs rgyas gang yin pa de rnams la mchod pa ni yid dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ji snyed yod pa grangs de snyed kyi sangs rgyas gang yin pa de rnams la mchod pa ni yid dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The worship of those Buddhas who are as numerous as the number of people in Jambudvipa, etc., is that which generates mental pleasure.

original: dge ba la sogs pa ni bsod nams kyi mchog go /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa ni bsod nams kyi mchog go /
translated: The merit, etc., is the supreme merit.

original: dper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //
analyzed: dper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //
translated: Having taken that as an example,

original: zhes bya ba ni me tog dang spos la sogs pa rnam pa mang po nyid kyis yang dang yang du ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me tog dang spos la sogs pa rnam pa mang po nyid kyis yang dang yang du ste /
translated: means again and again by means of many kinds of flowers, incense, etc.

original: de nyid snga ma snga ma la phyi ma phyi mas phan tshun dper mdzad nas gong nas gong du rnam par 'phel ba'i rim gyis bsod nams 'phel ba'i bdag nyid can bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de nyid snga ma snga ma la phyi ma phyi mas phan tshun dper mdzad nas gong nas gong du rnam par 'phel ba'i rim gyis bsod nams 'phel ba'i bdag nyid can bcu drug yin no //
translated: The latter is mutually exemplified by the former, and the increase of merit is the nature of the sixteen stages of increase.üîΩThe four continents, the sun and moon,

original: gling bzhi pa dang nyi zla dang // ri rab dang ni 'dod lha dang // tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la ni //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang nyi zla dang // ri rab dang ni 'dod lha dang // tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la ni //
translated: Meru, the desire gods, and the world of Brahma

original: stong ni spyi phud yin par 'dod //üîΩde stong la ni stong gnyis pa //üîΩbar ma'i 'jig rten khams yin no //
analyzed: stong ni spyi phud yin par 'dod // de stong la ni stong gnyis pa // bar ma'i 'jig rten khams yin no //
translated: are a chiliocosm.üîΩA thousand of those is a dichiliocosm.

original: de stong la ni stong gsum ste //
analyzed: de stong la ni stong gsum ste //
translated: A thousand of those is a trichiliocosm,

original: mnyam du 'dzin cing 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: mnyam du 'dzin cing 'byung ba yin //
translated: which is simultaneously created and destroyed.

original: zhes 'byung bas de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of this is as follows.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las 'dzam bu'i gling smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pas 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags po dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang /üîΩzla ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa de na sems can gang yin pa de nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de rnams la mchod pa ni rnam par 'phel
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las 'dzam bu'i gling smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pas 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags po dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / zla ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa de na sems can gang yin pa de nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de rnams la mchod pa ni rnam par 'phel
translated: The mention of Jambudvipa in the verse is only an illustration, so Jambudvipa and so on refers to Jambudvipa, P≈´rvavideha, AparagodƒÅnƒ´ya, and Uttarakuru,üîΩand the trichiliocosm together with the moon and so on.

original: ba dang po yin no //üîΩkhyad par du @221a * //
analyzed: ba dang po yin no // khyad par du @221a * //
translated: The worship of those Tathagatas who are equal in number to the sentient beings in that world is the first increase.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'phel ba rnam pa bdun du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'phel ba rnam pa bdun du bshad pa yin te /
translated: The special increase is explained in seven aspects, beginning with

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: the perfection of wisdom, which is threefold.

original: de yid la byed pa ni bsgom pa la sogs pa rten pa'o //
analyzed: de yid la byed pa ni bsgom pa la sogs pa rten pa'o //
translated: The mental attention to it is the support of the meditation and so on.

original: mi skye ba ni chos rnams kyi skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba ni chos rnams kyi skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Non-production is the non-production of things.

original: de la bzod pa ni sred pa ste de thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzod pa ni sred pa ste de thob pa'o //
translated: Patience with respect to that is the attainment of craving.

original: byang chub par bya ba dang byang chub par byed pa'i chos mi dmigs pa ni shes bya la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub par bya ba dang byang chub par byed pa'i chos mi dmigs pa ni shes bya la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the dharma which is to be enlightened and the dharma which enlightens is the non-apprehension of the knower, etc.

original: khyad par can ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dge ba bcu la sogs pa dang // gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bcu ste /
analyzed: khyad par can ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dge ba bcu la sogs pa dang // gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bcu ste /
translated: The special is the ten virtues, etc. which are not in common with the sravakas, etc. and the ten formless attainments.

original: de dag thob pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of those is the special attainment.

original: lha'i ris thams cad du nye bar 'gro ba ni lha la sogs pa bsdus par rtogs par gzhan gyi don gyi phyir 'gro'o //
analyzed: lha'i ris thams cad du nye bar 'gro ba ni lha la sogs pa bsdus par rtogs par gzhan gyi don gyi phyir 'gro'o //
translated: The going to all the classes of gods is the going for the sake of others, understanding the inclusion of gods, etc.

original: bdud thams cad ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud thams cad ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: All demons are Indra, etc.

original: de rnams zil gyis gnon pa ni mngon par shes pas nus pa med par byas pas so //
analyzed: de rnams zil gyis gnon pa ni mngon par shes pas nus pa med par byas pas so //
translated: The subjugation of those is the rendering of them powerless by the superknowledges.

original: ston pa dang 'dra ba'i skye ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: ston pa dang 'dra ba'i skye ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The birth which is like the Teacher is the birth of the bodhisattvas.

original: de dang mtshungs par gnas pa ni bya ba de nyid nyams su len pa'o //
