analyzed: de dang mtshungs par gnas pa ni bya ba de nyid nyams su len pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that way is practicing that very activity.

original: yang bsod nams ni rnam pa brgyad de zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang bsod nams ni rnam pa brgyad de zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: And merit is of eight kinds, as stated below.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: That is stated in all aspects, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad du thabs la mkhas pa ni dang pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thabs la mkhas pa ni dang pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Skill in means in all aspects is by faith, etc.

original: bslab pa yongs su dag pa ni bdag med pas zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'o sangs rgyas kyi rigs can du 'gyur ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa yongs su dag pa ni bdag med pas zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'o sangs rgyas kyi rigs can du 'gyur ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'joms pa'o //
translated: The purity of training is generosity, etc. embraced by selflessness. Becoming a member of the Buddha family is destroying the family of the sravakas, etc.

original: 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyu mtshan ni sems skyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyu mtshan ni sems skyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reason for attaining the result of buddhahood is the generation of the mind, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The perfections are generosity, etc.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna la sogs pa ste de'i sems mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna la sogs pa ste de'i sems mi skyed pa'o //
translated: The mind does not generate their resistances, such as stinginess, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par rtog pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par rtog pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The conception of possession of form, etc. is in regard to eye-consciousness, etc.

original: de rab tu mi skyed pa ni shes bya rang gi sems kyi rnam pa nyid yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rab tu mi skyed pa ni shes bya rang gi sems kyi rnam pa nyid yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-production of that is the seeing of the object of knowledge as only the aspect of one's own mind.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The perfections are generosity, etc.

original: de'i kun bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa re re la sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad khongs su @221b 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i kun bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa re re la sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad khongs su @221b 'dus pa'o //
translated: Their inclusion is the inclusion of all generosity, etc. in each one of generosity, etc.

original: de'i shes pa ni rtogs pa'o phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa dag go //
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni rtogs pa'o phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa dag go //
translated: The knowledge of that is the realization. All perfections are the high status and definite goodness.

original: de thos pa ni rab tu rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de thos pa ni rab tu rnyed pa'o //
translated: The hearing of that is the attainment.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Complete enlightenment is non-dualistic intuition.

original: de dang nye bar gyur pa gzung ba la sogs pa'i lta ba dang bral bas thag nye ba'o //
analyzed: de dang nye bar gyur pa gzung ba la sogs pa'i lta ba dang bral bas thag nye ba'o //
translated: Proximity to that is nearness due to freedom from the views of grasped, etc.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar rnam par 'phel bas rnam par spel ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar rnam par 'phel bas rnam par spel ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is the increase of the increase of merit.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i bsod nams rnam par 'phel ba rnam pa bcu drug mthar phyin pa'i dbang du gyur pa ni mngon sum du gyur pas rtogs pa yin la de nyid ni mthar phyin pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin la
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i bsod nams rnam par 'phel ba rnam pa bcu drug mthar phyin pa'i dbang du gyur pa ni mngon sum du gyur pas rtogs pa yin la de nyid ni mthar phyin pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin la
translated: The culmination of the sixteen aspects of the increase of merit just explained is the realization of the direct realization of the perfection of the increase of merit.

original: / de'i mtshan nyid rnams ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de'i mtshan nyid rnams ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very perfection is the non-conceptual wisdom, and its characteristics are its nature.

original: nges pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po thams cad kyi mthar thug pa rdzogs pa ni sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nges pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po thams cad kyi mthar thug pa rdzogs pa ni sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The certainty is the completion of all three omnisciences. The perfection is stated in the verse beginning with sentient beings.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the verses

original: da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: is from now onward.

original: yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i nus pas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i nus pas so //
translated: The power of skill in means is the ability of faith and so forth.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i bsod nams kyi rim pas rnam par mi rtog pa rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na 'tshang rgya ba nyid ni thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par gzhan gyi don gyi snying rje dang byams pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i bsod nams kyi rim pas rnam par mi rtog pa rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na 'tshang rgya ba nyid ni thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par gzhan gyi don gyi snying rje dang byams pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, at the time of realizing non-conceptuality through the stages of merit explained above, one becomes a Buddha, and one is always, without interruption, compassionate, loving, and so on, for the sake of others.

original: de rnams mngon sum du byed pa'i ngo bo de'i dbang du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams mngon sum du byed pa'i ngo bo de'i dbang du gyur pa ste /
translated: One is governed by the essence of the direct realization of those.

original: des na de'i dbang gis sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par gzhan gyi don gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i dbang gis sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par gzhan gyi don gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the power of that, the characteristic of not abandoning the welfare of sentient beings is the cause of the welfare of others, always, without interruption.

original: ji skad bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bya ba med pa nyid yin na yang bsod nams kyi dbang gis gzhan gyi don las mi ldog pas bdag med pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis byang chub thob na yang bsod nams kyi bya ba
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bya ba med pa nyid yin na yang bsod nams kyi dbang gis gzhan gyi don las mi ldog pas bdag med pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis byang chub thob na yang bsod nams kyi bya ba
translated: As for what was explained, and so on, even though there is no activity, because of the power of merit, one does not turn away from the welfare of others. Therefore, when those who possess the meditation on selflessness attain enlightenment, the activity of merit

original: la 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: la 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: has a result.

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Thus he thinks.

original: de ltar nges pas gtan la phab pa'i zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum bsgrub pas rdzogs par gyur pa ni bstan par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar nges pas gtan la phab pa'i zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum bsgrub pas rdzogs par gyur pa ni bstan par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, by ascertaining the three knowledges, which are to be accomplished, he becomes perfected, and is then taught.

original: de nyid du brtan por 'gyur ba @222a * //
analyzed: de nyid du brtan por 'gyur ba @222a * //
translated: He becomes firm in that,

original: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems kun tu gnas pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems kun tu gnas pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: and his mind is fully present with that nature, not abandoning the nonconceptual mind as previously explained.

original: sems kun tu gnas pa ni gling bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems kun tu gnas pa ni gling bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The full presence of mind is taught by the four continents, etc.

original: gling bzhi pa ni gling bzhi pa dang zla ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa ni gling bzhi pa dang zla ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four continents are the four continents, the moon, etc.

original: de dang ldan pa'i stong dang stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i stong dang stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum ni sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The thousand, the double-thousand, and the triple-thousand worlds are as previously explained.

original: de dag dper mdzad nas ting nge 'dzin gyi bsod nams dang ye shes zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de dag dper mdzad nas ting nge 'dzin gyi bsod nams dang ye shes zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Taking those as examples, the merit and wisdom of concentration are the remainder.

original: de bsod nams mang ba nyid kyis na ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni sems kun tu gnas pa yin no zhes yongs su bsgrags so //üîΩtshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: de bsod nams mang ba nyid kyis na ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni sems kun tu gnas pa yin no zhes yongs su bsgrags so // tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: Because of his great merit, it is well known that his samƒÅdhi is the complete stability of mind.üîΩThe verse summary says:

original: lugs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: lugs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe system‚Äù and so on.

original: srid pa bzung na zhes bya ba ni tshad yod pa srid na dngos po srang tshad kyis gzhal bar nus kyi zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi tshad mas gzhal bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: srid pa bzung na zhes bya ba ni tshad yod pa srid na dngos po srang tshad kyis gzhal bar nus kyi zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi tshad mas gzhal bar mi nus kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIf existence is grasped‚Äù means that if there is a limit, then things can be measured by a scale. In the same way, the limited cannot be measured by the valid cognition of those who see only a part.

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa tshad mar byas nas gzhal zhing yongs su brtags pa yin pa'i phyir sems kun tu gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa'i don yin no zhes 'dir yang shes par bya'o //üîΩde ni gling bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa tshad mar byas nas gzhal zhing yongs su brtags pa yin pa'i phyir sems kun tu gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa'i don yin no zhes 'dir yang shes par bya'o // de ni gling bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: However, it should be understood that the meaning of the complete stability of mind is to be measured and examined by taking omniscience as valid cognition.üîΩThe verse summary says:üîΩ‚ÄúThat is the four-continent world system‚Äù and so on.

original: gling bzhi pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i stong gsum pa ste /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i stong gsum pa ste /
translated: The trichiliocosm is endowed with four continents and so on.

original: stong dang stong gnyis pa dang stong gsum pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: stong dang stong gnyis pa dang stong gsum pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams so //
translated: the worlds of the first chiliocosm, the second dichiliocosm, and the third trichiliocosm.

original: de pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams so /
analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams so /
translated: The perfection of giving and so on are all the perfections.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams so //üîΩde'i ngo bo nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes gang yin pa de so sor re re nas dpe ste cha 'dra bar mdzad nas de dag las khyad par du 'phags shing tshad las 'das pa'i bsod
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni snying rje la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams so // de'i ngo bo nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes gang yin pa de so sor re re nas dpe ste cha 'dra bar mdzad nas de dag las khyad par du 'phags shing tshad las 'das pa'i bsod
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the collections of compassion and so on.üîΩThe merit and wisdom of those who have the nature of infinite concentrations are each individually compared to examples.

original: nams mang po nyid kyis grangs med pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de'i rgyus ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: nams mang po nyid kyis grangs med pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de'i rgyus ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The merit that is superior to those and beyond measure is the cause of the concentration of immeasurable merit.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par bya ba snying rje la sogs pa'i stobs las gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes tshad med @222b pa las yang dag par skyes pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par bya ba snying rje la sogs pa'i stobs las gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes tshad med @222b pa las yang dag par skyes pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye
translated: The characteristic of that is the mind abiding in its own nature.

original: shes brtan pa'i rgyu can sems rtse gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes brtan pa'i rgyu can sems rtse gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The mind that is the cause of stable nonconceptual gnosis, which is born from immeasurable merit and gnosis born from concentration that is born from the power of compassion and so on, which is to be realized by omniscient gnosis, is the one-pointed mind free from all concepts.üîΩThe characteristic of that is the mind abiding in its own nature.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba de'i ngo bo nyid ni sems kun du gnas pas zhes bya bar bshad do /üîΩbshad ma thag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems rgyun gyis 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba de'i ngo bo nyid ni sems kun du gnas pas zhes bya bar bshad do / bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems rgyun gyis 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa yin la /
translated: The mind that is the cause of stable nonconceptual gnosis, which is born from immeasurable merit and gnosis born from concentration that is born from the power of compassion and so on, which is to be realized by omniscient gnosis, is the one-pointed mind free from all concepts.üîΩThe mind that is the cause of stable nonconceptual gnosis, which is born from immeasurable merit and gnosis born from concentration that is born from the power of compassion and so on, which is to be realized by omniscient gnosis, is the one-pointed mind free from all concepts.üîΩThe mind that is the cause of stable nonconceptual gnosis, which is born from immeasurable merit and gnosis born from concentration that is born from the power of compassion and so on, which is to be realized by omniscient gnosis, is the one-pointed mind free from all concepts.üîΩThe mind that is the cause of stable nonconceptual gnosis, which is born from immeasurable merit and gnosis born from concentration that is born from the power of compassion and so on, which is to be realized by omniscient gnosis, is the one-pointed mind free from all concepts.üîΩThe mind that is the cause of stable nonconceptual gnosis, which is born from immeasurable merit and gnosis born from concentration that is born from the power of compassion and so on, which is to be realized by omniscient gnosis, is the one-pointed mind free from all concepts.üîΩThe mind that is the cause of stable nonconceptual gnosis, which is born from immeasurable merit and gnosis born from concentration that is born from the power of compassion and so on, which is to be realized by omniscient gnosis, is the one-pointed mind free from all concepts.

original: gzhan dag tu ni 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'tshe ba med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i don yin pa nyid dang / de'i phyogs su ltung bar bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'tshe ba med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i don yin pa nyid dang / de'i phyogs su ltung bar bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The mind that is the cause of stable nonconceptual gnosis, which is born from immeasurable merit and gnosis born from concentration that is born from the power of compassion and so on, which is to be realized by omniscient gnosis, is the one-pointed mind free from all concepts.üîΩThe mind that is

original: gzhan du na smon lam gyi dbang du byas pa'i sems ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pas ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na smon lam gyi dbang du byas pa'i sems ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pas ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Otherwise, the mind that is the object of the vow would not be stopped by afflictions and so on.üîΩThis is the intention.

original: de yang tshad ma rnam 'grel mdzad pas /
analyzed: de yang tshad ma rnam 'grel mdzad pas /
translated: Also, the author of the Pramanavarttika explains:

original: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //üîΩngo bo nyid la phyin log gis //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don // ngo bo nyid la phyin log gis //
translated: Nonviolence and the correct objectüîΩare not stopped by the error

original: 'bad du zin kyang mi zlog ste //
analyzed: 'bad du zin kyang mi zlog ste //
translated: of intrinsic reality, even if one tries,

original: blo ni de'i phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: blo ni de'i phyogs 'dzin phyir ro // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: because the mind grasps that side.

original: rtags dang rnam par 'phel ba dang / nges pa dang sems kun du gnas pa ni 'dir dro ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin par bshad la /
analyzed: rtags dang rnam par 'phel ba dang / nges pa dang sems kun du gnas pa ni 'dir dro ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin par bshad la /
translated: Here, the nature of heat and so on is explained as the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de ni rtags la sogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtags la sogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚Äúthe signs and so on.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'jug pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'jug pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the lines ‚Äúengagement and so on‚Äù is explained by the words ‚Äúengagement and so on.‚Äù

original: go rims bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin te ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin te ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The engagement in the nature of non-apprehension, in order, is the Dharma of the bodhisattva, because of the nature, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ldog pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ldog pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos yin te /
translated: The cessation of the nature of apprehension is the Dharma of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc.

original: srid pa dang zhi bar ltung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi bar ltung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of falling into existence and peace.

original: de ni len pa dang dor ba'i sgo nas bzung ba ste /
analyzed: de ni len pa dang dor ba'i sgo nas bzung ba ste /
translated: That is grasped by way of taking up and rejecting.

original: dmigs par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dag go //
translated: The objects of apprehension are the objects of the conceptualization of apprehension.

original: de ltar na gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa kho na bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa kho na bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: Thus, it is the conceptualization of apprehension that is grasped.

original: de ni dngos po dang ma 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid kyis zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni dngos po dang ma 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid kyis zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: That is said to be engagement without connection to a thing,

original: spyi'i yul yin pa nyid kyis mdo sde pa la sogs pas sbyar ba'i sha za snyam pa la sogs pa phyi'i yul dang 'brel ba nyid ni mi 'thad pa yin pas so //
analyzed: spyi'i yul yin pa nyid kyis mdo sde pa la sogs pas sbyar ba'i sha za snyam pa la sogs pa phyi'i yul dang 'brel ba nyid ni mi 'thad pa yin pas so //
translated: because it is not tenable that the object of the conceptualization of apprehension is connected to an external object, such as a ghost, as it is applied by SautrƒÅntika and so on, because it is an object of a generality.

original: de nyid kyis na phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir te //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir te //
translated: And because it is an appearance that is erroneous.

original: phyi'i tshul gyis spyi'i ngo bo la sogs @223a * //üîΩpa'i rang bzhin gyi rang gi rnam par 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir brdzun par shes pa yin pas yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag ste /
analyzed: phyi'i tshul gyis spyi'i ngo bo la sogs @223a * // pa'i rang bzhin gyi rang gi rnam par 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir brdzun par shes pa yin pas yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag ste /
translated: Because they apprehend the nature of a universal, etc.,üîΩin terms of the external mode, they are known to be false. Therefore, they are not the nature of the object as it is.

original: brdzun pa'i yul gyi bdag nyid can dag gi yul gyi dbye bas rnam par brtags pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa ni yul sna tshogs pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i yul gyi bdag nyid can dag gi yul gyi dbye bas rnam par brtags pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa ni yul sna tshogs pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the object as it is is the various natures, etc., which are differentiated by the division of the object, and which have an object that is false.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srid pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par nyon mongs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srid pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par nyon mongs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they afflict, i.e., afflict with regard to the continuation of one existence after another.

original: sems can rdzas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni so so'i skye bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: sems can rdzas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni so so'i skye bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel te /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚ÄúThe substance of sentient beings‚Äù is commented upon by the verse beginning with ‚ÄúThe ordinary man.‚Äù

original: go rims bzhin du so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i skyes bu rdzas dang btags par yod pa de dag ni yang dag pa dang tha snyad nyid du btags pa yin la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i skyes bu rdzas dang btags par yod pa de dag ni yang dag pa dang tha snyad nyid du btags pa yin la /
translated: Ordinary beings, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and so on are imputed to be substantially and nominally existent persons, respectively.

original: de'i rten can ni de la gnas pa'i 'dzin pa dag ste /
analyzed: de'i rten can ni de la gnas pa'i 'dzin pa dag ste /
translated: Their bases are the apprehensions that abide in them.

original: de ltar na 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag ni rnam par rtog pa nyid 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag ni rnam par rtog pa nyid 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus the phrase ‚Äúthe conceptual thoughts that apprehend‚Äù means that conceptual thoughts themselves are the apprehender.

original: de ni gang gi tshe de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen those‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: skyes bu de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gyur cing dmigs par gtogs pa'i gzung ba'i don dag ste /
analyzed: skyes bu de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gyur cing dmigs par gtogs pa'i gzung ba'i don dag ste /
translated: The objects that are the objects of those persons, the apprehended objects that are included within the observed objects,

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i yul dag ji ltar de dag gis yongs su btags pa de bzhin du gang gi tshe gzung ba'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i yul dag ji ltar de dag gis yongs su btags pa de bzhin du gang gi tshe gzung ba'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin te /
translated: are not existent in the manner in which they are imputed by those persons, as will be explained below.

original: gang gi phyir phyi'i gzung ba nyid 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na de dag 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i rgyu des na de'i tshe gang gi 'dzin par 'dod ces snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi'i gzung ba nyid 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na de dag 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i rgyu des na de'i tshe gang gi 'dzin par 'dod ces snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Because of the reason that external objects are not tenable as the apprehender due to being the cause of the apprehension of form and so on, at that time, what is it that is asserted to be the apprehender?

original: de ltar phyi'i gzung ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa nyid mi 'thad pas 'dzin pa'i ngo bos skyes bu rdzas su yod pa dang btags par yod pa dag gis dben zhing med pa'i ngo bo yin pas phyin ci log tu zhes bya ba la sogsüîΩpa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i gzung ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa nyid mi 'thad pas 'dzin pa'i ngo bos skyes bu rdzas su yod pa dang btags par yod pa dag gis dben zhing med pa'i ngo bo yin pas phyin ci log tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Since the character of being the effect of external objects is untenable as the character of being the apprehender, the phrase ‚Äúdue to being erroneous‚Äù and so on is stated because the nature of the person is devoid of substantial existence and imputed existence.

original: snga ma bzhin du yul gyi dbye bas zhes bya ba dmigs pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyis na ji ltar gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i srid pa dang zhi bar ltung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du yul gyi dbye bas zhes bya ba dmigs pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyis na ji ltar gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i srid pa dang zhi bar ltung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As before, due to the classification of objects, since the object is of various types, it is the case that, as imputed by others, one falls into either existence or peace.

original: gegs byed pa yin pas ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi sgrib pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gegs byed pa yin pas ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi sgrib pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since it is an obstruction, it is the obscuration of correct wisdom.

original: re zhig gnyis su med pa'i tshul la lta smos @223b kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: re zhig gnyis su med pa'i tshul la lta smos @223b kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention the way of nonduality?

original: phyi rol smra ba'i tshul la yang //
analyzed: phyi rol smra ba'i tshul la yang //
translated: Even in the way of the externalists,

original: tha dad dus su bzung ba na //
analyzed: tha dad dus su bzung ba na //
translated: when the object is apprehended at a different time,üîΩhow could it be?

original: ji ltar yin snyam rigs shes pas //üîΩshes pa'i rnam pa gtong nus pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar yin snyam rigs shes pas // shes pa'i rnam pa gtong nus pa'i //
translated: The rational mind

original: rgyu nyid yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin par shes par bya //
translated: should understand that the cause is the ability to give up the aspect of consciousness.

original: zhes smos pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: zhes smos pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'thad pas /
translated: Thus, since the nature of object and apprehender is not tenable,

original: bshad ma thag pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: the object and apprehender that have just been explained do not exist because they are imputed.

original: ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni dben pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni dben pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The first verse of the conception of the object that begins with ‚Äúown nature‚Äù is explained by ‚Äúbecause of being isolated‚Äù and so on.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba gzung ba nyid la sogs pas stong par gzugs la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba gzung ba nyid la sogs pas stong par gzugs la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The isolated is the nature of form, etc., which is not the object of the eye consciousness, etc., because it is empty of the apprehended, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na dben pas zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa stong ba'i tshul gyis na /üîΩde la skyon med pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na dben pas zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa stong ba'i tshul gyis na / de la skyon med pa nyid kyis te /
translated: Why? Because of isolation means by the method of the emptiness of the apprehended, etc.üîΩIt is faultless because it is the path to perfect enlightenment.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin pa nyid kyis na nyon mongs pa med pa nyid yin pas de nyid kyi phyir gzung bar bya ba nyid yin zhing blang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin pa nyid kyis na nyon mongs pa med pa nyid yin pas de nyid kyi phyir gzung bar bya ba nyid yin zhing blang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is without afflictions because it is the path to perfect enlightenment. Therefore, it is to be apprehended and to be taken up because it is the object to be engaged.

original: sa mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin du mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The immovable stage, etc., are the stages of the immovable, etc. Because of being ascertained in the lineage of the buddhas means because of being ascertained in the lineage of the buddhas.

original: sa bdun pa'i bar du rigs pa ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i bar du rigs pa ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because up to the seventh stage, the lineage is not ascertained.

original: sgyu ma lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the statement, ‚Äúlike an illusion,‚Äù etc., here, there is no attainment of the path of vision, etc., because of the possession of an objective support.

original: snang brnyan tsam du zad pas zhes bya ba rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pas 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i shes pa dmigs par bya ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa de la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snang brnyan tsam du zad pas zhes bya ba rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pas 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i shes pa dmigs par bya ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa de la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since it is merely a reflection, i.e., since it is merely representation-only, the non-erroneous consciousness is the non-dual consciousness. The objective support, etc. refers to the objective support of that.

original: yon tan dang skyon ni srid pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon ni srid pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The virtues and faults are characterized by the cessation and engagement in the succession of existences.

original: de mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba'i gang blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba'i gang blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The antidote and the counteragent are due to the fact that one should adopt and reject, respectively, that which is preceded by the vision of that.

original: dri ma thams cad ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi lam gyi gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog @224a * //üîΩpa rnams ni nyes pa thams cad de /
analyzed: dri ma thams cad ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi lam gyi gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog @224a * // pa rnams ni nyes pa thams cad de /
translated: of the three paths to omniscience.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams so //
translated: All faults are the faults of the afflictions, etc.

original: de dang bral ba nyid kyis rang gi rtogs pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba nyid kyis rang gi rtogs pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'o //
translated: By being free from them, one attains the enlightenment of perfect realization.

original: sngar bshad pa'i dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dman pa nyid yin pa dang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dman zhing gya nom pa ma yin pa nyid yin la des nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa ni sngar bshad pa'i sa brgyad yin la de
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dman pa nyid yin pa dang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dman zhing gya nom pa ma yin pa nyid yin la des nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa ni sngar bshad pa'i sa brgyad yin la de
translated: The inferior and not sublime states are the inferior states of the sravakas and so on, which are inferior because they are inferior to the bodhisattva states and because they are associated with the apprehension of signs, as previously explained.

original: rnams thag bsring bar byed pa ni spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams thag bsring bar byed pa ni spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are distant because they are to be abandoned.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba dang mthun par sprul pa ni gdul bya'i dbang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i tshul du ston pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba dang mthun par sprul pa ni gdul bya'i dbang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i tshul du ston pa ste /
translated: In accordance with their aspirations, they emanate in accordance with the dispositions of those to be trained, displaying the ways of the sravakas and so on.

original: des sems can gyi don gyi las te /
analyzed: des sems can gyi don gyi las te /
translated: By that, they perform the deeds that benefit sentient beings.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba bsgrub pa'i las rnams so //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba bsgrub pa'i las rnams so //
translated: The activities are those of accomplishing the definite goodness and high status of the disciples.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates an inclusive sense.

original: yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i dad pa la sogs pas skye bo thams cad sngar bshad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de la dgod pa'i bya ba nyid 'bras bu yin te de la'o
analyzed: yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i dad pa la sogs pas skye bo thams cad sngar bshad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de la dgod pa'i bya ba nyid 'bras bu yin te de la'o
translated: The power of skill in means is the activity of establishing all beings in that nirvana previously explained through faith, etc., which are focused on the Buddha, etc.

original: // ngo bo nyid la sogs pa ni skyon med pa nyid kyis de bshad pa nyid ni gsal ba yin pas logs shig tu ma bshad do //
analyzed: // ngo bo nyid la sogs pa ni skyon med pa nyid kyis de bshad pa nyid ni gsal ba yin pas logs shig tu ma bshad do //
translated: The essence, etc., are not explained separately because they are clear in the explanation of the power of skill in means.

original: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can ni 'jug pa'i yul la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can ni 'jug pa'i yul la gnas pa'o //
translated: The support of the side of engagement is the support of the object of engagement.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bsam gtan gyi khyad par gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bsam gtan gyi khyad par gang yin pa ste /
translated: The stage of preparation of the path of seeing is the special meditative stabilization of the path of seeing.

original: des spang bar bya bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des spang bar bya bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object to be abandoned by that, etc., are as was previously explained.

original: srid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: srid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the verse that stops the conception of the apprehended is:

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /üîΩ'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi nang nas gang yang rung ba gcig tu lhung ba nyid kyis ltung ba de ni nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin zhing rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i nyes pa nyid
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi nang nas gang yang rung ba gcig tu lhung ba nyid kyis ltung ba de ni nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin zhing rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i nyes pa nyid
translated: ‚ÄúSamsara‚Äù and so on.üîΩBecause of falling into either samsara or nirvana, that fall is associated with a reference point because it is associated with faults.

original: kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin zhing spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa nyid kyis na ldog par bya'o zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin zhing spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa nyid kyis na ldog par bya'o zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Because of the fault of the views of eternalism and nihilism, it is not to be apprehended. Because it is associated with the reference point of what is to be abandoned, it is to be stopped.üîΩThis is applied to the following.

original: de ltar na rtogs pa dman pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rtogs pa dman pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Thus it is applied to ‚Äúinferior realization‚Äù and so on.

original: kun tu @224b 'gro ba'i bdag nyid med pas stong pa'i phyir dman pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu @224b 'gro ba'i bdag nyid med pas stong pa'i phyir dman pa ste /
translated: It is inferior because it is empty of the nature of being all-pervading.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de la'o //
translated: By the incompleteness of the cause, the cause of the realization of the fruits of stream-entry, etc.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rgyus thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rgyus thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: By the cause of the spiritual teacher, skill in means.

original: sems mi 'gong ba la sogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa ste de dang bral ba nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sems mi 'gong ba la sogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa ste de dang bral ba nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ste /
translated: By the absence of the knowledge of non-discouragement, etc., there is the absence of grasping.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pas bdag gis byas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pas bdag gis byas pa med pa'o //
translated: By the absence of the spiritual teacher, there is the absence of the performance of duties.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag ni yul la sogs pas chod pa'i gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag ni yul la sogs pas chod pa'i gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the absence of the antidote to the obscurations to omniscience, there is the absence of the destruction of the objects to be abandoned.

original: de rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis 'joms par mi nus pa nyid yin zhing /üîΩsgrub pa'i lam ma tshang ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis 'joms par mi nus pa nyid yin zhing / sgrub pa'i lam ma tshang ba ste /
translated: By the absence of the power to destroy, there is the absence of the path of cultivation.

original: ye shes kyi thabs kyis spong ba nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi thabs kyis spong ba nyid do //
translated: By the absence of the means of knowledge, there is the absence of the abandonment by means of the path of cultivation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gdams ngag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba rang nyid rtogs pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos gcig la gcig gi gdams ngag las skyes pa'i ye shes yod pa nyid
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gdams ngag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba rang nyid rtogs pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos gcig la gcig gi gdams ngag las skyes pa'i ye shes yod pa nyid
translated: Because they are dependent on the instructions of the Tathagata and so on, they are not self-realized. Therefore, they are born from the wisdom of the instructions of the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and Sravakas, one to another.

original: kyis na gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba nyid de /
analyzed: kyis na gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba nyid de /
translated: Because of this, they are guided by the conditions of others.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i mkhyen pas khrid pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i mkhyen pas khrid pa nyid do //
translated: They are led by the knowledge of the Buddhas and so on.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi chen po nyid la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi chen po nyid la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa ste /
translated: The supremacy of all sentient beings, their greatness, and so on, have been explained above.

original: de la mi 'jug pa nyid kyis na de med pa yin pas ched du bya ba las log pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mi 'jug pa nyid kyis na de med pa yin pas ched du bya ba las log pa yin te /
translated: Because they do not engage in that, they do not have it, and so they turn away from their aim.

original: ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum med pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum med pa'o //
translated: They do not have the three kinds of aims.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa'i bag chags yod pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'ba' zhig gi gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis na nyi tshe ba zhes bya ba phyogs gcig pa'i lam gyi byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa'i bag chags yod pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'ba' zhig gi gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis na nyi tshe ba zhes bya ba phyogs gcig pa'i lam gyi byed pa ste /
translated: It is the function of the path that is partial.

original: bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa'i byed pa gang yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa'i byed pa gang yin pa de la'o //
translated: It is the function of the aspects of the four truths.

original: de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa yod pas /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa yod pas /
translated: Since it has the apprehension of the apprehended and so on,

original: 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: it is the realization of the first result and so on.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob pa de ni tha dad nyid kyis dbye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob pa de ni tha dad nyid kyis dbye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the result of stream entry and so on is the classification of the different results.

original: ma rig pa'i bag la nyal thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi bag chags te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag la nyal thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi bag chags te /
translated: All the latent tendencies of ignorance are the latent tendencies of all conceptions.

original: de rnams ma spangs pa nyid kyis na gnas pa dang 'gro ba mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams ma spangs pa nyid kyis na gnas pa dang 'gro ba mi shes pa ste /
translated: Since they are not abandoned, one does not know the abodes and destinies.

original: gdul bya'i yul du 'gro ba mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i yul du 'gro ba mi shes pa'o //
translated: One does not know the abodes and destinies of the objects to be tamed.

original: theg pa chen po thams cad sdud @225a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad sdud @225a * //
translated: It includes all of the Great Vehicle.

original: par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa gsum pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de'i 'og tu gang 'jug tu 'gro zhing rjes su 'brang ba de la drang ba'i lam med pas yon po'i lam
analyzed: par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de / thams cad mkhyen pa gsum pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de'i 'og tu gang 'jug tu 'gro zhing rjes su 'brang ba de la drang ba'i lam med pas yon po'i lam
translated: Since it is the cause of the knowledge of all aspects, it is the path of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩSince it is the third knowledge of all, it is the nirvana of all buddhas and so on.üîΩSince there is no path of the straight

original: gyis 'gro ba ni 'dir nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gyis 'gro ba ni 'dir nyes pa yin no //
translated: way for one who goes and follows after that nirvana, the fault here is that one goes by the crooked way.

original: 'di dag la yang dang ni bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag la yang dang ni bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúand‚Äù is inclusive.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyan thos la sogs pa las ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i gnas skabs go bzlog pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyan thos la sogs pa las ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i gnas skabs go bzlog pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs reversal of the situation of turning away from the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on and engaging in it is stated in the line ‚ÄúThe conception of apprehended objects,‚Äù and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The mind and mental factors of the path of seeing are consciousness, feeling, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi 'jug pa'i gnas skabs ni gzung ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin pas rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i khyad par des spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'jug pa'i gnas skabs ni gzung ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin pas rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i khyad par des spang bar bya'o //
translated: The occasion of their engagement is just the opposite of the apprehended object, etc. Therefore, it should be abandoned by the distinction of its occurrence in a continuum.

original: 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyes bu rdzas su yod pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyes bu rdzas su yod pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the verses on the substantial existence of the person begins with ‚Äúgrasping‚Äù and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /üîΩsgyu ma bzhin du ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / sgyu ma bzhin du ste /
translated: The conventional is said to be like a magical creation.üîΩThe conventional is like a magical creation.

original: sgyu ma dang 'dra bar kun rdzob tu dbye ba'i tha snyad kyis /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang 'dra bar kun rdzob tu dbye ba'i tha snyad kyis /
translated: By the conventional distinction,

original: 'dzin pa dang thar pa ste gzugs la sogs pa len pa dang 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang thar pa ste gzugs la sogs pa len pa dang 'dor ba'o //
translated: grasping and liberation are the taking up and laying down of form, etc.

original: yang dag pa nyid du dbye ba med pa'i blos yid la mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du dbye ba med pa'i blos yid la mi byed pa ste /
translated: The mind that is without distinction in reality is not mentally engaged.

original: yul med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa 'jog pa'i sems kyis yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa 'jog pa'i sems kyis yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The mind that is without distinction is mentally engaged by the mind that is placed in nonduality because of the absence of an object.

original: chos nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i sems chos nyid kyis te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i sems chos nyid kyis te /
translated: By the reality of the mind that is the object of form, etc.

original: gnyis su med pas khams gsum car dang nye bar 'brel pa zhes bya ba rnal 'byor pa'i lta bas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams gcig tu dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pas khams gsum car dang nye bar 'brel pa zhes bya ba rnal 'byor pa'i lta bas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams gcig tu dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since it is non-dual, it is called connected with all three realms - the yogin's view observes the desire, form, and formless realms as one.

original: stong pa nyid du dmigs pa ni gnas la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du dmigs pa ni gnas la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: Observing emptiness is the absence of attachment to abodes.

original: des gnas pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: des gnas pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that is abiding in form, etc.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la ma chags pas so //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la ma chags pas so //
translated: Attachment to things is attachment to form, etc.

original: thams cad la mngon par zhen pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la kun tu chags pa la'o //
analyzed: thams cad la mngon par zhen pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la kun tu chags pa la'o //
translated: Attachment to everything is attachment to form, etc.

original: rdzas su yod pa @225b med pas zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa @225b med pas zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it does not exist substantially, it does not exist ultimately.

original: chos thams cad btags pa ni kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa'i tha snyad du'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad btags pa ni kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa'i tha snyad du'o //
translated: All phenomena are imputed as form, etc. conventionally.

original: de kho na nyid shes pa'i chags pas zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la mngon par ma chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes pa'i chags pas zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la mngon par ma chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment to the knowledge of reality means non-attachment to the non-dual wisdom that is like an illusion.

original: mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa med pas gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa med pas gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment preceded by clinging is attachment to form, etc. without clinging.

original: mnyam pa nyid du bsgom pa ni de kho na nyid du na gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa gcig par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du bsgom pa ni de kho na nyid du na gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa gcig par bsgom pa'o //
translated: Meditation on sameness is meditation on form, etc. as one in reality.

original: de nyid ni gzung ba la sogs pa bye brag gi blo 'joms par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni gzung ba la sogs pa bye brag gi blo 'joms par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyen po ste /
translated: That itself is the antidote because it destroys the cognition of distinctions such as apprehended object, etc.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa gsum gyi lam ni gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa gsum gyi lam ni gnyen po yin no //
translated: Therefore, the path of the three omnisciences is the antidote.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par mi shes pa nyid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba thogs pa la zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam gyi bdag nyid can yin pa de'i tsheüîΩdngos po la sogs par mi dmigs par gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo yin par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i shes pa ni mi 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par mi shes pa nyid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba thogs pa la zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam gyi bdag nyid can yin pa de'i tshe dngos po la sogs par mi dmigs par gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo yin par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i shes pa ni mi 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Because of not knowing the perfection of wisdom, one is obstructed in going wherever one wishes.üîΩWhen the perfection of wisdom has the nature of a path, then, because one does not realize that it has the nature of nondual wisdom, which does not objectify things and so forth, one does not engage in the cognition that does not objectify form and so forth wherever one wishes.

original: yang gang gi tshe 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can yin pa de'i tshe gnyis su med pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byas pa yin pas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du thams cad du 'gro ba la thogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can yin pa de'i tshe gnyis su med pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byas pa yin pas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du thams cad du 'gro ba la thogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: But when it has the nature of a result, then, because one has actualized nondual wisdom, one is unobstructed in going wherever one wishes.

original: dang zhes bya ba rnams ni bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba rnams ni bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so forth‚Äù include the others.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de snga ma bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyi bsam gtan gyi khyad par gyis spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de snga ma bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyi bsam gtan gyi khyad par gyis spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no
translated: The conception of apprehending that was just explained is to be abandoned by the special meditative stabilization of the path of seeing, as before. This is the meaning of the passage beginning with ‚Äúultimate reality.‚Äù

original: // don dam pa'i dngos po ni skyes bu rdzas su yod pa ste /
analyzed: // don dam pa'i dngos po ni skyes bu rdzas su yod pa ste /
translated: The ultimate reality is the substantially existent person.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The conception of apprehending that is the conception of apprehending the ultimate reality.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.

original: ched bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes bu btags par yod pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /üîΩnyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /üîΩnyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i @226a * //
analyzed: ched bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes bu btags par yod pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni / nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i @226a * //
translated: The conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.

original: dbang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam nyid yin pa'i phyir ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: dbang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam nyid yin pa'i phyir ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
translated: The conception of apprehending the nominal is the conception of apprehending the imputedly existent person.üîΩThe conception of appre

original: ched du bya ba 'byung ba las ma 'das pas so //
analyzed: ched du bya ba 'byung ba las ma 'das pas so //
translated: because it does not transcend the elements that are its objects.

original: nges par mi 'byung ba ni chen po nyid gsum ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: nges par mi 'byung ba ni chen po nyid gsum ma thob pa'o //
translated: The non-ascertainment of the path is the non-attainment of the three greatnesses.

original: lam thams cad las yongs su rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lam thams cad las yongs su rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conquer all paths,üîΩone should take up the three omnisciences.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum bdag gir byas pa las rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i lam med pas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum bdag gir byas pa las rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i lam med pas /
translated: Since one does not have the path that one desires,

original: zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyis nges pa'i lam med pas lam gzhan la lam ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyis nges pa'i lam med pas lam gzhan la lam ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: one should ascertain that the other path is not the path.

original: mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa gsum las tha dad pa'i lam la lam ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa gsum las tha dad pa'i lam la lam ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One should ascertain that the path which is different from the three omnisciences, which have non-apprehension as their object, is only not the path.üîΩThe cause and effect are the conventional nature.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rdzob kyi ngo bos zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pas skye ba dang 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rdzob kyi ngo bos zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pas skye ba dang 'gag pa ste /
translated: Since cause and effect exist conventionally, there is arising and cessation.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'o //
translated: Arising and cessation are birth and death.

original: bar chad med pa dang cig shos su snang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba don dam pa nyid dang kun rdzob tu dbye ba med par rtogs pas dngos po mtha' dag ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang cig shos su snang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba don dam pa nyid dang kun rdzob tu dbye ba med par rtogs pas dngos po mtha' dag ste /
translated: Since it is perceived as uninterrupted and as the other, by realizing the absence of distinction between the ultimate and the superficial, one is endowed with all things.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la ldan pa ste /
translated: Since one is endowed with all things, forms, etc.,

original: dbye ba med par rtogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dbye ba med par rtogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: one is not endowed with the distinction,üîΩthat is, one is not endowed with the distinction which is the cognition of the absence of difference.

original: dbye ba gang yin pa de la tha dad pa med par shes pa sngon du 'gro bas dbye ba shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbye ba gang yin pa de la tha dad pa med par shes pa sngon du 'gro bas dbye ba shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cognition of the distinction is the cognition which precedes the absence of difference.

original: nam mkha' la gnas pa'i bya dang 'dra ba nyid kyis na rten med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas la gzugs la sogs pa gnas med par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas pa'i bya dang 'dra ba nyid kyis na rten med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas la gzugs la sogs pa gnas med par gnas pa'o //
translated: Since it is like a bird in the sky, it is without support, and form, etc., are without support in the support of form, etc.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba sangs rgyas la sogs pa las byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag la sogs pa yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba sangs rgyas la sogs pa las byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag la sogs pa yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'jig pa yin te /
translated: By the door of generating the Thought of Enlightenment, etc. means that by the power of generating the Thought of Enlightenment from the Buddhas, etc. and of taking the precepts, etc. , the lineage of the Sravakas, etc. is destroyed,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: de bzhin nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos med pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos med pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa med de /
translated: There is no desire because there is no form, etc. that is superior to emptiness, i.e. to voidness,

original: 'dod pa'i yul mi dmigs pas 'dod pas 'dod pa med pa'o //üîΩdon dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yul mi dmigs pas 'dod pas 'dod pa med pa'o // don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
translated: and because the object of desire is not perceived.üîΩIt is without cause, because it is based on the ultimate truth,

original: de kho na nyid mthong bas rgyu med pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong bas rgyu med pa ste /
translated: and because it sees reality.

original: yang dag pa'i nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med @226b pa'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa'i nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med @226b pa'o ;
translated: It is without appropriation and without a co-existent cause.

original: / ser sna shin tu goms par byas pa'i chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gtong ba med pa la goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / ser sna shin tu goms par byas pa'i chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gtong ba med pa la goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase due to the nature of having thoroughly cultivated stinginess means that [the bodhisattva] is accustomed to not giving.

original: bdud la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba'i dngos po dmigs pa ni rdzas gcig la mngon par 'dod pa'i mi dang bdud dang dgra bo la sogs pa'i yul du 'dzin pa'i shes pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba'i dngos po dmigs pa ni rdzas gcig la mngon par 'dod pa'i mi dang bdud dang dgra bo la sogs pa'i yul du 'dzin pa'i shes pa yod pa'o //
translated: The observation of the entities of adversaries such as Mara is the existence of consciousness that apprehends an object such as a human, Mara, or an enemy who is desired in one substance.

original: dang gi sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word and is as before.

original: btags pa'i dngos po skyes bu yod par btags pa'o //
analyzed: btags pa'i dngos po skyes bu yod par btags pa'o //
translated: The imputed entity is the imputation of the existence of a person.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis de la mngon par chags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis de la mngon par chags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Attachment to that and so on refers to the attachment to that [imputation].

original: gnyen po ma bstan du zin kyang 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs smos pas shugs kyis 'phangs par lta'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyen po ma bstan du zin kyang 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs smos pas shugs kyis 'phangs par lta'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Even though the antidote is not taught, since the opposing factor is mentioned here, it is implicitly indicated. This is stated by Thus... and so on.

original: rnam rtog 'di dag rang nyid ni //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'di dag rang nyid ni //
translated: These conceptualizations are realized

original: ma rig ngo bo nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: ma rig ngo bo nyid du rtogs //
translated: to be the nature of ignorance itself.

original: gang phyir rang gi rnam pa ni //
analyzed: gang phyir rang gi rnam pa ni //
translated: Because its aspectüîΩis engaged in superimposing an external entity.

original: phyi'i ngo bor sgro btags 'jug / ces smos pas ma rig pa dang bral ba'i byang chub pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya'o zhes spang bar bya ba nyid du sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i ngo bor sgro btags 'jug / ces smos pas ma rig pa dang bral ba'i byang chub pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya'o zhes spang bar bya ba nyid du sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the context of enlightenment, which is free from ignorance, all conceptualization is ignorance, and so it is to be abandoned. This is what was explained above.

original: 'dir gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa ni mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa ni mu bzhi ste /
translated: Here, there are four possibilities for the conceptualization of the apprehended but not the conceptualization of the apprehender.

original: de la mu dang po ni gang gzung ba'i rnam pa'i yul rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la mu dang po ni gang gzung ba'i rnam pa'i yul rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is the conceptual consciousness that has as its object the aspect of the apprehended.

original: gnyis pa ni skad cig ma gcig pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skad cig ma gcig pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The second is the aspect of the apprehender that is a single moment.

original: gsum pa ni de nyid kyis skad cig ma gzhan no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de nyid kyis skad cig ma gzhan no //
translated: The third is the other moment of that.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the perfection of wisdom that is free from those aspects.

original: rigs nyid yin la rigs kyi rnam par rtog par gyur pa ma yin par zhes bya ba phyi ma stong par byed pa ni re zhig rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pas rigs kyang de nyid yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs nyid yin la rigs kyi rnam par rtog par gyur pa ma yin par zhes bya ba phyi ma stong par byed pa ni re zhig rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pas rigs kyang de nyid yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the lineage itself, but it is not a conceptualization of the lineage‚Äù indicates the latter emptiness.

original: gnyen po yang dag par sgrub pa'i dus kyi rigs so //
analyzed: gnyen po yang dag par sgrub pa'i dus kyi rigs so //
translated: The conceptualization of the lineage is the lineage at the time of the practice of the antidote.

original: rigs nyid yin la rigs kyi rnam par rtog pas gyur pa ma yin pa ni /üîΩ'di lta ste yang dag par sgrub par gyur pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: rigs nyid yin la rigs kyi rnam par rtog pas gyur pa ma yin pa ni / 'di lta ste yang dag par sgrub par gyur pa'i rigs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the lineage itself, but it is not a conceptualization of the lineage‚Äù indicates the lineage at the time of the practice of the antidote.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is a conceptualization of the practice, but it is not a conceptualization of the object‚Äù indicates the former emptiness.üîΩThe conceptualization of the practice is the object of the conceptualization of the practice.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog par gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma ston par byed pa ni re zhig yang dag par sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de nyid dmigs pa'iüîΩrnam par rtog pa yang yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog par gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma ston par byed pa ni re zhig yang dag par sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de nyid dmigs pa'iüîΩrnam par rtog pa yang yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is a conceptualization of the practice, but it is not a conceptualization of the object‚Äù indicates the object of the conceptualization of the practice.

original: @227a * // yang dag par sgrub par gyur pa'i yang dag pa'i dmigs pa la rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: @227a * // yang dag par sgrub par gyur pa'i yang dag pa'i dmigs pa la rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: and one is engaged in the correct objective support that is accomplished correctly.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid yang dag par sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin par gyur pa ni 'di lta ste dmigs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid yang dag par sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin par gyur pa ni 'di lta ste dmigs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The non-conceptualization that is the accomplishment of the conceptualization of the objective support is as follows: the non-completion of the objective support.

original: phyogs 'dis lhag ma rnams dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis lhag ma rnams dpag par bya'o //
translated: By this method, the rest should be inferred.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa'i skye bo ni dang por rgyu tshol bar 'gyur ba yin pas byang chub kyi rgyu mthong ba'i lam gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum 'chad par byed pa'i phyogs snga ma bkod pas tshig le'ur byas pa la 'jug pa ni de ltar
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa'i skye bo ni dang por rgyu tshol bar 'gyur ba yin pas byang chub kyi rgyu mthong ba'i lam gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum 'chad par byed pa'i phyogs snga ma bkod pas tshig le'ur byas pa la 'jug pa ni de ltar
translated: Since persons who desire the result first seek the cause, the author of the treatise sets forth the three types of co-existent causes of the path of seeing, which are the causes of enlightenment. The introduction to the verses is as follows:

original: mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin la tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin la tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the path of seeing, etc. The meaning of the verses is stated as follows:

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid do //
translated: Enlightenment is the very state of Buddhahood, which has the characteristics to be described.

original: gzhan dag la ni gdul bya rnams la'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni gdul bya rnams la'o //
translated: Others refers to disciples.

original: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa ston pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam thob pas so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa ston pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam thob pas so //
translated: The path of insight, etc., is the path of insight and the path of cultivation, which are attained by oneself.

original: rab tu 'god pa ni gdul bya rnams la byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa sbyin pa ni rgyu gcig yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'god pa ni gdul bya rnams la byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa sbyin pa ni rgyu gcig yin no //
translated: To establish refers to the gift of the thought of enlightenment, etc., to disciples. This is the one cause.

original: zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be supplied in the following verses.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu mtshan kho nar zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi rgyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu mtshan kho nar zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi rgyur ro //
translated: The very cause of enlightenment refers to the cause of one's own enlightenment.

original: de dag la ni gdul bya rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni gdul bya rnams la'o //
translated: To them refers to disciples.

original: yang dag pa'i tshig dang don ni bcos ma'i don gyis stong pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshig dang don ni bcos ma'i don gyis stong pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'o //
translated: The right words and their meaning refers to the teaching of the perfection of wisdom, which is empty of the fabricated meaning.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lam de dang sgo de dang man ngag de las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag pa so sor gtod cing ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi yul rab tu sbyin pa ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni lam de dang sgo de dang man ngag de las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag pa so sor gtod cing ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi yul rab tu sbyin pa ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
