translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that the second cause is the correct application of the perfection of wisdom through that path, that door, and that instruction, and the bestowal of the object that is the nature of intuition.

original: byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir bdag nyid la bar chad med pa'i phyir rgyu gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir bdag nyid la bar chad med pa'i phyir rgyu gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third cause is the absence of obstacles for oneself in order to attain enlightenment.

original: de ni rang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated in the line ‚Äúthat is greater than the former.‚Äù

original: rang las te bdag nyid las ches mang po'i gus pa la sogs pa'am mang ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang las te bdag nyid las ches mang po'i gus pa la sogs pa'am mang ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Greater than oneself, that is, greater than one‚Äôs own respect, etc., or greater than one‚Äôs own cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, etc.,

original: thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa gang yin pa des bsod nams te /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa gang yin pa des bsod nams te /
translated: that is, hearing, reflection, etc., is the merit,

original: sems kyi dag byed de nyid mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sems kyi dag byed de nyid mtshan nyid de /
translated: that is, the purification of the mind.

original: de ltar na rgyu rnam pa gsum bstan pa @227b yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu rnam pa gsum bstan pa @227b yin no //
translated: Thus, the three causes have been taught.

original: gang gi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dri ma ste nyon mongs pa gang yin pa zad pa dang / mi skye ba de dag gi ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can du gang gi tshe gyur pa de'i tshe byang chub ces brjod //
analyzed: gang gi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dri ma ste nyon mongs pa gang yin pa zad pa dang / mi skye ba de dag gi ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can du gang gi tshe gyur pa de'i tshe byang chub ces brjod //
translated: As for ‚Äúfor the sake of which,‚Äù etc., when the knowledge of the extinction and non-production of those defilements, i.e., afflictions, becomes the knowledge characterized by non-conceptualization, then it is called enlightenment.

original: de rnam par rtog pa thams cad bral ba'i 'tshang rgya ba nyid ni sngar kun rdzob yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa thams cad bral ba'i 'tshang rgya ba nyid ni sngar kun rdzob yin par bshad do //
translated: The enlightenment of freedom from all conceptualization was previously explained as conventional.

original: ci nang gi mu stegs pa dang 'dra ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci nang gi mu stegs pa dang 'dra ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are they like the internal tƒ´rthikas?üîΩThey should be understood in order as:

original: zag med skye med phyir de dag / go rims bzhin du shes par bya //
analyzed: zag med skye med phyir de dag / go rims bzhin du shes par bya //
translated: uncontaminated and non-arisen.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang gi tshe yang dag par na nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skyes pa med pa nyid kyis na zad pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag par na nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skyes pa med pa nyid kyis na zad pa med do //
translated: When one knows that afflictions, etc., do not truly arise, they are not extinguished.

original: zhes mkhyen pa de'i tshe nyon mongs pa la sogs pa zad pa'i ye shes yin la /
analyzed: zhes mkhyen pa de'i tshe nyon mongs pa la sogs pa zad pa'i ye shes yin la /
translated: When one knows that, it is the knowledge of the extinction of afflictions, etc.

original: yang gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mi skye ba med pa nyid kyis skye ba med do //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mi skye ba med pa nyid kyis skye ba med do //
translated: Moreover, when afflictions and so on are not non-arisen, they are non-arisen due to non-arising.üîΩ

original: zhes mkhyen pa de'i tshe ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i ye shes 'dir shes par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: zhes mkhyen pa de'i tshe ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i ye shes 'dir shes par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //
translated: Moreover, when one knows that afflictions, etc. do not arise due to their non-existence, then this knowledge of the non-arising of afflictions, etc. is to be understood here. This is the general meaning.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Afflictions are attachment, etc.

original: shes bya ni gzung ba ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya ni gzung ba ma lus pa ste /
translated: The knowable is the entirety of the apprehended.

original: de dag nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gegs byed pa yin pa'i phyir sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gegs byed pa yin pa'i phyir sgrib pa ste /
translated: They are obscurations because they obstruct the knowledge of reality.

original: de nyid glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir dang / mi shes pa'i dri ma'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dri ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir dang / mi shes pa'i dri ma'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dri ma yin no //
translated: They are defilements because they are adventitious and the cause of the stain of ignorance.

original: de nas skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nyid du brtags pa ni /
analyzed: de nas skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nyid du brtags pa ni /
translated: Then, the examination of what is arisen and what is non-arisen is as follows:

original: nang gi mu stegs pa dag gis yang dag par na skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi mu stegs pa dag gis yang dag par na skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The internal tirthikas also assert that, in reality, there is production and non-production.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The dharmadhatu is non-dual wisdom.

original: de la ma gtogs par ni de dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de la ma gtogs par ni de dang bral ba ste /
translated: Apart from that, it is free from that.

original: gang gi phyir chos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos te /
translated: Because of that, the phenomenaüîΩof form and so forth do not exist.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul las bshad pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul las bshad pas /
translated: Since it is explained in the Perfection Vehicle system,

original: chos kyi khongs su 'dus pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: chos kyi khongs su 'dus pa nyid kyis na /
translated: it is included within the dharmadhatu,üîΩand it is the nature of non-dual wisdom.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin la nam mkha' bzhin du zhes bya ba rten med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin la nam mkha' bzhin du zhes bya ba rten med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Since it is like space, it is without support.üîΩBecause of the absence of cessation and production,

original: 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skyes pa rnams yang dag par na zad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skyes pa rnams yang dag par na zad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: the phenomena of afflictions and so forth that have arisen are, in reality, not exhausted.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni @228a * //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni @228a * //
translated: Because of the absence of production,

original: zag pa med pa la zad pa mkhyen pa'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la zad pa mkhyen pa'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the knowledge of destruction is in regard to the uncontaminated.

original: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid ni cha shas can dang rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid ni cha shas can dang rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of one and many is the nature of the possessor of parts and the accumulation of subtle particles.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni grags par zad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni grags par zad do //
translated: Cause and effect are well known.

original: dngos po'i chos 'di dag rnam par 'byed pa ni tshad ma ste gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba dang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos 'di dag rnam par 'byed pa ni tshad ma ste gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba dang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'o //
translated: The valid cognition that distinguishes these phenomena of entities is free from the nature of one and many and does not have cause and effect such as existence and non-existence.

original: sogs pa'i sgras thog ma la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bye brag dang phyogs gcig la sogs pa thams cad sgrib pa la sogs par thal ba dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras thog ma la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bye brag dang phyogs gcig la sogs pa thams cad sgrib pa la sogs par thal ba dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term etc. includes the distinctions of cognition such as the beginning, and all such things as one part, etc., which are subject to the consequence of being obscured, etc., and not being so.

original: des 'thad pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: des 'thad pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: By that, the nature of the reality of entities is tenable.

original: med pas zhes bya ba ni mi ldan pa nyid kyis na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pas zhes bya ba ni mi ldan pa nyid kyis na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-existence means because of non-possession.

original: nam mkha'i padma bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pas zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid du med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa rnams ni yang dag par skye ba'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa'i ye shes kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pas zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid du med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa rnams ni yang dag par skye ba'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa'i ye shes kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir
translated: Since they do not exist as things, afflictions and so on that are not produced are not produced by the gnosis that stops the characteristics of true production.

original: skye ba med pa mkhyen pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa mkhyen pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is explained that the Buddha knows nonproduction.

original: de ni de ltar go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The order in which the Buddha knows the extinction of contaminants and so on is as follows.üîΩThe order in which the contaminants explained above are extinguished is the order in which the Buddha knows their extinction and nonarising.üîΩThe gnosis of extinction and nonarising has the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: go rims bzhin du sngar bshad pa'i dri ma rnams ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can yin pas snga ma bzhin du zad pa shes pa dang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sngar bshad pa'i dri ma rnams ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can yin pas snga ma bzhin du zad pa shes pa dang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: Therefore, as before, the Buddha knows the extinction of contaminants and so on because they are free from one and many.

original: pa'i tshad mas gang gi tshe mir skye ba shes pa de'i tshe chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa de rnams phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i tshad mas gang gi tshe mir skye ba shes pa de'i tshe chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa de rnams phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ste /
translated: When one knows that one will be born as a human being by means of valid knowledge, then one realizes without error all dharmas, etc.

original: yang dag par na skye ba med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na skye ba med par shes pa'o //
translated: In reality, one knows that they are unborn.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni ye shes las sku gzhan gyi yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni ye shes las sku gzhan gyi yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: Its characteristic is that the essence, the nature of the dharmakƒÅya, etc., is not tenable as being other than the body of gnosis.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tshad mas 'thad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tshad mas 'thad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as it is means that it is tenable by means of valid knowledge.

original: byang chub chen po ni khyab pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: byang chub chen po ni khyab pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Great enlightenment is all-pervading gnosis.

original: nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyi byang chub mi 'thad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyi byang chub mi 'thad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa la 'jug pa ni /
translated: The introduction to the verses on the untenability of the enlightenment of the non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: is stated with because, etc.üîΩBecause in the MahƒÅyƒÅna system, enlightenment is like that,

original: gang gi phyir theg pa chen po'i tshul la byang chub de lta bu yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir theg pa chen po'i tshul la byang chub de lta bu yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: therefore,

original: nang gi mu stegs pa gang dag gis dngos po 'jig pa'i bsam pas dngos po can gyi nyon @228b mongs pa la sogs pa skyes pa rnams 'gag pa la bsams nas zad cing 'gag pa la zad cing 'gags so zhes bya ba'i shes pa ste rnam par rtog
analyzed: nang gi mu stegs pa gang dag gis dngos po 'jig pa'i bsam pas dngos po can gyi nyon @228b mongs pa la sogs pa skyes pa rnams 'gag pa la bsams nas zad cing 'gag pa la zad cing 'gags so zhes bya ba'i shes pa ste rnam par rtog
translated: The internal tƒ´rthikas think that things cease due to the thought that things are destroyed. They think that things that possess afflictions and so on that have arisen cease and that they are exhausted and cease. The consciousness that thinks, ‚ÄúThey are exhausted and cease‚Äù is the

original: pa ni zad par shes pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni zad par shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of exhaustion.

original: dngos po mi skye ba'i bsam pas dngos po can gyi nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skye ba rnams la skye ba med par bsams nas ma skyes pa yin zhing skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i 'gog pa la mi skye ba la mi skye'o snyam pa'i shes pa ma
analyzed: dngos po mi skye ba'i bsam pas dngos po can gyi nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skye ba rnams la skye ba med par bsams nas ma skyes pa yin zhing skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i 'gog pa la mi skye ba la mi skye'o snyam pa'i shes pa ma
translated: The thought that things do not arise is the thought that things that possess afflictions and so on that have arisen do not arise. The consciousness that thinks, ‚ÄúThey do not arise‚Äù in regard to the cessation that prevents their arising is theüîΩknowledge of nonarising.

original: skyes pa nyid kyis na nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi skye ba'i shes pa yin par brjod cing rang gi tshul rnam par 'jog na /
analyzed: skyes pa nyid kyis na nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi skye ba'i shes pa yin par brjod cing rang gi tshul rnam par 'jog na /
translated: The thought that due to the nonarising of things, afflictions do not arise is the knowledge of nonarising.

original: 'phags pa byams pas so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyis gzigs nas de rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i srid par dngos po dang dngos po med pas mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir thugs rjes rigs pa bdag gir mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyis gzigs nas de rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i srid par dngos po dang dngos po med pas mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir thugs rjes rigs pa bdag gir mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The noble Maitreya, having seen this with the wisdom of individual intuitive realization, composed this treatise with compassion for the sake of removing the attachment to things and nonthings in the beginningless cyclic existence of those beings.

original: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe path of seeing‚Äù is the inner extreme.

original: zhes bya ba ni nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyis bdag gi nyon mongs pa zad cing slar yang mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyis bdag gi nyon mongs pa zad cing slar yang mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid
translated: The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising of those who say, ‚ÄúI have eliminated the afflictions and they will not arise again,‚Äù are the reality of the suchness of the afflictions, and so on.

original: yin pas zad pa dang mi skye ba med pa ni /
analyzed: yin pas zad pa dang mi skye ba med pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of elimination and nonarising

original: 'gog pa med pa de'i rang bzhin yin zhing ldog tu med pa yin pa la dngos po la mngon par zhen pas rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi shes pa las gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa med pa de'i rang bzhin yin zhing ldog tu med pa yin pa la dngos po la mngon par zhen pas rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi shes pa las gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: is the nature of noncessation, and it is not to be reversed. It should be understood that this is due to the nonunderstanding of its nature, which is due to the attachment to things.

original: de las nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the fault of that?

original: rnam par rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i rigs ni rnam par rtog @229a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te / rnam par rtog pa'i rigs ni rnam par rtog @229a * //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe cessation of conceptuality is not understood.‚Äù

original: pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The type of conceptuality is the nature of conceptuality.

original: ci zhig zad pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig zad pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: What is the cessation of that?

original: yang na rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo skye med rnam pa ci zhig 'thob /üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo skye med rnam pa ci zhig 'thob / ces bya ba ste /
translated: Or, what kind of non-arising nature of conceptuality is obtained?

original: skye ba med pa'i chos ci zhig skyed de ci yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i chos ci zhig skyed de ci yang ma yin te /
translated: What kind of non-arising dharma is produced? Nothing at all.üîΩIf afflictions are reversed, the conceptuality that arises from them is reversed.

original: nyon mongs pa log na de las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ldog par yin na de yang bshad ma thag pa'i tshad mas 'thad pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bos drangs pa'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes
analyzed: nyon mongs pa log na de las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ldog par yin na de yang bshad ma thag pa'i tshad mas 'thad pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bos drangs pa'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes
translated: If that is so, the nature of afflictions and so on, which is induced by the nature of suchness that is established by the previously explained valid knowledge, and the knowledge of cessation and non-arising

original: pa'i rang bzhin ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pas rang gi ngo bo ma shes pas nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyis mi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pas rang gi ngo bo ma shes pas nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyis mi shes pa yin la /
translated: are not understood by the internal tƒ´rthikas because they do not understand their nature due to clinging to things.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas ji ltar na de rnams mthong ba'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnam par ldog par bya bar nus /
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas ji ltar na de rnams mthong ba'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnam par ldog par bya bar nus /
translated: Therefore, since one does not understand the nature of afflictions, how can one be able to stop afflictions and so on through the path of seeing?

original: de ldog pas kyang de las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ji ltar ldog ste /
analyzed: de ldog pas kyang de las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ji ltar ldog ste /
translated: And since they are not stopped, how can the continuum of conceptuality that arises from them be stopped?

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bu ldog pa ni gang na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'bras bu ldog pa ni gang na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas /
translated: When a cause exists, it is never the case that its effect is stopped.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i dgongs pa bshad pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni skyes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /üîΩskyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skyes pa rnams rnam par 'jig pa ni zad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i dgongs pa bshad pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni skyes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skyes pa rnams rnam par 'jig pa ni zad pa yin la /
translated: With this thought in mind, the meaning of the verses that explain the intention of ƒÄrya Maitreya is ‚Äúarisen and unarisen‚Äù and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa skye ba'i gegs byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa skye ba'i gegs byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen and unarisen‚Äù respectively refers to the destruction of arisen afflictions and so on and the prevention of the arising of unarisen afflictions and so on.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu med pas ma skyes pa yin la 'di dag gi mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa de rnams 'dod la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu med pas ma skyes pa yin la 'di dag gi mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa de rnams 'dod la /
translated: The cessation of their characteristics is the result of the path of seeing.

original: de dang bral ba de ni don dam par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang bral ba de ni don dam par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The freedom from that is ultimate reality and so on.

original: don dam pa ni yang dag pa nyid de rnam par dpyad cing brtag bzod pa nyid kyis na de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo ni rang bzhin yin zhing chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: don dam pa ni yang dag pa nyid de rnam par dpyad cing brtag bzod pa nyid kyis na de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo ni rang bzhin yin zhing chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Ultimate reality is reality, and since it is able to withstand analysis and investigation, its nature is suchness, its nature is the essence of the dharmadhatu.

original: dngos po la log par mngon par zhen pa khyed kyis zhes bya ba dngos po rnam pa la log par mngon par zhen pa khyed rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dngos po la log par mngon par zhen pa khyed kyis zhes bya ba dngos po rnam pa la log par mngon par zhen pa khyed rnams kyi'o //
translated: You who are attached to things as false means you who are attached to things as false aspects.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pas so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pas so //
translated: By the power of the path of seeing refers to what was explained earlier.

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos skyes pa ni ci zhig zad ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs @229b pa'i rnam par rtog pa ci zhig bag chags gang las 'byung ba ni 'gags /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos skyes pa ni ci zhig zad ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs @229b pa'i rnam par rtog pa ci zhig bag chags gang las 'byung ba ni 'gags /
translated: What is destroyed by the entity of conceptuality and so on? What is the latent state that ceases?

original: mi skye ba'i chos can ma skyes pa ni ci zhig skyes te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can ma skyes pa ni ci zhig skyes te /
translated: What non-arisen phenomenon arises?

original: skye ba med pas cung zad kyang med pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir med pa la mngon par zhen pa khyed kyis mthong ba'i lam ni lam ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pas cung zad kyang med pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir med pa la mngon par zhen pa khyed kyis mthong ba'i lam ni lam ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is non-arisen, it is nothing whatsoever. Therefore, your path of seeing that is fixated on nonexistence is not a path at all.üîΩFor this reason, you should accept only our scriptural system.

original: rgyu 'dis na kho bo cag gi gzhung lugs kho na khas blang par bya'o zhes bya ba kun tu 'gro ba'i bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can kho na byang chub kyi lam yin par rigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rten par gyis shig snyam du dgongs pa yinüîΩno zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rgyu 'dis na kho bo cag gi gzhung lugs kho na khas blang par bya'o zhes bya ba kun tu 'gro ba'i bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can kho na byang chub kyi lam yin par rigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rten par gyis shig snyam du dgongs pa yin no zhes bya ba /
translated: The path of awakening is only the characteristic of all-pervading selflessness.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is the intention of ƒÄrya Maitreya.

original: dngos po rnams yang dag par khas blangs nas sngar bshad pa bzhin du byang chub med pa'i nyes pa bsal bar bya ba ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams yang dag par khas blangs nas sngar bshad pa bzhin du byang chub med pa'i nyes pa bsal bar bya ba ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having accepted things as real, one should clear away the fault of the nonexistence of enlightenment as previously explained.

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi gzhung bor te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi gzhung bor te /
translated: ‚Äú It is not so‚Äù means that one should not abandon our scriptures.

original: chos yang dag par yod par khas len na zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa don dam par yod par bdag gir byed na bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: chos yang dag par yod par khas len na zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa don dam par yod par bdag gir byed na bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: If one accepts that phenomena really exist, that is, if one holds that form and so on exist ultimately, then the Bhagavat,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i rnam par rtog pa ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i rnam par rtog pa ni sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: the perfect Buddha, would not have the nonconceptual wisdom that is free from the obscurations of the afflictions and the obscurations of the knowable, as explained above.üîΩThat itself is the obscuration, as before. Since he would not have abandoned those, it would be impossible for him to have the cessation that is the object of the supreme victor‚Äôs wisdom, which is the state of wonder, the state of marvel.

original: de nyid ni snga ma bzhin du sgrib pa yin la de rnams spangs pas 'gog pa ni rnam pa thams cad du ngo mtshar gyi gnas yin pa ni ngo mtshar byed pa yin pa 'di ltar mi srid do zhes bya ba'i bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa
analyzed: de nyid ni snga ma bzhin du sgrib pa yin la de rnams spangs pas 'gog pa ni rnam pa thams cad du ngo mtshar gyi gnas yin pa ni ngo mtshar byed pa yin pa 'di ltar mi srid do zhes bya ba'i bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa
translated: The verse in the middle.

original: ni chos rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ni chos rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúThe phenomena of form and so on are also like this‚Äù indicates that the phenomena of form and so on are also like the mind in being devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: chos rnams te gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang yod ces bya ba dang zhes bya ba yang dag par khas len na shes bya la yang zhes bya ba gzung ba la yang sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams te gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang yod ces bya ba dang zhes bya ba yang dag par khas len na shes bya la yang zhes bya ba gzung ba la yang sgrib pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe phenomena‚Äù are forms and so on. If one accepts that they exist, then one is also obscured with respect to the object of knowledge, that is, the apprehended.

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa zad cing 'gog par ston pa gzhan gyis brjod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir kho bos mtshar du rtsis te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa zad cing 'gog par ston pa gzhan gyis brjod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir kho bos mtshar du rtsis te /
translated: Whatever others may say about the cessation and exhaustion of conceptualization and so on, here, since they are mutually contradictory, I consider them to be absurd.

original: 'di ni mi srid do zhes 'phags pa byams pas dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mi srid do zhes 'phags pa byams pas dgongs so //
translated: This is impossible, as the noble Maitreya intends.

original: nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyis byang chub pa'i thabs ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i skabs su thams cad du 'gro ba'i bdag med pa bstan pa ni /üîΩbyang chub ji lta ba de lta bu yin pa bla ma'i man @230a * //
analyzed: nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyis byang chub pa'i thabs ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i skabs su thams cad du 'gro ba'i bdag med pa bstan pa ni / byang chub ji lta ba de lta bu yin pa bla ma'i man @230a * //
translated: In the context of teaching that the internal tƒ´rthikas‚Äô method is not the method for enlightenment, the nonexistence of a self that is all-pervading is taught.

original: ngag mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: ngag mdor bsdus te /
translated: The method for enlightenment is just like that, as the guru has summarized.

original: bstan pas 'jug pa'i sgo nas tshig le'ur byas pa las ma smos pa'i don gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩde la skye ba dang zhes bya ba la dben pa'i bdag gis stong pa'i lta ba'i byang chub mi 'thad zhes bya ba ni phyi rol yod par lta ba'i byang chub mi 'thad par gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i bdag med pa'i sbyor
analyzed: bstan pas 'jug pa'i sgo nas tshig le'ur byas pa las ma smos pa'i don gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la skye ba dang zhes bya ba la dben pa'i bdag gis stong pa'i lta ba'i byang chub mi 'thad zhes bya ba ni phyi rol yod par lta ba'i byang chub mi 'thad par gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i bdag med pa'i sbyor
translated: In order to teach the meaning that is implied by the force of what is not mentioned in the verses that present the door of entry into the teaching,

original: ba dang ldan pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong ngo zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba yang dag par slar yang mi ldog pa nyid du spong ngo zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba dang ldan pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong ngo zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba yang dag par slar yang mi ldog pa nyid du spong ngo zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: in that regard, ‚Äúarising‚Äù and so on. The statement ‚Äúthe view of emptiness by a solitary self is untenable‚Äù means that the view of external existence is untenable. The statement ‚Äúthe yogi/nƒ´ endowed with the yoga of the all-pervading selflessness abandons the obscurations of knowledge‚Äù means that the net of conceptuality is abandoned so that it does not return again.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir ji lta bur zhes rtog pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ji lta bur zhes rtog pa la /
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy? In what way?‚Äù

original: skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: the text says ‚Äúarising‚Äù and so on.

original: phyi rol pa'i mu stegs pa kha cig rtag pa dang bdag dang rtogs pa'i ngo bo dang ma rtogs pa'i ngo bor smra la /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i mu stegs pa kha cig rtag pa dang bdag dang rtogs pa'i ngo bo dang ma rtogs pa'i ngo bor smra la /
translated: Some non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas say that it is permanent, a self, the nature of realization, and the nature of nonrealization.

original: de rnams ni rang nyid mar me'i me lce dang 'dra bar rtag pa nyid du mi 'thad pas skye ba dang 'jig pa de ni khas mi len gyi nang gi mu stegs pa kha cig rtag pa dang chad pa nyid las rnam par grol ba gso ba dang
analyzed: de rnams ni rang nyid mar me'i me lce dang 'dra bar rtag pa nyid du mi 'thad pas skye ba dang 'jig pa de ni khas mi len gyi nang gi mu stegs pa kha cig rtag pa dang chad pa nyid las rnam par grol ba gso ba dang
translated: Since it is not tenable that they are permanent, like the flame of a lamp, they do not accept arising and disintegration.

original: skyes bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du smra ste /
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du smra ste /
translated: Some inner tƒ´rthikas say that it is liberated from permanence and annihilation and is the nature of a person and so on.

original: de rnams kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bo dag gcig par mi srid cing dngos po ma yin pa nyid kyis na de skye ba dang 'jig pa khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bo dag gcig par mi srid cing dngos po ma yin pa nyid kyis na de skye ba dang 'jig pa khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Since it is impossible for the nature of something permanent and the nature of something impermanent to be the same, and since it is not a thing, it is not to be accepted that it arises and disintegrates.

original: gang yang skye ba dang 'jig pas stong pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang skye ba dang 'jig pas stong pa ni /
translated: That which is empty of arising and disintegration

original: kun rdzob tu yang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar rtag pa dang bdag med pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyid kyis grub pa la rtag pa dang dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas mngon parüîΩ'du byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag gi rten yin pas yod par lta ba la rten pa thams cad kyi rtse mo nyid yin pa'i phyir des sel bar byed pa'i rdo rje'i skyil mo krung la sogs pas bsgom pa rtsom pa yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar rtag pa dang bdag med pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyid kyis grub pa la rtag pa dang dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas mngon par 'du byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag gi rten yin pas yod par lta ba la rten pa thams cad kyi rtse mo nyid yin pa'i phyir des sel bar byed pa'i rdo rje'i skyil mo krung la sogs pas bsgom pa rtsom pa yin te /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the basis of the self because it is the peak of all views that are based on the view of the existence of the self. Therefore, one should meditate on the vajra seat and so on, which are the means of eliminating the view of the transitory collection.üîΩ  One should meditate on the thought that the self does not exist, but the aggregates do exist, and one should abandon the view of the transitory collection, which is the basis of the self.

original: de ni bdag ni med kyi phung po tsam nyid yin no zhes phyi rol pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las skye ba dang 'jig pa'i stong pa'i phyir bdag med do snyam du bsgom zhing mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bdag tu bdag tu mngon par zhen paüîΩyongs su bor la /
analyzed: de ni bdag ni med kyi phung po tsam nyid yin no zhes phyi rol pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las skye ba dang 'jig pa'i stong pa'i phyir bdag med do snyam du bsgom zhing mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bdag tu bdag tu mngon par zhen paüîΩyongs su bor la /
translated: One should meditate on the thought that the self does not exist, but the aggregates do exist, and one should abandon the view of the transitory collection, which is the basis of the self.

original: des dben pa'i bdag gis stong pa'i phung po la @230b sogs pa ste /
analyzed: des dben pa'i bdag gis stong pa'i phung po la @230b sogs pa ste /
