original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched tsam ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can la yang dag par dmigs te /üîΩzhes bya ba kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can la yang dag par dmigs te zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos kyang yin par 'jig rten du grags pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched tsam ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can la yang dag par dmigs te / zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can la yang dag par dmigs te zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos kyang yin par 'jig rten du grags pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i
translated: The dependent origination that is the mere dependent origination of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases from the twelve factors such as ignorance is the dependent origination that is the mere dependent origination of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases from the twelve factors such as ignorance.

original: rten la dmigs te /
analyzed: rten la dmigs te /
translated: The dependent origination that

original: de'i rjes la de bsal bar bya ba'i don du sngon po dang de'i blo dag lhan cig dmigs par nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba shes bya nang gi yin pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las sngon po dang de'i blo dag ces bya ba sngon po dang cig shos dag
analyzed: de'i rjes la de bsal bar bya ba'i don du sngon po dang de'i blo dag lhan cig dmigs par nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba shes bya nang gi yin pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las sngon po dang de'i blo dag ces bya ba sngon po dang cig shos dag
translated: In the treatise Ascertainment of Cognition Only, it says, ‚ÄúBlue and its cognition.‚Äù

original: kyang sha za yin snyam pa'am ka ba la sogs pa ltar sngon po dang blo dag ni de 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis na brtags pa yin pas rnam pa dang bcas pa'am rnam pa med par dmigs pa dang lhan cig par nges pa yin pa nyid kyis
analyzed: kyang sha za yin snyam pa'am ka ba la sogs pa ltar sngon po dang blo dag ni de 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis na brtags pa yin pas rnam pa dang bcas pa'am rnam pa med par dmigs pa dang lhan cig par nges pa yin pa nyid kyis
translated: Blue and its opposite are like a flesh-eater or a pillar, and so on. Blue and cognition are imputed by the mere apprehension of them. Therefore, it is ascertained that they are observed either with aspects or without aspects.

original: na zla ba gnyis pa dang 'dra bar rtogs pa'i phyir 'di ni sems tsam kho na yin gyi phyi rol gyi don ni med do zhes bya ba ni yang yul la sogs pa nges par grub ste /
analyzed: na zla ba gnyis pa dang 'dra bar rtogs pa'i phyir 'di ni sems tsam kho na yin gyi phyi rol gyi don ni med do zhes bya ba ni yang yul la sogs pa nges par grub ste /
translated: Since they are ascertained to be simultaneous, they are realized to be like a double moon. Therefore, it is established that objects and so on are ascertained, and it is said, ‚ÄúThis is mind only; external objects do not exist.‚Äù

original: mi 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mthas de'i sgrub pa'i yul la sogs pa'i nges pa ni med du zin kyang rmi lam du srid pas ma nges pa nyid kyis na sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid du sems shing sha za'am ka ba la sogs pa gzhan dagüîΩyod pa ma yin te /üîΩphyi'i don ni bems po yin te snang bar mi rung bas de med do zhes yid la byed cing dmigs pa na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems la mngon par zhen pa yongs su ma bor bas zhes bya ba'i phyir rol med pa na /
analyzed: mi 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mthas de'i sgrub pa'i yul la sogs pa'i nges pa ni med du zin kyang rmi lam du srid pas ma nges pa nyid kyis na sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid du sems shing sha za'am ka ba la sogs pa gzhan dag yod pa ma yin te / phyi'i don ni bems po yin te snang bar mi rung bas de med do zhes yid la byed cing dmigs pa na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems la mngon par zhen pa yongs su ma bor bas zhes bya ba'i phyir rol med pa na /
translated: One thinks that the other, such as a flesh-eater or a pillar, does not exist.üîΩSince external objects are inanimate, they are not suitable to appear. Therefore, when one thinks, ‚ÄúThey do not exist,‚Äù and observes, one does not abandon the manifest clinging to the mind that has the aspect of apprehending.

original: de 'dzin par byed pa de nyid du mi 'thad pa yin na yang skye ba thog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i goms pa dang de'i bag chags yod pas rang gi sems gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa la 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid mngonüîΩpar zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa de nyid du mi 'thad pa yin na yang skye ba thog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i goms pa dang de'i bag chags yod pas rang gi sems gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa la 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid mngonüîΩpar zhen pa yin no //
translated: When the external object does not exist, it is not tenable that it is apprehended. However, due to the cultivation that has been transmitted from one life to another since beginningless time and the latent propensities for that, one manifestly clings to the aspect of the nondual mind itself as the aspect of apprehending.

original: phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa spangs te zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du phyi'i yul du dmigs pa mi 'thad pas de la chags pa rnam par bsal te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa spangs te zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du phyi'i yul du dmigs pa mi 'thad pas de la chags pa rnam par bsal te /
translated: Having abandoned attachment to external objects, as before, it is not tenable to objectify external objects, so one should clear away attachment to them.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyis @231a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyis @231a * //
translated: Since the object and subject exist in mutual dependence, through cause and effect,

original: yod par rigs la /
analyzed: yod par rigs la /
translated: it is reasonable that they exist.

original: de'i 'og tu de yang rnam pa med pa'i shes pa ni yul la 'dzin par mi rigs so //üîΩrnam pa tshad ma med phyir dang // mi rigs phyir na cig shos min //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de yang rnam pa med pa'i shes pa ni yul la 'dzin par mi rigs so // rnam pa tshad ma med phyir dang // mi rigs phyir na cig shos min //
translated: After that, it is unreasonable that a cognition devoid of aspects apprehends objects.üîΩSince that is refuted by ‚Äúbecause of the absence of valid cognition of aspects‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it is unreasonable,‚Äù the other is not so.

original: zhes bya bas bsal bas gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med do zhes nges par bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bsal bas gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med do zhes nges par bsam mo //
translated: Thus, if the object does not exist, the subject does not exist.

original: de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu /
translated: After that,üîΩone should reflect

original: 'di dag rnam rig tsam nyid ces //üîΩde snyom du ni bsams nas su //
analyzed: 'di dag rnam rig tsam nyid ces // de snyom du ni bsams nas su //
translated: on the equality of mere cognition.

original: ci yang rung ste mdun 'jog na //
analyzed: ci yang rung ste mdun 'jog na //
translated: Whatever appears in front

original: de nyid tsam la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid tsam la mi gnas so //
translated: does not exist as that alone.

original: zhes smos pas gzung ba'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyang sems tsam nyid yin pas mdun du rnam pa brtag pa yang sems tsam nyid kyis rigs pa ma yin pas de yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rig pa tsam de yang rnam par bsal zhing
analyzed: zhes smos pas gzung ba'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyang sems tsam nyid yin pas mdun du rnam pa brtag pa yang sems tsam nyid kyis rigs pa ma yin pas de yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rig pa tsam de yang rnam par bsal zhing
translated: Therefore, that is also eliminated and discarded.

original: dor te / blo las nyams myong gzhan med cing //
analyzed: dor te / blo las nyams myong gzhan med cing //
translated: There is no experience other than mind.

original: de nyams myong ba gzhan med de //
analyzed: de nyams myong ba gzhan med de //
translated: There is no experience other than that.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa dang bral bas //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa dang bral bas //
translated: Free from apprehended and apprehender,

original: de ni rang nyid snang ba yin //
analyzed: de ni rang nyid snang ba yin //
translated: it is self-illuminating.

original: zhes bshad pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: Thus, it is said that it is only nondual wisdom.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa stong pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i rnam par shes pa tsam 'ba' zhig bdag la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa stong pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i rnam par shes pa tsam 'ba' zhig bdag la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa dang bral ba'am /
translated: The consciousness of the aspect of the factors conducive to penetrative insight that is empty of the apprehended and so on is only consciousness, free from the grasping of self and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i rig pa'i bya bas stong pa yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rig pa'i bya bas stong pa yang dag pa ste /
translated: It is real because it is empty of the activity of correct cognition.

original: de kho na nyid du na yod pa'i ngo bo ste gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rang rig par 'gyur ba nyid kyis yod cing gnas pa yin no snyam du de ltar nges par byas nas de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na yod pa'i ngo bo ste gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rang rig par 'gyur ba nyid kyis yod cing gnas pa yin no snyam du de ltar nges par byas nas de'i 'og tu /
translated: one should then contemplate the following thesis:

original: de dang de rten gang byung ba //
analyzed: de dang de rten gang byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on that

original: rang gi ngo bor de ma skyes //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor de ma skyes //
translated: does not arise in its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bor gang ma skyes //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gang ma skyes //
translated: Whatever does not arise in its own nature

original: de la skyes zhes ci zhig brjod //üîΩces bya ba'i grub pa'i mthas de yang ste /
analyzed: de la skyes zhes ci zhig brjod // ces bya ba'i grub pa'i mthas de yang ste /
translated: how can that be said to arise?üîΩThis thesis states that even consciousness is dependently arisen.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs pa'i dbang las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs pa'i dbang las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: Since it arises by the power of the collection of mind and mental factors, as before, it is like an illusion and lacks entityness.

original: rang rig pa nyid yin pa nyid kyis na bsnyon par mi nus pa yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor mi 'thad pas rang nyid kyis stong pa yin zhing yang dag par te /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid yin pa nyid kyis na bsnyon par mi nus pa yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor mi 'thad pas rang nyid kyis stong pa yin zhing yang dag par te /
translated: However, since it is untenable for it to be the nature of cause and result, it is empty of itself.

original: de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid kyis na gcig tu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid kyis na gcig tu ste /
translated: In reality, that is, in suchness, it is one.üîΩIt is free from the nature of being imputed as an entity, a nonentity, and so on.

original: shin tu dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par brtags pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba zhes bya ba dngos po dang dngos po med pa @231b dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo med cing spangs pa yin no
analyzed: shin tu dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par brtags pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba zhes bya ba dngos po dang dngos po med pa @231b dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo med cing spangs pa yin no
translated: It is free from the nature of the concepts of entity, nonentity, both, and neither.

original: snyom du bsgoms te /
analyzed: snyom du bsgoms te /
translated: It is cultivated in equipoise.

original: gang phyir yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: gang phyir yang dag yang dag min //
translated: Since it is real and not real,

original: shin tu bsgom pa gang gang yin //
analyzed: shin tu bsgom pa gang gang yin //
translated: what is the cultivation of what?

original: bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pas na //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pas na //
translated: Since the power of cultivation is complete,

original: de gsal mi rtog blo'i 'bras bu //
analyzed: de gsal mi rtog blo'i 'bras bu //
translated: the result is a mind of clarity and nonconceptuality.

original: zhes smos pas /
analyzed: zhes smos pas /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bsgom pa'i stobs grub nas zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs su /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs grub nas zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs su /
translated: After the power of cultivation is accomplished, that is, at the point of perfecting the highest cultivation,

original: kha cig la nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ji ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyi nor bu dang dngul dang me long la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa gcig dang du ma la sogs pa nyid kyis stong
analyzed: kha cig la nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ji ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyi nor bu dang dngul dang me long la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa gcig dang du ma la sogs pa nyid kyis stong
translated: Just as for ordinary beings, the cognition of a reflection in a jewel, silver, a mirror, and so on is empty of being one or many,

original: pa gsal bar snang ba de bzhin du 'khrul ba'i mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: pa gsal bar snang ba de bzhin du 'khrul ba'i mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: and yet it appears clearly, in the same way, the cognition of the illusion-like nature of things, which is free from all signs of error, free from all apprehended objects and so on,

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo zhes bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo zhes bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'thad pas so //
translated: appears as if it were an object of knowledge, although it is not tenable as a thing that is a cause or an effect.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas stong pa nyid kyis na ma rig pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas stong pa nyid kyis na ma rig pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual, free from ignorance, due to being empty of the concepts of attachment and so on.

original: so sor rang gis rig par bya ba ni mi slu bar so sor rang gis rig pa'o /
analyzed: so sor rang gis rig par bya ba ni mi slu bar so sor rang gis rig pa'o /
translated: It is to be personally experienced, personally experienced as non-deceptive.

original: ci zhig ltar 'ga' zhig gis kyang ste /
analyzed: ci zhig ltar 'ga' zhig gis kyang ste /
translated: In what way? By some.

original: yang dag par skyes na spong ngo zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag par skyes na spong ngo zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: If they were to arise in reality, they would be abandoned.

original: da ni ldog pa'i sgo nas tshig le'ur byas pa las ma smos pa'i don gyis 'phags pa ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /üîΩde lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ldog par khas mi len par gzhan dag gis gnyen po'i lam bsgoms pas chos de rnam pa cung zad kyang mi byed de nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spang
analyzed: da ni ldog pa'i sgo nas tshig le'ur byas pa las ma smos pa'i don gyis 'phags pa ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ldog par khas mi len par gzhan dag gis gnyen po'i lam bsgoms pas chos de rnam pa cung zad kyang mi byed de nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spang
translated: Now, in terms of reversal, the unstated meaning in the verse is stated in the commentary: ‚ÄúThe ƒÅryas are not like that.‚Äù

original: ba'i khyad par ci yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i khyad par ci yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot like that‚Äù means that they do not accept that afflictions and so on are reversed by the emptiness of essence. Others say that if the path of the antidote is cultivated, those phenomena are not made in the least bit nonactive, and no difference at all is produced in the abandonment of the afflictions and so on.

original: ji lta bu zhe na nam mkha' bzhin du ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na nam mkha' bzhin du ste /
translated: How is this? It is like space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la rdzas med pa tsam gyis ngo bo la khyad par gang gis kyang 'phel ba dang 'bri ba'i bdag nyid can gyi khyad par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la rdzas med pa tsam gyis ngo bo la khyad par gang gis kyang 'phel ba dang 'bri ba'i bdag nyid can gyi khyad par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Just as space, which is the mere absence of matter, has no nature that can be made different by any increase or decrease,

original: rtag pa nyid kyis don dam par ngo bo nyid de lta bur yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis don dam par ngo bo nyid de lta bur yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of its permanence, it exists ultimately with such an essence.

original: de bzhin du phyi dang nang gi mu stegs pa la grags pa'i dpe yin pa de smras pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi dang nang gi mu stegs pa la grags pa'i dpe yin pa de smras pa ni /
translated: Similarly, he states the example that is renowned to non-Buddhist philosophers, both internal and external:

original: de la nam mkha' bsgribs pa med pa @232a * //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' bsgribs pa med pa @232a * //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace is unobstructed.‚ÄùüîΩIn the tenets of the internal non-Buddhist philosophers, it is said to be

original: zhes bya ba nang gi mu stegs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las dus thams cad du ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nang gi mu stegs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las dus thams cad du ste /
translated: always,üîΩin every way, space.

original: rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha'i zhes bya ba ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar gsog yin pa nyid la de rnams kyi 'thad pa dang rdzas su btags pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha'i zhes bya ba ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar gsog yin pa nyid la de rnams kyi 'thad pa dang rdzas su btags pa yin te /
translated: Like the horn of a rabbit, it is a mere heap, and they impute it as a substance.

original: de ni rdzas med pa tsam gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa bzhin du zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rdzas med pa tsam gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa bzhin du zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: It is said to be like the mere nonexistence of a substance.

original: phyi rol gyi mu stegs kyi phyogs ni rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa med pa tsam gyi ngo bo yin la nang gi mu stegs pa'i phyogs ltar na yang gzugs la sogs pa spyi dang khyad par med pa tsam gyi ngo bo khyad par med pa namüîΩmkha' ji ltar 'dzin pa de bzhin du skyed du med pa ste /üîΩgzhal du med pa dang / spang du med pa dang bsal du med par rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mu stegs kyi phyogs ni rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa med pa tsam gyi ngo bo yin la nang gi mu stegs pa'i phyogs ltar na yang gzugs la sogs pa spyi dang khyad par med pa tsam gyi ngo bo khyad par med pa nam mkha' ji ltar 'dzin pa de bzhin du skyed du med pa ste / gzhal du med pa dang / spang du med pa dang bsal du med par rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The internal tƒ´rthika position is the mere nature of the nondifferentiation of form and so on, which is apprehended like space.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de 'dzin cing bdag nyid kyi ngo bor bdag gir byed pas chos rnams kyi 'dzin pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de 'dzin cing bdag nyid kyi ngo bor bdag gir byed pas chos rnams kyi 'dzin pa nyid de /
translated: The nature of that is apprehended and taken as one‚Äôs own entity.

original: yang dag pa nyid med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i skad cig ma skye ba tsam du gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i skad cig ma skye ba tsam du gnas pa yin la /
translated: Since there is no reality, the apprehended and the apprehender are merely present as the mere arising of instants.

original: de ni shes pa tsam gyi ngo bor zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni shes pa tsam gyi ngo bor zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: That is said to be the entity of mere consciousness.

original: 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bos stong pa rnams dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid rnams te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bos stong pa rnams dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid rnams te /
translated: If the characteristics of objects of knowledge,

original: de'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i bdag nyid rnams gal te don dam par bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis yod pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i bdag nyid rnams gal te don dam par bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis yod pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: the causes of those, such as form, and so on, which are the entities of apprehended objects, were to exist ultimately, in the sense of not being fabricated, then nothing would be done.üîΩ  The characteristics of the antidotes, the path, would not exist in the past and future, because the characteristics of the present aggregates that are afflicted would not exist.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi phung po'i mtshan nyid la gnyen po lam gyi mtshan nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med pas de skye ba'i skad cig ma yang da ltar gyi skad cig ma ni med pa nyid yin pa'i phyirüîΩcung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba nam mkha' rtag pa dang 'dra bar chos rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi phung po'i mtshan nyid la gnyen po lam gyi mtshan nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med pas de skye ba'i skad cig ma yang da ltar gyi skad cig ma ni med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba nam mkha' rtag pa dang 'dra bar chos rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na yang /
translated: Since the present moment of the arising of those aggregates would not exist,üîΩnothing would be done.

original: phul du byung ba'i byed pa med pa na khyad par ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i byed pa med pa na khyad par ci zhig yod de /
translated: If phenomena are momentary, like permanent space, and there is no special function, what is the point of the path?

original: ci yang med pas khyed cag gi phyogs ltar bsgom pa ni 'bras bu med pa dang / chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ma shes par gyur pa gang gis bzlog ces bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ci yang med pas khyed cag gi phyogs ltar bsgom pa ni 'bras bu med pa dang / chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ma shes par gyur pa gang gis bzlog ces bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since there is nothing at all, meditation according to your position is fruitless, and since you do not understand the nature of phenomena, how could you reverse it?üîΩThis is the thought.üîΩAnd this is what is explained in the following:

original: de yang / ji ltar ri mo mkhan gyis ni //
analyzed: de yang / ji ltar ri mo mkhan gyis ni //
translated: Just as a painter,

original: gnod sbyin 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: gnod sbyin 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs //
translated: having drawn a terrifying yak·π£a spirit,

original: bris nas bdag nyid skrag pa ltar //
analyzed: bris nas bdag nyid skrag pa ltar //
translated: is himself frightened,

original: 'khor bar mi mkhas de bzhin no //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lan gyi @232b zur gyis yang /
analyzed: 'khor bar mi mkhas de bzhin no // zhes gang bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lan gyi @232b zur gyis yang /
translated: so the unwise are in cyclic existence.üîΩThe meaning of the verse in the root text is stated in the following:

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las smos pa'i don ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las smos pa'i don ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir dngos po ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir dngos po ste /
translated: because it is so,üîΩone should not cling to

original: gzugs la sogs pa de la mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de la mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: things, such as form.

original: yang dag pa'i blor gyur pa de nyid phyin ci log yin zhing mi 'thad pa nyid kyis na de mi ldog pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i blor gyur pa de nyid phyin ci log yin zhing mi 'thad pa nyid kyis na de mi ldog pas /
translated: Since that very clinging to things, such as form, as real is mistaken and untenable, it is not reversed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas skabs su yang gnas pa yin la des na gang bcom ldan 'das te rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs shing gzung ba la sogs pa 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas skabs su yang gnas pa yin la des na gang bcom ldan 'das te rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs shing gzung ba la sogs pa 'gog pa dang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is also abiding in the state of the BhagavƒÅn. Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has completely abandoned the obscurations to omniscience along with their imprints, and he has ceased all apprehended objects and so on.üîΩThose who assert that phenomena, such as forms, exist and that they ultimately exist are accepting a meaning that is mutually contradictory.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.

original: chos rnams te gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang yod par khas len cing don dam par yod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don khas len pa ni /
analyzed: chos rnams te gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang yod par khas len cing don dam par yod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don khas len pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.üîΩTherefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.üîΩTherefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.üîΩTherefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.üîΩTherefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.

original: kho bos ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byas pas ya mtshan du rtsis te /üîΩlog pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yang gal te nyon mongs pa ldog par gyur na de'i tshe so so'i skye po rnams dang ci'i phyir ma gyur ces /üîΩ'phags pa byams pas dgongs so //
analyzed: kho bos ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byas pas ya mtshan du rtsis te / log pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yang gal te nyon mongs pa ldog par gyur na de'i tshe so so'i skye po rnams dang ci'i phyir ma gyur ces / 'phags pa byams pas dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.üîΩTherefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.

original: rgyu mchog nyid las 'bras bu mchog tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu mchog nyid las 'bras bu mchog tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.üîΩTherefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.üîΩTherefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddha, has directly perceived the meaning of suchness, and he has directly perceived the meaning of the scriptures that teach suchness.

original: ko tra pa'i sa bon las s'a lu'i myu gu dang 'dra bar gzhan las ma yin no zhes thams cad kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa 'di ni mchog ma yin pa'i dngos po la lta bas
analyzed: ko tra pa'i sa bon las s'a lu'i myu gu dang 'dra bar gzhan las ma yin no zhes thams cad kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa 'di ni mchog ma yin pa'i dngos po la lta bas
translated: Therefore, this supreme result of the abandonment of the afflictions is not a view of a non supreme thing,

original: dri ma can du byas pa'i mthong ba'i lam las rung ba ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma can du byas pa'i mthong ba'i lam las rung ba ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: and it should be understood that it is not suitable to be seen as defiled.

original: dbu ma'i rgyan las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rgyan las /
translated: In the Ornament of the Middle Way,üîΩit says:

original: rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las ni //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las ni //
translated: From a pure cause,

original: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa 'byung //üîΩyang dag ltas byung tshul khrims kyi //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa 'byung // yang dag ltas byung tshul khrims kyi //
translated: a pure result arises.üîΩLike the purity of the branches of ethical discipline

original: yan lag la sogs pa rnam dag bzhin //
analyzed: yan lag la sogs pa rnam dag bzhin //
translated: and so on that arise from right view.

original: zhes bya ba dang / rnam 'grel las //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / rnam 'grel las //
translated: And in the Thorough Exposition of Valid Knowledge, it says:üîΩThrough training in this for a long time

original: lan 'ga' thabs ni rnam pa zhig / dus kyang mang du 'di yis ni //
analyzed: lan 'ga' thabs ni rnam pa zhig / dus kyang mang du 'di yis ni //
translated: in some way and in some circumstances,üîΩthe faults and good qualities

original: bslabs pas de la yon tan dang // nyes pa bsal bar gyur ba yin //
analyzed: bslabs pas de la yon tan dang // nyes pa bsal bar gyur ba yin //
translated: in that person will be eliminated.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de ltar yod pa'i phyogs bsal bas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' mi bden pa'i grub pa'i mtha' nyid du bstan nas /üîΩngo bo nyid med pa'i phyogs thams cad du 'gro ba'i @233a * //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa'i phyogs bsal bas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' mi bden pa'i grub pa'i mtha' nyid du bstan nas / ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyogs thams cad du 'gro ba'i @233a * //
translated: Thus, by eliminating the position of existence, he teaches that the tenets of apprehended objects and so on are not real tenets.

original: bdag med pa'i grub pa'i mtha' brtan por mdzad cing nges par byas nas /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i grub pa'i mtha' brtan por mdzad cing nges par byas nas /
translated: He makes the position of selflessness firm and definite in all positions of nonentityness.üîΩHe says that those who desire liberation should accept this alone.

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di kho na khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa rnams kyis dngos po thams cad bdag med pa'i phyogs 'di kho na rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khas blang bar bya'o zhes gnas pa'i
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di kho na khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa rnams kyis dngos po thams cad bdag med pa'i phyogs 'di kho na rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khas blang bar bya'o zhes gnas pa'i
translated: Those who desire complete enlightenment should accept this position of the selflessness of all things alone, because it is reasonable.

original: phyogs te / nges pa grub pa'i mtha' bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa ni /üîΩ'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs te / nges pa grub pa'i mtha' bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa ni / 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the position of the conclusion. The intermediate verse of conclusion says:üîΩHere there is nothing to be removed

original: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: And not the slightest to be added.

original: ces bya ba gang gi phyir grol ba mi 'thad pa'i rgyu des na nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyis don dam par yod pa la sogs par sgro btags pa'i de kho na nyid kyi lta ba gang yin pa de bsal bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba gang gi phyir grol ba mi 'thad pa'i rgyu des na nang gi mu stegs pa rnams kyis don dam par yod pa la sogs par sgro btags pa'i de kho na nyid kyi lta ba gang yin pa de bsal bar bya ba dang /
translated: Because of that reason, the view of reality imputed by the internal tƒ´rthikas as ultimate existence and so on is to be eliminated.

original: bsnan par bya ba cung zad med ces bya bas ni phyi rol pa'i mu stegs pa rnams kyis bdag la sogs pa sgro btags pa gang yin pa des bstan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bsnan par bya ba cung zad med ces bya bas ni phyi rol pa'i mu stegs pa rnams kyis bdag la sogs pa sgro btags pa gang yin pa des bstan par mi bya ste /
translated: Because of the statement ‚Äúthere is nothing to be added,‚Äù the self imputed by the external tƒ´rthikas and so on is not to be taught.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i lta ba'i tshul la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i lta ba'i tshul la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe way of the view of the conventional and the ultimate‚Äù and so on is a remainder.

original: med par lta ba bsal ba ni yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: med par lta ba bsal ba ni yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The elimination of the view of nonexistence is stated by ‚Äúreality‚Äù and so on.

original: yang dag pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid kyis yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid kyis yang dag pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú In reality‚Äù means in reality by way of dependent origination.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du grags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa blta bar bya zhing shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du grags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa blta bar bya zhing shes par bya'o //
translated: Form and so on, which are renowned as they are, are to be seen and known.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: If one sees reality, one is liberated.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid sgom par byed pa ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pas sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //üîΩtshig le'ur byas pa 'di nyid kyi don ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid sgom par byed pa ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pas sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro // tshig le'ur byas pa 'di nyid kyi don ni /
translated: If one meditates on the reality of things, one becomes a Buddha, because one abandons the afflictions together with their propensities.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this very verse is stated in the words ‚Äúbecause‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bshad ma thag pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa las grol bar mi 'thad cing byang chub pa mi rung ba rgyu de'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bshad ma thag pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa las grol bar mi 'thad cing byang chub pa mi rung ba rgyu de'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa ste /
translated: Because it is not tenable that one is liberated from the adherence to the things just explained, and because it is not possible to attain enlightenment, for that reason one deprecates,

original: bdag med pa la gnod pa byed pa'i don dam par yod pa la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa la gnod pa byed pa'i don dam par yod pa la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: that is, one harms selflessness, and one superimposes, that is, one posits the essence of ultimate existence and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid yod par dogs pa bsal na gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i tshad mas de kho na nyid mthong bas bsal cing chos gang la yang bdag la sogs pas gnod pa kun rdzob dang don dam par ma @233b byas par 'di nyid shes
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par dogs pa bsal na gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i tshad mas de kho na nyid mthong bas bsal cing chos gang la yang bdag la sogs pas gnod pa kun rdzob dang don dam par ma @233b byas par 'di nyid shes
translated: If one removes the doubt that they have an essence, then one will know that all phenomena are not harmed either conventionally or ultimately by the self, etc.,

original: par gyur pa na ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las kun tu 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: par gyur pa na ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las kun tu 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa ste /
translated: and that they are produced from the twelve branches, such as ignorance, by seeing reality with valid knowledge, such as the nature of being one or different.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin zhing kun rdzob tu yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid de tha snyad du dben pa rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin zhing kun rdzob tu yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid de tha snyad du dben pa rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are dependently arisen and are not essentially real even conventionally, and are devoid of conventional reality, being essenceless.

original: sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bor brtag par bya zhing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bor brtag par bya zhing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should investigate and meditate on their nature as being like an illusion.

original: 'dis cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of doing this?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgyu ma'i glang pos sgyu ma'i glang po gzhan zhig pham par byas pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar brdzun gyis glang po dang 'thab pa ni zil gyis mnan pa de bzhin du phyin ci log pas zhes brdzun gyi lam gyis brdzun gyi bdag tu ltaüîΩba las skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'i phyin ci log spong ba'i rgyus na de kho na nyid mthong ba na ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang pos sgyu ma'i glang po gzhan zhig pham par byas pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar brdzun gyis glang po dang 'thab pa ni zil gyis mnan pa de bzhin du phyin ci log pas zhes brdzun gyi lam gyis brdzun gyi bdag tu lta ba las skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'i phyin ci log spong ba'i rgyus na de kho na nyid mthong ba na ste /
translated: Just as an illusory elephant defeats another illusory elephant, so too, through the path of falsity, one abandons the false view of a self that arises from the afflictions.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i bdag med pa mthong zhing mos pa ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i bdag med pa mthong zhing mos pa ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one sees reality, one sees and is convinced of the selflessness that is omnipresent, and one becomes liberated.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the perfect wisdom.

original: bdag cag gi phyogs ltar na chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin la de bas na nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgyu ma lam gyi sgyu mas ldog pa yin pas dngos po de kho na nyid la re bar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen por gyur
analyzed: bdag cag gi phyogs ltar na chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin la de bas na nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgyu ma lam gyi sgyu mas ldog pa yin pas dngos po de kho na nyid la re bar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen por gyur
translated: According to our standpoint, all phenomena are like illusions. Therefore, the illusion of the afflictions and so on is stopped by the illusion of the path. Thus, in terms of reality, there is no difference between the object of negation and the means of negation.

original: pa med do //
analyzed: pa med do //
translated: There is no such fault.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la sngar smras pa'i thar pa mi 'thad pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la sngar smras pa'i thar pa mi 'thad pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, we do not have the fault of the untenability of liberation as previously stated.

original: mya ngan 'das min mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das min mya ngan 'das //
translated: Liberation is not non-liberation.

original: 'jig rten mgon gyis bstan pa ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon gyis bstan pa ni //
translated: The protector of the world taught

original: nam mkhas byas pa'i mdud pa 'di //
analyzed: nam mkhas byas pa'i mdud pa 'di //
translated: This knot tied by space

original: nam mkha' nyid kyis bkrol ba yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid kyis bkrol ba yin /
translated: Is untied by space itself.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag phan tshun te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag phan tshun te /
translated: As such, etc. Those six perfections are mutually,

original: gcig la gcig bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gcig la gcig bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: one in the other, included.

original: snga ma bzhin du khongs su gtogs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa de re re la zhes bya ba so so re re zhing skad cig ma gcig pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du khongs su gtogs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa de re re la zhes bya ba so so re re zhing skad cig ma gcig pa ste /
translated: As before, each of those included, such as generosity, etc., is momentary,

original: skad cig ma gcig tu byung ba'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig tu byung ba'i bzod pa ste /
translated: arising in a single moment.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa des bsdus shing de dang 'brel ba'i sems kyi khyad par gang yin pa de ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa @234a * //üîΩ'dir mthong ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa des bsdus shing de dang 'brel ba'i sems kyi khyad par gang yin pa de ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa @234a * // 'dir mthong ba'i lam yin te /
translated: The distinctive thought that is included in and related to the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering is the clear realization of the summit.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spong bar mthong ba'i thabs su rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spong bar mthong ba'i thabs su rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Here, the path of seeing is presented as the method for seeing the abandonment of the afflictions and so on together with their imprints.üîΩThe rest is as above.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgenerosity and so on‚Äù is an explanation.

original: lan cig rnam par rtog pa du ma 'byung ba ni 'gal ba nyid yin gyi yul du ma la rnam par rtog pa gcig 'byung ba ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: lan cig rnam par rtog pa du ma 'byung ba ni 'gal ba nyid yin gyi yul du ma la rnam par rtog pa gcig 'byung ba ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is contradictory for many thoughts to arise at one time, but it is not contradictory for one thought to arise with many objects.

original: shin tu mang bas ma bslabs pas de ltar srid pa'i phyir yang dag par rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug nyid yin na yang sbyin pa la sogs pa tshogs pa'i yul gyi skad cig ma gcig la bzod pa gcig ni /üîΩsems gcig gi bdag nyid can gyis mthong ba'i lam yang skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin pa la 'gal ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: shin tu mang bas ma bslabs pas de ltar srid pa'i phyir yang dag par rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug nyid yin na yang sbyin pa la sogs pa tshogs pa'i yul gyi skad cig ma gcig la bzod pa gcig ni / sems gcig gi bdag nyid can gyis mthong ba'i lam yang skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin pa la 'gal ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since there are many, it is possible that one who is not trained would think that there are thirty six aspects.üîΩHowever, the intention is that although there are thirty six aspects, there is no contradiction in the fact that the path of seeing, which has the nature of a single moment of mind, is the cause of perfect enlightenment in a single moment, since it is the single patience of the stage of completion of the perfection of generosity and so on.

original: da ni mthong ba'i lam skyes par ma gtogs pa'i dgongs pa brjod nas spong ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam las bsgom pa'i lam tha dad pa nyid yin na yang bshad ma thag pa'i spang ba la dbang du byas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam brjod par rigs
analyzed: da ni mthong ba'i lam skyes par ma gtogs pa'i dgongs pa brjod nas spong ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam las bsgom pa'i lam tha dad pa nyid yin na yang bshad ma thag pa'i spang ba la dbang du byas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam brjod par rigs
translated: Now, having stated the intention of the Abhidharmakosa that the path of seeing is not generated, it is appropriate to explain the path of meditation that is distinct from the path of seeing, since it is the result of elimination.

original: pa yin no yang gang gis de don dang bcas pas re zhig de bstan pas ni de skyes pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: pa yin no yang gang gis de don dang bcas pas re zhig de bstan pas ni de skyes pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Also, since that is meaningful, he says, ‚ÄúWhen that is generated,‚Äù etc.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skyed mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skyed mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ste /
translated: Ignorance, compositional activity, consciousness, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death.

original: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni /
translated: The twelve limbs of existence are:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba nyid go rims kyis bdag med pa bsgom pa ni lugs su 'byung bar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba nyid go rims kyis bdag med pa bsgom pa ni lugs su 'byung bar bsgom pa'o //
translated: The so-called dependent origination itself is cultivated in order by the cultivation of selflessness.

original: de bzhin du tha ma nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tha ma nas brtsams te /
translated: Similarly, beginning from the end,

original: go bzlog nas bsgom pa ni lugs dang mi mthun pa bsgom pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: go bzlog nas bsgom pa ni lugs dang mi mthun pa bsgom pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: the cultivation of the reverse order should be understood as the cultivation of the reverse order.

original: de yang mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni bsal te /üîΩnyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de yang mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni bsal te / nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The commentary on the chapter called ‚ÄúThe Lion‚Äôs Play‚Äù begins with the words ‚ÄúSeeing, hearing, and so on‚Äù and so forth.

original: seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It is the meditative absorption called ‚ÄúThe Lion‚Äôs Play‚Äù because it is not overwhelmed by the afflictions.

original: ma rig pa la sogs @234b pa'i go rims ni don gyi dbang las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs @234b pa'i go rims ni don gyi dbang las shes par bya ste /
translated: The order of ignorance and so on should be understood according to the meaning.

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: In the Abhidharma it is said:

original: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
translated: Ignorance is the state prior to the afflictions.

original: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi //
analyzed: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi //
translated: Formation is prior to the karma.

original: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin //
analyzed: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin //
translated: Consciousness is the aggregate at conception.

original: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
translated: Name and form are from that point forward.

original: skye mched drug dod tshun chad do //
analyzed: skye mched drug dod tshun chad do //
translated: The six sense spheres are until the sense faculties are complete.

original: de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do //üîΩreg pa bde sdug la sogs kyi //üîΩrgyu shes nus pa tshun chad do //
analyzed: de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do // reg pa bde sdug la sogs kyi // rgyu shes nus pa tshun chad do //
translated: Contact is until the three meet.üîΩSensation is until the ability to recognize pleasure and pain.

original: tshor 'khrig tshun chad sred pa ni //
analyzed: tshor 'khrig tshun chad sred pa ni //
translated: Craving is until the ability to pursue objects.

original: longs spyod 'khrig pa'i chags can gyi //üîΩnye bar len pa longs spyod rnams //üîΩthob par bya phyir yongs rgyug pa'i //
analyzed: longs spyod 'khrig pa'i chags can gyi // nye bar len pa longs spyod rnams // thob par bya phyir yongs rgyug pa'i //
translated: The attachment of those who are attached to enjoymentüîΩis the appropriation of enjoyments.üîΩThey run around for the sake of obtaining enjoyments.üîΩ

original: de yi 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur ba'i //üîΩlas byed de ni srid pa yin //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur ba'i // las byed de ni srid pa yin //

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba skye ba yin //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba skye ba yin //

original: tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin //
translated: The karma that is to arise is existence.üîΩThe karma that is to arise is the result of the karma that is to arise.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: The karma that is to arise is existence.üîΩThe karma that is to arise is the result of the karma that is to arise.

analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i shin tu 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa shin tu mi skyed pa'o //
translated: The karma that is to arise is the result of the karma that is to arise.üîΩThe karma that is to arise is existence.üîΩThe karma that is to arise is the result of the karma that is to arise.üîΩThe karma that is to arise is existence.üîΩThe karma that is to arise is the result of the karma that is to arise.

analyzed: rten sgrub pa mngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gzhi med pa la spong ba la sogs pa mi 'thad pas de la brten pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba yin no //

analyzed: go sla ba ni rtogs sla ba'o //

original: zhes bya ba'i rgyus rten te spong ba la sogs pa'i gzhi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rgyus rten te spong ba la sogs pa'i gzhi /
translated: The path of cultivation is the basis of the abandonment of the cause of the origin of suffering, etc.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'gog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'gog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The path of cultivation is the basis of the abandonment of the cause of the origin of suffering, etc.

original: dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / byol song dang / mi dang / 'dod pa'i lha drug ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / byol song dang / mi dang / 'dod pa'i lha drug ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The desire realm consists of the hells, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, and six types of desire realm gods.

original: 'dod pa der gtogs pa ni skye bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa der gtogs pa ni skye bas thob pa'o //
translated: The desire realm gods are those who obtain their status by birth.

original: rnam par shes pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Unconcentrated consciousness is conceptual consciousness.

original: mtshams bzung ste zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams pa'i skye bo rnams las 'tshang rgya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar bzung zhing rnam par gzhag pas 'gog pa dang bcas pa'i snyoms 'jug dgu zhes gong ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtshams bzung ste zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams pa'i skye bo rnams las 'tshang rgya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar bzung zhing rnam par gzhag pas 'gog pa dang bcas pa'i snyoms 'jug dgu zhes gong ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúup to‚Äù means that the nine meditative attainments together with cessation are posited as the basis of the abandonment of the cause of the origin of suffering, etc., because they are the basis for the attainment of Buddhahood by beings in the desire realm.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te 'gog pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te 'gog pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
translated: The meaning is this: the four meditative attainments together with cessation and the four formless meditative attainments.

original: dgu'i nang nas bsam gtan dang po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dgu'i nang nas bsam gtan dang po nas brtsams te /
translated: From among the nine meditative attainments, beginning with the first absorption,

original: rim pa bzhin du bsgoms pas 'gog pa'i bar du song la 'ongs nas @235a * //üîΩzhes bya ba 'gog pa dang bcas pa'i snyoms 'jug dgur song nas zhes 'dir rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩdes na don ni 'di yin te tha ma 'gog pa nas brtsams te lugs las bzlog pa bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ongs nas yang snyoms par 'jug pa dgu pho de dag nyid kyi nang nas rnam pa gnyis su ste /

original: 'gog pa'i bar du mi 'dra bar 'gro /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bar du mi 'dra bar 'gro /
translated: It proceeds in a non-orderly way up to cessation.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rim pa dag gis 'gog pa mngon par khyab par byas pa go rims ma yin par 'gro ba de ni 'dir bsgom pa'i lam nyid yin par bshad do zhes bya bar shes
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rim pa dag gis 'gog pa mngon par khyab par byas pa go rims ma yin par 'gro ba de ni 'dir bsgom pa'i lam nyid yin par bshad do zhes bya bar shes
translated: This is the path of cultivation.

original: par bya'o // tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: par bya'o // tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows:üîΩThe bodhisattva, having gone from the first concentration up to cessation,üîΩand having taken hold of the mind distracted by the conceptual thoughts of the desire realm,

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste 'gog pa'i bar du song nas zhes bya ba nas 'dod pa mi dge ba'o zhes smos pas 'dod khams pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems nas nye bar gzung ba byas nas gzugs khams su gtogs pa'i sems kyis
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste 'gog pa'i bar du song nas zhes bya ba nas 'dod pa mi dge ba'o zhes smos pas 'dod khams pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems nas nye bar gzung ba byas nas gzugs khams su gtogs pa'i sems kyis
translated: with a mind belonging to the form realm,

original: bsam gtan dang po mngon sum du byas pa 'gog pa'i bar du song nas zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po mngon sum du byas pa 'gog pa'i bar du song nas zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: manifests the first concentration up to cessation.üîΩIn the same way,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang de bzhin du /
translated: The second, third, and fourth absorptions are also like this.

original: gzugs med khams la gnas med de //
analyzed: gzugs med khams la gnas med de //
translated: The formless realm has no location.

original: skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Birth is of four types.

original: zhes smos pa gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i sems nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched do //
analyzed: zhes smos pa gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i sems nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched do //
translated: The formless realm includes the minds of space, consciousness, nothingness, and neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: de'i 'og tu ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: After that, cessation.üîΩThe explanation of ‚Äúthen gradually returning‚Äù and so on is that after that, beginning with cessation, one returns up to the first absorption, meditating in the reverse order.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis song nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa ni de'i 'og tu 'gog pa nas bzung ste bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ongs te zhes bya ba rgyun du lugs dang mi mthun par bsgoms pas bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ongs
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis song nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa ni de'i 'og tu 'gog pa nas bzung ste bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ongs te zhes bya ba rgyun du lugs dang mi mthun par bsgoms pas bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ongs
translated: One returns up to the first absorption.

original: pa ni 'gog pa dang bcas @235b pa'i snyoms 'jug dgur 'ongs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ni 'gog pa dang bcas @235b pa'i snyoms 'jug dgur 'ongs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains ‚Äúreturning up to the nine meditative attainments including cessation‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rim gyis lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rim pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la song zhing zhes bya ba bsam gtan dang po nas brtsams te /üîΩ'gog pa'i bar du ni lugs dang mthun pa yin la 'gog pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rim gyis lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rim pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la song zhing zhes bya ba bsam gtan dang po nas brtsams te / 'gog pa'i bar du ni lugs dang mthun pa yin la 'gog pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, he has gone to the nine meditative attainments characterized by the four absorptions, the four formless states, and cessation, by the two modes of proceeding in forward and reverse order.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i bar du lugs dang mi mthun par 'ongs te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩyang de bzhin du rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa dor ba ni 'ongs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i bar du lugs dang mi mthun par 'ongs te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // yang de bzhin du rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa dor ba ni 'ongs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: He has come from the first absorption to cessation in forward order and from cessation to the first absorption in reverse order.

original: 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar dang por song ba las so //
analyzed: 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar dang por song ba las so //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúhe has come.‚ÄùüîΩAgain, he has come from the formless realm to the first absorption and so on, by discarding two and so on.üîΩHe has come from the formless realm to the first absorption and so on, by discarding two and so on.

original: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas gcig la sogs pa bor nas zhes bya ba gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa bor bas so //üîΩ'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la thub pa'i bar du mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas 'gro ba ni bsgom pa'i rim gyis rab tu 'gro ba'i rgyus mi 'dra bar 'gro ba thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa nyams smad
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas gcig la sogs pa bor nas zhes bya ba gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa bor bas so // 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la thub pa'i bar du mi 'dra ba'i sgo nas 'gro ba ni bsgom pa'i rim gyis rab tu 'gro ba'i rgyus mi 'dra bar 'gro ba thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa nyams smad
translated: By the process explained, one should pass over one, two, three, etc.,

original: par byed pa'i bsam gtan gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: par byed pa'i bsam gtan gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The leaping meditative attainment is a special meditative stabilization that weakens the afflictions together with their latencies, by the process of going in a non-gradual way, i.e., by the process of cultivation, up to the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: dbang pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni sems dbang du byed pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba'i don gyi phyir go cha bgos pas mngon sum du byed pa yin pas na bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: dbang pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni sems dbang du byed pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba'i don gyi phyir go cha bgos pas mngon sum du byed pa yin pas na bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
translated: The nature of the controlling power is the mastery of mind. It is manifested by the Bodhisattva who has donned the armor for the sake of the world. Therefore, it is on the path of cultivation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad du sems la dbang ba nyid kyis na rgyal po chen po dang 'dra bar 'dod pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir mi 'dra bar 'gro ba ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin par shes par bya la khyad
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad du sems la dbang ba nyid kyis na rgyal po chen po dang 'dra bar 'dod pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir mi 'dra bar 'gro ba ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin par shes par bya la khyad
translated: Since it is like a great king who enters the desire realm by the power of his mind over all meditative attainment, it is known as the meditative attainment of the lion's sport.

original: par can rnams ni khyad par gyi lam kho na yin pas thod rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rigs kyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: par can rnams ni khyad par gyi lam kho na yin pas thod rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rigs kyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the special meditative attainments are the special path alone, this leaping concentration is for bodhisattvas and not for others.üîΩThe leaping meditative attainmentüîΩis the eight levels, two types,

original: sa brgyad rnam pa gnyis 'brel dang // gcig brgal song zhing 'ongs nas ni //
analyzed: sa brgyad rnam pa gnyis 'brel dang // gcig brgal song zhing 'ongs nas ni //
translated: skipping one and going and returning.

original: ris mi mthun par gsum par 'gro //üîΩthod rgal gyi ni snyoms 'jug yin //
analyzed: ris mi mthun par gsum par 'gro // thod rgal gyi ni snyoms 'jug yin //
translated: It goes to the third level of a different type.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis bshad pa'i thod rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin ni 'dir skabs ma @236a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis bshad pa'i thod rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin ni 'dir skabs ma @236a * //
translated: This leaping concentration explained here is not the context of the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: mgo smos pa dang rnam par spros pas shes pa kha sbub la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba dag la lung nye bar ston pas mdor bsdus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: mgo smos pa dang rnam par spros pas shes pa kha sbub la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba dag la lung nye bar ston pas mdor bsdus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis yin no //
translated: The two concepts are abridged and so on, which are taught in the scriptures to those who are free from the faults of inverted understanding and so on, by mentioning the head and elaborating.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i don ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i don ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning explained is generosity and so on.

original: de rnams nan tan du mi byed pa ni sgrub par mi byed sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstangs pa ni mgon du bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams nan tan du mi byed pa ni sgrub par mi byed sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstangs pa ni mgon du bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Not practicing them is not accomplishing them. Protected by the buddhas means being taken as a protector.

original: des yongs su ma bzung zhing bdag gir ma mdzad pa ni de'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: des yongs su ma bzung zhing bdag gir ma mdzad pa ni de'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Not being taken as such, not being made one's own, is another concept.

original: byung ba dang 'gag pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa kun tu byung ba rnams rang gi ngang gis 'jig pas sbyor ba'i lam gyi yon tan gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni med pa ste /
analyzed: byung ba dang 'gag pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa kun tu byung ba rnams rang gi ngang gis 'jig pas sbyor ba'i lam gyi yon tan gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni med pa ste /
translated: By the very arising and ceasing means that the afflictions that arise are naturally destroyed, so the qualities of the path of preparation are free from the characteristic of non-existence.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba nyid kyis ni gcig la byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo gnyis mi 'thad pas med pa'am ngo bo nyid gnyis las 'das pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir dang ma 'ongs pa ni rang gi ngo
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba nyid kyis ni gcig la byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo gnyis mi 'thad pas med pa'am ngo bo nyid gnyis las 'das pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir dang ma 'ongs pa ni rang gi ngo
translated: Since they are mutually exclusive, it is untenable that one thing has two natures, that of having arisen and that of arising. Therefore, since they are nonexistent or have a nature that transcends two natures, they are intrinsically perishable.

original: bor med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bor med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And since the future does not exist as its own nature,

original: yang dag par skye ba'i rgyu dang mi ldan pas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams ni yang dag pa'i skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par skye ba'i rgyu dang mi ldan pas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams ni yang dag pa'i skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is said that they are not endowed with the cause of real arising because afflicted entities do not arise in reality.

original: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyis 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyis 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúthat which is seen,‚Äù etc., future afflicted entities do not exist as their own nature.

original: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum 'gog par bya ba'i phyir lam gsum la 'jug pa dang // nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag par na yod pa ma yin pas yul med pa nyid kyis na lam gsum pa 'jug pa dus gsum gyi yon tan du @236b ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum 'gog par bya ba'i phyir lam gsum la 'jug pa dang // nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag par na yod pa ma yin pas yul med pa nyid kyis na lam gsum pa 'jug pa dus gsum gyi yon tan du @236b ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin
translated: Since the afflictions do not exist in reality, one thinks, How can the three paths that one enters be the qualities of the three times, since they are devoid of objects?üîΩThis is the general meaning.

original: te / dus gsum yon tan med pa dang zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: te / dus gsum yon tan med pa dang zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation is: The three times do not exist as qualities.

original: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa yod na mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i lam la sogs pa yod pa yin la //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa yod na mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i lam la sogs pa yod pa yin la //
translated: When there is the view of self and so on, there is the path of nirvana and so on.

original: de med pas sel ba'i lam med pa de ni phyin ci log ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de med pas sel ba'i lam med pa de ni phyin ci log ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Since that does not exist, the path of elimination does not exist. That is called misconception and so on.

original: phyin ci log zhi ba nyid la sogs pas bdag tu lta ba dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du sbyor ba'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log zhi ba nyid la sogs pas bdag tu lta ba dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du sbyor ba'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: The path of application for those who have the view of self and so on to attain nirvana is called the pacification of misconception and so on.

original: de la stong pa nyid du mngon par bsgrub pa nyid kyis bdag med pa'i ye shes thob pas mthong ba'i lam mo //üîΩrang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pas bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid du mngon par bsgrub pa nyid kyis bdag med pa'i ye shes thob pas mthong ba'i lam mo // rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pas bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The path of seeing is the attainment of the wisdom of selflessness by means of the direct realization of emptiness.üîΩThe path of meditation is the path of meditation on the reality of the absence of intrinsic reality, because there is no meditation, etc.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: on the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis ni //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis ni //
translated: The three kinds of conceptualization

original: legs pa'i lam ni rnam gsum la //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ni rnam gsum la //
translated: are the three good paths.

original: zhes bya ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: legs pa'i lam rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The three good paths are the three good paths.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is inclusive.

original: gnas skabs 'dir zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba nyid kyis dbang du bya ba'i gnas skabs su shin tu spang bar bya ba nyid kyis na /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba nyid kyis dbang du bya ba'i gnas skabs su shin tu spang bar bya ba nyid kyis na /
translated: In this situation, the situation of being controlled by what is to be abandoned, because of being what is to be abandoned,

original: bsgom pa'i lam sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs gang bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par dang po ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs gang bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par dang po ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is the uninterrupted engagement of the mind and mental factors in the special object that was explained previously as the occasion of preparation.

original: de'i yul can gzung ba rnam pa dgu ni chos bsdus pa la sogs pa ci rigs par blang ba dang dor ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can gzung ba rnam pa dgu ni chos bsdus pa la sogs pa ci rigs par blang ba dang dor ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The first of these is the nine aspects of the object that is grasped by the subject of that path, which is the conception of accepting and rejecting the various collections of Dharma, such as the Compendium of Dharma.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa ni spang bar bya ba nyid yin pas de ltar dang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa ni spang bar bya ba nyid yin pas de ltar dang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Since all conceptions are to be abandoned, the root text states, ‚ÄúThus, the first . . .‚Äù

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is stated in the root text with the words, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who is free from the spiritual friend . . . .‚Äù

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral bas yang dag pa'i man ngag ston pa dang dad pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral bas yang dag pa'i man ngag ston pa dang dad pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems mi skye ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is free from the spiritual friend and so on does not generate the thought of awakening because he or she lacks the correct instructions and lacks faith and so on.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de dmigs pas byang chub nyid ces bya ba yin pa'i phyir snying po yin pa'am /üîΩde mngon sum du @237a * //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de dmigs pas byang chub nyid ces bya ba yin pa'i phyir snying po yin pa'am / de mngon sum du @237a * //
translated: The merit which is distinguished by the complete purity of the three sectors, which is focused on the Buddha, is the essence because it is called the enlightenment of the object.

original: byed pa'i gnas skabs de yid la mi byed pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i gnas skabs de yid la mi byed pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the occasion of its realization is the non-apprehension of the object.

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The word only in the verse is to be supplied from the preceding section.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nyid yin pa'i phyir lam gyi 'bras bu mngon du byed pa re ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nyid yin pa'i phyir lam gyi 'bras bu mngon du byed pa re ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are of the lineages of the Sravaka and Pratyekabuddha, they have the hope of realizing the fruit of the path.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom has been explained previously.

original: de sgrub pa med pa ni nyams su lan pa dang bral bas yang dag pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la dmigs par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrub pa med pa ni nyams su lan pa dang bral bas yang dag pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la dmigs par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of its practice is the absence of the experience of the perfection of wisdom. The non-attention to perfect enlightenment is the non-apprehension of the object, i.e. the perfect Buddha.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzung ba la sogs pa la dmigs pas bsgom pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzung ba la sogs pa la dmigs pas bsgom pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since it has an objective reference, it is the meditative development of the objective supports of the apprehended object etc.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la gzung ba la sogs pa ma dmigs pas bsgom pa med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩdmigs pa yang med mi dmigs pa yang med pas zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa dang dmigs pa dag bsgom pa yang med sgom pa med pa yang ma yin pa ste /
