analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la gzung ba la sogs pa ma dmigs pas bsgom pa med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'o // dmigs pa yang med mi dmigs pa yang med pas zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa dang dmigs pa dag bsgom pa yang med sgom pa med pa yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: Since it is devoid of an objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa dang dmigs pa'o //üîΩphyin ci log la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa dang dmigs pa'o // phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: Since it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.üîΩSince it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension of the apprehended object etc. is not discerned.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni log pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni log pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: Since it is neither an objective reference nor non-objective reference, it is the meditative development of the non-apprehension of form etc. since the apprehension

original: gnas skabs de ni spang bar bya ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'i gnas skabs su shin tu spang bar bya ba nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: gnas skabs de ni spang bar bya ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'i gnas skabs su shin tu spang bar bya ba nyid yin pas so //
translated: The state of being abandoned is due to the fact that it is to be completely abandoned in the state of mastery.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi sngar bshad pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni khyad par can gyi shes pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi sngar bshad pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni khyad par can gyi shes pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind and mental factors that were previously explained in the path of cultivation are the special feelings, etc. of the knowledge of the superior.

original: de rnams kyi 'jug pa'i gnas skabs ni rgyun gyis skye ba'i khyad par gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'jug pa'i gnas skabs ni rgyun gyis skye ba'i khyad par gang yin pa ste /
translated: The state of their engagement is the special arising of the continuum.

original: de'i yul can ni de'i gzung bar bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can ni de'i gzung bar bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The subject of that is the object of that, etc.

original: 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rdzas su yod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rdzas su yod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: As for the apprehension, etc., the meaning of the verse is stated with the words substantially existent, etc.

original: rdzas su yod par mi skye bas zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod par skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod par mi skye bas zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod par skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not arise as substantially existent, it is not reasonable that it arise as ultimately existent.

original: sems can du btags pa ni gang zag la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: sems can du btags pa ni gang zag la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The designation of sentient beings is the convention of the person, etc.

original: snang ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don yod @237b par mi rung bas sems can nyid yin pa'i phyir chos su btags pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: snang ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don yod @237b par mi rung bas sems can nyid yin pa'i phyir chos su btags pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: Because it is exhausted as mere appearance means that since external objects are not possible, the designation of phenomena is form, etc.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang du yang mi gnas pas yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa gsum po'i chos sems skyed pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi stong pa nyid ma
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang du yang mi gnas pas yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa gsum po'i chos sems skyed pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi stong pa nyid ma
translated: Because it goes everywhere means that since it does not abide anywhere, it is not possible that it exists. The emptiness of those is the emptiness of all phenomena, such as the three, the knowledge of all things, etc.

original: yin pa nyid du yod pa'o //
analyzed: yin pa nyid du yod pa'o //
translated: It exists as nonexistence.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pas zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad du gzung ba la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa mi 'gog pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pas zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad du gzung ba la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa mi 'gog pas /
translated: Because one has not abandoned attachment to all aspects means that because one has not stopped attachment to all aspects, such as the apprehended,

original: chos la chags pa ste gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: chos la chags pa ste gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: one is attached to phenomena, that is, one is attached to form, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa med par shes pas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa gzugs la sogs pa'i char dbye ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa med par shes pas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa gzugs la sogs pa'i char dbye ba shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the discernment of phenomena that is the knowledge of the differentiation of form, etc. by the knowledge that form, etc. do not exist, through the realization that they lack intrinsic reality.

original: ched du bya ba mi byed pas zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum la mi dmigs pas dngos po'i ched du bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: ched du bya ba mi byed pas zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum la mi dmigs pas dngos po'i ched du bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: By not performing the function, one should understand the performance of the function of the entity, by not objectifying the three kinds of function previously explained.

original: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi don ston pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi don ston pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the objective support for the teaching of the meaning that has the nature of the internal and the external.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa med par gzugs la sogs pa mi shes pas theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa med par gzugs la sogs pa mi shes pas theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: By because of the non-objectification of form, etc., one should understand the three vehicles of definite emergence, because one does not know form, etc. without knowing the non-existence of the apprehended, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the actualization of the result of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yang dag par rab tu ma zhugs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa med par mngon sum du ma shes pas yon ma dag pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu ma zhugs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gzung ba la sogs pa med par mngon sum du ma shes pas yon ma dag pa ste /
translated: Because of not engaging in reality, i.e., because of not directly knowing the non-existence of the grasped, etc., the gift is impure.

original: slob ma la sogs pas byin pa'i rdzas la sogs pa rnam par mi sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: slob ma la sogs pas byin pa'i rdzas la sogs pa rnam par mi sbyong ba'o //
translated: The substances, etc., given by disciples, etc., are not purified.

original: sbyin pa la sogs par dmigs te sgrub pas zhes bya ba bsam gtan dang bsam bya dang gnyi ga la sogs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i shes pas spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs par dmigs te sgrub pas zhes bya ba bsam gtan dang bsam bya dang gnyi ga la sogs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i shes pas spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa ste /
translated: Because of accomplishing by objectifying giving, etc., i.e., because of the practice being disturbed by the consciousness which objectifies the entity of meditation, the object of meditation, both, etc.,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: there is attachment to the performance of giving, etc.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa nyid kyis na gnas skabs 'dir spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dzin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa nyid kyis na gnas skabs 'dir spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dzin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no
translated: As before, i.e., because of not being in accord with fact due to inverted attachment, in this context it is to be abandoned. Therefore, he says, ‚Äúgrasping, etc.‚Äù

original: // @238a * //  sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni sems can btags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: // @238a * //  sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni sems can btags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The verse text of the apprehender is stated with ‚Äúsentient beings, etc.‚Äù

original: sems can btags pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yod pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: sems can btags pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yod pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The designation of sentient beings is the convention of the existence of form, etc.

original: de'i rgyun ni tshul 'di la spyi'i don med pas shes pa tsam gang yin par de rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyun ni tshul 'di la spyi'i don med pas shes pa tsam gang yin par de rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Its continuum is the cause of the establishment of whatever is mere consciousness, since this mode lacks the meaning of generality.

original: de'i yul ni de'i gzung ba bsgom pa'i lam dang 'brel pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yul ni de'i gzung ba bsgom pa'i lam dang 'brel pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu spang bar bya'o //
translated: Its object is the other nine aspects that are related to the path of meditation and are to be abandoned as the counter conditions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na de la gnod pa byed pa yis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na de la gnod pa byed pa yis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why? It is said ‚Äúby the harm to that.‚Äù

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis te 'gog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis te 'gog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is by the path of meditation, because it is cessation.

original: don 'di nyid ni mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: This very meaning is stated with ‚Äúthe counter conditions, etc.‚Äù

original: sems can du btags pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yod pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: sems can du btags pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yod pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The designation of sentient beings is the convention of the existence of form, etc.

original: de rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir gang snang ba tsam ni phyi'i don yod par mi rung bas sems tsam mo //
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir gang snang ba tsam ni phyi'i don yod par mi rung bas sems tsam mo //
translated: In order to establish that, since mere appearance is not suitable as an external object, it is mind only.

original: de nyid ni rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa kho na tha snyad ma lus pa la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa kho na tha snyad ma lus pa la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the reason for positing the cause, because only the aspects of conceptualization engage in all conventions.

original: de'i yul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The subject of that is called the obscuration to omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse that begins ‚ÄúThe three omnisciences‚Äù and so on is stated in the verse that begins ‚ÄúAll aspects‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams kyi rnam pa yongs su ma shes pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgrib pa gang yin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la kun tu rmongs shingüîΩmi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams kyi rnam pa yongs su ma shes pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgrib pa gang yin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la kun tu rmongs shingüîΩmi shes pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot fully understanding all aspects‚Äù means that due to not fully understanding the aspects of internal and external things, one is confused and ignorant about the discordant class that is the obscuration to omniscience.

original: lam thams cad yongs su mi shes pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i lam gsum po ma shes pas lam shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa gang yin pa de mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: lam thams cad yongs su mi shes pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i lam gsum po ma shes pas lam shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa gang yin pa de mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to the knowledge of paths is the confusion about that adverse element which is the non-knowledge of all the paths, such as the three paths of the knowledge of all modes, etc.

original: gzhi thams cad yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba phyi nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po tsam yongs su ma shes pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa gang yin pa de la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi thams cad yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba phyi nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po tsam yongs su ma shes pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa gang yin pa de la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to the knowledge of all modes is the confusion about the mere non-knowledge of the bases, i.e., the mere non-knowledge of the entities which are of the nature of internal and external.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //üîΩde yongs su ma shes pas @238b thams cad zhi ba'i lam la kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snga ma bzhin no // de yongs su ma shes pas @238b thams cad zhi ba'i lam la kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is as before.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam mi shes pa'o //
translated: The confusion about the path of the pacification of all is the non-knowledge of the paths of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and perfect buddhas.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i shes bya dang de bzhin nyid dag tu yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid dag nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa la kunüîΩdu rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i shes bya dang de bzhin nyid dag tu yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid dag nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa la kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: One is confused about the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of suchness and so on, because one does not understand the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of suchness and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa dag la phrad pa dang 'bral ba mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa dag la phrad pa dang 'bral ba mi shes pa'o //
translated: One is confused about the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the equality of suchness and so on, because one does not understand the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the equality of suchness and so on.üîΩOne is confused about the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of suchness and so on, because one does not understand the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of suchness and so on.üîΩOne is confused about the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the equality of suchness and so on, because one does not understand the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the equality of suchness and so on.üîΩOne is confused about the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of suchness and so on, because one does not understand the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of suchness and so on.

original: bdud la sogs par rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba bdud dang phyir rgol ba dang dgra bo rnams dngos po med par ma shes pas mi mnyam pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: bdud la sogs par rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba bdud dang phyir rgol ba dang dgra bo rnams dngos po med par ma shes pas mi mnyam pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: One is confused about the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the equality of suchness and so on, because one does not understand the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of the equality of suchness and so on.

original: bdag nyid kyi thun mong ma yin pa nyid du mi shes pa la'o //üîΩdon la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi thun mong ma yin pa nyid du mi shes pa la'o //üîΩdon la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: One is confused about the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension

original: la lar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po don dam pa nyid du 'dzin pas sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: la lar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po don dam pa nyid du 'dzin pas sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: Some are confused about the four noble truths, because they hold the aggregates of form, etc. to be ultimate reality, and so are ignorant of the truths of suffering, etc.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mi shes pa'o //
translated: They do not understand the four noble truths.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma shes pas 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni mi bden pa'i phyin ci log gi kun nas blangs pa nyid du mi shes pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun du rmongs pa ste
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma shes pas 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni mi bden pa'i phyin ci log gi kun nas blangs pa nyid du mi shes pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun du rmongs pa ste
translated: Some are confused about the nature of the afflictions, because they do not understand that what are called ‚Äúattachment,‚Äù etc. are themselves unreal and are taken up by error, and so they do not understand the nature of the afflictions.

original: / 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: / 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma shes pa'o //
translated: They do not understand that attachment, etc. are things that do not exist.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba gnyis dang bral bar mi shes pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa la kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba gnyis dang bral bar mi shes pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa la kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: Some are confused about nonduality, because they do not understand the absence of duality, since they do not understand the characteristics of the grasped and the grasper.

original: gnyis su med pa ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ma shes pa'o //
translated: It is the non-understanding of non-duality.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: As before means as in the discriminations of grasping, etc.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs brjod pa'i shugs kyis 'phangs pa gnyen po'i phyogs kyang rnam pa bzhi yin la re re zhing snga ma bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgu las go bzlog par bshad pa'i don las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs brjod pa'i shugs kyis 'phangs pa gnyen po'i phyogs kyang rnam pa bzhi yin la re re zhing snga ma bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgu las go bzlog par bshad pa'i don las shes par bya'o //
translated: The side of the antidote, which is implied by the force of the expression of the counteragent, is also fourfold, and each one should be understood as the opposite of the nine aspects of the counteragent, as before.

original: de ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi zhes bya ba la @239a * //üîΩsogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi zhes bya ba la @239a * // sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is the path of meditative development, etc.üîΩThe path of meditative development is the antidote to the nine categories of the obscurations that consist in the knowable.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dgongs pa ni snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dgongs pa ni snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The intention of the path of meditative development is as follows:

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra bar 'dir yang rnam par rtog pa bzhi por re re zhing chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa dgu car yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa nyid kyis rnam pa dgu yin pa'i phyir rnam par
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra bar 'dir yang rnam par rtog pa bzhi por re re zhing chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa dgu car yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa nyid kyis rnam pa dgu yin pa'i phyir rnam par
translated: As before means that, as in the case of the path of vision, here also each one of the four discriminations consists in nine categories, beginning with the small of the small, because of the nine aspects of the purity of the three spheres.üîΩThe path of meditative development is the antidote to the nine categories of the obscurations that consist in the knowable.

original: rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The one hundred and eight refers to the one hundred and eight conceptualizations.

original: yams nad ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa dang 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: yams nad ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa dang 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The epidemics and so on are easy to understand in the verse and commentary.

original: yun ring lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //üîΩzhes bya ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yun ring lon nas dbugs phyin ltar // zhes bya ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Like one who, after a long time, finds relief,

original: gegs byed pa med pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas so //
analyzed: gegs byed pa med pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas so //
translated: he is without obstruction because there is no longer any resistance.

original: dga' bas dbugs 'byin pa thob pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yun ring po ste /
analyzed: dga' bas dbugs 'byin pa thob pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yun ring po ste /
translated: Like one who, after a long time, finds relief,

original: 'tshang rgya ba nyid la gnas pa'i bar du rab tu dga' bas brgal ba lta bur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba nyid la gnas pa'i bar du rab tu dga' bas brgal ba lta bur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: he is delighted, as if crossing over, up to the point of abiding in enlightenment.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang /
translated: The path of cultivation and so on are easy to understand.

original: stong gsum pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bar chad byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa yin te /
analyzed: stong gsum pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bar chad byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa yin te /
translated: The three thousand and so on are the verses on the obstructions.

original: nyan thos dang bse ru dag gi rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang bse ru dag gi rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas is the perfection of understanding.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam la ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam la ste /
translated: The faultless state of a bodhisattva is the path of seeing explained above.

original: stong gsum pa'i skye bo bkod pa ni thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: stong gsum pa'i skye bo bkod pa ni thob par byed pa ste /
translated: The beings of a billion worlds are established in the state of a bodhisattva,üîΩand the virtue that generates merit is exemplified by that.

original: de byed pas bsod nams gang skye bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba rnams dper mdzad nas zhes bya ba dge ba de dpe nyid du byas nas bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba de'i bsod nams kyi grangs nyid kyis grangs med pa'i bsod nams kyis gang
analyzed: de byed pas bsod nams gang skye bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba rnams dper mdzad nas zhes bya ba dge ba de dpe nyid du byas nas bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba de'i bsod nams kyi grangs nyid kyis grangs med pa'i bsod nams kyis gang
translated: The merit of that is immeasurable, and by that immeasurable merit,üîΩone attains buddhahood without impediment.

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa la bar chad med par 'tshang rgya ba nyid du bar chad med pa de ni 'dir bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa la bar chad med par 'tshang rgya ba nyid du bar chad med pa de ni 'dir bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: That is the uninterrupted samadhi here,

original: bsam gtan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: which is a special meditative stabilization.

original: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
translated: That is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ces bya ba rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nye bar len pa nyid kyis ni nye bar gdags pas sangs rgyas nyid ces kyang de la bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nye bar len pa nyid kyis ni nye bar gdags pas sangs rgyas nyid ces kyang de la bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúperfect buddha‚Äù is also called ‚Äúbuddhahood‚Äù because of the appropriation of that.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i 'grel pa dang 'di'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa dang 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i 'grel pa dang 'di'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa dang 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The commentary on ‚Äúsome‚Äù and the verse on ‚Äúits object‚Äù and so on are easy to understand.

original: gnas 'di la zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs pa la sogs pa'i gnas @239b skabs ni gting dpag dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis na rab tu smra ba rnams /
analyzed: gnas 'di la zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs pa la sogs pa'i gnas @239b skabs ni gting dpag dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis na rab tu smra ba rnams /
translated: This topic is difficult to fathom because of the context of the object of the uninterrupted samƒÅdhi and so on. Since it is not the domain of valid cognition,

original: brgyud mar rgol lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: brgyud mar rgol lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: the disputants continue to argue.

original: klan ka'i rgol ba brgyud mar 'byung ba ni rgol ba smra ba mang po'o //
analyzed: klan ka'i rgol ba brgyud mar 'byung ba ni rgol ba smra ba mang po'o //
translated: The disputants who continue to argue are the many proponents of debate.

original: gang zhig yin zhe na thabs la mkhas pa ma rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig yin zhe na thabs la mkhas pa ma rtogs pa ste /
translated: What is it? It is not realizing skillful means.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa mngon par ma shes pa rnams la 'phags pa byams pa 'jig rten sgrol ba la mkhas pa'i thabs la mkhas pas de dag gsal bar bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pas kun rdzob dang don
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa mngon par ma shes pa rnams la 'phags pa byams pa 'jig rten sgrol ba la mkhas pa'i thabs la mkhas pas de dag gsal bar bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pas kun rdzob dang don
translated: For those who do not understand the skill in means based on the conventional and ultimate truths, the noble Maitreya, skilled in liberating the world, with skill in means clarifies them with skill in means.

original: dam pa dag gi rgol ba rnams kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag gis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa dag gi rgol ba rnams kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag gis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The disputants about the conventional and the ultimate are taught with the conventional and the ultimate.

original: 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin 'di zab pa nyid du bsnyad de /
analyzed: 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin 'di zab pa nyid du bsnyad de /
translated: This explains the profundity of this meditative absorption,

original: tshad mas mi rtogs pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: tshad mas mi rtogs pa nyid du ston to //
translated: showing that it is not realized by means of valid cognition.

original: blo'i nor can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag ces bya ba rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i lam dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis dmigs par 'thad pa ste /
analyzed: blo'i nor can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag ces bya ba rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i lam dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis dmigs par 'thad pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe one who possesses the wealth of mind‚Äù and so on and beginning with ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù and so on is as follows: The conditioned and unconditioned realms are the path that depends on causes and conditions.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul du rigs pa nyid du log par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul du rigs pa nyid du log par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Form and so on and space and so on are tenable as objects due to their nonexistence.

original: zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to all.

original: gal te yang dag par yul du gyur na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kho na yul yin gyi de med na yul gang zhig yin zhes rgol ba po'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang dag par yul du gyur na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kho na yul yin gyi de med na yul gang zhig yin zhes rgol ba po'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: If they are truly objects, only conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are objects. If they do not exist, what object is there? This is the opponent‚Äôs thought.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi cha shas can la sogs pa'i ngo bo med pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi cha shas can la sogs pa'i ngo bo med pas /
translated: Since they are completely devoid of intrinsic reality, forms and so on have no nature as wholes and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par gzung zhing yul gyi rnam pa nges par bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par gzung zhing yul gyi rnam pa nges par bya ste /
translated: One should ascertain the nature of the object and determine the aspect of the object.

original: yang dag par na cha shas can la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa yod par nges pa yin gyi de med na ji ltar yod ces bya ba snyam mo //
analyzed: yang dag par na cha shas can la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa yod par nges pa yin gyi de med na ji ltar yod ces bya ba snyam mo //
translated: If the nature of the whole, etc., exists in reality, then the object of eye consciousness, etc., form, etc., would certainly exist. But if that does not exist, how could it exist?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Things and nonthings are apprehended, etc.

original: de med pa ni mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de med pa ni mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Their nonexistence is nonapprehension.

original: mi rtog pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'tshang rgya ba na dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i yul mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de la gzung ba la sogs @240a * //
analyzed: mi rtog pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'tshang rgya ba na dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i yul mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de la gzung ba la sogs @240a * //
translated: When one awakens to omniscience through nonconceptuality, the wisdom that knows things and nonthings, etc., as objects, is the wisdom that knows all things.

original: pa rnam pa thams cad yang dag par yod na ni /
analyzed: pa rnam pa thams cad yang dag par yod na ni /
translated: If all the aspects of apprehendeds, etc.,

original: de mkhyen pa yin gyi de med par de ji ltar yod /
analyzed: de mkhyen pa yin gyi de med par de ji ltar yod /
translated: really exist, then that wisdom would know them. But if they do not exist, how could it know them?

original: yul med par yul can skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul med par yul can skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that a subject arises without an object.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis dbye ba ni 'thad pas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni khyad par ram khyad par gyi rgyu yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste 'gal ba'i chos la gnas pa dang / rgyu'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dbye ba thams cad la yin la khyed kyi phyogs ltar na rgyu'i dbye bas mi rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis dbye ba ni 'thad pas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni khyad par ram khyad par gyi rgyu yin te / 'di lta ste 'gal ba'i chos la gnas pa dang / rgyu'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dbye ba thams cad la yin la khyed kyi phyogs ltar na rgyu'i dbye bas mi rigs te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe two truths, the conventional and the ultimate‚Äù is a specification or reason for the division.üîΩThe reason is that all divisions are by way of the reason of the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of contradictory attributes and because of the particular cause.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa'i rgyu dang rkyen kho na las de gnyis skye ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa med pa ste ji ltar de dag tha dad par yod ces bya ba snyam mo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rgyu dang rkyen kho na las de gnyis skye ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa med pa ste ji ltar de dag tha dad par yod ces bya ba snyam mo //
translated: But in your system, the division by way of cause is not tenable, because those two are generated only from a cause and conditions that are nonthings, and because suchness is the nature of both the conventional and the ultimate, and because the conventional and the ultimate do not have the existence of contradictory attributes.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa med de ma shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba sbyin pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa yod pa kho nas sbyin pa la sogs pa yin la de na de med
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa med de ma shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba sbyin pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa yod pa kho nas sbyin pa la sogs pa yin la de na de med
translated: Since the practice of generosity and so on exists, generosity and so on exist.

original: na ji ltar yod snyam mo //
analyzed: na ji ltar yod snyam mo //
translated: If it does not exist, how can it exist?

original: rtogs par bya ba med pas zhes bya ba ni shes bya med pas so //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba med pas zhes bya ba ni shes bya med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the object of realization does not exist‚Äù means because the object of knowledge does not exist.

original: blo'i khyad par dang ldan pa gang yin pa ni sangs rgyas yin la de nyid gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la dga' ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: blo'i khyad par dang ldan pa gang yin pa ni sangs rgyas yin la de nyid gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la dga' ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The one who possesses the special mind is the Buddha. Since he himself generates joy in the mindstream of the disciple,

original: dkon mchog yin na de la rtogs par byed pas ji ltar sangs rgyas shes bya snyam mo //
analyzed: dkon mchog yin na de la rtogs par byed pas ji ltar sangs rgyas shes bya snyam mo //
translated: he is the jewel. How can the Buddha be known by the one who realizes him?

original: ming du btags pa tsam du zad pas zhes bya ba gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po dag gam gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i shes pa dag ni ming du btags pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni gcig dang du ma
analyzed: ming du btags pa tsam du zad pas zhes bya ba gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po dag gam gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i shes pa dag ni ming du btags pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni gcig dang du ma
translated: Since they are mere nominal designations, the aggregates of form and formation, or consciousnesses that are both and neither, are mere nominal designations.

original: dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas de med pas ming du btags pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir chos dkon mchog ste lung dang rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas de med pas ming du btags pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir chos dkon mchog ste lung dang rtogs pa'o //
translated: Since the nature imputed in that way is free from one and many, and so on, valid knowledge does not exist. Therefore, since they are mere nominal designations, they are the jewel of Dharma, which is scripture and realization.

original: gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa bkag pas zhes bya ba phyi'i don yod par mi 'thad pas gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa yul bkag pa'i phyir dge 'dun te gzugs dang gzugs med pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i dge 'dun ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa bkag pas zhes bya ba phyi'i don yod par mi 'thad pas gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa yul bkag pa'i phyir dge 'dun te gzugs dang gzugs med pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i dge 'dun ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po
translated: Since the observation of form and so on is refuted, since external objects are not tenable, the aggregates of form and so on are refuted. Therefore the Sa·πÖgha is the Sa·πÖgha of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on of the form and formless realms.

original: yod na dkon mchog gsum grub kyi de med na de ji ltar yod @240b snyam mo //
analyzed: yod na dkon mchog gsum grub kyi de med na de ji ltar yod @240b snyam mo //
translated: If form and so on existed, the three jewels would be established. If they do not exist, how could they exist?

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dmigs pas sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dmigs pas sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Skill in means is the giving of gifts and so on, because one sees the gift, giver, and recipient.

original: sems mi 'gong ba la sogs pa la sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mthong bas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skrag pa la sogs pa 'byung bas sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: sems mi 'gong ba la sogs pa la sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mthong bas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skrag pa la sogs pa 'byung bas sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: How can one have a fearless mind and so on, since one has a basis, because one sees the gift and so on?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga'i ngo bor rtogs pa ni shes pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga'i ngo bor rtogs pa ni shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge is the realization of the nature of both entity and nonentity.

original: de bkag pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bkag pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The negation of that is the realization of the Tathagata.

original: 'tshang rgya ba nyid mngon sum du bya ba la dngos po la sogs pa med na dngos po la sogs pa ji lta ba de ltar mkhyen pa gang la yod snyam mo //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba nyid mngon sum du bya ba la dngos po la sogs pa med na dngos po la sogs pa ji lta ba de ltar mkhyen pa gang la yod snyam mo //
translated: If there is no entity and so on, how can one know entities and so on as they are?

original: spros pa rnam par gzhag pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gdul bya'i dbang gis rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid du ston pa'i nges pa nyid kyis na mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spros pa rnam par gzhag pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gdul bya'i dbang gis rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid du ston pa'i nges pa nyid kyis na mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Impermanence, etc. are established as elaborations, because they are taught in various ways due to the necessity of teaching in accordance with the inclinations of those to be trained.

original: rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: Therefore, they are impermanence, etc.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa go bzlog pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du mnyam pa'i phyir gnod par bya ba dang / gnod pa byed par ji ltar 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa go bzlog pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du mnyam pa'i phyir gnod par bya ba dang / gnod pa byed par ji ltar 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: Since permanence, etc. are the opposites of impermanence, etc., how can they be the objects of harm and the agents of harm, since permanence, etc. are the same as impermanence, etc. in being unreal?

original: lam rnam par bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de mngon sum du mi phyed pa'i phyir lam ste /
analyzed: lam rnam par bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de mngon sum du mi phyed pa'i phyir lam ste /
translated: The path is that by which one does not realize the result of the cultivation of the path.

original: lam bsgoms pas 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa 'byung ba yin na de ji ltar mngon sum du mi byed pa yin snyam mo //
analyzed: lam bsgoms pas 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa 'byung ba yin na de ji ltar mngon sum du mi byed pa yin snyam mo //
translated: If the result of the cultivation of the path were to occur, how could one not realize it?

original: blang ba dang dor ba med pas zhes bya ba spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po ste /
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba med pas zhes bya ba spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po ste /
translated: Since there is nothing to adopt or reject, means that there is nothing to be abandoned or adopted.

original: dgag par bya ba dang / 'gog par byed pa'i dngos po yod na dor ba dang blang bar bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po yod par rigs na /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba dang / 'gog par byed pa'i dngos po yod na dor ba dang blang bar bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po yod par rigs na /
translated: If there were an entity that was to be refuted and a refutation, then it would be reasonable that there would be an opposing side and an antidote.

original: de med pas de ji ltar yod pa yin snyam mo //
analyzed: de med pas de ji ltar yod pa yin snyam mo //
translated: But since that does not exist, how could they exist?

original: chos can med pas zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa med pas chos kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos can med pas zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa med pas chos kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Since there is no basis of attributes, means that since form and so on do not exist, the characteristics of phenomena

original: gzugs la sogs pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: are the general and specific characteristics of form and so on.

original: mtshan gzhi yod na mtshan nyid yod par rigs na /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi yod na mtshan nyid yod par rigs na /
translated: If there were a basis of characteristics, it would be reasonable that there would be characteristics.

original: de med par de ji srid yod pa yin snyam mo //üîΩrang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas zhes bya @241a * //
analyzed: de med par de ji srid yod pa yin snyam mo // rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas zhes bya @241a * //
translated: But since that does not exist, how could they exist?üîΩSince general and specific characteristics are untenable, means that since the characteristics of capability and noncapability are untenable,

original: ba nus pa dang / mi nus pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir sgom pa la ste /
analyzed: ba nus pa dang / mi nus pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir sgom pa la ste /
translated: there is no meditation.

original: lam bsam pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i don gyi bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas kyang thams cad med pa yin la de bas na de'i don med par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: lam bsam pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i don gyi bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas kyang thams cad med pa yin la de bas na de'i don med par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: The path is not tenable as the cultivation of the meaning of attaining omniscience, and therefore its meaning is nonexistent.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is inclusive.

original: log par rtogs pa rnams kun rdzob yin pa'o //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa rnams kun rdzob yin pa'o //
translated: Misconception is conventional.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba ltar snang ba'i don gang yin pa de ni phan tshun 'gal bar snang ba'i don te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba ltar snang ba'i don gang yin pa de ni phan tshun 'gal bar snang ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning that appears to be mutually contradictory is the meaning that appears to be mutually contradictory.

original: de bsgrubs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba phan tshun 'gal ba dang 'dra bas /üîΩmi 'thad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba mi rigs pa nyid kyis na gang rgol ba nyid kyis the tshom gyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de bsgrubs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba phan tshun 'gal ba dang 'dra bas / mi 'thad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba mi rigs pa nyid kyis na gang rgol ba nyid kyis the tshom gyi ngo bo ste /
translated: Since that is established, the activity of the bodhisattvas is like that which is mutually contradictory.üîΩSince it is untenable, that is, since it is illogical, the meaning that is the nature of doubt is refuted.

original: log pa nyid yin par yid gnyis su gyur pa na ji skad bshad pa'i yul can nyid kyis zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i lam gyi yul can yin pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: log pa nyid yin par yid gnyis su gyur pa na ji skad bshad pa'i yul can nyid kyis zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i lam gyi yul can yin pa nyid kyis /
translated: When one becomes uncertain about whether it is false, then, as it was explained, the object of the uninterrupted path is the object of the path of liberation.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can zhes bya ba 'tshang rgya ba nyid la brten pa'o //üîΩlog par rtogs pa rnam pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba dmigs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can zhes bya ba 'tshang rgya ba nyid la brten pa'o // log par rtogs pa rnam pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba dmigs pa /
translated: The basis of the knowledge of all aspects is the very state of Buddhahood.üîΩThe sixteen false views are the sixteen kinds of views that are based on the notions of real and unreal in regard to the aggregates, etc.

original: 'thad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams so //
analyzed: 'thad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams so //
translated: The sixteen false views are the sixteen kinds of views that are based on the notions of real and unreal in regard to the aggregates, etc.

original: log par rtogs pa de dag gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa de dag gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of these false views?

original: skye bo byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa mi shes pa'i rab tu smra ba nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye bo byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa mi shes pa'i rab tu smra ba nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The utterance of the ignorant refers to the utterance of those who do not know the skillful means of the bodhisattva.

original: skye bo mngon par rtogs pa brgyad mi shes shing /
analyzed: skye bo mngon par rtogs pa brgyad mi shes shing /
translated: The utterance of the ignorant refers to the utterance of those who do not know the eight realizations,

original: sems mi 'god pa nyid la sogs pa'i thabs mi shes pa'i rab tu smra ba ste /üîΩbstan bcos shes pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i rgol ba byed par 'dod pa'i mkhas pa chen po rnams dang / thams cad kyi zhes bya ba de rnams nyid dang / lha chen po dang khyab 'jug la sogs pa dang / de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: sems mi 'god pa nyid la sogs pa'i thabs mi shes pa'i rab tu smra ba ste /üîΩbstan bcos shes pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i rgol ba byed par 'dod pa'i mkhas pa chen po rnams dang / thams cad kyi zhes bya ba de rnams nyid dang / lha chen po dang khyab 'jug la sogs pa dang / de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: and who do not know the skillful means of the bodhisattva, such as the non-fixation of the mind, etc.üîΩThe utterance of the ignorant refers to the utterance of those who do not know the eight realizations,üîΩand who do not know the skillful means of the bodhisattva, such as the non-fixation of the mind, etc.üîΩThe utterance of the ignorant refers to the utterance of those who do not know the eight realizations,üîΩand who do not know the skillful means of the bodhisattva, such as the non-fixation of the mind, etc.üîΩThe utterance of the ignorant refers to the utterance of those who do not know the eight realizations,üîΩand who do not know the skillful means of the bodhisattva, such as the non-fixation of the mind, etc.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Therefore, means by the explained process.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo can gyi zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa nyid du rgol ba mi rigs pa nyid du rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo can gyi zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa nyid du rgol ba mi rigs pa nyid du rtogs pa la'o //
translated: Having the doors of the conventional and the ultimate means that one should understand the inappropriateness of the dispute in terms of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: go rims bzhin du don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi sgo nas lan btab dgos pas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rgol ba la ni don dam pa'i thabs kyis /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi sgo nas lan btab dgos pas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rgol ba la ni don dam pa'i thabs kyis /
translated: One should reply in order, with the door of the ultimate and the door of the conventional, means that one should reply to the dispute in terms of the conventional with the method of the ultimate,

original: don dam par rgol ba la ni kun rdzob kyi thabs kyis lan gdab pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par rgol ba la ni kun rdzob kyi thabs kyis lan gdab pa'o //
translated: and one should reply to the dispute in terms of the ultimate with the method of the conventional.

original: de bzhin du rgol ba kha cig la ni @241b don dam pa dang kun rdzob dag dang / la lar ni yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob dag gis lan gdab par bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgol ba kha cig la ni @241b don dam pa dang kun rdzob dag dang / la lar ni yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob dag gis lan gdab par bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should understand that one should reply to some disputes with the ultimate and the conventional, and to some with the correct and incorrect conventional.

original: de ltar na gnyi ga la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pas zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de ltar na gnyi ga la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pas zhes bya ba /
translated: Thus, with skill in means based on both, means

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tha snyad la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa la bya bas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tha snyad la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa la bya bas so //
translated: because it is skill in means based on the conventional of the mundane and supramundane.

original: de la kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa la yod pas na dmigs pa yin la de'i ngo bo nyid nges par bzung ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa la yod pas na dmigs pa yin la de'i ngo bo nyid nges par bzung ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin no //
translated: Therein, the object is form, etc. because it exists conventionally, and the apprehension of its reality is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyis lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyis lan btab pa'o //
translated: The Three Jewels are the conventional response.

original: kun rdzob tu sbyin pa la sogs pa mthong na yang de kho na nyid du ma mthong ba ni thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sbyin pa la sogs pa mthong na yang de kho na nyid du ma mthong ba ni thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though one sees generosity, etc. conventionally, not seeing reality is called skill in means.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag gis so //
translated: By the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob dang dngos po la sogs pa srid pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob dang dngos po la sogs pa srid pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the realization of the Tathagata is possible because of the conventional, things, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The correct conventional is impermanence, etc.

original: log pa'i kun rdzob ni rtag pa la sogs pa yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa la rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log pa ni yang dag pa dang log pa'i kun rdzob dag gis 'grub ste tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i smon lam 'grub po zhes
analyzed: log pa'i kun rdzob ni rtag pa la sogs pa yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa la rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log pa ni yang dag pa dang log pa'i kun rdzob dag gis 'grub ste tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i smon lam 'grub po zhes
translated: Since the opposite of the conventional is permanence and so on, the error of permanence and so on in regard to impermanence and so on is established by the correct and incorrect conventional, because it is said:

original: smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe prayers of one endowed with ethics are fulfilled.‚Äù

original: lam rnam par bsgoms pas kyang 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed ces bya ba ni kun rdzob kyis te /
analyzed: lam rnam par bsgoms pas kyang 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed ces bya ba ni kun rdzob kyis te /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúOne does not actualize the result by cultivating the path‚Äù is made conventionally.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob tu nyon mongs pa la sogs pa dang / lam yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po nyid yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob tu nyon mongs pa la sogs pa dang / lam yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po nyid yod do //
translated: Similarly, since afflictions and so on and the path exist conventionally, there is the relationship of antidotes and objects to be abandoned.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yod pas de'i mtshan nyid yod pa dang / yang de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad la bsgom pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir legs pa yin no zhes ci rigs par de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo nas lan gdab par byaüîΩste / de dag la sogs pa rnam pa stong du bsal ba sngon du 'gro bas lha chen po dang khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i rgol ba du ma tshar gcod pa'i nges pa rnam pa thams cad du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yod pas de'i mtshan nyid yod pa dang / yang de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad la bsgom pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir legs pa yin no zhes ci rigs par de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo nas lan gdab par bya ste / de dag la sogs pa rnam pa stong du bsal ba sngon du 'gro bas lha chen po dang khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i rgol ba du ma tshar gcod pa'i nges pa rnam pa thams cad du ste /
translated: Likewise, since form and so on exist, their characteristics exist, and likewise, since meditation on all aspects of form and so on is the cause of omniscience, it is good.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes kyi tshad ma du ma dag gis yang dag cing phyin ci ma log pa'i nges @242a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes kyi tshad ma du ma dag gis yang dag cing phyin ci ma log pa'i nges @242a * //
translated: Thus, in this way, the objections of the great gods, Vi·π£·πáu and so on, are completely refuted by many hundreds of thousands of aspects, preceded by the removal of their objections, by means of the correct and unmistaken ascertainment that is the valid knowledge of samƒÅdhi and wisdom.

original: pa ste / 'di kho na yang dag pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni rmongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa brtan por bskyed nas dge ba 'dod pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: pa ste / 'di kho na yang dag pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni rmongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa brtan por bskyed nas dge ba 'dod pa rnams kyis te /
translated: Having generated the firm knowledge that this alone is correct and the others are confused, those who desire virtue,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don kun nas byed cing 'tshang rgya ba nyid 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don kun nas byed cing 'tshang rgya ba nyid 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba dbang du bya'o //
translated: those Bodhisattvas who desire to become Buddhas in order to benefit all sentient beings, should generate the uninterrupted samadhi.

original: yul gyi dbye bas log par rtog pa rnams kyi dbye ba mtha' yas pa yin na yang nye ba na 'dug pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo las ltos te /
analyzed: yul gyi dbye bas log par rtog pa rnams kyi dbye ba mtha' yas pa yin na yang nye ba na 'dug pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo las ltos te /
translated: Although the divisions of misconceptions are infinite due to the divisions of objects, in relation to the disciples who are nearby,

original: bcu drug nyid du bshad pa yin la de bas na rnam pa stong du zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: bcu drug nyid du bshad pa yin la de bas na rnam pa stong du zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: they are explained as sixteen. Therefore, it does not contradict the statement about a thousand aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas ni gzhung rtogs dka' ba'i snang ba mdor mdzad pa chos kyi grags pas byas pa las skabs lnga pa'i 'grel pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas ni gzhung rtogs dka' ba'i snang ba mdor mdzad pa chos kyi grags pas byas pa las skabs lnga pa'i 'grel pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: Haribhadra's commentary on the fifth chapter of the treatise on the levels of the perfection of wisdom called the Abhisamayalamkara, which is difficult to understand, is concisely composed by Dharmakirti.

original: // / rab tu byed pa'i phan tshun gyi 'brel pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: // / rab tu byed pa'i phan tshun gyi 'brel pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The mutual connection of the chapters is stated in

original: rtse mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rtse mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The peak... and so on.üîΩHaving attained the peak realization means having attained spontaneous accomplishment in the peak application explained above.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rtse mo'i sbyor ba la lhun gyis grub pa thob pa'o / so so dang bsdus pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i lugs las bzlog pa dang lugs su 'byung ba dag gis so //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rtse mo'i sbyor ba la lhun gyis grub pa thob pa'o / so so dang bsdus pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i lugs las bzlog pa dang lugs su 'byung ba dag gis so //
translated: In terms of individual and collective means in reverse order and in forward order.

original: rtogs pa'i don rnams ni bsgoms pas yul du byas pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don rnams ni bsgoms pas yul du byas pa'i yul lo //
translated: The objects of realization are the objects made into objects by meditation.

original: go rims su bklags pa ni rim gyis dran pa la yang dag par bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: go rims su bklags pa ni rim gyis dran pa la yang dag par bzhag pa'o //
translated: In order means correctly established in sequence.

original: bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pa dran pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pa dran pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate means in order to engage in spontaneous recollection.

original: rnam par sgom par byed pas zhes bya ba ni sems phyi rol las yang dag par bsdus te /
analyzed: rnam par sgom par byed pas zhes bya ba ni sems phyi rol las yang dag par bsdus te /
translated: By cultivating means by withdrawing the mind from external objects

original: nang du nges par dmigs par byed pas so //
analyzed: nang du nges par dmigs par byed pas so //
translated: and by focusing it internally.

original: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the realization of the serial

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: is stated by the words ‚Äúgenerosity‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyin pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: It is the wisdom that is accompanied by generosity,

original: pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: because it is the perfection.

original: bar dag ces bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad @242b pa dag go //
analyzed: bar dag ces bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad @242b pa dag go //
translated: The middle means the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, and so on, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs dran dang ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs dran dang ni //
translated: Recollection of the Buddha and so on,

original: zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pas dran pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa rjes su dran pa'i sgom pa gang yin pa'i chos dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa ste mthar gyis pa'i bya bar bzhed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pas dran pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa rjes su dran pa'i sgom pa gang yin pa'i chos dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa ste mthar gyis pa'i bya bar bzhed /
translated: This is the Dharma that is mindfulness and meditation that is recollection of the Three Jewels and recollection of virtue, etc. It is the non-apprehension of form, etc. as having an intrinsically real entity. This is considered the activity of the serial one.

original: ces bya ba de ni go rims kyi sbyin pa grub pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba de ni go rims kyi sbyin pa grub pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the order. It should be understood that this is the order.

original: don 'di nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This very meaning is stated in the verse: ‚ÄúThe perfections, etc.‚Äù

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba ni sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa gsum po nye bar mi dmigs pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad du ste /
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba ni sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa gsum po nye bar mi dmigs pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad du ste /
translated: The perfections of giving, etc. that are distinguished by the purity of the three spheres, which arise from the non-apprehension of the three‚Äîthe object given, etc.‚Äîare the six perfections of giving, etc. They are in every way, i.e., by the three natures of the object given, etc.

original: gtong ba dang gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste yongs su rdzogs shing bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba dang gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste yongs su rdzogs shing bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The perfection of giving is the perfection of giving, great giving, and complete giving, and so on, which is fully accomplished and perfected.

original: drug ces bya ba smos na yang //
analyzed: drug ces bya ba smos na yang //
translated: Although it is said that there are six,

original: 'di dag gi las shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi las shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: how is their function to be known?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: It is said that the four perfections are the function of the four perfections, and so on.

original: gang du pha rol tu tu phyin pa smos pa der pha rol tu phyin pa bcu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gang du pha rol tu tu phyin pa smos pa der pha rol tu phyin pa bcu shes par bya ste /
translated: Wherever the perfections are mentioned, there the ten perfections should be understood,

original: 'bras bu sa bcu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu sa bcu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ten grounds are taught as the result.

original: ci zhig rdzogs par byed pas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig rdzogs par byed pas she na /
translated: By perfecting what?

original: de ni sa bcu yang dag par byed pa zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sa bcu yang dag par byed pa zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is the perfection of the ten grounds.

original: bar dag ces bya ba'i sgras bsdus pa'i don ni dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bar dag ces bya ba'i sgras bsdus pa'i don ni dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning included by the word and is stated by mindfulness and so on.

original: lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dag ni chos zhes bya ba ni yin pas phyogs gnyi ga la yang go rims bzhin du lung du gsungs pa nyid yin pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos dkon mchog kho na la dkon mchog gsum zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dag ni chos zhes bya ba ni yin pas phyogs gnyi ga la yang go rims bzhin du lung du gsungs pa nyid yin pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos dkon mchog kho na la dkon mchog gsum zhes brjod do //
translated: The Three Jewels are the Jewel of the Dharma alone, because the scriptures are taught in both of these two systems in order and because the Three Jewels are characterized by nondual transcendent wisdom.

original: de ni don dam par na lung dang rtogs pa ma gtogs bar gzhan du dkon mchog gsum du mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de ni don dam par na lung dang rtogs pa ma gtogs bar gzhan du dkon mchog gsum du mi 'thad pas /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the Three Jewels are not tenable as anything other than the scriptures and realization.

original: gang 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan mtha' yas shing mthar thug pa med pa 'di dag ni chos las skyes pa chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /
analyzed: gang 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan mtha' yas shing mthar thug pa med pa 'di dag ni chos las skyes pa chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /
translated: The qualities of the Bhagavan Buddha are born from the Dharma, they enjoy the inheritance of the Dharma,

original: chos kyi rgyu can chos kyi dbang du byas pas chos las byung ba chos kyi spyod yul can chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba chos las grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @243a * //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyu can chos kyi dbang du byas pas chos las byung ba chos kyi spyod yul can chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba chos las grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @243a * //
translated: they are the cause of the Dharma, they are governed by the Dharma, they arise from the Dharma, they have the Dharma as their domain, they follow the Dharma, they are established in the Dharma and so on.

original: gsungs pa'i rnam pas chos dran pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid dang de'i bdag nyid can gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang chos yang dag par bsdus pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde thos pa dang bsam pa'i sgo nas phyis yid la byed pas
analyzed: gsungs pa'i rnam pas chos dran pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid dang de'i bdag nyid can gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang chos yang dag par bsdus pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde thos pa dang bsam pa'i sgo nas phyis yid la byed pas
translated: The wisdom that has the nature of the mindfulness of phenomena that is taught in that way and the perfection of wisdom that has the nature of that, by means of mental contemplation that is subsequent to hearing and contemplating the s≈´tras that correctly collect phenomena and so on

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa rnam pa gsum gang yin pa des na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa rnam pa gsum gang yin pa des na /
translated: are the three recollections of the Buddha and so on.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid kyis chos med pa yin pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dran pa rnam pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes kyang 'dogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid kyis chos med pa yin pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dran pa rnam pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes kyang 'dogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since phenomena do not exist due to the characteristics of phenomena, it is also not imputed that here there are only two recollections.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum du yang yongs su brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum du yang yongs su brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are without entityness, they are imputed as the three jewels.

original: gzhan dun chos dkon mchog tu brtags pa yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan dun chos dkon mchog tu brtags pa yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could phenomena be imputed as the jewel of Dharma?

original: yang na chos kyi bdag nyid med pa na dkon mchog gnyis su brtags par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na chos kyi bdag nyid med pa na dkon mchog gnyis su brtags par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, if phenomena are without self, the imputation of the two jewels would also be illogical.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum du brtags par mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum du brtags par mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of intrinsic reality, it is not unreasonable to designate the Three Jewels.

original: yang na 'dir gnyis su med pa'i stong pa'i ye shes kho na la nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa med pas gtsor dga' ba bskyed pa nyid kyis na chos dkon mchog yin pa'i phyogs 'di la ni dkon mchog gsum du gtogs pa'i chos kyi sgras lung

translated: Or else, in this context, the Dharma Jewel is the nondual gnosis alone, which is empty, since it is the primary cause of the generation of joy, because it is free from the afflictions and their traces.üîΩIn this context, the term Dharma that is included in the Three Jewels should be understood as scripture,

translated: The uncommonness of generosity and so on with respect to non Buddhist tirthikas and those of the outer and innerüîΩis indicated by form and so on.üîΩThe entity of the nonexistence of all phenomena such as form and so on is the object comprehended by the special mindfulness of generosity and so on that is established by valid knowledge and scripture, as previously explained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad gang yin pa de rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dran pa'i khyad par tshad ma dang / lung gis grub pa gang yin pa des khong du chud pas sbyin pa la sogs pa dran pa'i shes pas rtogs pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni mthar gyis pa'i khyad par bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad gang yin pa de rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dran pa'i khyad par tshad ma dang / lung gis grub pa gang yin pa des khong du chud pas sbyin pa la sogs pa dran pa'i shes pas rtogs pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni mthar gyis pa'i khyad par bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The special realization by the consciousness that is the mindfulness of generosity and so on is asserted to be the special realization of the serial nature.
